AP@DOTA命令：全阵营选择\r\n全选模式：-ap/-allpick 玩家可以选择所有酒馆的英雄
ar@全体随机模式：-ar/-allrandom 玩家从所有酒馆的范围里自动随机得到一个英雄。和反转模式不兼容。 
Mr@模式随机：-mr/-moderandom 随机从全体随机模式，全选模式，团队随机模式和常规模式中选择一个模式。和反转模式、死亡竞赛模式不兼容。 
TR@团队随机模式： -tr/-teamrandom 玩家从自己方酒馆里随机得到一个英雄。和反转模式、死亡竞赛模式不兼容。 
AA@-aa-\"AllAgility\"的简称;强幷迫所有玩家只能选择敏捷型英雄。\r\ndota英雄  极寒幽魂卡尔德的简称
ai@abbr. 人工智能=（Artificial Intelligence ）在DOTA中代指由电脑操作的英雄。\r\n-ai-\"AllIntelligence\"的简称;强幷迫所有玩家只能选择智力型英雄。
as@-as-\"AllStrength\"的简称;强幷迫所有玩家只能选择力量型英雄。
du@-du-\"DuplicateMode\"的简称;不同的玩家可以选择相同的英雄。现在只能同-allrandom模式一起使用。
ID@-id-\"ItemDrop\"的简称;在这个模式下随机的物品掉落取代金幷钱丢失成为对英雄死亡的惩罚。注：游戏会随机的选择一个物品栏掉落，所以买许多便宜的物品并不是一个好主意。有传言说物品的掉落并不是完全随机的，75%的几率掉落最好的物品，25%几率从其他物品栏中掉落。\r\nabbr. 玩家在游戏用的名字（=identification）  
CW@abbr. clan war正规的竞技性质的DOTA比赛，与路人相区别。\r\nDOTA英雄半人马酋长的简称
cm@-cm 需要10个玩家启动。两队中，首先各方禁止10个英雄，然后按1-2-2-1-1-1-1-1的顺序选取英雄，先ban的一方先选。\r\nDOTA英雄冰女的简称
Rd@-rd/randomdraft，从全部酒馆中随机选出20个英雄，开始者为随机蓝色或者粉色，以1-2-2-2-2-1的方式选英雄，过时则定位random，从这20个中随机选出，并且开始金钱和不random的一样。
ma@-ma/matchup，显示对方的阵容。
Ms@-ms/movespeed，显示自己的移动速度。
cs@-cs/creepstats，计算杀了多少小兵还有反补。
refresh@-refresh，让PA变回透明。\r\n刷新英雄状态： -refresh 刷新英雄技能和物品的冷却时间，并且恢复生命和魔法。-refreshall 全部刷新
swap@-swap，和队友交换英雄，只可以在游戏时间90秒前用。
music@-music XXX切换游戏内的音乐:XXX是以下选项中的一个 random, nightelf1, nightelf2, nightelf3, human1, human2, human3, orc1, orc2, orc3, undead1, undead2, undead3, other1, other2, other3, other4, other5,off,special
DI@-di，cson+showdeny ，显示正补/反补面板 最常用的指令（在6.60及以后版本默认开启）
unstuck@-unstuck - 将你的英雄在60秒后传送到生命之泉；当你的英雄被卡在了一个没办法移动的位置(比如被困在树林中)的时候可以使用这个指令。在传送的过程中英雄不能移动，并且命令生效的延迟时间可以阻止玩家滥用这个命令。
roll@-roll xxx（xxx为1至2000内的数字，此命令可以丢出xxx内的一个随机数）
water@-water xxx (xxx为red、blue等颜色）改变河道水的颜色
weather@-weather rain，下雨\r\n　　-weather snow，下雪\r\n　　-weather wind，刮风（有沙尘）\r\n　　-weather moonlight，有月光照下\r\n　　-weather off，天气正常(类似的有-water red/yellow...改变水的颜色）
em@-em 容易模式\r\nDOTA英雄enigma谜团的简称
sc@-sc 出现超级兵种.-sc - \"Super Creeps\"的简称；随机的超强野怪会在每波小兵中产生。这个模式是完全随机的，会有攻城傀儡，恐怖怪鱼，远古九头蛇随机加入双方阵营以增加游戏的成就感。

hg@-he/hg 机器人得到的经验是玩家的双倍/机器人得到的钱是玩家的1.5倍
NE@-ne/ng 机器人得到的经验和玩家的相同/机器人得到的钱和玩家的相同
ng@-ne/ng 机器人得到的经验和玩家的相同/机器人得到的钱和玩家的相同
sm@-sm 简单模式（-em 是经验多些 -sm 是玩家更容易杀死塔和小兵）
option@-vr模式启动后每队有3种随机的英雄组合可以选择，玩家可以用-option n（n=1，2，3）投票。票数最多的组合会被使用。

CD@abbr. 技能冷却时间。cool down。\r\n中国DOTA战队，以四保周战术闻名，已解散。
AP@DOTA命令：全阵营选择 全选模式：-ap/-allpick 玩家可以选择所有酒馆的英雄
ar@全体随机模式：-ar/-allrandom 玩家从所有酒馆的范围里自动随机得到一个英雄。和反转模式不兼容。
Mr@模式随机：-mr/-moderandom 随机从全体随机模式，全选模式，团队随机模式和常规模式中选择一个模式。和反转模式、死亡竞赛模式不兼容。
TR@团队随机模式： -tr/-teamrandom 玩家从自己方酒馆里随机得到一个英雄。和反转模式、死亡竞赛模式不兼容。

clarification@n. 澄清, 阐明 酒庄会在葡萄酒进行装瓶前对葡萄酒进行澄清，主要采用原料有，明胶，鸡蛋等！

aged@adj. 陈年的
appellation@法定产区n. 名称, 称呼

austere@平淡的。通常形容单宁多，酸度强的酒，不太容易入口。
backward@adj. 晚熟性 形容酒陈年数年后仍具备年轻的特征。
bitter@adj.苦味。多来自于单宁，或与葡萄酒风格有关

buttery@adj. 黄油状味
cedar@n. 松树味
champagne@ n. 香槟酒, 香槟色
chewy@肉质的。一般单宁含量高，必须配以食物才能下咽

cloudy@adj. 浑浊的。
creamy@adj. 奶香的

direct@直接。 指葡萄酒中所有的气味、味道迅速展示出来
dry@adj. 干型/半干型
earthy@adj. 泥土味

hazy@adj. 朦胧的 指酒对着光照时，有轻微颗粒物含量。
honeyed@adj. 蜂蜜的
hot@adj. 炙热的指酒中含有高的酒精度，在口中有刺痛感。
jammy@adj. 粘上果酱的 经常形容美国加州仙粉黛。
lemony@ adj. 柠檬的

evolve@vt. &vi. 进展,进化,展开\nif an animal or plant evolves, it changes gradually over a long period of time
intricate@adj. 复杂的,错综的,缠结的,难懂的\ncontaining many small parts or details that all work or fit together
mechanics@n. 力学,机械学,(技术的,操作的)过程,手法\nthe science that deals with the effects of forces on objects
microbiology@n. 微生物学\nthe scientific study of very small living things such as bacteria
physics@n. 物理学\nthe science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement
weird@adj. 怪异的，离奇的\nn.命运；预言者\nvery strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain
infant@adj. 婴儿的, 幼稚的, 初期的\nn. 婴儿, 幼儿\na baby or very young child
marine@n. (海军)士兵或军官, 海景画\nadj. 海的,海事的,船舶的,航海的\nrelating to the sea and the creatures that live there
aquarium@n. 水族馆,养鱼池,玻璃缸\na clear glass or plastic container for fish and other water animals
captivity@n. 囚禁, 被俘虏\nwhen a person or animal is kept in a prison, cage etc and not allowed to go where they want
jaw@n. 颚,颌,说教,流言蜚语\nvt. &vi. 喋喋不休,教训\none of the two bones that your teeth are in
skull@n. 头骨,骷髅头\nvt. 击打头部\nthe bones of a person’s or animal’s head
spine@n. 背骨, 脊柱, 尖刺\nthe row of bones down the centre of your back that supports your body and protects your spinal cord
aspect@n. 方面, 外貌, 外观; 方位, 方向\none part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts
attempt@vt.试图； 尝试\nn.进攻； 尝试，冲击\nto try to do something, especially something difficult
constrain@vt.强迫； 强使； 限制； 约束\nto stop someone from doing what they want to do
core@n.中心，核心，精髓； 果心，果核； [地质学]地核； [计] 磁心\nvt.去（果）核，挖去…的果心； 提取岩芯（样品）\nthe most important or central part of something
element@n. 成分,要素,元素,基本原理,(复数)恶劣天气\none part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important
inadequate@adj. 不充分的,不适当的\nnot good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose
microbe@n. 微生物\nan extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a microscope
organism@n. 生物体, 有机体\nan animal, plant, human, or any other living thing
oxygen@n. 氧,氧气\na gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O
species@n. [生物] 物种；种类\nadj. 物种上的\na group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants
trace@n. 痕迹,踪迹,微量\nvt. 追踪,找出根源,描绘\nvi. 追踪\na very small amount of a quality, emotion, substance etc that is difficult to see or notice
visible@adj. 可见的, 看得见的\nsomething that is visible can be seen
absence@n. 没有；缺乏；缺席；不注意\nthe lack of something or the fact that it does not exist
nuclear@adj. 原子核的,原子能的\nrelating to or involving the nucleus (=central part) of an atom, or the energy produced when the nucleus of an atom is either split or joined with the nucleus of another atom
planet@n. 行星\na very large round object in space that moves around the Sun or another star
sphere@adj. 球体的\nn. 范围, 领域, 球, 球体\na ball shape
surface@n. 表面,平面, 外表\nadj. 表面的,肤浅的\nvt. 在某物上加表层, 使...成平面\nvi. 浮到水面, 披露出来, 在表面工作\nthe top layer of an area of water or land
humanity@n. 人类 人性;人道;慈爱\npeople in general
sculpture@n. 雕塑\nvt. 雕刻,雕塑\nvi. 当雕刻师\nan object made out of stone, wood, clay etc by an artist

depiction@n. 描述，描画\ndescribing something or someone in writing or speech, or showing them in a painting, picture etc
expressive@adj. 表达的, 用作表达的, 富于表情的\nshowing very clearly what someone thinks or feels
surreal@adj. 超现实的, 离奇的\na situation or experience that is surreal is very strange and difficult to understand, like something from a dream
apprentice@n. 学徒\nv. 使当学徒\nsomeone who works for an employer for a fixed period of time in order to learn a particular skill or job

meticulous@adj. 一丝不苟的, 精确的\nvery careful about small details, and always making sure that everything is done correctly
renowned@adj. 有名的, 有声誉的\nknown and admired by a lot of people, especially for a special skill, achievement, or quality
stint@v. 节省, 限制, 停止\nn. 舍不得花, 节约, 限制\nn. 连续不断的一段时间从事某件事\na period of time spent doing a particular job or activity
venerate@vt. 尊敬, 崇敬, 崇拜\nhonoured or respected because they are old, holy, or connected with the past
ambitious@adj. 热望的, 有雄心的, 有抱负的\nhonoured or respected because they are old, holy, or connected with the past
analogy@n. 相似,类似，类比\nsomething that seems similar between two situations, processes etc
interpretation@n. 解释,演出,翻译,互動\nthe way in which someone explains or understands an event, information, someone’s actions etc
manipulate@v. 操纵,利用,假造\n[计算机] 操作\nto use skill in moving or handling something
pose@n. 姿势,姿态,装模作样\nvt. 提出(问题),引起,定格\nvi. 摆姿势,装模作样\nto sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
practitioner@n. 从业者\nsomeone who regularly does a particular activity
transform@vt. 转换,变形\nvi. 改变\nn. 变形\nto completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it
unique@adj. 独一无二的, 独特的, 稀罕的\nbeing the only one of its kind
ornamentation@n. 装饰, 修饰\ndecoration on an object that makes it look attractive
perfection@n. 完美, 完善the state of being perfect
proportion@n. 比例,均衡,部分\nvt. 使成比例,使均衡,分摊\nthe correct or most suitable relationship between size, shape or position of the different parts of something
symmetry@n. 对称(性), 匀称, 整齐\nhaving one side the opposite in shape as the other
ability@n. 才能, 能力\nif you can do something, you have the ablity to do it
competent@adj. 有能力的,胜任的,足够的\nhaving enough skill or knowledge to do something to a satisfactory standard
equipment@n. 设备,装备\nthe tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity
fundamental@adj. 基本的,根本的,重要的\nn. 基本原理,基础\nrelating to the most basic and important parts of something
ignore@vt. 不顾,不理,忽视\nto deliberately pay no attention to something that you have been told or that you know about
phase@n. 相, 相位,时期,局面,阶段\nv. 逐步执行,实行,按计划进行\none of the stages of a process of development or change
rehearsal@n. 排练,彩排\nv. (使)排练,背诵\na time when all the people in a play, concert etc practise before a public performance
talented@adj. 有才能的(多才的)\nhaving a natural ability to do something well
budget@n. 预算\nvt. 编预算,为…做预算\nvi. 节省开支\nadj. 不贵的，廉价的\nthe money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent
tremendous@adj. 巨大的, 惊人的\nvery big, fast, powerful etc
genre@n. 类型,流派\na particular type of art, writing, music etc, which has certain features that all examples of this type share
hazard@n. 冒险,危险,危害\nv. 冒...的危险,赌运气\nsomething that may be dangerous, or cause accidents or problems
indistinguishable@adj. 不能区别的，难区分的, 不易觉察的\nthings that are indistinguishable are so similar that you cannot see any difference between them
dimension@n. 尺寸, 次元, 容积, 维度\nn. 范围; 方面\nvt. 标尺寸; 形成...尺寸\nthe size of something, especially when this is given as its length, height, and width
emerge@vi. 浮现, (由某种状态)脱出, (事实)显现出来\nto appear or come out from somewhere
impact@n. 冲击(力), 冲突, 影响(力)\nvt. 挤入, 压紧; 撞击; 对...发生影响\nto have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
initial@n. (词)首字母\nadj. 开始的, 最初的, 字首的\nvt. 签姓名的首字母于\nhappening at the beginning
interact@vi. 相互作用,相互影响\nif people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc
military@adj.军事的；军用的；讨厌的；好战的\nn.军人；军队；武装力量\nused by, involving, or relating to the army, navy, airforce etc
nanometer@n. 纳米\n=nanometre(英)a billionth of a metre
pursue@v. 追捕, 追求, 继续从事\nto continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time
atmosphere@n. 大气, 气氛，空气, 格调, 情趣, 气压\nthe gases, such as air, surrounding the Earth or another planet
capability@n. 能力,才能,性能,容量\nthe natural ability, skill, or power that makes a machine, person, or organization able to do something, especially something difficult
content@n. 内容, 目录, 含量\nadj. 满足的, 满意的\nvt. 使...满足, 使...安心\n1.n- the things that are inside a box, bag, room etc\n2.n. un.-the information contained in a website, smartphone app etc
empirical@adj. 经验主义的\nbased on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas
equation@n. 相等,方程(式),等式,均衡\na statement in mathematics that shows that two amounts or totals are equal
rational@adj. 合理的,理性的,能推理的\nn. 有理数\nrational thoughts, decisions etc are based on reasons rather than emotions
vehicle@n. 传播媒介, 工具, 手段, 交通工具, 车辆;\na machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck
aerodynamics@n. 空气动力学,气体力学\nthe scientific study of how objects move through the air
aloft@adv. 在高处, 在空中，在桅杆上\nprep. 在...上\nhigh up in the air
mission@n. 任务,代表团,使命,传教\nvt. 传教\n[计算机] 使命\nan important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft
satellite@n. 卫星,卫星城,随从\na machine that has been sent into space and goes around the Earth, Moon etc, used for radio, television, and other electronic communication
simultaneously@adv. 同时地\nthings that are simultaneous happen at exactly the same time
stratospheric@adj. 平流层的，同温层的，极高的\nrelating to the outer part of the air surrounding the Earth
surveillance@n. 监视,监督\nwhen one country watches the military etc activities of another country to see what they are planning to do
speech recognition@语音识别\nthe ability of a computer to recognise speech
mechanism@n. 机制,原理，机械,机构,结构\npart of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job
compromise@n. 妥协, 折衷, 折衷案\nvt. 妥协处理, 危害\nvi. 妥协, 让步\nan agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement
despair@n. 绝望,失望\nvi. 失望\ngive someone the feeling that they do not know how to deal with you
a host of@大量，许多, 一大群\na large number of
inadvertent@adj. 不注意的, 疏忽的，非故意的\nwithout realizing what you are doing
resort@n. (渡假)胜地, 手段, 凭借\nvi. 诉诸, 常去to do something bad, extreme, or difficult because you cannot think of any other way to deal with a problem
texture@n. 质地；纹理；结构；本质，实质\nthe way a surface or material feels when you touch it, or the way that a particular type of food feels in your mouth
tolerant@adj. 宽容的, 容忍的\naccepting something without criticising or complaining
acceptance@n. 接受（礼物、邀请、建议等），同意，认可\nwhen people agree that an idea, statement, explanation etc is right or true
additional@adj. 附加的, 另外的\nmore than what was agreed or expected
charge@n. 电荷, 指控, 费用; 照顾, 责任\nvt. &vi 控诉, 加罪于, 要价, 赊帐, 充电, 管理\nto ask someone for a particular amount of money for something you are selling
divide@vt.& vi.分； 划分； 分离； （使）产生分歧\nn.分水岭，分界线； 分配\nif you divide something, or if something divides, it separates into two or more parts
draw@v. (drew, drawn) 拉, 拖, 挨近, 提取, 画, 绘制\nn. 平局; 抽签; 拉, 拽吸引人的事物\nto attract someone, or make them want to do something
levy@n. 征税,召集\nvt. 征收,发动(战争\nvi. 强收\nan additional sum of money, usually paid as a tax
malnourished@adj. 营养不良的\n动词malnourish的过去式和过去分词\nsomeone who is malnourished is ill or weak because they have not had enough good food to eat
ongoing@adj. 前进的,进行的\nn. 前进,举止,行为\ncontinuing, or continuing to develop
overeat@vi. 吃过量\nto eat too much, or eat more than is healthy
portion@n. 部分,份,命运\nv. 将...分配,分配\nan amount of food for one person at a meal; a part of something larger, especially a part that is different from the other parts
reinforce@vt. 加强，加固；强化；补充\nvi. 求援；得到增援；给予更多的支持\nn. 加强；加固物；加固材料\nto give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger
reject@n. 被拒之人,不合格品,不及格者\nv. 拒绝,驳回,丢弃\nto refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something
so-called@adj. 所谓的\nused to describe someone or something that has been given a name that you think is wrong
strengthen@vt. &vi. 加强,变坚固to make something stronger, or to become stronger
supplement@n. 补充物,增刊\nvt. 补充,增补\nsomething that you add to something else to improve it or make it complete
undercooked@adj.煮得欠熟的,煎(或烤、炸) 得火候不足的\nto not cook something enough, so that it isn't tasty or isn't healthy
elective@adj. 选举的，随意选择的\nn. 选修科目\na course that students can choose to take, but they do not have to take it in order to graduate
faculty@n.能力，才能； 全体教职员； <英>（大学的）专科，系； 特权，特许\na department or group of related departments within a university
major@n. 主修, 成年人, 陆军少校; 巨头\nadj. 主要的, 较多的, 大部份的\nvi. 主修\nthe main subject that a student studies at college or university
mediation@n. 调停, 调解, 仲裁\nan attempt to end a disagreement by helping the two sides to talk through the issues and find a solution
protocol@n. 草案, 协议,礼仪\nvt 拟定议定书\na system of rules about the correct way to behave on an official occasion
tutorial@n. 个别指导\nadj. 个别指导的\na period of teaching and discussion with a tutor, especially in a British university
act@n. 行为,行动,法案,（戏剧、歌剧等的）一幕\nvt. 表演,扮演\nvi. 表演,行动,表现,充当,奏效\na law that has been officially accepted by a parliament, congress etc
engage@v. 答应, 预定, 使忙碌, 雇佣, 订婚\nto get involved with other people and their ideas in order to understand them
fulfilling@adj. 令人高兴的, 令人满意\n动词fulfill的现在分词形式\nif you fulfill a hope, wish or aim, you achieve the thing that you hoped for, wishes for etc
need@v. (为做成某事或正常生活)要求有，必须有，需要\nn. 必须品\nA need is a good or service essential for living.
want@v. 需要;想要\nn. 想要（一种愿望）\nA want is a good or service which people would like to have, but which is not essential for living. People's wants are unlimited.
problem@n. 问题；难题；困难\nEconomic problem：there exist unlimited wants but limited resources to produce the goods and services to satisfy those wants. This creates scarcity.
scarcity@n. 缺乏;不足;稀少\nScarcity is the lack of sufficient products to fulfil the total wants of the population.
opportunity@n. 机会；时机\nOpportunity cost is the next best alternative given up by choosing another item.
specialisation@n. 专门, 专业化\n=specialization(美)\nSpecialisation occurs when people and businesses concentrate on what they are best at.
division of labour@劳动分工\nDivision of labour is when the production process is split up into different tasks and each worker performs one of these tasks. It is a form of specialisation.
business@n. 商业；买卖；交易；生意\nBusinesses combine factors of production to make products(goods and services) which satisfy people's wants.
added value@n. （商品的）附加值，增值\nAdded value is the difference between the selling price of a product and the cost of bought in materials and components.
goods@n. 货物；商品\nGoods are things that are made to be sold.
land@n. 土地；田地；（尤指）耕作用地，建筑\nThis term is used to cover all of the natural resources provided by nature and includes fields and forests,oil,gas,metals and other mineral resources.
labour@n. 劳作；体力劳动;劳工\nThis is the number of people available to make products.
capital@n. 资本;资金\n1:This is the finance, machinery and equipment needed for the manufacture of goods.\n2:Capital is the money invested into a business by the owners.
enterprise@n. 企业，公司\nThis is the skill and risk-taking ability of the person who brings the other resources of factors of production together to produce a good or service. For example,the owner of a business. These people are called entrepreneurs.
turnover@n. 营业额\nThe turnover of a company is the value of the goods or services sold during a particular period of time.
primary sector@n.第一产业\nThe primary sector of industry extracts and uses the natural resources of the earth to produce raw materials used by other businesses.
secondary@adj. 第二位的;次要的;从属的\nThe secondary of industry manufactures goods using the raw materials provided by the primary sector. Example: baking,aircraft,building.
tertiary sector@n. 第三产业\nThe tertiary sector of industry provides services to consumers and the other sectors of industry. Example: banking,transport,hairdressing,hotels,insurance.
industrialisation@n.工业化\nDe-industrialisation occurs when there is a decline in the importance of the secondary, manufacturing sector of industry in a country.
mixed economy@n. (国有和私有企业并存的)混合型经济\nA mixed economy has both a private sector and a public(state) sector.
private sector@n. 私营产业；私营企业\nThe private sector is the part of a country's economy which consists of industries and commercial companies that are not owned or controlled by the government.
public sector@n. 公营部门；国营部门\nThe public sector is the part of a country's economy which is controlled or supported financially by the government.
entrepreneur@n. 企业家\nEntrepreneur is a person who organises, operates and takes the risk for a new business venture.
business plan@n. 商业企划（尤指为贷款而作的计划）\nA business plan is a document containing the business objectives and important details about the operations, finance and owners of the new business.
employe@employed n.（employ的过去式和过去分词 ); 使用\nCapital employed is the total value of capital used in the business.
output@n. 产量；输出；排出量\nOutput is used to refer to the amount of something that a person or thing produces.
internal@adj. 国内的;内政的;(组织)内部的\nInternal growth occurs when a business expands its existing operations.
external@adj. 外部的;外面的;外来的\nExternal growth is when a business takes over or merges with another business.
integration@n. 综合,整合\nIt is often called integration as one firm is integrated into another one.
merger@n. (公司、组织等的)合并，兼并，归并\nA merger is when the owner of two businesses agree to join their firms together to make one business.
acquisition@n. （对公司的）收购，并购\nA takeover or acquisition is when one business buys out the owners of another business which then becomes part of the'predator' business(the firm which has taken it over).
horizontal@adj. 水平的;横的;横向合并\nHorizontal integration is when one firm merges with or takes over another one in the same industry at the same stage of production.
vertical integration@n.[经]垂直统一管理;纵向合并\nVertical integration is when one firm merges with or takes over another one in the same industry but at a different stage of production. Vertical integration can be forward or backward.
conglomerate@n. 大型联合企业;企业集团\nConglomerate integration is when one firm merges with or takes over a firm in a completely different industry. This is also known as diversification.
sole trader@n. 个体户\nSole trader is a business owned by one person.
limited liability@n. 有限责任\nLimited liability means that the liability of shareholders in a company is only limited to the amount they invested.
unlimited@adj. 无限的；（数量）极大的\nUnlimited liability means that the owners of a business can be held responsible for the debts of the business they own. Their liability is not limited to the investment they made in the business.
partnership@n. 伙伴关系；合作关系\nPartnership is a form of business in which two or more people agree to jointly own a business.\nA partnership agreement is the written and legal agreement between business partners. It is not essential for partners to have such an agreement but it is always recommended.
incorporated@adj. (用于公司名称后)组成公司的，股份有限的\nIncorporated businesses are companies that have separate legal status from their owners.\nUnincorporated business is one that does not have a separate legal identity. Sole traders and partnerships are unincorporated businesses.
shareholder@n. 股票持有人;股东\nShareholders are the owners of a limited company. They buy shares which represent part ownership of a company.
annual general meeting@年度例会\nAn Annual General Meeting(AGM) is a legal requirement for all companies. Shareholders may attend and vote on who they want to be on the Board of Directors for the coming year.
dividend@n. 红利;股息;股利\nDividends are payments made to shareholders from the profits(after tax) of a company. They are the return to shareholders for investing in the company.
franchise@n. 特许经营权;专卖权;经销权\nA franchise is a business based upon the use of the brand names, promotional logos and trading methods of an existing successful business. The franchisee buys the licence to operate this business from the franchisor.
objective@n. 目的；长远的目标；宗旨\nBusiness objectives are the aims or targets that a business works towards.
profit@n. 利润；收益；盈利\nProfit is total income of a business(sales revenue) less total costs.
market share@n. 市场份额;市场占有率\nMarket share is the proportion of total market sales achieved by one business.
social enterprise@n. 社会企业\nA social enterprise has social objectives as well as an aim to make a profit to reinvest back into the business.
stakeholder@n. 利益相关者\nA stakeholder is any person or group with a direct interest in the performance and activities of a business.
GDP@n. 国内生产总值\nGross domestic product (GDP) is a monetary measure of the value of all final goods and services produced in a period (quarterly or yearly).
David@David Arthur:) #tag
motivation@n. 动力;诱因\nMotivation is the reason why employees want to work hard and work effectively for the business.
affiliation@n. （组织之间的）密切联系，隶属关系\nIf one group has an affiliation with another group, it has a close or official connection with it.
taylor@n.泰勒(m.& f.)\nF.W.Taylor based his ideas on the assumption that all individuals are motivated by personal gain.
Maslow@n. 马斯洛(人名)\nAbraham Maslow proposed a hierarchy of needs.
hygiene@n. 保健因素\nAccording to Herzberg, humans have two sets of needs; one is for the basic animal needs, which he called 'hygiene' factors or needs.
recognition@n. 认出;认可\nWhen a person receives recognition for the things that they have done, people acknowledge the value or skill of their work.
wage@n. 工资;工钱\nWage is payment for work, usually paid weekly.
piece rate@n. 计件工资率\nThis is where the workers are paid depending on the quantity of products made-the more they make, the more they get paid.
salary@n. (尤指从事某一职业的人获得的)薪水，薪金,工资\nA salary is payment for work, usually paid monthly.
commission@n. 受托之事;(接受报酬的)任务;佣金\nCommission is payment relating to the number of sales made.
profit sharing@n.分红制\nProfit sharing is a system whereby a proportion of the company's profits is paid out to employees.
bonus@n. 奖金；津贴;年终奖\nA bonus is an additional amount of payment above basic pay as a reward for good work.
performance-related pay@n. 与业绩挂钩的工资；绩效工资\nPerformance-related is pay which is related to the effectiveness of the employee where their output can easily be measured.
ownership@n. 股权\nShare ownership is where shares in the company are given to employees so that they become part owners in the company.
preen@Mark preen:) #tag
appraisal@n. 评价；评估；估量\nAn appraisal is a method of assessing the effectiveness of an employee.
fringe benefit@n. (用车等工资之外的)附加福利；额外津贴\nFringe benefits are non-financial rewards given to employees.
job satisfaction@n. 工作满足感\nJob satisfaction is the enjoyment derived frome feeling that you have done a good job.
job rotation@岗位轮换\nJob rotation involves workers swapping round and doing each specific task for only a limited time and then changing round again.
enlargement@n. 职务扩大化\nJob enlargement is where extra tasks of a similar level of work are added to a worker's job description.
enrichment@n. 职务丰富化\nJob enrichment involves looking at jobs and adding tasks that require more skill and/or responsibility.
autonomous@自治工作团体\nAutonomous work group is a group encouraged to manage its own work and working practices.
organisational@组织结构\nOrganisational structure refers to the levels of management and division of responsibilities within an organisation.
chain of command@n.行政管理系统\nChain of command is the structure in an organisation which allows instructions to be passed down from senior management to lower levels of management.
span@n. 管理跨度;管理跨度\nThe span of control is the number of subordinates working directly under a manager.
line manager@n. 部门经理\nLine managers have direct responsibility over people below them in the hierarchy of an organisation.
advisor@n. 顾问;人事经理\nAdvisor/Staff managers are specialists who provide support, information and assistance to line managers.
coordinate@n.协调；协同\nCoordinating means bring people in the organisation together.
delegation@n. [经] 授权\nDelegation means giving a subordinate the authority to perform particular tasks.
leadership@n. 领导风格\nLeadership styles are the different approaches to dealing with people when in a position of authority-autocratic, laissez-faire or democratic.
autocratic@adj. 独裁的;专制的;独断专行的\nAutocratic leadership is where the manager expects to be in charge of the business and to have their orders followed.
democratic@adj. 民主的;民主制度的;民主政体的\nDemocratic leadership gets other employees involved in the decision-making process.
laissez-faire@n. （政府对工商业的）自由放任政策\nLaissez-faire leadership makes the broad objectives of the business known to employees, but then they are left to make their own decisions and organise their own work.
trade union@n. 工会\nA trade union is a group of workers who have joined together to ensure their interests are protected.
closed shop@n. 只雇用工会会员的工厂(或商店等)\nAll employees must be a member of the same trade union.
recruitment@n. 招募；招聘\nRecruitment is the process from identifying that the business needs to employ someone up to the point at which applications have arrived at the business.\nInternal recruitment is when a vacancy is filled by someone who is an existing employee of the business.
analysis@n. 细察；分析\nA job analysis identifies and records the responsibilities and tasks relating to a job.
description@n. 描述;形容;叙述;说明\nA job description outlines the responsibilities and duties to be carried out by someone employed to do a specific job.
specification@n. 规格;具体要求\nA job specification is a document which outlines the requirements, qualifications, expertise, physical characteristics, etc. for a specified job.
CV@n. 个人履历\nCurriculum Vitae
resume@n. 简历
part-time@adj. 非全日制的；兼职的\nPart-time employment is often considered to be between 1 and 30-35 hours a week.
full-time@adj. 全职的;专职的;全日制的\nFull-time employees will usually work 35 hours or more a week.
induction@n. 就职;就职仪式;\nInduction training is an introduction given to a new employee, explaining the firm's activities, customs and procedures and introducing them to their fellow workers.
on-the-job@adj.在职的\nOn-the-job training occurs by watching a more experienced worker doing the job.
off-the-job@adj. 工作时间外\nOff-the-job training involves being trained away from the workplace, usually by specialist trainers.
workforce@n. 人力资源规划\nWorkforce planning is establishing the workforce needed by the business for the foreseeable future in terms of the number and skills of employees required.
redundancy@n. 裁减冗员;裁员(由于公司形势所迫，和员工表现无关)\nRedundancy is when an employee is no longer needed and so loses their job. It is not due to any aspect of their work being unsatisfactory.
dismissal@ n. 免职, 解雇
termination@n. 终结,合同中止\nTermination occurs when the employment  relationship comes to an end. This can be  when the employee hands in their resignation,  when a fixed term contract comes to an end,  or when an employee is dismissed for a  particular reason.
ethical@adj. 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的\nEthical decision is a decision taken by a manager or a company because of the moral code observed by the firm.
tribunal@n. [经] 劳资仲裁法庭\nAn industrial tribunal is a legal meeting which considers workers' complaints of unfair dismissal or discrimination at work.
contract@n. 雇佣合同\nA contract of employment is a legal agreement between employer and employee listing the rights and responsibilities of workers.
communication@n. 通信系统，通信\nCommunication is the transferring of a message from the sender to the receiver, who understands the message.
message@n. 音信;消息\nThe message is the information or instructions being passed by the sender to the receiver.
internal communication@n.内部沟通\nInternal communication is between members of the same organisation.
external@adj. 外部沟通\nExternal communication is between the organisation and other organisations or individuals.
transmitter@n. (电视、广播节目的)发射机;传送者; 传达者\nThe transmitter or sender of the message is the person starting off the process by sending the message.
medium@沟通媒介\nThe medium of communication is the method used to send a message, for example, a letter is a method of written communication and a meeting is a method of verbal communication.
receiver@n. 接收者\nThe receiver is the person who receives the message.
feedback@n. 反馈;反应\nFeedback is the reply from the receiver which shows whether the message has arrived, been understood and, if necessary, acted upon.
one-way@n. 单向通信\nOne-way communication involves a message which does not call for or require a response.
two-way@n. 双向通信\nTwo-way communication is when the receiver gives a response to the message and there is a discussion about it.
Post-it@n. 报事贴，便利贴\nInformal communication
memo@n. (公司或组织内部的)公务便条，备忘录\nFormal communication
formal@正式信息交流\nFormal communication is when messages are sent through established channels using professional language.
informal@非正式信息交流\nInformal communication is when information is sent and received casually with the use of everyday language.
barrier@n. 沟通障碍\nCommunication barriers are factors that stop effective communication of messages.
market share@n. 市场份额;市场占有率\nMarket share is the percentage of total market sales held by one brand or business.
niche market@缝隙市场\nNiche market is a small, usually specialised, segment of a much larger market.
mass market@n. (有意购买某产品的)大众市场\nMass market is where there is a very large number of sales of a product.
segment@n. 市场分割\nMarket segment is an identifiable sub-group of a whole market in which consumers have similar characteristics or preferences.
product@产品导向型\nA product-orientated business is one whose main focus of activity is on the product itself.
market@市场导向型\nA market-orientated business is one which carries out market research to find out consumer wants before a product is developed and produced.
budget@n. 市场预算\nA marketing budget is a financial plan for the marketing of a product or product range for some specified period of time. It specifies how much money is available to market the product or range, so that the Marketing department know how much they may spend.
market research@n. 市场研究;市场调查\nMarket research is the process of gathering, analysing and interpreting information about a market.
primary@初步研究\nPrimary research is the collection and collation of orginal data via direct contact with potential or existing customers. Also called field research.
secondary@次级研究\nSecondary research is information that has already been collected and is available for use by others. Also called desk research.
questionnaire@n. 调查问卷;调查表\nA questionnaire is a set of questions to be answered as a means of collecting data for market reserach.
sample@n. 样品;货样\nA sample is the group of people who are selected to respond to a market research exercise, such as a questionnaire.
random sample@n.随机抽样调查\nA random sample is when people are selected at random as a source of information for market research.
quota@n. 定量;定额;配额\nA quota sample is when people are selected on the basis of certain characteristics(such as age, gender of income) as a source of information for market research.
focus group@n. 焦点人群(代表大众，其观点可用于市场调查)\nA focus group is a group of people who are representative of the target market.
bar chart@ 条形图
pie chart@ n. 饼形图，圆形分格统计图表
marketing mix@n. （为推销某项产品或服务而推行的)营销组合,综合营销策略\nThe marketing mix is a term which is used to desecribe all the activities which go into marketing a product or service. These activities are often summarised as the four Ps-product, price, place and promotion.
usp@n. （产品、服务等的）独特卖点，与众不同之处，出众之处\nThe USP is the special feature of a product that differentiates it from the products of competitors.
brand name@n. 商标；品牌名称\nThe brand name is the unique name of a product that distinguishes it from other brands.
brand loyalty@品牌忠实度\nBrand loyalty is when consumers keep buying the same brand again and again instead of choosing a competitor's brand.
brand image@n. 品牌形象\nBrand image is an image or identity given to a product which gives it a personality of its own and distinguishes it from its competitors' brands.
packaging@n. 包装物\nPackaging is the physical container or wrapping for a product. It is also used for promotion and selling appeal.
product life cycle@产品寿命周期\nThe product life cycle describes the stages a product will pass through from its introduction, through its growth until it is mature and then finally its decline.
cost-plus@adj. 成本加利润的\nCost-plus pricing is the cost of manufacturing the product plus a profit mark-up.
competitive@竞争性竞价\nCompetitive pricing is when the product is priced in line with or just below competitors' prices to try to capture more of the market.
penetration@n. 渗透竞价\nPenetration pricing is when the price is set lower than the competitors' prices in order to be able to enter a new market.
skimming@n. 吸脂定价法\nPrice skimming is where a high price is set for a new product on the market.
promotional@n. 促销定价\nPromotional pricing is when a product is sold at a very low price for a short period of time.
dynamic@n. 动态定价\nDynamic pricing happens when customers are split into two or more groups and they are charged different prices for basically the same product or service because they have different demand levels.
psychological@n. 心理定价\nPsychological pricing is an approach when particular attention is paid to the effect that the price of a product will have upon consumers' perceptions of the product.
elasticity@n. 弹性价格\nPrice elasticity is a measure of the responsiveness of demand to a change in price.
informative@n. 信息性广告\nInformative advertising is where the emphasis of advertising or sales promotion is to give full information about the product.
persuasive@n. 说服性广告\nPersuasive advertising is advertising or promotion which is trying to persuade the consumer that they really need the product and should buy it.
target audience@n. 目标受众\nThe target audience refers to people who are potential buyers of a product or service.
sales promotion@n. 促销\nSales promotion-incentives such as special offers or special deals aimed at consumers to achieve short-term increases in sales.
distribution@n. 分销渠道，销售渠道\nA distribution channel is the means by which a product is passed from the place of production to the customer or retailer.
agent@n. 代理商\nAn agent is an independent person or business that is appointed to deal with the sales and distribution of a product or range of products.
e-commerce@n. 电子商务\nE-commerce is the buying and selling of goods and services using computer systems linked to the internet.
strategy@n. 市场营销战略\nA marketing strategy is a plan to combine the right combination of the four elements of the marketing mix for a product or service to achieve a particular marketing objective(s).
occur@ vi.发生； 出现； 闪现
response@ n. 反应, 响应; 回答
sought@ vbl. 寻找,搜索(seek的过去式和过去分词)
reliance@ n. 信赖,所信赖的人或物
coordination@ n. 同等,调和
reaction@ n. 反应,反作用力,化学反应

concentration@n. 集中, 专心, 浓度

option@ n.选择（的自由）； 选项； 选择权； 选择能力\nvt.得到或获准进行选择； 调动球员

acknowledged@ adj. 公认的\nv. 承认, 通知收到, 答谢\nvbl. 承认, 通知收到, 答谢

buckle@n. 皮带扣\nvt.&amp; vi. 扣住,弯曲,专心做事,屈服\nadj. 带扣的,弯曲的1.N-COUNT（皮带等的）搭扣，搭钩A buckle is a piece of metal or plastic attached to one end of a belt or strap, which is used to fasten it.\n\n    He wore a belt with a large brass buckle.\n\n    他系了条带有一个大的铜搭扣的皮带。\n\n2.VERB扣住；扣紧When you buckle a belt or strap, you fasten it. \n\n    A door slammed in the house and a man came out buckling his belt.\n\n    房子里的一扇门砰地关上，一个男子边扣腰带边走了出来。\n\n3.V-ERG（因受热或受力）（使）弯曲，（使）变形If an object buckles or if something buckles it, it becomes bent as a result of very great heat or force. \n\n    The door was beginning to buckle from the intense heat...\n\n    门在高温高热下开始变形。\n\n    A freak wave had buckled the deck.\n\n    突然掀起的巨浪打弯了甲板。\n\n4.VERB（双腿或膝盖因虚弱、劳累）发软If your legs or knees buckle, they bend because they have become very weak or tired. \n\n    Mcanally's knees buckled and he crumpled down onto the floor...\n\n    麦卡纳利双膝发软，瘫倒在地板上。\n\n    His right leg buckled under him.\n\n    他的右腿发软打战。

leaven@n. 酵素, 酵母，要素\nvt. 使...发酵, 影响\n1.VERB给…添趣；为…增色；使生动If a situation or activity is leavened by or with something, it is made more interesting or cheerful. \n\nHis mood of deep pessimism cannot have been leavened by his mode of transport—a black cab...\n\n他极度悲观沮丧，而他的代步工具——一辆黑色的出租车，丝毫不能舒缓这一情绪。\n\n\nHe found congenial officers who knew how to leaven war's rigours with riotous enjoyment.\n\n他找到了懂得用狂欢来冲淡战争的严酷的志趣相投的军官。\n\n

skirmish@\n1.N-COUNT小规模战斗；接触战A skirmish is a minor battle. \n\nBorder skirmishes between India and Pakistan were common.\n\n印度和巴基斯坦边境上常常发生小规模战斗。\n\n\n\n2.V-RECIP发生小冲突；进行小规模战斗；打斗If people skirmish, they fight. \n\nThey were skirmishing close to the minefield now...\n\n他们当时正在雷区附近交火。\n\n\nPolice skirmished with youths on the estate last Friday.\n\n上周五警方与一些青年在住宅区发生了冲突。\n\n\n\nskirmishing\n\nOn land there was minor skirmishing.\n\n陆地上发生了小规模的战斗。\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT小争执；口角；争论；冲突A skirmish is a short, sharp argument.\n\nThis difference in approach has led to several political skirmishes.\n\n这种方式上的差异已经导致了几场政治冲突。\n\n\n
custody@1.N-UNCOUNT（尤指父母离异后孩子的）监护权\nI'm going to go to court to get custody of the children...\n我将起诉，要求获得孩子们的监护权。\n2.PHRASE被拘留；在拘禁中Someone who is in custody or has been taken into custody has been arrested and is being kept in prison until they can be tried in a court.\n3.N-UNCOUNT（类似监狱的）监禁，关押If someone is being held in a particular type of custody, they are being kept in a place that is similar to a prison. \n\nThe youngster got nine months' youth custody...\n这个少年被处以9个月的管教。\n\n
rack up@PHRASAL VERB（商业上）大量获得（利润），遭受（严重损失），热销；（体育中）获胜，得（分）If a business racks up profits, losses, or sales, it makes a lot of them. If a sportsman, sportswoman, or team racks up wins, they win a lot of matches or races. \n\nLower rates mean that firms are more likely to rack up profits in the coming months...\n\n更低的费率意味着各公司更有可能在未来的几个月中大幅获利。\n\n\nIndia while not racking up such an impressive score beat Japan 3-0.\n\n印度尽管没有大胜，却也以3比0击败了日本。\n\n
