blight@\n1.N-VAR破坏因素；祸根；阴影You can refer to something as a blight when it causes great difficulties, and damages or spoils other things. \n\nThis discriminatory policy has really been a blight on America...\n\n这项歧视性政策确实成了美国的一大祸根。\n\n\nManchester still suffers from urban blight and unacceptable poverty.\n\n曼彻斯特仍然受到城区脏乱和严重贫困问题的困扰。\n\n\n\n2.VERB破坏（生活）；使（希望）破灭；摧毁；损毁If something blights your life or your hopes, it damages and spoils them. If something blights an area, it spoils it and makes it unattractive. \n\nAn embarrassing blunder nearly blighted his career before it got off the ground.\n\n一个令人难堪的疏忽几乎毁掉了他还没有起步的事业。\n\n\n...thousands of families whose lives were blighted by unemployment.\n\n成千上万因为失业而难以维持生计的家庭\n\n\n...a strategy to redevelop blighted inner-city areas.\n\n改建破败不堪的旧城区的策略\n\n\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT（植物的）枯萎病\n
prowl@\n1.VERB潜行；悄悄巡行If an animal or a person prowls around, they move around quietly, for example when they are hunting. \n\nPolicemen prowled around the building.\n\n警察在大楼四周暗中巡查。\n\n\n\n2.PHRASE（动物）在觅食；（人）在寻找性伴侣（或生意）If an animal is on the prowl, it is hunting. If a person is on the prowl, they are hunting for something such as a sexual partner or a business deal. \n\nTheir fellow travellers are a mix of honeymooners, single girls on the prowl and elderly couples...\n\n他们的旅伴中有度蜜月的新人，有寻觅伴侣的单身女孩，也有老年夫妇。\n\n\nThe new administration are on the prowl for ways to reduce spending.\n\n新政府在寻求削减开支的方法。\n\n\n
dangle@\n1.V-ERG悬挂；悬摆If something dangles from somewhere or if you dangle it somewhere, it hangs or swings loosely. \n\nA gold bracelet dangled from his left wrist...\n\n一只金手镯在他的左手腕上晃来晃去。\n\n\nCrystal chandeliers dangled from every ceiling...\n\n每个房间的天花板上都悬有枝形水晶吊灯。\n\n\nHe and I were sitting out on his jetty dangling our legs in the water.\n\n我和他坐在他的码头上，双腿在水中荡悠。\n\n\n\n2.VERB炫示（诱惑物）If you say that someone is dangling something attractive before you, you mean they are offering it to you in order to try to influence you in some way. \n\nThey've dangled rich rewards before me.\n\n他们以丰厚的酬劳诱惑我。\n\n\n
slash@\n1.VERB割破；在…上留下深长的切口If you slash something, you make a long, deep cut in it. \n\nHe came within two minutes of bleeding to death after slashing his wrists.\n\n若再晚两分钟割腕的他就会因失血过多而死。\n\n\nSlash is also a noun.\n\nMake deep slashes in the meat and push in the spice paste.\n\n在肉上切出深深的口子，再把辣酱塞进切口中。\n\n\n\n\n2.VERB挥砍；劈If you slash at a person or thing, you quickly hit at them with something such as a knife. \n\nHe slashed at her, aiming carefully.\n\n他仔细地瞄准她劈了过去。\n\n\n\n3.VERB大量削减To slash something such as costs or jobs means to reduce them by a large amount. \n\nCar makers could be forced to slash prices after being accused of overcharging yesterday...\n\n昨天被指控要价太高之后，汽车生产商可能会被迫大幅度降价。\n\n\nEveryone agrees that subsidies have to be slashed.\n\n所有人都同意必须大幅度削减补贴。\n\n\n\n4.斜线号You say slash to refer to a sloping line that separates letters, words, or numbers. For example, if you are giving the number 340/2/K you say 'Three four zero, slash two, slash K.'\n
wad@n. 块状软物，填料，一叠（钞票）\nvt. 使 ... 成一团1.N-COUNT卷；叠；捆A wad of something such as paper or cloth is a tight bundle or ball of it. \n\n...a wad of banknotes.\n\n一沓钞票\n\n\n...a wad of cotton soaked in cleaning fluid.\n\n一团浸泡了清洁剂的棉花\n\n
sweet spot@ (平衡各种因素的)最有效点,最有效位置\n原来指棒球击球时的在球棒上的最佳击球位置等
wield@\n1.VERB使用，挥，操（武器、工具等）If you wield a weapon, tool, or piece of equipment, you carry and use it. \n\n...a lone assailant wielding a kitchen knife.\n\n孤身一人、手持菜刀的袭击者\n\n\n\n2.VERB掌握，运用，行使（权利）If someone wields power, they have it and are able to use it. \n\nHe remains chairman, but wields little power at the company.\n\n他还是主席，但在公司没有什么实权了。\n\n\n
manic@adj. 狂躁的\nn. 狂躁者\n1.ADJ-GRADED发狂的；狂躁的；非常激动的If you describe someone as manic, you mean that they do things extremely quickly or energetically, often because they are very excited or anxious about something.\n\nHe was really manic...\n\n他真的疯了一般。\n\n\nHe seemed to have an almost manic energy.\n\n他似乎有一股近乎疯狂的劲头。\n\n\n\nmanically\n\nWe cleaned the house manically over the weekend...\n\n周末，我们干劲十足地把屋子打扫了一遍。\n\n\nHers is a manically full life.\n\n她的生活忙得不可开交。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED（微笑、笑声或幽默）过度的，失常的If you describe someone's smile, laughter, or sense of humour as manic, you mean that it seems excessive or strange, as if they were insane.\n\n...a manic grin.\n\n傻笑\n\n\n
divinity@\n1.N-UNCOUNT神学Divinity is the study of religion.\n\nHe entered Otago University to study arts and divinity.\n\n他进入奥特哥大学学习艺术和神学。\n\n\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT神性；神圣性Divinity is the quality of being divine. \n\n...a lasting faith in the divinity of Christ's word.\n\n对基督话语的神圣性的持久信仰\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT神；女神A divinity is a god or goddess.\n\nThe three statues above are probably Roman divinities.\n\n上面的3尊雕像可能是罗马诸神。\n\n\n
stature@\n1.N-UNCOUNT身高；个子Someone's stature is their height. \n\nIt's more than his physical stature that makes him remarkable...\n\n他的与众不同之处不光是他的身高。\n\n\nMother was of very small stature, barely five feet tall...\n\n母亲身材矮小，只有 5 英尺高。\n\n\nShe was a little short in stature.\n\n她个子较矮。\n\n\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT地位；声望The stature of a person is the importance and reputation that they have. \n\nWho can deny his stature as the world's greatest cellist?...\n\n谁能否认他是世界上最伟大的大提琴演奏家呢？\n\n\nThis club has grown in stature over the last 20 years.\n\n这家俱乐部在过去 20 年间知名度大增。\n\n\n
ballistic@\n1.ADJ弹道（学）的Ballistic means relating to ballistics. \n\n...ballistic missiles...\n\n弹道导弹\n\n\nBallistic tests have matched the weapons with bullets taken from the bodies of victims.\n\n弹道测试表明，武器和受害者体内取出的子弹相吻合。\n\n\n\n2.PHRASE勃然大怒If someone goes ballistic, they suddenly become very angry. \n\nThe singer went ballistic after one member of his band failed to show for a sound check.\n\n因为乐队的一个成员没来试音，这位歌手大发雷霆。\n\n\n\n3.PHRASE（常指令人惊讶或不受欢迎地）激涨，猛增If something goes ballistic, it suddenly becomes very much greater or more powerful, often in a surprising or unwanted way. \n\nAugust registrations have gone ballistic, accounting now for a quarter of the annual total.\n\n8月份的注册人数突然暴涨，现在已经达到了年注册量的四分之一。\n\n\n
laceration@1.N-COUNT割伤；划伤；撕裂伤Lacerations are deep cuts on your skin. \n\nHe had lacerations on his back and thighs.\n\n他的背部和大腿都有划伤。\n\n
scarlet@\n1.COLOUR猩红色；绯红色；鲜红色Something that is scarlet is bright red.\n\n...her scarlet lipstick.\n\n她鲜红色的唇膏\n\n\n\n2.COLOUR（脸）羞红的，红晕的，涨红的If someone with pale skin turns or goes scarlet, their face becomes redder than usual because they are very embarrassed or angry. \n\nShe turned scarlet from embarrassment, once she realized what she had done...\n\n等她明白自己的所作所为后，尴尬得满脸通红。\n\n\nHer face went bright scarlet.\n\n她的脸变得通红。\n\n\n
impervious@\n1.ADJ-GRADED无动于衷的；不受影响的If you are impervious to someone's actions, you are not affected or influenced by them. \n\nShe seems almost impervious to the criticism from all sides...\n\n对于来自各方的指责，她似乎无动于衷。\n\n\nThe political system there has been impervious to all suggestions of change.\n\n那里的政治体制对于所有的改革建议一概置之不理。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ防渗漏的；不能渗透的；不能穿过的Something that is impervious to water, heat, or a particular object is able to resist it or stop it passing through it. \n\nThe floorcovering you select will need to be impervious to water.\n\n挑选的地板材料必须是防水的。\n\n\n...a layer of impervious rock.\n\n一层防渗漏的岩石\n\n\n
fang@1.N-COUNT（某些动物的）尖牙，尖齿Fangs are the two long, sharp, upper teeth that some animals have. \n\nThe cobra sank its venomous fangs into his hand.\n\n眼镜蛇狠狠咬了他一口，毒牙刺进他手上的皮肤。\n\n
kinematics@ n. 运动学
squarely@\n1.ADV径直；正中地Squarely means directly or in the middle, rather than indirectly or at an angle. \n\nI kept the gun aimed squarely at his eyes.\n\n我一直将枪径直瞄准他的双眼。\n\n\n\n2.ADV完全地；毫无疑问地If something such as blame or responsibility lies squarely with someone, they are definitely the person responsible. \n\nThe president put the blame squarely on his opponent...\n\n总统将责任完全归咎于对手。\n\n\nResponsibility for success or failure lies squarely with the Nigerians.\n\n成败完全取决于尼日利亚人。\n\n\n\n3.ADV直截了当地；不回避地If you face something squarely, you face it directly, without trying to avoid it. \n\nThe management committee have faced the situation squarely...\n\n管理委员会直面当前形势。\n\n\nWe have to drop our pretences and look squarely at schooling as it really is.\n\n我们必须抛开一切伪装，正视学校教育的真实情况。\n\n\n
runaway@\n1.ADJ迅速的；无法控制的；失控的You use runaway to describe a situation in which something increases or develops very quickly and cannot be controlled. \n\nOur Grand Sale in June was a runaway success.\n\n我们6月份的大型促销一举成功。\n\n\n...a runaway best-seller.\n\n一炮打响的畅销书\n\n\n...in an era of runaway inflation.\n\n恶性通货膨胀时期\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT离家出走者（尤指小孩），逃亡者A runaway is someone, especially a child, who leaves home without telling anyone or without permission. \n\n...a teenage runaway.\n\n离家出走的十几岁的孩子\n\n\n...a runaway slave.\n\n逃跑的奴隶\n\n\n\n3.ADJ（车辆、动物等）失控的A runaway vehicle or animal is moving forward quickly, and its driver or rider has lost control of it. \n\nThe runaway car careered into a bench, hitting an elderly couple...\n\n那辆失控的车猛冲到一条长椅上，撞伤了一对老夫妇。\n\n\nThe narrative pulls you along like a runaway train.\n\n这个故事就像一辆失控的高速列车，读起来惊险刺激。\n\n\n...a runaway horse.\n\n脱缰的马\n\n\n
shootout@\n1.N-COUNT枪战；交火A shoot-out is a fight in which people shoot at each other with guns.\n\nThree IRA men were killed in the shoot-out.\n\n交火中3名爱尔兰共和军成员被打死。\n\n\n...a bloody shoot-out between rival gangs that killed 18 people.\n\n致使18人丧生的敌对帮派间的激烈枪战\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（足球等运动的）点球大战，罚点球决胜负In games such as football, a shoot-out or a penalty shoot-out is a way of deciding the result of a game that has ended in a draw. Players from each team try to score a goal in turn until one player fails to score and their team loses the game.\n\nThe Danes won that UEFA tie in a shoot-out.\n\n丹麦人在点球大战中胜出，赢下了那场欧洲杯淘汰赛。\n\n\n
terrain@1.N-VAR地形；地势；地带Terrain is used to refer to an area of land or a type of land when you are considering its physical features. \n\nThe terrain changed quickly from arable land to desert.\n\n那个地带很快就从耕地变成了沙漠。\n\n\n...a tortuous eight-hour coach ride around 1,200 bends of rough terrain.\n\n在崎岖不平的地势上拐了 1，200 个弯、长达 8 小时的冗长的长途汽车旅行\n\n
maneuver@n. 演习,调遣,策略\nvt. 调遣,演习,巧妙地操纵\nvi. 调遣,演习,用计策in AM, use 美国英语用 maneuver\n1.VERB（熟练地）移动，调动，转动，操纵If you manoeuvre something into or out of an awkward position, you skilfully move it there. \n\n    We attempted to manoeuvre the canoe closer to him...\n\n    我们试图让独木舟靠他更近一些。\n\n    I manoeuvred my way among the tables to the back corner of the place...\n\n    我在桌子中间穿行，来到后面的角落里。\n\n    The pilot instinctively maneuvered to avoid them.\n\n    飞行员本能地驾机避开他们。\n\n    Manoeuvre is also a noun.\n\n        ...a ship capable of high speed and rapid manoeuvre.\n\n        速度快、机动性强的轮船\n\n2.VERB操纵；控制；耍花招If you manoeuvre a situation, you change it in a clever and skilful way so that you can benefit from it. \n\n    The authorities have to manoeuvre the markets into demanding a cut in interest rates...\n\n    当局不得不干预市场，迫其提出削减利率的要求。\n\n    He brilliantly manoeuvred himself back to power...\n\n    他依靠手腕巧妙地重掌权力。\n\n    He manoeuvres to foster recovery.\n\n    他采取手段促进复苏。\n\n    Manoeuvre is also a noun.\n\n        ...manoeuvres to block the electoral process.\n\n        阻碍选举进程的手段\n\nmanoeuvring\n\n    ...his unrivalled skill in political manoeuvring.\n\n    他那无人能及的运筹帷幄的政治手段\n\n    ...his manoeuvrings on the matter of free trade.\n\n    他在自由贸易问题上耍的花招\n\n3.N-PLURAL军事演习Military manoeuvres are training exercises which involve the movement of soldiers and equipment over a large area.\n\n    Allied troops begin maneuvers tomorrow to show how quickly forces could be mobilized in case of a new invasion...\n\n    盟军明日演习，来展示一旦发生新的入侵，其集结速度之快。\n\n    The camp was used for military manoeuvres.\n\n    这个营地被用于军事演习。
ammo@N-UNCOUNT军火；弹药Ammo is ammunition for guns and other weapons.
stance@\n1.N-COUNT态度；立场Your stance on a particular matter is your attitude to it. \n\nThe Congress had agreed to reconsider its stance on the armed struggle...\n\n国会已同意重新考虑其对武装斗争的态度。\n\n\nThey have maintained a consistently neutral stance...\n\n他们一直持中立态度。\n\n\nHis stance towards the story is quite similar to ours.\n\n他对该报道的态度和我们很相像。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT站姿Your stance is the way that you are standing. \n\nTake a comfortably wide stance and flex your knees a little...\n\n双腿适度分开站立，双膝稍稍弯曲。\n\n\nThe woman detective shifted her stance from one foot to another.\n\n女侦探改变了站姿，把重心从一只脚移到另一只脚。\n\n\n
smack@\n1.VERB（用手）打；掌掴If you smack someone, you hit them with your hand. \n\nShe smacked me on the side of the head.\n\n她狠狠地拍了一下我的脑袋。\n\n\nSmack is also a noun.\n\nSometimes he just doesn't listen and I end up shouting at him or giving him a smack.\n\n有时候，他就是不肯听话，闹到最后，我会冲他大喊大叫，或给他一巴掌。\n\n\n\n\n2.VERB啪的一声甩（或扔、打等）If you smack something somewhere, you put it or throw it there so that it makes a loud, sharp noise. \n\nHe smacked his hands down on his knees...\n\n他的双手使劲地拍了一下膝盖。\n\n\nRay Houghton smacked the ball against a post.\n\n雷·霍顿把球狠狠地砸到一根柱子上。\n\n\n\n3.VERB令人想起；类似于；含有…的意味If one thing smacks of another thing that you consider bad, it reminds you of it or is like it. \n\nThe engineers' union was unhappy with the motion, saying it smacked of racism.\n\n工程师联盟对这项提议感到很不满，称该提议有点种族主义的味道。\n\n\n\n4.ADV正好，恰巧（在某处）Something that is smack in a particular place is exactly in that place. \n\nIn part that's because industry is smack in the middle of the city.\n\n部分原因在于：工业恰好在城市的中心。\n\n\n\n5.N-UNCOUNT海洛因；白面Smack is heroin\n
split second@adj. 极快的, 一刹那的1.N-SING一刹那；一瞬间A split second is an extremely short period of time.\n\nHer gaze met Michael's for a split second...\n\n她和迈克尔在一瞬间四目相对。\n\n\nSoldiers had to make split-second decisions before opening fire, he said.\n\n他说，士兵们必须要在开火之前作出瞬间的决定。\n\n
customize@1.VERB定制；定做；改制If you customize something, you change its appearance or features to suit your tastes or needs. \n\n...a control that allows photographers to customise the camera's basic settings.\n\n使拍照者能够自定义相机的基本设置的控制按钮\n\n\n...customized software.\n\n定制软件\n\n
baddy@\n1.N-COUNT（多指小说或电影中的）反角，坏人，恶人A baddy is a person in a story or film who is considered to be evil or wicked, or who is fighting on the wrong side. You can also refer to the baddies in a situation in real life. \n\n...a baddie who's trying to take over the world.\n\n企图统治世界的恶人\n\n\n\nin AM, use 美国英语通常用 bad guy\n\n
feat@n. 壮举,功绩,伟业
synthesis@\n1.N-COUNT综合；结合；结合体A synthesis of different ideas or styles is a mixture or combination of these ideas or styles. \n\nHis novels are a rich synthesis of Balkan history and mythology...\n\n他的小说融合了大量巴尔干半岛的历史和神话故事。\n\n\nHer synthesis of feminism and socialism ran counter to all other historical currents.\n\n她将女权主义和社会主义的结合与所有其他的历史潮流背道而驰。\n\n\n\n2.N-VAR（通过化学或生物反应进行的）合成The synthesis of a substance is the production of it by means of chemical or biological reactions. \n\n...the genes that regulate the synthesis of these compounds...\n\n控制这些化合物合成的基因\n\n\nThis kind of lighting encourages vitamin D synthesis in the skin.\n\n这种光照会促进皮肤中维生素 D 的合成。\n\n\n
bestow@1.VERB给予；赠与；授予；赐予To bestow something on someone means to give or present it to them. \n\nThe Queen has bestowed a knighthood on him.\n\n女王已经授予他爵士头衔。\n\n
unleash@v. 解开...的皮带, 解除...的束缚, 解放1.VERB释放；放纵…而出If you say that someone or something unleashes a powerful force, feeling, activity, or group, you mean that they suddenly start it or send it somewhere. \n\nThen he unleashed his own, unstoppable, attack...\n\n接着他开始了自己不可阻挡的攻击。\n\n\nThe officers were still reluctant to unleash their troops in pursuit of a defeated enemy.\n\n军官们仍不愿发兵乘胜追击溃败的敌人。\n\n\n...the fury unleashed by the church schools' proposals.\n\n由教会学校的建议引发的熊熊怒火\n\n
seminar@\n1.N-COUNT专题讨论会；研讨会A seminar is a meeting where a group of people discuss a problem or topic.\n\n...a series of half-day seminars to help businessmen get the best value from investing in information technology.\n\n旨在帮助商界人士从投资信息技术中获得最大价值的一系列半日研讨会\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（大学里由教师指导一小组学生参加的）研讨班，研讨课A seminar is a class at a college or university in which the teacher and a small group of students discuss a topic.\n\nStudents are asked to prepare material in advance of each weekly seminar.\n\n学生要在上每星期的研讨课前备好材料。\n\n\n
vitality@1.N-UNCOUNT活力；生命力；热情If you say that someone or something has vitality, you mean that they have great energy and liveliness.\n\nWithout continued learning, graduates will lose their intellectual vitality...\n\n如果不继续学习，毕业生就会失去思想上的活力。\n\n\nMr Li said China's reforms had brought vitality to its economy.\n\n李先生说中国的改革给其经济注入了活力。\n\n
gauge@\n1.VERB（常指用某种仪器）测量，测定，算出If you gauge the speed or strength of something, or if you gauge an amount, you measure or calculate it, often by using a device of some kind. \n\nHe gauged the wind at over thirty knots...\n\n他测出风速在30节以上。\n\n\nDistance is gauged by journey time rather than miles.\n\n距离以行程时间而非英里数来计算。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT测量仪器；计量仪A gauge is a device that measures the amount or quantity of something and shows the amount measured. \n\n...temperature gauges.\n\n温度计\n\n\n...pressure gauges.\n\n压力计\n\n\n\n3.VERB判断，判定（人的行动、情感或意图）If you gauge people's actions, feelings, or intentions in a particular situation, you carefully consider and judge them. \n\n...as he gauged possible enemy moves and his own responses...\n\n他在盘算着敌人可能的动向和自己的对策时\n\n\nHis mood can be gauged by his reaction to the most trivial of incidents.\n\n从他对鸡毛蒜皮的小事的反应就可以判断出他的情绪。\n\n\n\n4.N-SING（评价或判断的）事实，依据，标准A gauge of someone's feelings or a situation is a fact or event that can be used to judge them. \n\nThe index is the government's chief gauge of future economic activity.\n\n这一指数是政府判断未来经济活动的主要依据。\n\n\n\n5.N-COUNT（铁道的）轨距A gauge is the distance between the two rails on a railway line. \n\n...a narrow gauge railway.\n\n窄轨铁路\n\n\n\n6.N-COUNT（金属等的）厚度；（金属丝等的）直径A gauge is the thickness of something, especially metal or wire.\n
loofah@1.N-COUNT（洗澡用的）丝瓜络A loofah is a long rough sponge-like piece of plant fibre which you use to scrub your body.
pomeranian@ adj.波美拉尼亚 的 n.波美拉尼亚 人,波美拉尼亚种小狗
memorial@\n.N-COUNT纪念碑A memorial is a structure built in order to remind people of a famous person or event. \n\nBuilding a memorial to Columbus has been his lifelong dream...\n\n为哥伦布建一座纪念碑是他一生的梦想。\n\n\nEvery village had its war memorial.\n\n每座村庄都有自己的战争纪念碑。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ（对逝者）纪念的；悼念的；追思的A memorial event, object, or prize is in honour of someone who has died, so that they will be remembered. \n\nA memorial service is being held for her at St Paul's Church.\n\n她的追悼会正在圣保罗教堂举行。\n\n\n...memorial plaques to local regiments...\n\n发给驻扎本地的兵团的纪念章\n\n\nHe went on to win the James E. Sullivan Memorial Trophy as the outstanding amateur athlete of 1962.\n\n接着，他又作为1962年度杰出业余运动员赢得了“詹姆斯·E。沙利文纪念奖”。\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT（追忆逝者的）纪念物，纪念品If you say that something will be a memorial to someone who has died, you mean that it will continue to exist and remind people of them. \n\nThe museum will serve as a memorial to the millions who passed through Ellis Island...\n\n这个博物馆将用来纪念经过埃利斯岛的数百万移民。\n\n\nThe city's rather uncompromising bleakness is a permanent memorial to its dark and mysterious founders.\n\n这座城市毫不妥协的荒凉面貌是对其神秘莫测的创建者的永久纪念。\n\n\n
bouquet@\n1.N-COUNT花束A bouquet is a bunch of flowers which is attractively arranged. \n\nThe woman carried a bouquet of dried violets.\n\n这个女人拿着一束干枯的紫罗兰。\n\n\n\n2.N-VAR（尤指葡萄酒散发的）香味，芬芳The bouquet of something, especially wine, is the pleasant smell that it has.\n\n...a Sicilian wine with a light red colour and a bouquet of cloves.\n\n颜色淡红、散发着丁香香味的西西里葡萄酒\n\n\n
den@\n1.N-COUNT（狮子、狐狸等野生动物的）兽穴，兽窝A den is the home of certain types of wild animals such as lions or foxes.\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（家里用来学习、工作或从事业余爱好的）书房，私室Your den is a quiet room in your house where you can go to study, work, or carry on a hobby without being disturbed. \n\n\n3.N-COUNT（通常指为了从事非法活动的）秘密聚集处，窝点，巢穴A den is a secret place where people meet, usually for a dishonest purpose. \n\nI could provide you with the addresses of at least three illegal drinking dens.\n\n我可以为你提供至少 3 处非法饮酒窝点的地址。\n\n\n...the crack dens of urban America.\n\n美国城市中的可卡因毒窟\n\n\n\n4.N-COUNT（某一不良行为或非法活动的猖獗）场所，渊薮If you describe a place as a den of a particular type of bad or illegal behaviour, you mean that a lot of that type of behaviour goes on there. \n\n...the one-bedroomed flat that was to become his den of savage debauchery.\n\n即将成为他野蛮放荡之所的一居室公寓\n\n\n...a den of greed.\n\n贪欲横行之地\n\n\n
rhizome@ n.[植]根茎,根状茎
sprinkle@\n1.VERB洒（水）；撒（粉末）If you sprinkle a thing with something such as a liquid or powder, you scatter the liquid or powder over it. \n\nSprinkle the meat with salt and place in the pan...\n\n在肉上撒上盐，然后放进平底锅。\n\n\nAt the festival, candles are blessed and sprinkled with holy water...\n\n在节日里，要对蜡烛祝圣，并洒以圣水。\n\n\nCheese can be sprinkled on egg or vegetable dishes.\n\n奶酪可以撒在鸡蛋或蔬菜做的菜肴上。\n\n\n\n2.VERB使…上零星分布（着…）If something is sprinkled with particular things, it has a few of them throughout it and they are far apart from each other. \n\nUnfortunately, the text is sprinkled with errors...\n\n遗憾的是，文本中零星地有一些错误。\n\n\nMen in green army uniforms are sprinkled throughout the huge auditorium.\n\n穿着绿色军服的人星星点点地分布在整个大礼堂中。\n\n\n\n3.VERB下毛毛细雨If it is sprinkling, it is raining very lightly.\n
partition@\n1.N-COUNT隔断；隔扇；隔墙；隔板A partition is a wall or screen that separates one part of a room or vehicle from another.\n\n...new offices divided only by glass partitions...\n\n只用玻璃隔板隔开的新办公室\n\n\nHer taxicab has a thick perspex partition between the passengers' seats and the driver.\n\n她的出租车里乘客座位和驾驶员之间装着厚厚的有机玻璃隔板。\n\n\n\n2.VERB（用隔板、隔扇等）隔开，分隔If you partition a room, you separate one part of it from another by means of a partition. \n\nBedrooms have again been created by partitioning a single larger room...\n\n通过将一间大屋用隔断断开的方法再隔出了几间卧室。\n\n\nHe sat on the two-seater sofa in the partitioned office.\n\n他坐在用隔板隔开的办公室里的双人沙发上。\n\n\n\n3.VERB分割，分裂（国家）If a country is partitioned, it is divided into two or more independent countries. \n\n...for the first time since Ireland was partitioned...\n\n自爱尔兰被分裂后第一次\n\n\nBritain was accused of trying to partition the country 'because of historic enmity'...\n\n英国被指“出于历史仇恨”企图分裂该国。\n\n\nThe island has been partitioned since the mid-seventies.\n\n自从70年代中期以来，这个岛就分裂了。\n\n\nPartition is also a noun.\n\n...areas ruled by the Russian Tsar during Poland's period of partition.\n\n波兰被分割期间俄国沙皇的统治区\n\n\n...fighting which followed the partition of India.\n\n印度分裂后随之而来的战乱\n\n\n\n
debut@n. 初次登场\nvt.&amp;vi. 初次登场1.N-COUNT（表演者或运动员的）首次登台，初次露面；（歌手的）首次录音The debut of a performer or sports player is their first public performance, appearance, or recording. \n\nDundee United's Dave Bowman makes his international debut.\n\n邓迪联队的戴夫·鲍曼首次亮相国际比赛。\n\n\n...her debut album 'Sugar Time'.\n\n她的首张专辑《甜蜜时光》\n\n
rove@\n1.VERB漫游；流浪；漂泊If someone roves about an area or roves an area, they wander around it. \n\n...roving about the town in the dead of night and seeing something peculiar...\n\n夜深人静时在小镇游走，看见一些怪异的景象\n\n\nShe became a photographer, roving the world with her camera in her hand.\n\n她成了一个摄影师，拿着相机周游世界。\n\n\n\n2.VERB（眼睛）环视，扫视If you say that someone's eyes rove round a place, you mean that they are looking around to see what is interesting. \n\nHouston's eyes roved restlessly about the room...\n\n休斯敦不安地扫视着这个房间。\n\n\nHis eyes roved to see how many of the group appreciated his heavy humour.\n\n他环视四周，看看有多少人能理解他重口味的幽默。\n\n\n
stinker@n.发恶臭之人(动物或物体),臭鬼1.N-COUNT令人讨厌的人；恶劣之事；坏蛋If you describe someone or something as a stinker, you mean that you think they are very unpleasant or bad. \n\nI think he's an absolute stinker to do that to her...\n\n我认为他那样对待她真太缺德了。\n\n\nI thought it was a right stinker.\n\n我认为这事太恶劣了。\n\n
attest@1.VERB说明，表示，证明（某事属实）To attest something or attest to something means to say, show, or prove that it is true. \n\nPolice records attest to his long history of violence...\n\n警方记录证明他有长期从事暴力活动的前科。\n\n\nI can personally attest that the cold and flu season is here...\n\n感冒和流感季节来了，对此我有切身体会。\n\n\nHis beautifully illustrated book well attested his love of the university.\n\n他那本带有精美插图的书见证了他对大学的热爱。\n\n
drone@\n1.VERB嗡嗡作响；嗡嗡叫If something drones, it makes a low, continuous, dull noise. \n\nAbove him an invisible plane droned through the night sky.\n\n在他头顶上一架隐形飞机嗡嗡地飞过夜空。\n\n\n...a virtually non-stop droning noise in the background.\n\n背景中几乎从未间断的嗡嗡声\n\n\nDrone is also a noun.\n\n...the constant drone of the motorways.\n\n高速公路上持续不断的嗡嗡声\n\n\n\n\ndroning\n\n...the droning of a plane far overhead.\n\n远处天空中飞机的嗡嗡声\n\n\n\n2.VERB（人）絮絮叨叨地说，喋喋不休地说If you say that someone drones, you mean that they keep talking about something in a boring way. \n\nChambers' voice droned, maddening as an insect around his head...\n\n钱伯斯一直在他耳边嗡嗡地说个不停，他都快疯了。\n\n\nThe droning murmur of the doctor's voice in the bedroom had ceased.\n\n卧室里医生喋喋不休的低语声已经停下了。\n\n\nDrone is also a noun.\n\nThe minister's voice was a relentless drone.\n\n部长不停地絮叨着。\n\n\n\nDrone on means the same as drone .\n\nAunt Maimie's voice droned on...\n\n梅米姨妈喋喋不休地说着。\n\n\nDaniel just drones on about American policy.\n\n丹尼尔对美国政策谈个没完。\n\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT游手好闲者；寄生虫People who do not contribute anything to society or to an organization are sometimes described as drones . \n\nA few are dim-witted drones, but most are talented, frustrated, wasted people.\n\n有几个是愚笨的寄生虫，但是大多数是有才能却不得志而自暴自弃的人。\n\n\n\n4.N-COUNT雄蜂A drone is a male bee.\n
pheromone@n. 〈生化〉信息素1.N-COUNT信息素（生物体释放的化学物质、能影响其他同类生物的行为）Some animals and insects produce chemicals called pheromones which affect the behaviour of other animals and insects of the same type, for example by attracting them sexually.
incapacitate@\n1.VERB使无能力；使伤残If something incapacitates you, it weakens you in some way, so that you cannot do certain things. \n\nA serious fall incapacitated the 68-year-old congressman.\n\n一次严重跌伤使这位 68 岁的国会议员丧失了行动能力。\n\n\n\nincapacitated\n\nHe is incapacitated and can't work.\n\n他受伤致残，失去了工作能力。\n\n\n
turret@\n1.N-COUNT角楼；塔楼A turret is a small narrow tower on top of a building or a larger tower.\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（坦克、战舰等上的）回转炮塔，旋转枪架The turret on a tank or warship is the part where the guns are fixed, which can be turned in any direction. \n
bombardment@\n1.N-VAR（猛烈而持久的）炮击，轰炸A bombardment is a strong and continuous attack of gunfire or bombing. \n\nThe city has been flattened by heavy artillery bombardments...\n\n城市已被猛烈的炮火夷为平地。\n\n\nThe capital is still under constant bombardment by the rebel forces.\n\n首都仍在遭受叛军的持续轰炸。\n\n\n\n2.N-VAR一连串（想法、要求、质问或批评）A bombardment of ideas, demands, questions, or criticisms is an aggressive and exhausting stream of them. \n\n...the constant bombardment of images urging that work was important.\n\n铺天盖地的图片，强调工作是至关重要的\n\n\n
jugular@adj. 颈部的，咽喉的\nn. 颈静脉，致命处\n1.N-COUNT颈静脉A jugular or jugular vein is one of the three important veins in your neck that carry blood from your head back to your heart.\n\n\n2.PHRASE抨击致命的弱点；直击软肋If you say that someone went for the jugular, you mean that they strongly attacked another person's weakest points in order to harm them. \n\nMr Black went for the jugular, asking intimate sexual questions.\n\n布莱克先生直攻要害，问起了性方面的隐私问题。\n\n\n
corkscrew@n. 拔塞钻, 螺丝锥\nadj. 拔钻形的\nvt. 硬强地拉出, 探听, 作螺旋状的前进1.N-COUNT瓶塞钻；螺丝开瓶起子A corkscrew is a device for pulling corks out of bottles.
recoil@\nThe verb is pronounced /rɪ'kɔɪl/. The noun is pronounced /'riːkɔɪl/. 动词读作/rɪ'kɔɪl/。名词读作/'riːkɔɪl/。\n\n\n1.VERB退缩；后退If something makes you recoil, you move your body quickly away from it because it frightens, offends, or hurts you. \n\nFor a moment I thought he was going to kiss me. I recoiled in horror...\n\n我当时以为他要亲我，所以吓得直往后退。\n\n\nWe are attracted by nice smells and recoil from nasty ones.\n\n我们会被好闻的味道吸引，难闻的味道则会让我们退避三舍。\n\n\nRecoil is also a noun.\n\nHis reaction was as much of a rebuff as a physical recoil.\n\n他的反应既是身体的退缩，也是一种断然的拒绝。\n\n\n...his small body jerking in recoil from the volume of his shouting.\n\n他的小身板儿被他的喊叫声吓得猛地一缩\n\n\n\n\n2.VERB（因为不喜欢而）拒绝，回绝，退避If you recoil from doing something or recoil at the idea of something, you refuse to do it or accept it because you dislike it so much. \n\nPeople used to recoil from the idea of getting into debt...\n\n过去人们不能接受欠债这种事情。\n\n\nShe recoiled at the number of young girls who had to live by selling their bodies.\n\n那么多年轻的女孩不得不靠出卖肉体谋生，她觉得难以接受。\n\n\n\n3.N-SING（枪炮的）反冲The recoil of a gun is the quick backward movement that it makes when it is fired. \n\nThe policeman fires again, tensed against the recoil, unleashing round after round at his assailant...\n\n警察再次开火，紧抵着反冲机构，不断向袭击他的人射击。\n\n\nI assembled the weapon, checked the firing and recoil mechanism and loaded it.\n\n我把家伙组装起来，检查了一下击发和反冲机构，装上子弹。\n\n\n
pounce@\n1.VERB（人）猛扑，突袭If someone pounces on you, they come up towards you suddenly and take hold of you. \n\nHe pounced on the photographer, beat him up and smashed his camera...\n\n他突然扑向摄影师，痛打了他一顿，还摔碎了他的照相机。\n\n\nFraud squad officers had bugged the phone and were ready to pounce.\n\n反诈骗小组的警员们已在电话上安装了窃听器，并随时准备突击。\n\n\n\n2.VERB揪出，抓住（错误等）If someone pounces on something such as a mistake, they quickly draw attention to it, usually in order to gain an advantage for themselves or to prove that they are right. \n\nThe Democrats were ready to pounce on any Republican failings or mistakes...\n\n民主党人随时准备揪出共和党人的过失或错误。\n\n\n'That's much too subtle, even for Sam.' — 'Even for Sam!' He pounced on the phrase with a sound of triumph.\n\n“那太微妙了，即便对萨姆来说。”——“即便对山姆来说！”，他得意洋洋地抓住了这句话。\n\n\n\n3.VERB（野兽或飞禽）猛扑，突袭When an animal or bird pounces on something, it jumps on it and holds it, in order to kill it. \n\n...like a tiger pouncing on its prey...\n\n像老虎猛扑向猎物一样\n\n\nBefore I could get the pigeon the cat pounced.\n\n未等我逮到鸽子，猫就猛扑了上去。\n\n\n
arachnoid@ adj. 蛛网状的, 蛛网膜的\nn. 蛛网膜
deathtrap@n. 危险的地方，危险的建筑物；死地
mingle@\n1.V-RECIP（声音、气味等）混合，混杂；（感情）交织，交错If things such as sounds, smells, or feelings mingle, they become mixed together but are usually still recognizable. \n\nNow the cheers and applause mingled in a single sustained roar...\n\n现在，欢呼声和掌声汇成了一片持续的喧闹声。\n\n\nForeboding mingled with his excitement.\n\n他在兴奋的同时又夹杂着一种不祥的预感。\n\n\n\n2.V-RECIP应酬；交际At a party, if you mingle with the other people there, you move around and talk to them. \n\nGo out of your way to mingle with others at the wedding...\n\n去跟婚礼上的其他人聊聊。\n\n\nGuests ate and mingled...\n\n客人们边用餐边攀谈。\n\n\nAlison mingled for a while and then went to where Douglas stood with John.\n\n艾利森去应酬了一会儿，然后走到道格拉斯和约翰站着的地方。\n\n\n
indeterminate@1.ADJ-GRADED不确定的；不明确的；模糊不清的If something is indeterminate, you cannot say exactly what it is. \n\nDr Amid was a man of indeterminate age...\n\n看不出阿米德博士的具体年龄。\n\n\nI hope to carry on for an indeterminate period.\n\n我希望能进行一段时期。\n\n
engulf@\n1.VERB（常指突然）吞没，吞噬If one thing engulfs another, it completely covers or hides it, often in a sudden and unexpected way. \n\nA seven-year-old boy was found dead after a landslide engulfed a block of flats...\n\n山体滑坡掩埋了一栋公寓楼，造成一名7岁男孩丧生。\n\n\nThe flat is engulfed in flames.\n\n那套公寓被火焰吞噬。\n\n\n\n2.VERB使陷入（某种感觉或情绪）If a feeling or emotion engulfs you, you are strongly affected by it. \n\n...the pain that engulfed him...\n\n将他吞噬的苦痛\n\n\nHe looked around his dark, cluttered office and was engulfed by a feeling of emptiness.\n\n他环顾自己昏暗杂乱的办公室，陷入一阵空虚之中。\n\n\n
grotesque@\n1.ADJ-GRADED古怪的；怪诞的；荒唐的You say that something is grotesque when it is so unnatural, unpleasant, and exaggerated that it upsets or shocks you.\n\n...the grotesque disparities between the wealthy few and nearly everyone else.\n\n少数富人与几乎所有其他人之间悬殊的贫富差距\n\n\n...a country where grotesque abuses are taking place.\n\n发生骇人听闻的虐待事件的国家\n\n\n\ngrotesquely\n\nHe called it the most grotesquely tragic experience that he's ever had.\n\n他称之为人生中最离奇的不幸经历。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED丑陋的；奇形怪状的；极其难看的If someone or something is grotesque, they are very ugly.\n\nThey tried to avoid looking at his grotesque face and his crippled body.\n\n他们尽量不去看他那张奇丑无比的脸和残疾的身体。\n\n\n\ngrotesquely\n\n...grotesquely deformed beggars.\n\n身体畸形、丑陋不堪的乞丐\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT（尤指小说或绘画中的）怪异的人，丑八怪A grotesque is a person who is very ugly in a strange or unnatural way, especially one in a novel or painting.\n\nGrass's novels are peopled with outlandish characters: grotesques, clowns, scarecrows, dwarfs.\n\n格拉斯的小说里充斥着稀奇古怪的人物：丑陋的怪人、小丑、稻草人和侏儒。\n\n\n
Humvee@n. 输送车n.悍马（一种军用吉普车）
tentacle@\n1.N-COUNT（章鱼等的）触须，触手，触角The tentacles of an animal such as an octopus are the long thin parts that are used for feeling and holding things, for getting food, and for moving. \n\n\n2.N-COUNT（政治、商业、社会等机构的）影响力，触角If you talk about the tentacles of a political, commercial, or social organization, you are referring to the power and influence that it has in the outside community. \n\nFree speech is being gradually eroded year after year by new tentacles of government control.\n\n言论自由正在一年又一年逐渐被政府不断施加的影响力所削弱。\n\n\n
distortion@\n1.N-VAR歪曲；曲解Distortion is the changing of something into something that is not true or not acceptable. \n\nI think it would be a gross distortion of reality to say that they were motivated by self-interest...\n\n我认为说他们是受自身利益的驱使是对事实的严重歪曲。\n\n\nHe later accused reporters of wilful distortion and bias.\n\n他后来指责记者有意歪曲事实并带有偏见。\n\n\n\n2.N-VAR失真；变形Distortion is the changing of the appearance or sound of something in a way that makes it seem strange or unclear.\n\nAudio signals can be transmitted along cables without distortion.\n\n声音信号可以通过电缆传送而不失真。\n\n\n
scuff@\n1.V-ERG（使）磨损；（使）磨坏If you scuff something or if it scuffs, you mark the surface by scraping it against other things or by scraping other things against it. \n\nConstant wheelchair use will scuff almost any floor surface...\n\n任何地板上经常有轮椅走动几乎都会有所磨损。\n\n\nMolded plastic is almost indestructible, but scuffs easily.\n\n注塑几乎弄不坏，但是容易磨损。\n\n\n\nscuffed\n\n...scuffed brown shoes.\n\n几双磨坏的棕色鞋\n\n\n\n2.VERB拖着脚走If you scuff your feet, you pull them along the ground as you walk. \n\nPolly, bewildered and embarrassed, dropped her head and scuffed her feet.\n\n波莉既困惑又尴尬，低下头拖着脚走开了。\n\n\n
focal@\n1.ADJ焦点的；有焦点的Focal is used to describe something that relates to the point where a number of rays or lines meet. \n\n...the focal plane of the telescope.\n\n望远镜的焦平面\n\n\n\n2.ADJ重要的；中心的Focal is used to describe something that is very important. \n\n...one of the focal centres of the Far East.\n\n远东的中心地区之一\n\n\n
terminal@\n1.ADJ（疾病）致命的，不治的，晚期的A terminal illness or disease causes death, often slowly, and cannot be cured. \n\n...terminal cancer.\n\n晚期癌症\n\n\n...his illness was terminal.\n\n他的病没治了。\n\n\n\nterminally\n\nThe patient is terminally ill.\n\n那个病人患了不治之症。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ（病人）患绝症的，晚期的，病危的A terminal patient is dying of a terminal illness or disease. \n\nThey have started a hospice for terminal patients.\n\n他们为身患绝症的病人开办了一个安养所。\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT（车辆、乘客、货物的）集散地，起点站，终点站A terminal is a place where vehicles, passengers, or goods begin or end a journey. \n\nPlans are underway for a fifth terminal at Heathrow airport.\n\n正在制定在希思罗机场修建第 5 航站楼的计划。\n\n\n\n4.N-COUNT终端；终端机A computer terminal is a piece of equipment consisting of a keyboard and a screen that is used for putting information into a computer or getting information from it. \n\nCarl sits at a computer terminal 40 hours a week.\n\n卡尔每周在电脑终端前坐 40 个小时。\n\n\n\n5.N-COUNT（电路的）端头，端子，线接头On a piece of electrical equipment, a terminal is one of the points where electricity enters or leaves it.\n\n...the positive terminal of the battery.\n\n电池的阳极\n\n\n
respite@n. 暂缓, 缓期执行 ,缓刑,停付,延缓,延期\nvt 展延, 暂时休息\n1.N-SING（不快事情中的）喘息，缓解，暂息A respite is a short period of rest from something unpleasant. \n\nIt was some weeks now since they had had any respite from shellfire.\n\n他们已经好几周没有在炮火中获得任何喘息的机会了。\n\n\n\n2.N-SING（不快或困难的）暂缓，暂延A respite is a short delay before a very unpleasant or difficult situation which may or may not take place. \n\nDevaluation would only give the economy a brief respite.\n\n贬值只能让经济得到暂时的缓解。\n\n\n
exponential@adj. 指数的\nn. 指数\n1.ADJ迅速增长的；成指数倍增的Exponential means growing or increasing very rapidly. \n\nThe policy tried to check the exponential growth of public expenditure.\n\n该政策试图控制公共开支的迅猛增长。\n\n\n\nexponentially\n\nThe quantity of chemical pollutants has increased exponentially.\n\n化学污染物排放量已经迅速增加。\n\n\n
nubile@adj. 适婚的, 性感的1.ADJ-GRADED（女子）年轻迷人的，性感的A nubile woman is young, physically mature, and sexually attractive. \n\nWhat is this current television obsession with older men and nubile young women?\n\n现在的电视节目为什么这么喜欢描写老男人和妙龄性感女郎的故事呢？\n\n
interdisciplinary@1.ADJ学科间的；涉及若干学科的；跨学科的Interdisciplinary means involving more than one academic subject. \n\n...interdisciplinary courses combining psychology, philosophy and linguistics.\n\n综合了心理学、哲学与语言学的跨学科课程\n\n
innuendo@n. 讽刺, 讥讽\nvi. 说讽刺话1.N-VAR影射；暗讽Innuendo is indirect reference to something rude or unpleasant.\n\nThe report was based on rumours, speculation, and innuendo.\n\n这份报告建立在谣言、臆断和含沙射影的基础之上。\n\n\n...magazines which are full of sexual innuendo.\n\n充满性暗示的杂志\n\n
tycoon@n. 企业界的大亨，巨头；（日本幕府的）将军
flank@n. 侧面, 侧腹, 腰窝肉\nv. 攻击侧面, 面临着, 守侧面\n1.N-COUNT胁；胁腹An animal's flank is its side, between the ribs and the hip.\n\nHe put his hand on the dog's flank.\n\n他把手放在狗的胁腹上。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（军队的）侧翼，翼侧A flank of an army or navy force is one side of it when it is organized for battle.\n\nThe assault element, led by Captain Ramirez, opened up from their right flank.\n\n拉米雷斯上尉率领的突击队从他们的右翼开火。\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT（大型物体的）侧面，一侧，一边The side of anything large can be referred to as its flank . \n\nThey continued along the flank of the mountain.\n\n他们沿着山的一侧继续前行。\n\n\n\n4.VERB两侧有；（有时指）一侧有If something is flanked by things, it has them on both sides of it, or sometimes on one side of it. \n\nThe altar was flanked by two Christmas trees... \n\n圣坛两侧是两棵圣诞树。\n\n\nBookcases flank the bed...\n\n床的两侧有书柜。\n\n\nShe crossed the room and sat in the armchair flanking the window seat...\n\n她穿过房间，坐在座位靠窗一侧的扶手椅上。\n\n\n
paradox@\n1.N-COUNT自相矛盾；有矛盾特点的情况You describe a situation as a paradox when it involves two or more facts or qualities which seem to contradict each other.\n\nThe paradox is that the region's most dynamic economies have the most primitive financial systems...\n\n矛盾之处在于这个地区最有活力的经济体却有着最落后的金融体系。\n\n\nThe paradox of exercise is that while using a lot of energy it seems to generate more...\n\n锻炼奇怪的地方在于它会越活动越有劲。\n\n\nDeath itself is a paradox, the end yet the beginning.\n\n死亡本身就是自相矛盾的，既是终结也是开始。\n\n\n\n2.N-VAR悖论；自相矛盾的说法；似矛盾而（可能）正确的说法A paradox is a statement in which it seems that if one part of it is true, the other part of it cannot be true.\n\nThe story contains many levels of paradox...\n\n这个故事存在多重悖论。\n\n\nAlthough I'm so successful I'm really rather a failure. That's a paradox, isn't it?\n\n虽然我非常成功，可事实上我却是个相当失败的人。这句话自相矛盾，是吧？\n\n\n
aquarium@\n1.N-COUNT水族馆An aquarium is a building, often in a zoo, where fish and underwater animals are kept.\n\n\n2.N-COUNT养鱼缸；水族箱An aquarium is a glass tank filled with water, in which people keep fish.\n
corporal@adj. 肉体的, 身体的\nn. (陆军或空军)下士1.N-COUNT; N-TITLE（陆军或美国海军陆战队的）下士A corporal is a non-commissioned officer in the army or United States Marines.\n\nThe corporal shouted an order at the men.\n\n下士向士兵们发出号令。\n\n\n...Corporal Devereux.\n\n德弗罗下士\n\n
muster@v.集合，收集，鼓起，激起\nn.集合，检阅，集合人员，点名册\n1.VERB聚集（支持力量）；奋（力）；集中（精力）If you muster something such as support, strength, or energy, you gather as much of it as you can in order to do something. \n\nHe travelled around West Africa trying to muster support for his movement...\n\n他在西非四处奔走，为自己的运动争取支持。\n\n\nMustering all her strength, Nancy pulled hard on both oars.\n\n南希使出所有力气，用力划动双桨。\n\n\n\n2.V-ERG召集，集合（士兵）When soldiers muster or are mustered, they gather together in one place in order to take part in a military action. \n\nThe men mustered before their clan chiefs...\n\n男人们聚集在族长们面前。\n\n\nThe general had mustered his troops north of the Hindu Kush.\n\n将军在兴都库什山脉以北集结军队。\n\n\n\n3.PHRASE合格；符合要求If someone or something passes muster, they are good enough for the thing they are needed for. \n\nI could not pass muster in his language...\n\n我说不好他的语言。\n\n\nIf it doesn't pass muster, a radio station could have its license challenged.\n\n如果不合要求，电台可能会被吊销执照。\n\n\n
explosive@\n1.N-VAR炸药；爆炸物An explosive is a substance or device that can cause an explosion.\n\n...one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive...\n\n150磅塞姆汀塑胶炸药\n\n\nThere were traces of explosives in the bedroom.\n\n卧室里有炸药的痕迹。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED会爆炸的；能引起爆炸的Something that is explosive is capable of causing an explosion.\n\nThe explosive device was timed to go off at the rush hour...\n\n爆炸装置被设定在高峰时间引爆。\n\n\nHighly explosive gas is naturally found in coal mines.\n\n煤矿中天然存有高爆气体。\n\n\n\nexplosively\n\nHydrogen is explosively flammable when mixed with oxygen.\n\n氢气与氧气混合时会发生爆炸性燃烧。\n\n\n\n3.ADJ-GRADED（增长）爆炸性的，迅猛的An explosive growth is a sudden, rapid increase in the size or quantity of something.\n\nThe explosive growth in casinos is one of the most conspicuous signs of Westernisation.\n\n西化最显著的标志之一就是赌场的骤增。\n\n\n\nexplosively\n\nThese transactions grew explosively in the early 1980s.\n\n这类交易在20世纪80年代早期迅猛增加。\n\n\n\n4.ADJ-GRADED（局面等）一触即发的，千钧一发的An explosive situation is likely to have difficult, serious, or dangerous effects. \n\nHe appeared to be treating the potentially explosive situation with some sensitivity...\n\n他似乎正小心地应对可能一触即发的局势。\n\n\nNobody knows what explosive arguments the future of Europe will bring.\n\n没有人知道欧洲的未来这一议题会引起怎样爆炸性的讨论。\n\n\n\nexplosively\n\nA referendum next year would coincide explosively with the election campaign.\n\n明年的全民公决将和竞选活动同时进行，届时局势会十分紧张。\n\n\n\n5.ADJ-GRADED易怒的；暴躁的If you describe someone as explosive, you mean that they tend to express sudden violent anger.\n\nShe was unpredictable, explosive, impulsive and easily distracted...\n\n她难以捉摸，脾气暴躁，冲动鲁莽，容易分心。\n\n\nHe's inherited his father's explosive temper.\n\n他遗传了其父暴躁的脾气。\n\n\n\nexplosively\n\n'Are you mad?' David asked explosively.\n\n“你疯了吗？”戴维暴躁地问道。\n\n\n\n6.ADJ-GRADED（声响突然）爆发的A sudden loud noise can be described as explosive.\n\nHe made a loud, explosive noise of disgust.\n\n他反感地爆发出一阵叫嚷。\n\n\n...an explosive drumbeat.\n\n爆发的鼓声\n\n\n\nexplosively\n\nThe sound of her own chewing and swallowing were explosively loud.\n\n她自己嚼咽食物的声音非常大。\n\n\n
colossal@adj. 巨大的,庞大的,异常的
evacuate@\n1.VERB疏散；使撤离；转移To evacuate someone means to send them to a place of safety, away from a dangerous building, town, or area. \n\nThey were planning to evacuate the seventy American officials still in the country...\n\n他们正计划转移仍滞留在该国的70名美国官员。\n\n\nSince 1951, 18,000 people have been evacuated from the area.\n\n自1951年以来，已有18， 000人撤离了该地区。\n\n\n\nevacuation\n\n...the evacuation of the sick and wounded...\n\n伤病员的撤离\n\n\nAn evacuation of the city's four-million inhabitants is planned for later this week.\n\n计划在本周晚些时候疏散该市400万居民。\n\n\n\n2.VERB（尤指因为危险而）撤离，撤出，搬出If people evacuate a place, they move out of it for a period of time, especially because it is dangerous. \n\nThe fire is threatening about sixty homes, and residents have evacuated the area...\n\n大火正威胁着大约60户人家，居民已经从该地区撤离。\n\n\nOfficials ordered the residents to evacuate.\n\n官员命令居民撤离。\n\n\n\nevacuation\n\n...the mass evacuation of the Bosnian town of Srebrenica...\n\n波斯尼亚小镇斯雷布雷尼察的大撤离\n\n\nBurning sulfur from the wreck has forced evacuations from the area.\n\n残骸上燃烧着的硫黄迫使人们撤出该地区。\n\n\n
monophyletic@adj.[生]单元的,单源的；单系的
devour@\n1.VERB狼吞虎咽地吃；吞食If a person or animal devours something, they eat it quickly and eagerly. \n\nA medium-sized dog will devour at least one can of food per day...\n\n中型犬每天至少要吃掉一罐狗粮。\n\n\nShe devoured half an apple pie.\n\n她狼吞虎咽地吃下了半个苹果派。\n\n\n\n2.VERB如饥似渴地阅读；热切地看If you devour a book or magazine, for example, you read it quickly and with great enthusiasm. \n\nShe began devouring newspapers when she was only 12.\n\n年仅 12 岁时，她就开始如饥似渴地阅读报纸。\n\n\n

phyletic@ adj. 种族的，种类的
pillar@\n1.N-COUNT柱；柱子A pillar is a tall solid structure, which is usually used to support part of a building.\n\n...the pillars supporting the roof.\n\n支撑屋顶的柱子\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（制度、协议等的）支柱，核心If something is the pillar of a system or agreement, it is the most important part of it or what makes it strong and successful. \n\nThe pillar of her economic policy was keeping tight control over money supply.\n\n她经济政策的核心是严格控制货币的供应。\n\n\n...the last pillar of apartheid.\n\n种族隔离制最后的支柱\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT中坚；栋梁；台柱If you describe someone as a pillar of society or as a pillar of the community, you approve of them because they play an important and active part in society or in the community. \n\nMy father had been a pillar of the community.\n\n我父亲一直是社区的顶梁柱。\n\n\n...well-respected pillars of society.\n\n深受尊重的社会栋梁\n\n\n
reinforce@\n1.VERB加强；增强If something reinforces a feeling, situation, or process, it makes it stronger or more intense. \n\nA stronger European Parliament would, they fear, only reinforce the power of the larger countries...\n\n他们担心一个更加强大的欧洲议会只会增强大国的力量。\n\n\nThis sense of privilege tends to be reinforced by the outside world.\n\n这种优越感往往会被外部世界强化。\n\n\n\n2.VERB给予…更多支持；为…提供更多证据If something reinforces an idea or point of view, it provides more evidence or support for it. \n\n...films that reinforce the idea that we live in a threatening and risky world.\n\n让我们更加意识到自己生活的世界充满威胁和危险的电影\n\n\n\n3.VERB加固；增强To reinforce an object means to make it stronger or harder. \n\nEventually, they had to reinforce the walls with exterior beams.\n\n最终，他们不得不通过增加外梁来对墙体进行加固。\n\n\n\nreinforced\n\nIts windows were of reinforced glass.\n\n它的窗户装的是强化玻璃。\n\n\n\n4.VERB为（军队或警察队伍）增加力量（或装备）；向（某地）增兵；增援To reinforce an army or a police force means to make it stronger by increasing its size or providing it with more weapons. To reinforce a position or place means to make it stronger by sending more soldiers or weapons. \n\nBoth sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting...\n\n双方经过昨天的激战后都在向各自的阵地增派兵力。\n\n\nTroops and police have been reinforced in the southern Pakistan city of Hyderabad.\n\n巴基斯坦南部的海得拉巴市已增派了军队和警力。\n\n\n
amphibious@\n1.ADJ（军事行动）两栖作战的In an amphibious military operation, army and navy forces attack a place from the sea. \n\nA third brigade is at sea, ready for an amphibious assault.\n\n还有一个旅已在海上待命，准备两栖进攻。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ（车辆）水陆两用的An amphibious vehicle is able to move on both land and water. \n\n...an amphibious landing craft which can carry helicopters and up to 2,000 troops.\n\n能运送直升机和多达两千人的部队的水陆两用登陆艇\n\n\n\n3.ADJ（动物）水陆两栖的Amphibious animals are animals such as frogs and toads that can live both on land and in water.\n
surpass@\n1.VERB超过；胜过；优于If one person or thing surpasses another, the first is better than, or has more of a particular quality than, the second. \n\nHe was determined to surpass the achievements of his older brothers...\n\n他决心超越几个哥哥的成就。\n\n\nWarwick Arts Centre is the second largest Arts Centre in Britain, surpassed in size only by London's Barbican.\n\n沃里克艺术中心是英国第二大艺术中心，规模仅次于伦敦的巴比肯。\n\n\n\n2.VERB远远超出（预期）If something surpasses expectations, it is much better than it was expected to be. \n\nConrad Black gave an excellent party that surpassed expectations.\n\n康拉德·布莱克举办了一次远超人们预期的精彩聚会。\n\n\n\n3.VERB超出（理解范围）If something surpasses understanding, it is too difficult to understand. \n\n...a clever and spectacularly successful system, the detailed complexity of which surpasses our full understanding.\n\n一个设计巧妙且极其成功的系统，其复杂的细节非我辈所能完全理解\n\n\n
lebanese@\n1.ADJ黎巴嫩的；黎巴嫩人的；黎巴嫩文化的Lebanese means belonging or relating to Lebanon, or to its people or culture.\n\n...talks with the Lebanese government.\n\n与黎巴嫩政府的谈判\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT黎巴嫩人A Lebanese is a Lebanese citizen, or a person of Lebanese origin.\n
beirut@ n.贝鲁特(黎巴嫩的首都,为一海港)
blizzard@n. 暴风雪\nn.暴雪 极负盛名的美国游戏软件制作公司\n1.N-COUNT大风雪；暴风雪A blizzard is a very bad snowstorm with strong winds.\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（指令人反感或恼火的事情）大量，铺天盖地You can refer to a large number of things that you do not like or which annoy you as a blizzard of those things. \n\nRetailers were hit with a blizzard of new products and brands in all shapes, sizes and colours.\n\n各种形色不一、大小各异的新产品和新品牌铺天盖地，让零售商们疲于应付。\n\n\n...the annual blizzard of bills and amendments.\n\n每年大量的议案和修正案\n\n\n
surveillance@n. 监视,监督\n1.N-UNCOUNT（尤指来自警方、军队等组织的）监视，监察Surveillance is the careful watching of someone, especially by an organization such as the police or the army.\n\nHe was arrested after being kept under constant surveillance...\n\n在被连续监视了一段时间后，他被逮捕了。\n\n\nPolice swooped on the home after a two-week surveillance operation...\n\n在两周的监视行动之后，警方突击搜查了那栋房子。\n\n\nPolice keep track of the kidnapper using electronic surveillance equipment.\n\n警方利用电子监视设备跟踪绑架者。\n\n\n
peg@\n1.N-COUNT挂钩；挂钉A peg is a small hook or knob that is attached to a wall or door and is used for hanging things on.\n\nHis work jacket hung on the peg in the kitchen.\n\n他的工作服挂在厨房里的挂钩上。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（晾衣用的）衣夹A peg is a small device which you use to fasten clothes to a washing line. \n\n\nin AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 clothespin\n\n\n3.N-COUNT（金属或木制的）销钉，楔子，栓A peg is a small piece of wood or metal that is used for fastening something to something else.\n\nHe builds furniture using wooden pegs instead of nails.\n\n他用木楔子取代钉子制作家具。\n\n\n...the noise of the hammer striking the steel pegs.\n\n锤子敲击钢栓的噪音\n\n\n\n4.VERB用销钉（或楔子、木栓）固定If you peg something somewhere or peg it down, you fix it there with pegs. \n\n...trying to peg a double sheet on a washing line on a blustery day...\n\n大风天试图用衣夹把双人床单固定在晾衣绳上\n\n\nPeg down netting over the top to keep out leaves.\n\n用销钉在顶上加固防护网，防止叶子落入。\n\n\n...a tent pegged to the ground nearby for the kids.\n\n用楔子固定在附近地面上供孩子们用的帐篷\n\n\n\n5.VERBSee also:level-pegging；限定（价格、数量等）；把…固定在一定水平；使与…挂钩If a price or amount of something is pegged at a particular level, it is fixed at that level. \n\nIts currency is pegged to the dollar... \n\n其货币与美元挂钩。\n\n\nUK trading profits were pegged at £40 million...\n\n英国的贸易利润固定在4，000万英镑。\n\n\nThe Bank wants to peg rates at 9%.\n\n该银行想把利率限定在9%。\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6.PHRASE杀…的威风；挫…的锐气If you say that someone should be brought down a peg or be taken down a peg, you mean that they should be made to realize that they are not so important or wonderful as they think they are. \n\nWe thought it was time they were brought down a peg or two...\n\n我们认为是时候煞煞他们的嚣张气焰了。\n\n\nWe'd have liked to see her taken down a peg, but not this way.\n\n我们乐意看到她杀威风，但不是用这种方法。\n\n\n\n7.PHRASE（衣服）非定制的，成品的Off-the-peg clothes are made in large numbers and sent to shops, not made specially for a particular person. \n\n...an off-the-peg two-piece suit...\n\n两件套西服成衣\n\n\nInstead of dining in top restaurants and wearing expensive suits, he likes to eat hamburgers and buys clothes off the peg.\n\n比起穿着昂贵的套装到高档饭店吃饭，他更喜欢吃汉堡、买成衣。\n\n\n\nin AM, use 美国英语用 off-the-rack\n\n\n8.PHRASE方枘圆凿；格格不入If you describe someone as a square peg in a round hole, you mean that they are in a situation or doing something that does not suit them at all. \n\nTaylor is clearly the wrong man for the job — a square peg in a round hole.\n\n泰勒明显不适合做这项工作——简直就是方枘圆凿。\n\n\n相关词组：peg out\n
disband@1.V-ERG解散；解体；（使）散伙If someone disbands a group of people, or if the group disbands, it stops operating as a single unit. \n\nAll the armed groups will be disbanded...\n\n所有的武装团体都将被解散。\n\n\nThe rebels were to have fully disbanded by June the tenth.\n\n叛乱分子会在 6 月 10日前全部解散。\n\n
mastermind@\n1.VERB谋划，策划（艰难或复杂的行动）If you mastermind a difficult or complicated activity, you plan it in detail and then make sure that it happens successfully. \n\nThe finance minister will continue to mastermind Poland's economic reform...\n\n财政部长将继续策划波兰的经济改革。\n\n\nThe bombings were masterminded by a known drugs smuggler.\n\n爆炸是由一个臭名昭著的毒品走私分子操纵的。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（常指罪案）主谋，出谋划策的人，幕后操纵者The mastermind behind a difficult or complicated plan, often a criminal one, is the person who is responsible for planning and organizing it. \n\nHe was the mastermind behind the plan to acquire the explosives.\n\n他就是密谋获取炸药的主谋。\n\n\n
barrage@\nPronounced /'bɑːrɪdʒ/ for meaning 4 in American English. 美国英语中义项4读作 /'bɑːrɪdʒ/。\n\n\n1.N-COUNT连续的炮火；弹幕；火力网A barrage is continuous firing on an area with large guns and tanks.\n\nThe artillery barrage on the city centre was the heaviest since the ceasefire...\n\n针对市中心的炮火是停战以来最猛烈的。\n\n\nThe two fighters were driven off by a barrage of anti-aircraft fire.\n\n两架战斗机被防空火力网逼退。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT接二连三，一连串（的批评、抱怨等）A barrage of something such as criticism or complaints is a large number of them directed at someone, often in an aggressive way. \n\nHe was faced with a barrage of angry questions from the floor.\n\n他受到了与会者一连串愤怒的质询。\n\n\n\n3.VERB（大批人或事物）包围；使穷于应付If you are barraged by people or things, you have to deal with a great number of people or things you would rather avoid. \n\nDoctors are complaining about being barraged by drug-company salesmen...\n\n医生们抱怨他们疲于应付医药公司的销售人员。\n\n\nHughes was barraged with phone calls from friends who were furious at the indiscreet disclosures.\n\n休斯的电话快被他的朋友打爆了，就因为他一不小心说漏了嘴而惹恼了他们。\n\n\n\n4.N-COUNT堰；水坝；拦河坝A barrage is a structure that is built across a river to control the level of the water.\n\n...a hydro-electric tidal barrage.\n\n潮汐水电站\n\n\n
prey@1.N-UNCOUNT-COLLSee also:bird of prey；猎物；捕食对象A creature's prey are the creatures that it hunts and eats in order to live. \n\nElectric rays stun their prey with huge electrical discharges...\n\n电鳐能放出强大的电流把猎物击晕。\n\n\nThese animals were the prey of hyenas.\n\n这些动物是鬣狗的猎物。\n\n\n2.VERB捕食；以捕猎…为生A creature that preys on other creatures lives by catching and eating them. \n\nThe effect was to disrupt the food chain, starving many animals and those that preyed on them...\n\n其结果就是破坏食物链，使很多动物和那些以捕食它们为生的动物饿死。\n\n\nThe larvae prey upon small aphids.\n\n这种幼虫以小蚜虫为食。\n\n\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT伤害的对象；愚弄的对象；欺骗的对象You can refer to the people who someone tries to harm or trick as their prey . \n\nPolice officers lie in wait for the gangs who stalk their prey at night...\n\n警察设伏等待那些在晚上跟踪目标伺机作案的歹徒。\n\n\nThis burglar thought old people are easy prey.\n\n这个夜贼觉得老人容易下手。\n\n\n\n4.VERB欺凌，坑害（尤指弱者）If someone preys on other people, especially people who are unable to protect themselves, they take advantage of them or harm them in some way. \n\nPam had never learned that there were men who preyed on young runaways...\n\n帕姆从来不知道有人专门坑骗离家出走的年轻人。\n\n\nThe survey claims loan companies prey on weak families already in debt.\n\n这项调查声称信贷公司专对那些已经负债的弱势家庭下手。\n\n\n\n5.VERB不断困扰；折磨；使耿耿于怀If something preys on your mind, you cannot stop thinking and worrying about it. \n\nThe absence of children at Christmas preyed on Liz's mind...\n\n利兹因为圣诞节时孩子们不在而一直心神不宁。\n\n\nHe had been unwise and it preyed on his conscience.\n\n他做得不太明智，这一直让他良心不安。\n\n\n\n6.N-UNCOUNT受影响；受折磨；受害If someone is prey to something bad, they have a tendency to let themselves be affected by it. \n\nHe was prey to a growing despair...\n\n他被与日俱增的绝望折磨着。\n\n\nYou were both a prey to compulsions.\n\n你俩都太冲动了。\n\n\n\n7.PHRASE受…控制；成为…的牺牲品；受…的影响To fall prey to something bad means to be taken over or affected by it. \n\nOn the flight from Paris to Toulon, Mechiche fell prey to panic...\n\n在从巴黎飞往土伦的航班上，梅希什惊慌失措。\n\n\nChildren in evacuation centres are falling prey to disease.\n\n疏散中心的孩子正受到疾病的折磨。\n\n\n
relentless@adj. 无情的, 冷酷的, 残酷的\n1.ADJ-GRADED不停的；不懈的；不间断的；未减轻的Something bad that is relentless never stops or never becomes less intense.\n\nThe pressure now was relentless.\n\n压力现在没完没了。\n\n\n\nrelentlessly\n\nThe sun is beating down relentlessly.\n\n太阳火辣辣地持续照射着大地。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED坚韧的；不屈不挠的Someone who is relentless is determined to do something and refuses to give up, even if what they are doing is unpleasant or cruel.\n\nRelentless in his pursuit of quality, his technical ability was remarkable...\n\n对质量孜孜不倦的追求使他的技能出类拔萃。\n\n\nHe was the most relentless enemy I have ever known.\n\n他是我所遇到的最不屈不挠的敌手。\n\n\n\nrelentlessly\n\nShe always questioned me relentlessly.\n\n她总是没完没了地问我问题。\n\n\n
render@\n1.VERB致使；造成You can use render with an adjective that describes a particular state to say that someone or something is changed into that state. For example, if someone or something makes a thing harmless, you can say that they render it harmless. \n\nIt contained so many errors as to render it worthless.\n\n它错误太多，所以毫无用处。\n\n\n...barrel-makers whose trade was rendered obsolete by the introduction of stainless steel wine vats.\n\n不锈钢葡萄酒桶的出现使木制酒桶制造者没了生意\n\n\n\n2.VERB给予（帮助）；提供（服务）If you render someone help or service, you help them. \n\nHe had a chance to render some service to his country...\n\n他有了一个为国服务的机会。\n\n\nAny assistance you can render him will be appreciated...\n\n无论给予他何种帮助，他都会非常感激。\n\n\nThe money was in fact payment by the CIA for services rendered.\n\n这些钱其实是中央情报局付给的工作报酬。\n\n\n\n3.VERB宣布，作出（判决、决定或回应）When a jury or authority renders a verdict, decision, or response, they announce it. \n\nThe Board had been slow to render its verdict.\n\n董事会迟迟未能作出决定。\n\n\n\n4.VERB翻译To render something in a particular language or in a particular way means to translate it into that language or in that way. \n\n...'Zensho shimasu,' which the translator rendered literally as, 'I will do my best.'...\n\n“Zensho shimasu，”译者直译为“我会尽全力”。\n\n\nAll the signs and announcements were rendered in English and Spanish.\n\n所有的指示标志和公告都被译成了英语和西班牙语。\n\n\n\n5.VERB（用石灰或水泥）粉刷（墙壁）To render a wall means to cover it with a layer of plaster or cement, usually in order to protect it. \n\n\nin AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 stucco\n\n
impale@vt. 刺穿(钉住,使...绝望)1.VERB（以尖物）刺穿，刺入To impale something on a pointed object means to cause the point to go into it or through it. \n\nResearchers observed one bird impale a rodent on a cactus...\n\n研究人员观察到一只鸟把一只啮齿动物钉在一棵仙人掌上。\n\n\nLenny swayed for a moment, then dropped to the ground, impaling himself on his switchblade...\n\n伦尼晃了一下，然后倒在了地上，他的弹簧刀刺穿了自己的身体。\n\n\nThe boy died after being impaled on railings when he slipped while playing.\n\n小男孩玩耍时失足滑倒，被栏杆刺穿身体致死。\n\n
skewer@n. (烤肉用的)串肉杆\nv. 用杆串好\n1.N-COUNT串肉扦；扦子A skewer is a long metal pin which is used to hold pieces of food together during cooking.\n\n\n2.VERB用扦子串住；将…叉住If you skewer something, you push a long, thin, pointed object through it. \n\nHe skewered his victim through the neck.\n\n他用扦子刺穿了受害人的脖子。\n\n\n...skewered beef with vegetables.\n\n串有蔬菜的烤牛肉串\n\n\n
tenacious@adj. 紧粘不放的, 固执的, 不屈不挠的\n1.ADJ-GRADED坚韧不拔的；坚毅的；坚持不懈的If you are tenacious, you are very determined and do not give up easily.\n\nShe is very tenacious and will work hard and long to achieve objectives...\n\n她是个锲而不舍的人，为了达到目标愿意长期苦干。\n\n\nHe is regarded at the BBC as a tenacious and persistent interviewer.\n\n在英国广播公司，他被看成一个不屈不挠、坚定执著的采访者。\n\n\n\ntenaciously\n\nIn spite of his illness, he clung tenaciously to his job.\n\n尽管有病在身，他仍顽强地坚持工作。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED（观点、信念）根深蒂固的，深入人心的If you describe something such as an idea or belief as tenacious, you mean that it has a strong influence on people and is difficult to change or remove.\n\n...a remarkably tenacious belief that was to dominate future theories of military strategy.\n\n会左右未来军事战略理论的一个特别根深蒂固的信念\n\n\n
extremity@\n1.N-COUNT尽头；末端The extremity of something is its furthest end or edge. \n\n...a small port on the north-western extremity of the Iberian peninsula.\n\n伊比利亚半岛西北端的小港口\n\n\n...the extremities of the aeroplane.\n\n飞机的末端\n\n\n\n2.N-PLURAL（身体的）末端，末梢；（尤指）手脚Your extremities are the end parts of your body, especially your hands and feet. \n\nHe found that his extremities grew cold...\n\n他发现手脚变冷了。\n\n\nExercise is very important as it keeps the circulation moving and warms the extremities.\n\n锻炼非常重要，它可以促进血液循环，保持手脚温暖。\n\n\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT极度；极端The extremity of a situation or of someone's behaviour is the degree to which it is severe, unusual, or unacceptable. \n\nIn spite of the extremity of her seclusion she was sane...\n\n尽管完全与世隔绝，她依然心智健全。\n\n\nIn the past, the region had been protected by its forbidding geography and the extremities of its climate...\n\n过去，这个地区令人生畏的地理条件和极端的天气状况使它受到保护。\n\n\nOnly in extremity, when his defences had been reduced by six weeks of bombing, was he ready to leave.\n\n经过6周的轰炸，他的防御已经不堪一击，在这种极端情况下他才愿意离开。\n\n\n
tandem@\n1.N-COUNT双人自行车A tandem is a bicycle designed for two riders, on which one rider sits behind the other.\n\n\n2.PHRASE与…同时（发生）If one thing happens or is done in tandem with another thing, the two things happen at the same time. \n\nMalcolm's contract will run in tandem with his existing one.\n\n马尔科姆的合同将与他手头的合同同时生效。\n\n\n\n3.PHRASE与…协作；配合If one person does something in tandem with another person, the two people do it by working together. \n\nHe is working in tandem with officials of the Serious Fraud Office.\n\n他正配合欺诈重案办公室的官员工作。\n\n\n
rigid@\n1.ADJ-GRADED（法律、制度或体系）严格的，刻板的，不可变更的Laws, rules, or systems that are rigid cannot be changed or varied, and are therefore considered to be rather severe. \n\nSeveral colleges in our study have rigid rules about student conduct...\n\n在我们的研究中，有几所大学制定了严格的学生行为规则。\n\n\nHospital routines for nurses are very rigid.\n\n医院中护士的日常工作非常刻板。\n\n\n\nrigidity\n\n...the rigidity of government policy.\n\n政府政策的死板\n\n\n\nrigidly\n\nThe caste system was rigidly enforced.\n\n过去印度的种姓制度非常严格。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED固执的；顽固的；刻板的If you disapprove of someone because you think they are not willing to change their way of thinking or behaving, you can describe them as rigid . \n\nShe was a fairly rigid person who had strong religious views...\n\n她相当顽固，宗教观念极强。\n\n\nMy father is very rigid in his thinking.\n\n我父亲的思想非常顽固。\n\n\n\n3.ADJ-GRADED坚硬的；刚性的；不易弯曲的A rigid substance or object is stiff and does not bend, stretch, or twist easily.\n\n...rigid plastic containers...\n\n坚硬的塑料容器\n\n\nThese plates are fairly rigid.\n\n这些盘子非常坚硬。\n\n\n\nrigidity\n\n...the strength and rigidity of glass.\n\n玻璃的强度和硬度\n\n\n\n4.ADJ-GRADED（常因震惊或害怕）身体僵直的，不能动弹的，呆住的If someone goes rigid, their body becomes very straight and stiff, usually as a result of shock or fear. \n\nI went rigid with shock...\n\n我惊得僵在那里。\n\n\nAndrew went rigid when he saw a dog, any dog, anywhere.\n\n安德鲁过去只要看见狗，无论在哪里，无论什么狗，都会吓得一动不动。\n\n\n\nrigidly\n\nShe stood rigidly and stared into the room.\n\n她直直地站在那里，凝视着屋内。\n\n\n
pyramidal@adj. 金字塔形的, 角锥状的, 锥体的1.ADJ角锥（体）的；金字塔形的Something that is pyramidal is shaped like a pyramid. \n\n...a black pyramidal tent.\n\n黑色的角锥形帐篷\n\n
void@\n1.N-COUNT空白；空虚感If you describe a situation or a feeling as a void, you mean that it seems empty because there is nothing interesting or worthwhile about it. \n\nHis death has left a void in the cricketing world which can never be filled.\n\n他的死给板球界留下一个永远无法填补的空白。\n\n\n...an aching void of loneliness.\n\n痛苦的孤寂感\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT空间；真空；空虚You can describe a large or frightening space as a void .\n\nHe stared into the dark void where the battle had been fought...\n\n他凝望着那片漆黑的空旷之地，那次战役就是在这里进行的。\n\n\nThe ship moved silently through the black void...\n\n船静悄悄地划过漆黑的夜。\n\n\nObservers have recently found in the Universe giant voids about 500,000,000 light-years across.\n\n观察员最近在宇宙中发现了直径约5亿光年的巨型空洞。\n\n\n\n3.ADJ无价值的；无用的；无效的Something that is void or null and void is officially considered to have no value or authority. \n\nThe original elections were declared void by the former military ruler...\n\n前军事领导人宣布最初的选举无效。\n\n\nThe agreement will be considered null and void.\n\n该协议将被视作无效。\n\n\n\n4.ADJ缺乏的；没有的If you are void of something, you do not have any of it. \n\nHe rose, his face void of emotion as he walked towards the door...\n\n他站起来，面无表情地朝门口走去。\n\n\nThe treaty is now void of absolute commitments.\n\n条约现在失去了绝对的约束力。\n\n\n\n5.VERB使无效；宣布…作废；取消To void something means to officially say that it is not valid. \n\nThe Supreme Court threw out the confession and voided his conviction for murder.\n\n最高法院驳回了供词，宣布他谋杀罪名不成立。\n\n\n
fusion@\n1.N-COUNT（不同特质、思想等的）合成体，融合体A fusion of different qualities, ideas, or things is something new that is created by joining them together. \n\nHis previous fusions of jazz, pop and African melodies have proved highly successful.\n\n事实证明他先前融合了爵士乐、流行乐和非洲旋律的作品非常成功。\n\n\n\n2.N-VAR合为一体；融合The fusion of two or more things involves joining them together to form one thing. \n\nHis final reform was the fusion of regular and reserve forces.\n\n他最后的一项改革是把常规军和预备役部队合为一体。\n\n\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT（物理学上的）核聚变In physics, fusion is the process in which atomic particles combine and produce a large amount of nuclear energy.\n\n...research into nuclear fusion.\n\n核聚变研究\n\n\n
abduct@\n1.VERB诱拐；劫持；绑架If someone is abducted by another person, he or she is taken away illegally, usually using force. \n\nHis car was held up and he was abducted by four gunmen...\n\n他的车遭遇拦劫，随后他被4名持枪歹徒劫持。\n\n\nShe was charged with abducting a six-month-old child.\n\n她被控诱拐一个6个月大的孩子。\n\n\n\nabduction\n\n...the abduction of four youths.\n\n对4名青年的绑架\n\n\n\nabductor\n\nShe co-operated with her abductor.\n\n她顺从绑匪的要求。\n\n\n
proprietor@n. 所有人,业主,经营者1.N-COUNT所有人；业主The proprietor of a hotel, shop, newspaper, or other business is the person who owns it. \n\n...the proprietor of a local restaurant...\n\n一家当地餐馆的业主\n\n\nHe was the sole proprietor with total management control.\n\n他是唯一业主，掌握全部管理权。\n\n
pastry@n. 面粉糕饼, 馅饼皮\n1.N-UNCOUNT油酥面饼；油酥面皮Pastry is a food made from flour, fat, and water that is mixed together, rolled flat, and baked in the oven. It is used, for example, for making pies.\n\n\n2.N-COUNT油酥点心；油酥糕饼A pastry is a small cake made with sweet pastry.\n
gourmet@\n.ADJ珍馐的；美味佳肴的Gourmet food is nicer or more unusual or sophisticated than ordinary food, and is often more expensive. \n\nFlavored coffee is sold at gourmet food stores and coffee shops...\n\n花式咖啡可在美食店和咖啡店买到。\n\n\nThe couple share a love of gourmet cooking.\n\n这夫妇俩都有烹饪美食的嗜好。\n\n\n...a gourmet dinner.\n\n美味大餐\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT美食家；讲究饮食的人；老饕A gourmet is someone who enjoys good food, and who knows a lot about food and wine.\n
lieu@\n1.PREP-PHRASE代替…；作为…的替代If you do, get, or give one thing in lieu of another, you do, get, or give it instead of the other thing, because the two things are considered to have the same value or importance. \n\nHe left what little furniture he owned to his landlord in lieu of rent.\n\n他把自己仅有的那点家具留给了房东抵房租。\n\n\n\n2.PHRASE…以代之If you do, get, or give something in lieu, you do, get, or give it instead of something else, because the two things are considered to have the same value or importance. \n\n...an increased salary or time off in lieu.\n\n加薪或代之以休假\n\n\n
recuperate@\n1.VERB（身体）恢复，康复When you recuperate, you recover your health or strength after you have been ill or injured. \n\nI went away to the country to recuperate...\n\n我去了乡下休养。\n\n\nHe is recuperating from a serious back injury.\n\n他背部受了重伤，目前正在康复中。\n\n\n\nrecuperation\n\nLeonard was very pleased with his powers of recuperation.\n\n伦纳德对他的康复能力非常满意。\n\n\n
charismatic@\n1.ADJ-GRADED有魅力的；有感召力的A charismatic person attracts, influences, and inspires people by their personal qualities. \n\n...her striking looks and charismatic personality.\n\n她出众的相貌和迷人的气质\n\n\n\n2.ADJ（基督教会中相信人可以得到神赐异能的）神恩教派的The charismatic church is the part of the Christian Church that believes that people can obtain special gifts from God, for example the power to heal sick people.\n
vocalist@n. 声乐家, 歌手1.N-COUNT（流行乐队中的）歌手A vocalist is a singer who sings with a pop group.\n\nHe and Carla Torgerson take turns as the band's lead vocalist.\n\n他和卡拉·托格森轮流担当乐队的主唱。\n\n
latch@n. 门闩\nv. 上闩\n1.N-COUNT门闩；插销A latch is a fastening on a door or gate. It consists of a metal bar which you lift in order to open the door.\n\nYou left the latch off the gate and the dog escaped.\n\n你没把门闩插上，所以狗跑了。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT碰锁；弹簧锁A latch is a lock on a door which locks automatically when you shut the door, so that you need a key in order to open it from the outside. \n\n...a key clicked in the latch of the front door.\n\n钥匙插进前门弹簧锁里发出咔嗒一声\n\n\nIf a door is on the latch or off the latch, the latch has been set so that it will not lock when you shut the door.（门）虚掩着，没上锁\n\nLet yourself in; the door's on the latch...\n\n你自己进来吧，门没上锁。\n\n\nThey leave their back door off the latch when they're at home so that friends can pop in.\n\n他们在家时就让后门虚掩着，好让朋友们可以随时进来。\n\n\n\n\n3.VERB用闩闩上；用碰锁锁上If you latch a door or gate, you fasten it by means of a latch. \n\nHe latched the door, tested it, and turned around to speak to Frank.\n\n他把门锁上，又试了试，然后转身和弗兰克说话。\n\n\n
posthumous@adj. 死后的；遗腹的；作者死后出版的\n1.ADJ死后的；身后的Posthumous is used to describe something that happens after a person's death but relates to something they did before they died. \n\nHis family and supporters have campaigned for many years for a posthumous pardon.\n\n他的家人和支持者为争取其获得身后赦免而开展了多年的运动。\n\n\n...the posthumous publication of his first novel.\n\n他的第一部小说在他死后的出版\n\n\n\nposthumously\n\nAfter the war she was posthumously awarded the George Cross.\n\n战争结束后，她被追授乔治十字勋章。\n\n\n
royalty@\n1.N-UNCOUNT王室；皇族The members of royal families are sometimes referred to as royalty .\n\nRoyalty and government leaders from all around the world are gathering in Japan.\n\n世界各国的王室成员和政府首脑齐聚日本。\n\n\n...a ceremony attended by royalty.\n\n王室成员参加的一个庆典\n\n\n\n2.N-PLURAL（作家、音乐家等的）版税Royalties are payments made to authors and musicians when their work is sold or performed. They usually receive a fixed percentage of the profits from these sales or performances.\n\nI lived on about £3,000 a year from the royalties on my book.\n\n我靠着写书得来的每年约3，000英镑的版税生活。\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT（发明、创意、财产等的）使用费Payments made to someone whose invention, idea, or property is used by a commercial company can be referred to as royalties . \n\nThe royalties enabled the inventor to re-establish himself in business.\n\n专利使用费让这位发明家得以再次立足于商界。\n\n\n
heart-wrenching@ 令人心碎的，令人心痛的
merge@vt. &amp;vi. 合并,消失,吞没, 融合\n[计算机] 合并\n1.V-RECIP-ERG（使）合并；（使）融合If one thing merges with another, or is merged with another, they combine or come together to make one whole thing. You can also say that two things merge, or are merged . \n\nMy life merged with his... \n\n我和他的生活合而为一。\n\n\nBank of America merged with a rival bank...\n\n美国银行与一家竞争银行合并了。\n\n\nThe rivers merge just north of a vital irrigation system...\n\n就在一个重要的灌溉系统的北边，这些河流交汇在一起。\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.V-RECIP渐渐消失于；融入；相融If one sound, colour, or object merges into another, the first changes so gradually into the second that you do not notice the change. \n\nLike a chameleon, he could merge unobtrusively into the background...\n\n他就像一条变色龙，可以神不知鬼不觉地隐藏在背景中间。\n\n\nHis features merged with the darkness...\n\n他的面容消失在黑暗之中。\n\n\nNight and day begin to merge.\n\n夜尽昼来。\n\n\n
eternity@\n1.N-UNCOUNT永恒；永生；不朽Eternity is time without an end or a state of existence outside time, especially the state which some people believe they will pass into after they have died.\n\nI have always found the thought of eternity terrifying.\n\n我向来觉得永生的想法很可怕。\n\n\n...laying him to rest for all eternity.\n\n让他永远安息\n\n\n\n2.N-SING极长的一段时间；似乎无穷尽的一段时间If you say that a situation lasted for an eternity, you mean that it seemed to last an extremely long time, usually because it was boring or unpleasant. \n\nThe war continued for an eternity...\n\n那场战争持续了极长的一段时间。\n\n\nThe ringing went on for what seemed an eternity, and then someone answered.\n\n电话响了似乎很长一段时间，然后有人接了电话。\n\n\n
dub@\n1.VERB给…起绰号；把…称作If someone or something is dubbed a particular thing, they are given that description or name. \n\n...the man whom the Labour opposition dubbed as the 'no change Prime Minister'...\n\n被工党反对派戏称为“不变首相”的男人\n\n\nAt the height of her career, Orson Welles dubbed her 'the most exciting woman in the world'.\n\n奥森·韦尔斯把处在事业巅峰的她戏称为“世上最令人兴奋的女人”。\n\n\n\n2.VERB为（影片等）配音；译制If a film or soundtrack in a foreign language is dubbed, a new soundtrack is added with actors giving a translation. \n\nIt was dubbed into Spanish for Mexican audiences.\n\n它被译制成西班牙语以方便墨西哥观众观看。\n\n\n...a badly dubbed foreign film.\n\n配音很差劲的外国电影\n\n\n
presume@\n1.VERB（不肯定地）认为，相信，推测If you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain. \n\nI presume you're here on business... \n\n我想你是来这里出差的。\n\n\nDido's told you the whole sad story, I presume?...\n\n我想狄多已经把这件伤心事全部告诉你了吧？\n\n\n'Had he been home all week?' — 'I presume so.'\n\n“他整个星期都在家吗？”——“我想是这样的。”\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.VERB冒昧；擅自主张；妄行If you say that someone presumes to do something, you mean that they do it even though they have no right to do it. \n\nThey're resentful that outsiders presume to meddle in their affairs...\n\n他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务非常愤慨。\n\n\nI wouldn't presume to question your judgment.\n\n我不会冒昧地质疑你的判断。\n\n\n\n3.VERB假设；假定If an idea, theory, or plan presumes certain facts, it regards them as true so that they can be used as a basis for further ideas and theories. \n\nThe legal definition of 'know' often presumes mental control...\n\n“知晓”的法律定义通常假定存在思维控制能力。\n\n\nThe arrangement presumes that both lenders and borrowers are rational.\n\n这一协议假定借贷双方都是在神志清楚的状态下签订的。\n\n\n
overrun@\n1.VERB（迅速）侵占，占领If an army or an armed force overruns a place, area, or country, it succeeds in occupying it very quickly. \n\nA group of rebels overran the port area and most of the northern suburbs...\n\n一群叛乱分子迅速占领了港口地区和大部分城北郊区。\n\n\nThe centre of New Delhi was overrun by an armed mob which attacked government buildings.\n\n新德里市中心被一群袭击政府大楼的武装暴徒控制了。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED横行的；泛滥的；肆虐的If you say that a place is overrun with things that you consider undesirable, you mean that there are a large number of them there. \n\nThe flower beds were overrun with grasses...\n\n花坛里杂草横生。\n\n\nThe Hotel has been ordered to close because it is overrun by mice and rats...\n\n由于老鼠泛滥成灾，该旅馆被勒令关闭。\n\n\nPadua and Vicenza are prosperous, well-preserved cities, not overrun by tourists.\n\n帕多瓦和维琴察两市商业繁荣，建筑古迹保存良好，也没有蜂拥而至的游客。\n\n\n\n3.VERB超过时限If an event or meeting overruns by, for example, ten minutes, it continues for ten minutes longer than it was intended to. \n\nTuesday's lunch overran by three-quarters of an hour...\n\n星期二的午餐超时了45分钟。\n\n\nThe talks overran their allotted time.\n\n会谈超过了他们的预定时间。\n\n\n\n4.VERB（费用等）超支，超出预算If costs overrun, they are higher than was planned or expected. \n\nWe should stop the nonsense of taxpayers trying to finance new weapons whose costs always overrun hugely...\n\n新武器研发的费用总是大大超支，却还要试图让纳税人出钱资助，我们应该制止这一荒谬至极的行为。\n\n\nCosts overran the budget by about 30%.\n\n开支超出预算将近30%。\n\n\nOverrun is also a noun.\n\nHe was stunned to discover cost overruns of at least $1 billion.\n\n他震惊地发现花费至少超了10亿美元。\n\n\n\n
extensive@\n1.ADJ-GRADED广大的；广阔的Something that is extensive covers or includes a large physical area.\n\n...an extensive tour of Latin America...\n\n在拉丁美洲广泛游历\n\n\nWhen built, the palace and its grounds were more extensive than the city itself.\n\n建成时，宫殿及其庭园比城市本身面积还要大。\n\n\n\nextensively\n\nMark, however, needs to travel extensively with his varied business interests.\n\n然而，马克因为各种生意需要频繁出差。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED广泛的；全面的；包罗万象的Something that is extensive covers a wide range of details, ideas, or items.\n\nDevelopments in South Africa receive extensive coverage in The Sunday Telegraph...\n\n《星期日电讯报》全面报道了南非的发展。\n\n\n...the extensive research into public attitudes to science...\n\n针对公众科学观的广泛调查\n\n\nThe facilities available are very extensive.\n\n可使用的设施非常多。\n\n\n\nextensively\n\n...the extensively reported trial...\n\n受到全面报道的审判\n\n\nAll these issues have been extensively researched in recent years.\n\n近年来，对所有这些问题都作了全面研究。\n\n\n\n3.ADJ-GRADED巨大的；大量的If something is extensive, it is very great.\n\nThe blast caused extensive damage, shattering the ground-floor windows...\n\n爆炸造成了巨大的破坏，震碎了一楼的窗户。\n\n\nThe security forces have extensive powers of search and arrest...\n\n安全部队拥有搜查和逮捕的至高权力。\n\n\nMr Marr makes extensive use of exclusively Scottish words.\n\n马尔先生使用了大量苏格兰特有的词汇。\n\n\n\nextensively\n\nHydrogen is used extensively in industry for the production of ammonia.\n\n氢气在工业上广泛用于制氨。\n\n\n
emergence@1.N-UNCOUNT出现；兴起The emergence of something is the process or event of its coming into existence. \n\n...the emergence of new scientific ideas.\n\n新科技思想的兴起\n\n
ahold@\n1.PHRASE联系到；找到；得到If you get ahold of someone or something, you manage to contact, find, or get them. \n\nI tried again to get ahold of my cousin Joan.\n\n我再次尝试联系我的表妹琼。\n\n\n\n2.PHRASE（受惊吓或遇到困难之后）保持镇静，保持理智If you get ahold of yourself, you force yourself to become calm and sensible after a shock or in a difficult situation. \n\nI'm going to have to get ahold of myself.\n\n我一定要保持头脑冷静。\n\n\n
rally@n. 集会,重振旗鼓,示威运动,回合\nvi. (人)集合起来,重整旗鼓,恢复精神\nvt. 重新召集,激励,嘲弄\n1.N-COUNT群众大会；集会A rally is a large public meeting that is held in order to show support for something such as a political party.\n\nAbout three thousand people held a rally to mark international human rights day...\n\n大约3，000人举行了一场大会来庆祝国际人权日。\n\n\nSupporters of the policy are reported to be gathering in Delhi for a mass rally.\n\n有报道说这项政策的拥护者要齐聚德里召开群众集会。\n\n\n\n2.V-ERG一致支持；团结起来When people rally to something or when something rallies them, they unite to support it. \n\nHis supporters have rallied to his defence...\n\n他的拥护者团结起来为他辩护。\n\n\nHe rallied his own supporters for a fight.\n\n他把自己的拥护者召集起来准备斗争。\n\n\n\n3.VERB振作；恢复When someone or something rallies, they begin to recover or improve after having been weak. \n\nHe rallied enough to thank his doctors...\n\n他身体好得差不多了，于是去感谢他的医生。\n\n\nMarkets began to rally worldwide.\n\n世界各地的市场开始复苏。\n\n\nRally is also a noun.\n\nAfter a brief rally the shares returned to 126p.\n\n经过短暂的反弹后，股价回落到了126便士。\n\n\n\n\n4.N-COUNT（汽车、摩托车等的）公路大赛A rally is a competition in which vehicles are driven over public roads. \n\nCarlos Sainz of Spain has won the New Zealand Motor Rally.\n\n西班牙人卡洛斯·赛恩斯在新西兰摩托车公路大赛中夺冠。\n\n\n...an accomplished rally driver.\n\n技术精湛的公路赛车手\n\n\n\n5.N-COUNT（网球、羽毛球、壁球等的）连续对打A rally in tennis, badminton, or squash is a continuous series of shots that the players exchange without stopping.\n\n...a long rally.\n\n长时间的连续对打\n\n\n
dent@\n1.VERB使凹陷；使产生凹痕If you dent the surface of something, you make a hollow area in it by hitting or pressing it. \n\nA great chunk of loose kerbing smashed into my left-front wheel, bursting the tyre and denting the rim...\n\n我车子的左前轮撞在一大块松动的路缘石上，导致车胎爆裂、轮辋凹陷。\n\n\nIts brass feet dented the carpet's thick pile.\n\n其黄铜支脚把厚绒地毯压出了印。\n\n\n\ndented\n\nWatch out for bargains, but never buy dented cans.\n\n留意便宜货，但绝不要买表面凹陷的罐头。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT凹痕；凹坑A dent is a hollow in the surface of something which has been caused by hitting or pressing it.\n\nThere was a dent in the car which hadn't been there before.\n\n车上出现了一处以前没有的凹痕。\n\n\n\n3.VERB削减；削弱；损害If something dents your ideas or your pride, it makes you realize that your ideas are wrong, or that you are not as good or successful as you thought. \n\nThis has not dented the City's enthusiasm for the company.\n\n这并没有减弱伦敦金融界对这个公司的热情。\n\n\nAfter a while that sort of thing dents your confidence.\n\n那种事情过上一段时间就会挫伤信心。\n\n\n\n4.N-COUNT削减；削弱If one thing makes a dent in another, it reduces it by a large amount. \n\nThe commission had barely begun to make a dent in the problem...\n\n委员会几乎还没有在这个问题上取得任何进展。\n\n\nI hated to put any dents in his enthusiasm, but I was trying to be realistic.\n\n我不想打击他的热情，只是试图现实一些。\n\n\n
cooperative@\n1.N-COUNT合作社；合作机构A co-operative is a business or organization run by the people who work for it, or owned by the people who use it. These people share its benefits and profits. \n\nThey decided a housing co-operative was the way to regenerate Ormiston Crescent...\n\n他们最终决定通过住房合作社来重建奥米斯顿月牙街。\n\n\nThe restaurant is run as a co-operative.\n\n这家饭店是合作经营的。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ齐心协力的；合作进行的A co-operative activity is done by people working together. \n\nHe was transferred to FBI custody in a smooth co-operative effort between Egyptian and US authorities...\n\n在埃及当局和美国当局的共同努力下他被顺利移交美国联邦调查局进行羁押。\n\n\nThe President said the visit would develop friendly and co-operative relations between the two countries.\n\n总统说这次访问将会促进两国之间的友好合作关系。\n\n\n\nco-operatively\n\nThey agreed to work co-operatively to ease tensions wherever possible.\n\n他们同意互相配合尽一切努力缓解紧张局势。\n\n\n\n3.ADJ-GRADED合作的；有协作精神的；愿意配合的If you say that someone is co-operative, you mean that they do what you ask them to without complaining or arguing.\n\nI made every effort to be co-operative.\n\n我尽了最大努力配合。\n\n\n
inevitable@adj. 不可避免的, 必然(发生)的1.ADJ不可避免的；无法规避的；必然（发生）的If something is inevitable, it is certain to happen and cannot be prevented or avoided. \n\nIf the case succeeds, it is inevitable that other trials will follow...\n\n如果该案胜诉，其他审判必然随之而来。\n\n\nThe defeat had inevitable consequences for British policy.\n\n战败对英国政策不可避免地产生了影响。\n\n\nThe inevitable is something which is inevitable.不可避免的事\n\n'It's just delaying the inevitable,' he said.\n\n“那仅仅会延迟不可避免之事的发生，”他说。\n\n\n
