besiege@\n1.VERB烦扰；纠缠If you are besieged by people, many people want something from you and continually bother you. \n\nShe was besieged by the press and the public.\n\n她被媒体和公众纠缠不休。\n\n\n\n2.VERB包围；围攻If soldiers besiege a place, they surround it and wait for the people in it to stop fighting or resisting. \n\nThe main part of the army moved to Sevastopol to besiege the town...\n\n军队主力转移到了塞瓦斯托波尔，对该城进行围攻。\n\n\nThe Afghan air force was using helicopters to supply the besieged town.\n\n阿富汗空军正用直升机向被围城镇提供补给。\n\n\n
fiery@\n1.ADJ熊熊燃烧的；含火的If you describe something as fiery, you mean that it is burning strongly or contains fire. \n\nA helicopter crashed in a fiery explosion in Vallejo.\n\n一架直升机在瓦列霍爆炸起火并坠毁。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED（颜色）火一般的，如火的You can use fiery for emphasis when you are referring to bright colours such as red or orange. \n\nA large terracotta pot planted with Busy Lizzie provides a fiery bright red display.\n\n一个栽种了凤仙花的大赤陶罐里开出了明艳如火的花朵。\n\n\n\n3.ADJ-GRADED（食物或饮料）辛辣的，刺激的If you describe food or drink as fiery, you mean that it has a very strong hot or spicy taste. \n\nA fiery combination of chicken, chillies and rice.\n\n把鸡肉、辣椒和米饭和在一起、口味辛辣的搭配\n\n\n\n4.ADJ-GRADED（感情、尤指愤怒）激烈的，暴烈的If you describe someone as fiery, you mean that they express very strong emotions, especially anger, in their behaviour or speech. \n\nShe was a fiery, brilliant and unyielding intellectual and politician...\n\n她是个充满激情、才华卓越、毫不妥协的知识分子和政治家。\n\n\nShe had a fiery temper and liked to get her own way.\n\n她脾气火爆，喜欢我行我素。\n\n\n
fiend@\n1.N-COUNT恶魔般的人；极端凶残的人If you describe someone as a fiend, you mean that they are extremely wicked or cruel. \n\nA tearful husband repeated calls for help in catching the fiend who battered his wife.\n\n泪流满面的丈夫不断呼喊求助，想抓到摧残他妻子的恶魔。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT对…着魔的人；对…痴狂的人；…迷Fiend can be used after a noun to refer to a person who is very interested in the thing mentioned, and enjoys having a lot of it or doing it often. \n\n...if you're a heavy coffee drinker or strong-tea fiend.\n\n如果你喝浓咖啡，或是喝浓茶成瘾\n\n\n
runt@\n1.N-COUNT（一胎中）最弱小的仔畜The runt of a group of animals born to the same mother at the same time is the smallest and weakest of them. \n\nAnimals reject the runt of the litter.\n\n动物会丢弃最弱小的幼仔。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（表厌恶或不满）矮子You call a small person a runt when you are annoyed with them and are expressing your dislike for them. \n\nYou little runt!...\n\n你这个小矬子！\n\n\nMy research owes nothing to anybody, least of all to a little runt like you.\n\n我的研究不归功于任何人，尤其不会归功于像你这样的小矮子。\n\n\n
spawn@\n1.N-UNCOUNT（鱼、蛙等产下的）卵，子，卵块Spawn is a soft, jelly-like substance containing the eggs of fish, or of animals such as frogs. \n\n...her passion for collecting frog spawn.\n\n她对采集蛙卵的热爱\n\n\n\n2.VERB（鱼、蛙等）产卵When fish or animals such as frogs spawn, they lay their eggs. \n\n...fish species like salmon and trout which go upstream, spawn and then die...\n\n诸如鲑鱼和鳟鱼这样洄游产卵后死去的鱼类\n\n\nThe toads have settled in and accepted the pond as a good spawning ground.\n\n蟾蜍已经在这个池塘里住下来了，把这里当成了理想的产卵地。\n\n\n\n3.VERB产生；造成；引起If something spawns something else, it causes it to happen or to be created. \n\nTyndall's inspired work spawned a whole new branch of science...\n\n由廷德尔富有创见的著作发展出了一个崭新的科学分支。\n\n\nHe wrote 54 crime novels, which spawned both movies and television shows.\n\n他写了 54 部侦探小说，很多被改编成了电影和电视剧。\n\n\n
mutant@1.N-COUNT变种；突变体A mutant is an animal or plant that is physically different from others of the same species because of a change in its genes.\n2.adj.突变的；变异的；变异所引起的；经过突变的
moult@v. 脱毛, 换羽毛，脱皮\nn. 脱毛，脱皮\n=molt(美)\nin AM, use 美国英语用 molt\n\n\n1.VERB脱毛；蜕皮；换羽When an animal or bird moults, it gradually loses its coat or feathers so that a new coat or feathers can grow. \n\nFinches start to moult at around twelve weeks of age.\n\n燕雀大约在12个星期大小的时候开始换羽毛。\n\n\n
en masse@1.ADV全体；一起If a group of people do something en masse, they do it all together and at the same time. \n\nThe people marched en masse.\n\n人们齐步前进。\n\n\n...the arrival en masse of the Latin American delegates.\n\n拉美国家代表的同时到达\n\n
run-of-the-mill@1.ADJ-GRADED普通的；一般的；平凡的；不突出的A run-of-the-mill person or thing is very ordinary, with no special or interesting features. \n\nI was just a very average run-of-the-mill kind of student...\n\n我只是一个普普通通的学生。\n\n\nFor many they clearly represent an alternative to run-of-the-mill estate cars.\n\n对于很多人来说，他们显然可以作为一般旅行车的替代品。
barb@n. 倒钩\nn. 尖刻、刻薄的言语\nvt. 给...装倒钩\n1.N-COUNT（箭头、鱼钩等的）倒钩，倒刺A barb is a sharp curved point near the end of an arrow or fish-hook which makes it difficult to pull out.\n\n\n2.N-COUNT带刺的话；尖刻的话A barb is an unkind remark meant as a criticism of someone or something.\n\nThe barb stung her exactly the way he hoped it would.\n\n如他所愿，这句带刺的话刺痛了她。\n\n\n
eliminate@\n1.VERB消除，剔除，根除（尤指不需要之物）To eliminate something, especially something you do not want or need, means to remove it completely. \n\nThe Sex Discrimination Act has not eliminated discrimination in employment...\n\n《反性别歧视法》并未根除工作中的歧视。\n\n\nAcademic departments are being eliminated...\n\n纯理论研究院系即将被裁撤。\n\n\nIf you think you may be allergic to a food or drink, eliminate it from your diet.\n\n如果觉得可能对某种食物或饮料过敏，将其从日常饮食中去除。\n\n\n\nelimination\n\n...the prohibition and elimination of chemical weapons.\n\n对化学武器的禁止和销毁\n\n\n\n2.V-PASSIVE（在竞赛中）淘汰When a person or team is eliminated from a competition, they are defeated and so take no further part in the competition. \n\nI was eliminated from the 400 metres in the semi-finals...\n\n我在400米半决赛中被淘汰。\n\n\nIf you are eliminated in the show-jumping then you are out of the complete competition.\n\n如果在马术障碍赛中被淘汰，就意味着完全出局。\n\n\n\n3.VERB消灭；干掉If someone says that they have eliminated an enemy, they mean that they have killed them. By using the word 'eliminate', they are trying to make the action sound more positive than if they used the word 'kill'. \n\nHe declared war on the government and urged right-wingers to eliminate their opponents...\n\n他向政府宣战，并煽动右翼分子干掉他们的对手。\n\n\nThe radio station claimed that 87,000 'reactionaries' had been eliminated.\n\n广播电台声称已经消灭了87，000名“反动分子”。\n\n\n
verge@\n1.PREP-PHRASE即将；接近于；濒于If you are on the verge of something, you are going to do it very soon or it is likely to happen or begin very soon. \n\nThe country was on the verge of becoming prosperous and successful...\n\n这个国家即将走向繁荣富强。\n\n\nCarole was on the verge of tears.\n\n卡萝尔差点就要哭了。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT路边；（道路的）植草边沿The verge of a road is a narrow piece of ground by the side of a road, which is usually covered with grass or flowers. \n\n\nin AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 shoulder\n\n相关词组：verge on\n
crustacean@n. 甲壳类动物（如螃蟹、龙虾和褐虾）\nadj. 甲壳纲的
hideous@\n1.ADJ-GRADED极难看的；极丑的If you say that someone or something is hideous, you mean that they are very ugly or unattractive.\n\nShe saw a hideous face at the window and screamed.\n\n她在窗口看到了一张极丑陋的脸，吓得尖叫了起来。\n\n\n...hideous new Europe architecture, and horrible metal sculptures.\n\n奇丑无比的新式欧洲建筑和糟糕透顶的金属雕塑\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED（事件、经历或行动）极可恶的，非常痛苦的，令人难以忍受的You can describe an event, experience, or action as hideous when you mean that it is very unpleasant, painful, or difficult to bear.\n\nHis family was subjected to a hideous attack by the gang...\n\n他的家人遭到了匪帮的恐怖袭击。\n\n\nIt's been a perfectly hideous day.\n\n这一天真是糟糕透了。\n\n\n
cryptic@adj. 秘密的(使用密码的, 意义深远的)\n1.ADJ-GRADED有隐含意义的；含义隐晦的A cryptic remark or message contains a hidden meaning or is difficult to understand.\n\nHe has issued a short, cryptic statement denying the spying charges...\n\n他发表了一个简短隐晦的声明，否认对其间谍行为的指控。\n\n\nMy father's notes are more cryptic here.\n\n父亲的这段笔记更加晦涩难懂。\n\n\n\ncryptically\n\n'Not necessarily,' she says cryptically.\n\n“不一定，”她隐晦地说道。\n\n\n
juvenile@\n1.N-COUNT少年A juvenile is a child or young person who is not yet old enough to be regarded as an adult. \n\nThe number of juveniles in the general population has fallen by a fifth in the past 10 years.\n\n总人口中少年所占比例在过去10年中下降了1/5。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ少年的；未成年的Juvenile activity or behaviour involves young people who are not yet adults. \n\nJuvenile crime is increasing at a terrifying rate.\n\n青少年犯罪正在以惊人的速度增长。\n\n\n...a scheme to lock up persistent juvenile offenders.\n\n将青少年惯犯关入监狱的计划\n\n\n\n3.ADJ-GRADED（行为）幼稚的，不成熟的，孩子气的If you describe someone's behaviour as juvenile, you are critical of it because you think that it is silly or childish. \n\nHe's a typical male, as he gets older he becomes more juvenile.\n\n他是个典型的男人，年龄越大越孩子气。\n\n\n\n4.N-COUNT幼仔；幼兽；雏鸟Young animals are sometimes referred to as juveniles .\n
fuse@n. 保险丝,引线,导火线\nvt. 熔化,融合,装导线,装引信于\nvi. 熔化,融合\n1.N-COUNT保险丝；熔丝A fuse is a safety device in an electric plug or circuit. It contains a piece of wire which melts when there is a fault so that the flow of electricity stops.\n\nThe fuse blew as he pressed the button to start the motor...\n\n他按下按钮启动马达的时候保险丝烧断了。\n\n\nRemove the circuit fuse before beginning electrical work.\n\n开始电工作业之前取下电路保险丝。\n\n\n\n2.V-ERG（使）（电器等）因保险丝熔断而停止工作When an electric device fuses or when you fuse it, it stops working because of a fault. \n\nThe wire snapped at the wall plug and the light fused...\n\n墙上插座的电线短路烧断了保险丝，电灯跟着灭了。\n\n\nRainwater had fused the bulbs.\n\n雨水引发保险丝烧熔，使得灯泡都不亮了。\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT导火线；引信；信管A fuse is a device on a bomb or firework which delays the explosion so that people can move a safe distance away.\n\nA bomb was deactivated at the last moment, after the fuse had been lit.\n\n炸弹在导火索已经点燃的最后一刻被解爆了。\n\n\n\n4.V-RECIP-ERG（使）熔接；（使）熔合；（使）结合When things fuse or are fused, they join together physically or chemically, usually to become one thing. You can also say that one thing fuses with another. \n\nThe skull bones fuse between the ages of fifteen and twenty-five... \n\n头骨在 15 至 25 岁之间长合。\n\n\nConception occurs when a single sperm fuses with an egg...\n\n受孕发生在单个精子与卵子结合的时候。\n\n\nManufactured glass is made by fusing various types of sand...\n\n人造玻璃是将各种不同类型的沙子熔合在一起制成的。\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.V-RECIP-ERG（使）（不同特质、思想等）合二为一，合为一体If something fuses two different qualities, ideas, or things, or if they fuse, they join together, especially in order to form a pleasing or satisfactory combination. \n\nHis music fused the rhythms of jazz with classical forms...\n\n他的音乐把爵士乐的节奏和古典乐的形式结合在了一起。\n\n\nWhat they have done is fuse two different types of entertainment, the circus and the rock concert...\n\n他们所做的就是把马戏表演和摇滚音乐会这两种不同类型的娱乐形式糅合了起来。\n\n\nPast and present fuse.\n\n古今相融。\n\n\n\n6.PHRASE勃然大怒；大发雷霆If you blow a fuse, you suddenly become very angry and are unable to stay calm. \n\nFor all my experience, I blew a fuse in the quarter-final and could have been sent off.\n\n尽管已经是老经验了，我还是在四分之一决赛的时候按捺不住发了脾气，差点就被罚出场。\n\n\n\n7.PHRASE（突然）触发，启动，激活If someone or something lights the fuse of a particular situation or activity, they suddenly get it started. \n\nHopes for an early cut in German interest rates lit the market's fuse early on.\n\n对德国很快将会降低利率的期望使得市场早早启动了。\n\n\n\n8.PHRASE容易发怒；动辄发火If you say that someone has a short fuse or is on a short fuse you mean that they are quick to react angrily when something goes wrong. \n\nI have a very short fuse and a violent temper.\n\n我容易发怒，脾气暴躁。\n\n\n
stronghold@n. 要塞, 堡垒, 中心地\n1.N-COUNT（持共同态度或信仰的人的）大本营，据点If you say that a place or region is a stronghold of a particular attitude or belief, you mean that most people there share this attitude or belief. \n\nThe westernmost part of north Wales is a stronghold of Welsh-speakers...\n\n北威尔士最西部是说威尔士语人的聚居区。\n\n\nThe seat was a stronghold of the Labour party.\n\n这个选区是工党的大本营。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（某种动物的）主要栖息地If you say that a place is a stronghold of a particular type of animal, you mean that more of that type of animal live there than in other places. \n\nShetland is the last stronghold of otters in the British Isles.\n\n设得兰群岛是水獭在不列颠群岛上最后的栖息地。\n\n\n
hail@n. 冰雹,致敬,招呼\nvt. 向...欢呼,致敬,招呼\nvi. 下雹 \nint. 万岁,欢迎\n1.VERB赞扬，称颂（人、事件或成就）If a person, event, or achievement is hailed as important or successful, they are praised publicly. \n\nFaulkner has been hailed as the greatest American novelist of his generation...\n\n福克纳被誉为他那一代人中最伟大的美国小说家。\n\n\nUS magazines hailed her as the greatest rock'n'roll singer in the world...\n\n美国杂志把她奉为世界上最伟大的摇滚歌手。\n\n\nThe deal was hailed by the Defence Secretary.\n\n该项协议受到了国防部长的称赞。\n\n\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT雹子；冰雹Hail consists of small balls of ice that fall like rain from the sky.\n\n...a sharp short-lived storm with heavy hail.\n\n一阵短暂的大雹暴\n\n\n\n3.VERB下雹；下冰雹When it hails, hail falls like rain from the sky. \n\nIt started to hail, huge great stones.\n\n开始下雹，而且是很大的雹子。\n\n\n\n4.N-SING雹子般的一阵A hail of things, usually small objects, is a large number of them that hit you at the same time and with great force. \n\nThe victim was hit by a hail of bullets...\n\n受害者被一阵弹雨击中。\n\n\nThe riot police were met with a hail of stones and petrol bombs.\n\n防暴警察遭到一阵密集的石块和汽油弹的袭击。\n\n\n\n5.VERB（人）生于，来自Someone who hails from a particular place was born there or lives there. \n\nI hail from Brighton...\n\n我来自布赖顿。\n\n\nThe band hail from Glasgow.\n\n乐团来自格拉斯哥。\n\n\n\n6.VERB（人或物）来自If someone or something hails from a particular background, they come from it. \n\nHe hails from an affluent background...\n\n他出身于一个富有的家庭。\n\n\nThis is a film which seems to hail from the hippie era.\n\n这看起来是一部嬉皮士时代的影片。\n\n\n\n7.VERB招呼；喊If you hail someone, you call to them. \n\nJill saw him and hailed him...\n\n吉尔看到了他，并和他打招呼。\n\n\nSuddenly, a voice hailed us and there was Miss Quigley.\n\n忽然传来一声招呼，原来是奎格利小姐。\n\n\n\n8.VERB招呼，叫（出租车）If you hail a taxi, you wave at it in order to stop it because you want the driver to take you somewhere. \n\nI hurried away to hail a taxi.\n\n我赶紧去叫出租车。\n\n\n\n9.CONVENTION致意；致敬Hail is used as a word of greeting. \n\nHail to the new champion Bengali D'Albret.\n\n向新科冠军本·贾利·达阿尔布雷致敬。\n\n\n
assault@\n1.N-COUNT猛攻；强攻An assault by an army is a strong attack made on an area held by the enemy. \n\nThe rebels are poised for a new assault on the government garrisons...\n\n叛军准备好要对政府驻军发起新一轮的猛攻。\n\n\nMost US soldiers welcomed the ground assault when the order was finally given.\n\n当命令最终下达的时候，大多数美军士兵都愿意发动地面进攻。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ（武器）用于战争的，军用的Assault weapons such as rifles are intended for soldiers to use in battle rather than for purposes such as hunting. \n\n...a high-powered assault rifle.\n\n大火力军用步枪\n\n\n\n3.N-VAR人身攻击；殴打；（身体）侵犯An assault on a person is a physical attack on them. \n\nThe attack is one of a series of savage sexual assaults on women in the university area...\n\n这次袭击是在大学校园内发生的一系列针对女性的野蛮性侵犯事件中的一起。\n\n\nAt the police station, I was charged with assault.\n\n在警察局，我被指控殴打他人。\n\n\n\n4.VERB袭击；殴打To assault someone means to physically attack them. \n\nThe gang assaulted him with iron bars...\n\n这伙人用铁棍殴打他。\n\n\nShe may have been sexually assaulted by her killer.\n\n她可能遭到过凶手的性侵犯。\n\n\n\n5.N-COUNT严厉抨击；强烈批评An assault on someone's beliefs is a strong criticism of them. \n\nHe leveled a verbal assault against his Democratic opponents.\n\n他猛烈抨击其民主党对手。\n\n\n
rifle@\n1.N-COUNT来复枪；步枪A rifle is a gun with a long barrel.\n\nThey shot him at point blank range with an automatic rifle...\n\n他们用自动步枪近距离开枪射杀了他。\n\n\nNeighbours heard the sound of rifle fire and alerted the police.\n\n邻居们听到了步枪声，就报了警。\n\n\n\n2.VERB快速翻找；搜寻If you rifle through things or rifle them, you make a quick search among them in order to find something or steal something. \n\nI discovered my husband rifling through the filing cabinet...\n\n我发现我丈夫正在档案柜里匆匆翻找着什么东西。\n\n\nThe men rifled through his clothing and snatched the wallet...\n\n那些人匆匆翻了翻他的衣服，然后一把抢走了钱包。\n\n\nThere were lockers by each seat and I quickly rifled the contents.\n\n每个座位旁都有带锁的柜子，我迅速翻找着里面的东西。\n\n\n
transmit@\n1.VERB传送；传递；播送When radio and television programmes, computer data, or other electronic messages are transmitted, they are sent from one place to another, using wires, radio waves, or satellites. \n\nThe game was transmitted live in Spain and Italy... \n\n这场比赛在西班牙和意大利进行了现场直播。\n\n\nThe information is electronically transmitted to schools and colleges…\n\n信息通过电子方式传送到各所学校和学院。\n\n\nThis is currently the most efficient way to transmit certain types of data like electronic mail...\n\n这是目前传送电子邮件等某些类型的数据的最高效方式。\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.VERB传播，传染（疾病）If one person or animal transmits a disease to another, they have the disease and cause the other person or animal to have it. \n\n...mosquitoes that transmit disease to humans...\n\n传染疾病给人类的蚊子\n\n\nThere was no danger of transmitting the infection through operations.\n\n不存在通过手术传播这种传染病的风险。\n\n\n…the spread of sexually transmitted diseases.\n\n性传播疾病的蔓延\n\n\n\n3.VERB传达，传输（思想、感情）If you transmit an idea or feeling to someone else, you make them understand and share the idea or feeling. \n\nThe message they are transmitting to their daughters is very different from that of previous generations…\n\n他们向女儿传输的信息与上几代人截然不同。\n\n\nHe transmitted his keen enjoyment of singing to the audience.\n\n他把自己对演唱的激情投入传递给了观众。\n\n\n\n4.VERB传导（声、电等）If an object or substance transmits something such as sound or electrical signals, the sound or signals are able to pass through it. \n\nThese thin crystals transmit much of the power...\n\n这些薄薄的晶体传导了大部分的动力。\n\n\nThere was no vibration transmitted to the handles and the machine wasn't noisy either.\n\n没有任何振动传导到手柄，机器也没有任何噪音。\n\n\n
mudflap@n.挡泥垂布，挡泥板
lure@\n1.VERB引诱；诱惑；哄骗To lure someone means to trick them into a particular place or to trick them into doing something that they should not do. \n\nHe lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun...\n\n他把她哄到家里，用他父亲的枪射杀了她。\n\n\nThey did not realise that they were being lured into a trap...\n\n他们没有意识到自己正被诱入圈套。\n\n\nThe company aims to lure smokers back to cigarettes.\n\n该公司旨在把吸烟人士诱回到香烟上来。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT诱饵A lure is an object which is used to attract animals so that they can be caught.\n\n\n3.N-COUNT诱惑力；魅力A lure is an attractive quality that something has, or something that you find attractive. \n\nThe excitement of hunting big game in Africa has been a lure to Europeans for 200 years...\n\n到非洲猎取大型野生动物的刺激两百年来一直吸引着欧洲人。\n\n\nThe lure of rural life is proving as strong as ever.\n\n事实证明，乡村生活的魅力丝毫未减。\n\n\n
hellhole@n. 极端凄惨的地方，极度肮脏不堪的地方，&lt;古&gt;地狱1.N-COUNT地狱般的地方；鸟不拉屎的地方；环境极肮脏（或恶劣）的地方If you call a place a hellhole, you mean that it is extremely unpleasant, usually because it is dirty and uncomfortable.\n\n...stuck in this hellhole of a jail.\n\n困在这鬼监狱里\n\n
fort@\n1.N-COUNT; N-IN-NAMES堡垒；要塞；城堡A fort is a strong building or a place with a wall or fence around it where soldiers can stay and be safe from the enemy.\n\n\n2.PHRASE替人照料；代为负责If you hold the fort for someone, or, in American English, if you hold down the fort, you look after things for them while they are somewhere else or are busy doing something else. \n\nHis business partner is holding the fort while he is away.\n\n他不在的时候，其生意伙伴代为负责。\n\n\n
detonate@1.V-ERG引爆；起爆；（使）爆炸If someone detonates a device such as a bomb, or if it detonates, it explodes. \n\nFrance is expected to detonate its first nuclear device in the next few days...\n\n法国预计将在几天后引爆其首枚核装置。\n\n\nAn explosive device detonated on the roof of the building.\n\n一个爆炸装置在该楼的楼顶爆炸了。\n\n
sap@n.树液；精力  v. 使虚弱；削弱；逐渐破坏\n1.VERB消耗（精力）；削弱（信心）If something saps your strength or confidence, it gradually weakens or destroys it. \n\nI was afraid the sickness had sapped my strength...\n\n我担心患病已让我元气大伤。\n\n\nAnalysts say the recession in Japan has sapped investor confidence.\n\n分析家称日本的经济衰退已经打击了投资者的信心。\n\n\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT（植物的）液，汁Sap is the watery liquid in plants and trees.\n\nThe leaves, bark and sap are also common ingredients of local herbal remedies.\n\n树叶、树皮和树汁也是当地草药的常用药材。\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT笨蛋；傻瓜If you describe someone as a sap, you think they are foolish. \n\n...her poor sap of a husband.\n\n她可怜的傻瓜丈夫\n\n\n
composite@adj. 合成的,复合的\nn. 合成物, 复合材料\nvt. 合成1.ADJ拼成的；混合成的；复合的A composite object or item is made up of several different things, parts, or substances. \n\nGalton devised a method of creating composite pictures in which the features of different faces were superimposed over one another.\n\n高尔顿发明了一种把不同人的五官相互叠加在一起的制作合成照片的方法。\n\n\nComposite is also a noun.\n\nSpain is a composite of diverse traditions and people.\n\n西班牙是一个汇集了多种传统和民族的国家。\n\n\n
coordinator@n. 协调者,同等的人或物\n[计算机] 协调程序\nThe verb is pronounced /kəʊ'ɔːdɪneɪt/. The noun is pronounced /kəʊ'ɔːdɪnət/. 动词读作 /kəʊ'ɔːdɪneɪt/，名词读作 /kəʊ'ɔːdɪnət/。\n\n\n1.VERB协调；调和If you co-ordinate an activity, you organize the various people and things involved in it. \n\nGovernment officials visited the earthquake zone on Thursday morning to co-ordinate the relief effort.\n\n星期四上午，政府官员视察地震灾区，以协调救援工作。\n\n\n...the setting up of an advisory committee to co-ordinate police work.\n\n建立咨询委员会以协调警务工作\n\n\n\nco-ordinated\n\n...a rapid and well co-ordinated international rescue operation.\n\n迅速而且协调有序的国际救援行动\n\n\n\nco-ordinator\n\n...the party's campaign co-ordinator, Mr Peter Mandelson.\n\n该党的竞选协调人，彼得·曼德尔森先生\n\n\n\n2.V-RECIP-ERG（使）和谐；（使）协调If you co-ordinate clothes or furnishings that are used together, or if they co-ordinate, they are similar in some way and look nice together. \n\nShe'll show you how to co-ordinate pattern and colours... \n\n她会教你如何搭配款式和颜色。\n\n\nTie it with fabric bows that co-ordinate with other furnishings...\n\n系上与其他装饰相配的布质蝴蝶结。\n\n\nColours and looks must fit the themes of the seasons so that the shops co-ordinate well.\n\n颜色和外观必须符合季节的主题，这样各个商家看起来才会比较协调。\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.N-PLURAL套装；配套的装饰Co-ordinates are pieces of clothing or soft furnishings which are similar and which are intended to be worn or used together.\n\n...new lingerie co-ordinates.\n\n新的内衣套装\n\n\n\n4.VERB使（身体各部分）协调If you co-ordinate the different parts of your body, you make them work together efficiently to perform particular movements. \n\nThey spend several weeks each year undergoing intensive treatment which enables them to coordinate their limbs better.\n\n他们每年都花费几周的时间接受强化治疗，以使四肢能够更好地协调。\n\n\n\n5.N-COUNT坐标The co-ordinates of a point on a map or graph are the two sets of numbers or letters that you need in order to find that point. \n\nCan you give me your co-ordinates?\n\n您能告诉我您的坐标吗？\n\n\n...the latitude and longitude co-ordinates of any location in the world.\n\n世界各地的经纬坐标\n\n\n
payroll@n. 工资单,计算报告表,工薪总额1.N-COUNT工资名单The people on the payroll of a company or an organization are the people who work for it and are paid by it. \n\nThey had 87,000 employees on the payroll.\n\n他们在编员工有87，000名。\n\n
graphic@\n1.ADJ-GRADED（对令人不快之事的描述）形象的，具体的，活灵活现的If you say that a description or account of something unpleasant is graphic, you are emphasizing that it is clear and detailed. \n\nThe descriptions of sexual abuse are graphic.\n\n这些性虐待的描写绘声绘色。\n\n\n...graphic scenes of drug taking.\n\n赤裸裸的吸毒场景\n\n\n\ngraphically\n\nHere, graphically displayed, was confirmation of the entire story.\n\n通过这里形象的展示证实了整件事的真实性。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ绘画的；绘图的；图像的Graphic means concerned with drawing or pictures, especially in publishing, industry, or computing. \n\n...fine and graphic arts.\n\n美术与平面艺术\n\n\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT绘画；（尤指出版、工业或计算机领域的）制图，图形设计Graphics is the activity of drawing or making pictures, especially in publishing, industry, or computing.\n\n...a computer manufacturer which specialises in graphics.\n\n专注于图形设计的计算机制造商\n\n\n\n4.N-COUNT绘画作品；图表；图样Graphics are drawings and pictures that are composed using simple lines and sometimes strong colours. \n\nThe articles are noticeably shorter with strong headlines and graphics...\n\n这些文章明显短了许多，并且配上了醒目的标题和图表。\n\n\nThe Agriculture Department today released a new graphic to replace the old symbol.\n\n农业部今天发布了一个新图标以取代旧标志。\n\n\n
compositor@n. 排字工人1.N-COUNT排字（或排版）工人A compositor is a person who arranges the text and pictures of a book, magazine, or newspaper before it is printed.
animator@1.N-COUNT动画片制作者；动画片绘制者An animator is a person who makes films by means of animation.
publicity@\n1.N-UNCOUNT宣传；报道Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something.\n\nMuch advance publicity was given to the talks...\n\n对于这次会谈有很多前期报道。\n\n\n...government publicity campaigns...\n\n政府宣传活动\n\n\nIt was all a publicity stunt.\n\n这完全是个宣传噱头。\n\n\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT（媒体或公众的）关注When the news media and the public show a lot of interest in something, you can say that it is receiving publicity.\n\nThe case has generated enormous publicity in Brazil.\n\n这个案件已经在巴西引起了极大的关注。\n\n\n...the renewed publicity over the Casey affair.\n\n对凯西事件的再次关注\n\n\n
festive@\n1.ADJ-GRADED喜庆的；欢乐的；充满节日气氛的Something that is festive is special, colourful, or exciting, especially because of a holiday or celebration. \n\nThe town has a festive holiday atmosphere...\n\n镇子上充盈着一种节日的喜庆气氛。\n\n\nThe Captain's Party on Saturday evening is the cruise's most festive event.\n\n周六晚上的船长晚会是游轮上最喜庆的活动。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ与节日有关的；与节庆有关的；（尤指）与圣诞节有关的Festive means relating to a holiday or celebration, especially Christmas. \n\nThe factory was due to shut for the festive period...\n\n节日期间工厂将关门。\n\n\nThe government's armed forces have halved their strength for the festive break.\n\n由于节日休假，政府武装部队人数减半。\n\n\n
outfit@\n1.N-COUNT全套服装An outfit is a set of clothes.\n\nShe was wearing an outfit she'd bought the previous day...\n\n她穿着前一天买的那套衣服。\n\n\nI spent lots of money on smart new outfits for work.\n\n我花大笔钱购置了上班时穿的漂亮新套装。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT机构；组织You can refer to an organization as an outfit . \n\nHe works for a private security outfit...\n\n他在一家私人保安公司工作。\n\n\nWe are a professional outfit and we do require payment for our services.\n\n我们是一家专业机构，对所提供服务确实要收取费用。\n\n\n\n3.VERB装备；配备；供给To outfit someone or something means to provide them with equipment for a particular purpose. \n\nThey outfitted him with artificial legs...\n\n他们为他安了假腿。\n\n\nI outfitted an attic bedroom as a studio.\n\n我把阁楼卧室改装成了工作室。\n\n\n
rookie@\n1.N-COUNT新手；菜鸟；（尤指）新兵，新警员A rookie is someone who has just started doing a job and does not have much experience, especially someone who has just joined the army or police force. \n\nI don't want to have another rookie to train.\n\n我不想再训练新兵了。\n\n\n...a rookie police officer.\n\n新上任的警官\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（第一年参加体育比赛的）新队员A rookie is a person who has been competing in a professional sport for less than a year. \n
stake@\n1.PHRASE处于危险境地；处于成败关头If something is at stake, it is being risked and might be lost or damaged if you are not successful.\n\nThe tension was naturally high for a game with so much at stake...\n\n对于一场成败攸关的比赛来说气氛自然非常紧张。\n\n\nAt stake is the success or failure of world trade talks...\n\n世界贸易谈判正处于成败的重要关头。\n\n\nAt stake are more than 20,000 jobs in Britain's aerospace sector.\n\n英国航天部门 2 万多人面临失业的危险。\n\n\n\n2.N-PLURAL（比赛或行动的）赌注，风险The stakes involved in a contest or a risky action are the things that can be gained or lost. \n\nThe game was usually played for high stakes between two large groups...\n\n游戏通常在两大集团之间进行，下的赌注一般都很大。\n\n\nBy arresting the organisation's two top leaders the government and the army have now raised the stakes...\n\n逮捕了该组织的两名主要头目后，政府和军队现在面临的风险更大了。\n\n\nFor Mr Blair the political stakes could hardly have been higher.\n\n对布莱尔来说，这已经是最高的政治赌注了。\n\n\n\n3.VERB将…押（在…）；以…打赌；拿…冒险If you stake something such as your money or your reputation on the result of something, you risk your money or reputation on it. \n\nHe has staked his political future on an election victory...\n\n他把自己的政治前途押在竞选获胜上。\n\n\nHe has staked his reputation on the outcome.\n\n他将自己的名声赌在了这个结果上。\n\n\n\n4.N-COUNT利害关系；重大利益；（企业等中的）股本，股份If you have a stake in something such as a business, it matters to you, for example because you own part of it or because its success or failure will affect you. \n\nHe was eager to return to a more entrepreneurial role in which he had a big financial stake in his own efforts...\n\n他渴望回到一个更多参与创业的角色，那样他所付出的努力会与自己的经济利益息息相关。\n\n\nDetectives now believe the Mafia also had a stake in the plot and killed him when it went wrong.\n\n侦探们现在相信黑手党在这个阴谋中也有利害关系，并在事败后杀了他。\n\n\n\n5.N-PLURAL比赛；竞赛You can use stakes to refer to something that is like a contest. For example, you can refer to the choosing of a leader as the leadership stakes . \n\nBritain lags behind in the European childcare stakes.\n\n英国在儿童保育方面落后于欧洲其他国家。\n\n\n\n6.N-COUNT桩A stake is a pointed wooden post which is pushed into the ground, for example in order to support a young tree.\n\n\n7.PHRASE提出权利要求；主张权利If you stake a claim, you say that something is yours or that you have a right to it. \n\nJane is determined to stake her claim as an actress...\n\n简决心主张自己作为一名女演员的权利。\n\n\nBaguet's success staked his claim for a place in Belgium's world championship team.\n\n巴古埃特的成功使他有资格成为比利时世界锦标赛参赛队伍中的一员。\n\n\n
conscience@n. 良心, 责任心, 顾忌\n1.N-COUNT良心；良知Your conscience is the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is right or wrong. If you have a guilty conscience, you feel guilty about something because you know it was wrong. If you have a clear conscience, you do not feel guilty because you know you have done nothing wrong. \n\nI have battled with my conscience over whether I should actually send this letter...\n\n我备受良心的煎熬，不知是否真的应该把这封信寄出去。\n\n\nWhat if he got a guilty conscience and brought it back?...\n\n要是他觉得内疚，把东西拿回来了怎么办？\n\n\nI could go away again with a clear conscience.\n\n我可以问心无愧地再次离开。\n\n\n\n2.N-UNCOUNTSee also:prisoner of conscience；信仰；凭良心行事Conscience is doing what you believe is right even though it might be unpopular, difficult, or dangerous.\n\nHe refused for reasons of conscience to sign a new law legalising abortion.\n\n他出于信仰，拒绝签署使堕胎合法化的新法。\n\n\n...the law on freedom of conscience and religious organizations.\n\n有关信仰自由和宗教组织自由的法律\n\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT内疚；良心不安Conscience is a feeling of guilt because you know you have done something that is wrong.\n\nI'm so glad he had a pang of conscience...\n\n我很高兴他会有负疚感。\n\n\nThey have shown a ruthless lack of conscience.\n\n他们没有表现出丝毫内疚，实在是太无情了。\n\n\n\n4.PHRASE凭良心；出于公道If you say that you cannot do something in all conscience ,in good conscience, or in conscience, you mean that you cannot do it because you think it is wrong. \n\nShe could not, in good conscience, back out on her deal with him.\n\n凭良心她不能背弃与他达成的协议。\n\n\n\n5.PHRASE内疚；良心不安If you have something on your conscience, you feel guilty because you know you have done something wrong. \n\nNow the murderer has two deaths on his conscience.\n\n现在，这个杀人犯背着两条人命，受到了良心的谴责。\n\n\n
annihilate@\n1.VERB歼灭；消灭；毁灭；彻底击溃To annihilate something means to destroy it completely. \n\nThere are lots of ways of annihilating the planet...\n\n毁灭地球有很多方法。\n\n\nThe Army was annihilated.\n\n陆军被彻底击溃了。\n\n\n\nannihilation\n\n...the threat of nuclear war and annihilation of the human race.\n\n核战争的威胁和人类的灭绝\n\n\n\n2.VERB（在竞赛或争论中）彻底击败，大胜If you annihilate someone in a contest or argument, you totally defeat them. \n\nThe Dutch annihilated the Olympic champions 5-0.\n\n荷兰队以5比0完胜奥运冠军队。\n\n\n
retaliate@\n1.VERB报复；反击If you retaliate when someone harms or annoys you, you do something which harms or annoys them in return. \n\nI was sorely tempted to retaliate... \n\n我非常想报复。\n\n\nChristie retaliated by sending his friend a long letter detailing Carl's utter incompetence...\n\n为了报复，克里斯蒂给他朋友寄了一封长信，细述卡尔完全不称职。\n\n\nThe militia responded by saying it would retaliate against any attacks...\n\n民兵组织回复说他们会对任何进攻予以反击。\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nretaliation\n\nPolice said they believed the attack was in retaliation for the death of the drug trafficker.\n\n警察说他们认为这次袭击是针对那个毒犯的死实施的报复。\n\n\n
crossfire@\n1.N-UNCOUNT交叉火力Crossfire is gunfire, for example in a battle, that comes from two or more different directions and passes through the same area.\n\n\n2.PHRASE被卷进争端If you are caught in the crossfire, you become involved in an unpleasant situation in which people are arguing with each other, although you do not want to be involved or say which person you agree with. \n\nThey say they are caught in the crossfire between the education establishment and the government.\n\n他们称自己被卷进了教育机构与政府之间的争端。\n\n\n
briefing@n. 简要情况，简介\n动词brief的现在分词形式1.N-VARSee also:brief；情况介绍会；任务下达会A briefing is a meeting at which information or instructions are given to people, especially before they do something.\n\nThey're holding a press briefing tomorrow...\n\n他们明天将召开一个新闻发布会。\n\n\nSecurity staff did not then receive any briefing before they started each shift.\n\n保安人员当时开始轮岗前没有收到任何指示。\n\n
crumble@\n1.V-ERG（使）破碎；（使）成碎屑If something crumbles, or if you crumble it, it breaks into a lot of small pieces. \n\nUnder the pressure, the flint crumbled into fragments...\n\n燧石在压力的作用下碎成了小块。\n\n\nRoughly crumble the cheese into a bowl.\n\n把干酪大致弄碎，装入一只碗内。\n\n\n\n2.VERB坍塌；损坏；崩裂If an old building or piece of land is crumbling, parts of it keep breaking off. \n\nThe high and low-rise apartment blocks built in the 1960s are crumbling...\n\n20世纪60年代建造的高低不一的公寓楼群正在逐渐破损坍塌。\n\n\nThe cliffs were estimated to be crumbling into the sea at the rate of 10ft an hour.\n\n预计那处悬崖会以每小时10英尺的速度坍塌坠入大海。\n\n\nCrumble away means the same as crumble .crumble away 同 crumble\n\nBritain's coastline stretches 4000 kilometres and much of it is crumbling away.\n\n英国的海岸线绵延4，000公里，其中大部分正在逐渐沉陷。\n\n\n\n\n3.VERB（体系、关系或希望等）崩溃，瓦解，消亡If something such as a system, relationship, or hope crumbles, it comes to an end. \n\nTheir economy crumbled under the weight of United Nations sanctions...\n\n在联合国制裁的重压之下，他们的经济崩溃了。\n\n\nThe traditional marriage is crumbling fast...\n\n传统婚姻正迅速消失。\n\n\nIt only takes a minute for the football hopes of an entire country to crumble.\n\n就在一分钟之内，全国民众的足球梦想就化为了泡影。\n\n\nCrumble away means the same as crumble .crumble away 同 crumble\n\nOpposition more or less crumbled away.\n\n反对势力差不多都瓦解了。\n\n\n\n\n4.VERB不再抵抗；放弃奋斗；无力应付If someone crumbles, they stop resisting or trying to win, or become unable to cope. \n\nBrighton have too many experienced players to crumble just because we are in town...\n\n布赖顿队有很多经验丰富的队员，他们不会因为我们在城里就丧失斗志。\n\n\nHe is a skilled and ruthless leader who isn't likely to crumble under pressure.\n\n他是个经验丰富、冷酷无情的领导，不会被压力击垮。\n\n\n\n5.N-VAR酥皮水果甜点A crumble is a baked pudding made from fruit covered with a mixture of flour, butter, and sugar. \n\n...apple crumble.\n\n酥皮苹果甜点\n\n\n
deja vu@ n. (法语)似曾相识的感觉，过分熟悉
nuke@n. 核武器, 核能发电厂\nv. 以核武器攻击\n1.N-COUNT核武器A nuke is a nuclear weapon. \n\nThey have nukes, and if they're sufficiently pushed, they'll use them.\n\n他们拥有核武器，如果逼得太紧，他们就有可能会使用。\n\n\n\n2.VERB对…进行核打击If one country nukes another, it attacks it using nuclear weapons. \n\nHe wanted to nuke the area.\n\n他想用核弹轰掉那个地区。\n\n\n
showdown@n. 摊牌1.N-COUNT（解决长期存在的争端的）最后决战，决出胜负的较量A showdown is a big argument or conflict which is intended to settle a dispute that has lasted for a long time. \n\nThe Prime Minister is preparing for a showdown with Ministers.\n\n首相正准备和部长们摊牌。\n\n
throes@n. 剧痛\n1.N-PLURAL（尤指最后阶段的）困境，痛苦If someone is experiencing something very unpleasant or emotionally painful, you can say that they are in the throes of it, especially when it is in its final stages. \n\n...when the country was going through the final throes of civil war.\n\n当时这个国家正处在内战最后的痛苦关头\n\n\n...the agonising throes of transition.\n\n过渡时期的煎熬\n\n\n\n2.PREP-PHRASE正忙于…；处于…困境之中If you are in the throes of doing or experiencing something, especially something difficult, you are busy doing it or are deeply involved in it. \n\nThe country is in the throes of a general election...\n\n该国正忙于大选。\n\n\nDespite being in the throes of school exams, Tamsin made the long trek from Liverpool.\n\n虽然还要忙着准备学校的考试，塔姆辛还是完成了从利物浦出发的漫长而艰辛的跋涉。\n\n\n\n3.See also: death throes；\n1.N-PLURAL（彻底失败或终结前的）垂死挣扎The death throes of something are its final stages, just before it fails completely or ends. \n\nTheir work is a despairing metaphor for a society in its death throes...\n\n他们的作品是对一个正在作垂死挣扎的社会的绝望隐喻。\n\n\nThe dead tycoon's sons will remain in their plush offices overseeing the death throes of the family empire.\n\n这位已故大亨的儿子们将坐在豪华的办公室里，目睹这个家族帝国崩溃前的痛苦挣扎。\n\n\n\n2.N-PLURAL（人或动物）临死前痛苦的挣扎If a person or animal is in their death throes, they are dying and making violent, uncontrolled movements, usually because they are suffering great pain.\n
putative@adj. 假定的，被公认的1.ADJ公认的；推定的If you describe someone or something as putative, you mean that they are generally thought to be the thing mentioned. \n\n...a putative father.\n\n推定的父亲\n\n
disintegrate@v. (使)粉碎,(使)碎裂,解体,瓦解\nvt. 瓦解,崩溃\n1.VERB崩溃；瓦解If something disintegrates, it becomes seriously weakened, and is divided or destroyed. \n\nDuring October 1918 the Austro-Hungarian Empire began to disintegrate.\n\n在 1918 年 10 月间，奥匈帝国开始瓦解。\n\n\n\ndisintegration\n\n...the disintegration of the country's two largest political parties.\n\n该国两个最大政党的分崩离析\n\n\n...the disintegration of an ordinary marriage.\n\n一桩普通婚姻的解体\n\n\n\n2.VERB碎裂；分裂；粉碎If an object or substance disintegrates, it breaks into many small pieces or parts and is destroyed. \n\nAt 420mph the windscreen disintegrated.\n\n挡风玻璃在时速420英里时破碎。\n\n\n\ndisintegration\n\n...the catastrophic disintegration of the aircraft after the explosion.\n\n爆炸后飞机灾难性的解体\n\n\n
last-ditch@adj. 最后防线的, 已无后退余地的, 坚持到最后的1.ADJ孤注一掷的；最后一搏的A last-ditch action is done only because there are no other ways left to achieve something or to prevent something happening. It is often done without much hope that it will succeed. \n\n...a last-ditch attempt to prevent civil war.\n\n阻止内战发生的最后努力\n\n\n...a desperate, last-ditch counterattack.\n\n孤注一掷的反击\n\n
innermost@adj. 内心的, 最深处的\nn. 最深处\n1.ADJ内心深处的；最隐秘的Your innermost thoughts and feelings are your most personal and secret ones. \n\n...expressing your innermost feelings.\n\n表达内心深处的情感\n\n\n...revealing a company's innermost secrets.\n\n揭开一家公司最不为人知的秘密\n\n\n\n2.ADJ最接近中心的；最里面的；最深处的The innermost thing is the one that is nearest to the centre. \n\n...the innermost part of the eye...\n\n眼睛最深处的部分\n\n\nShe put the receipt into the innermost pocket of her bag.\n\n她把收据放在提包最里面的口袋里。\n\n\n
eddy@\n1.N-COUNT（水或气流的）漩涡，涡流An eddy is a movement in water or in the air which goes round and round instead of flowing in one continuous direction.\n\n\n2.VERB起漩涡；旋转；杂乱无章地移动To eddy means to move round and round, or to move in a disorganized way. \n\nThe dust whirled and eddied in the sunlight...\n\n灰尘在阳光下旋转翻腾。\n\n\nThe crowds were eddying into the road.\n\n人群乱哄哄地涌上街头。\n\n\n
suck@v. 啜,吸,吸入,吮吸 \n&lt;俚&gt;糟糕, 太烂了\n1.VERB吮；啜；吸If you suck something, you hold it in your mouth and pull at it with the muscles in your cheeks and tongue, for example in order to get liquid out of it. \n\nThey waited in silence and sucked their sweets...\n\n他们安静地等着，嘴里咂着糖果。\n\n\nHe sucked on his cigarette...\n\n他抽了一口烟。\n\n\nDoran was clutching the bottle with both hands and sucking intently.\n\n多兰双手紧紧抓着瓶子尽情地喝着。\n\n\n\n2.VERB抽吸，抽取，抽，吸（空气、液体等）If something sucks a liquid, gas, or object in a particular direction, it draws it there with a powerful force. \n\nThe pollution-control team is at the scene and is due to start sucking up oil any time now... \n\n污染控制小组就在现场，现在随时准备开始吸油。\n\n\nThe air is sucked out by a high-powered fan...\n\n由强力风机把空气吸出去。\n\n\nThey sucked in deep lungfuls of air.\n\n他们深吸了几口气。\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.V-PASSIVE将…卷入If you are sucked into a bad situation, you are unable to prevent yourself from becoming involved in it. \n\nHe warned that if the President tried to enforce control, the country would be sucked into a power vacuum.\n\n他警告说，如果总统想要实施强权统治的话，那么这个国家将陷入权力真空状态。\n\n\n...the extent to which they have been sucked into the cycle of violence.\n\n他们卷入暴力恶性循环的程度\n\n\n\n4.VERB糟糕透顶；很差If someone says that something sucks, they are indicating that they think it is very bad. \n\nThe system sucks.\n\n这个系统太差劲了。\n
incandescent@adj. 光亮的, 发白热光的, 白热化的\nn. 白炽灯泡\n1.ADJ遇热发光的；白炽的Incandescent substances or devices give out a lot of light when heated. \n\n...incandescent gases.\n\n遇热发光的气体\n\n\n...incandescent light bulbs.\n\n白炽灯泡\n\n\n\n2.ADJ活力四射的；热情洋溢的If you describe someone or something as incandescent, you mean that they are very lively and impressive. \n\nGill had an extraordinary, incandescent personality.\n\n吉尔个性鲜明，热情洋溢。\n\n\n...an incandescent performance from Jessye Norman.\n\n杰茜·诺曼活力四射的演出\n\n\n\nincandescence\n\nShe burned with an incandescence that had nothing to do with her looks.\n\n她光彩照人，却与容貌无关。\n\n\n\n3.ADJ暴怒的；盛怒的If you say that someone is incandescent with rage, you mean that they are extremely angry. \n\nIt makes me incandescent with fury.\n\n它令我极其愤怒。\n\n\n
devoid@1.ADJ-GRADED毫无…的；没有…的If you say that someone or something is devoid of a quality or thing, you are emphasizing that they have none of it. \n\nI have never looked on a face that was so devoid of feeling...\n\n我从来没有见过一张如此面无表情的脸。\n\n\nThe skies are virtually devoid of birdlife.\n\n天空中几乎没有任何鸟的踪迹。\n\n
cathedral@1.N-COUNT大教堂；主教座堂A cathedral is a very large and important church which has a bishop in charge of it.\n\n...St. Paul's Cathedral.\n\n圣保罗大教堂\n\n\n...the cathedral city of Canterbury.\n\n有主教座堂的坎特伯雷市\n\n
amok@adv. （尤指在公共场所）发狂，狂暴，疯狂1.PHRASE（人或动物）发狂，狂暴，疯狂If a person or animal runs amok, they behave in a violent and uncontrolled way. \n\nA soldier was arrested after running amok with a vehicle through Berlin.\n\n一名士兵在疯狂飙车穿越柏林后被逮捕。\n\n
suppress@\n1.VERB镇压；制止；压制If someone in authority suppresses an activity, they prevent it from continuing, by using force or making it illegal. \n\n...drug traffickers, who continue to flourish despite international attempts to suppress them...\n\n在国际社会强力打击下活动依然猖獗的贩毒分子\n\n\n...nationwide demonstrations for democracy, suppressed after 7 weeks by the army.\n\n在进行7周后遭到军队镇压的全国性民主示威活动\n\n\n\nsuppression\n\n...people who were imprisoned after the violent suppression of the pro-democracy movement protests.\n\n在拥护民主的抗议活动遭到暴力镇压后被投入监狱的人们\n\n\n\n2.VERB制止，阻止，抑制（身体的功能或反应）If a natural function or reaction of your body is suppressed, it is stopped, for example by drugs or illness. \n\nThe reproduction and growth of the cancerous cells can be suppressed by bombarding them with radiation.\n\n可以通过放疗杀死癌细胞来抑制其再生和扩散。\n\n\n...the strongest evidence so far that ultraviolet light can suppress human immune responses.\n\n迄今为止可证明紫外线能抑制人体免疫反应的最有力证据\n\n\n\nsuppression\n\nEye problems can indicate an unhealthy lifestyle with subsequent suppression of the immune system.\n\n患眼疾可能表明生活方式不健康，而且免疫系统同时受到抑制。\n\n\n\n3.VERB抑制，控制，克制（感情或反应）；忍住If you suppress your feelings or reactions, you do not express them, even though you might want to. \n\nLiz thought of Barry and suppressed a smile...\n\n莉兹想起了巴里，忍住没笑。\n\n\nThe Professor said that deep sleep allowed suppressed anxieties to surface.\n\n教授说深度睡眠可以使压抑的焦虑情绪得以释放。\n\n\n\nsuppression\n\nA mother's suppression of her own feelings can cause problems.\n\n母亲压抑自己的情感会产生问题。\n\n\n\n4.VERB封锁，隐瞒（消息）If someone suppresses a piece of information, they prevent other people from learning it. \n\nAt no time did they try to persuade me to suppress the information...\n\n他们从没有试图劝我隐瞒这个消息。\n\n\nThe wrong criminal is in the dock either because a genuine mistake has been made or because evidence has been suppressed.\n\n冤案错案的出现，要么是因为确实弄错了，要么是因为证据被隐瞒。\n\n\n\nsuppression\n\nThe inspectors found no evidence which supported any allegation of suppression of official documents.\n\n检察官没有找到任何证据来证实有关官方文件被封锁的说法。\n\n\n\n5.VERB压制，抑制，阻止（进程或活动）If someone or something suppresses a process or activity, they stop it continuing or developing. \n\n'The Government is suppressing inflation by devastating the economy,' he said...\n\n他说，“政府正在通过破坏经济来抑制通货膨胀。”\n\n\nLawyers said today's ruling would lead to higher prices and would suppress innovation of new products.\n\n律师们称今天的裁决将会抬升价格，并抑制新产品的创新。\n\n\n
avail@\n1.PHRASE毫无用处；没效果If you do something to no avail or to little avail, what you do fails to achieve what you want. \n\nHis efforts were to no avail...\n\n他徒劳无功。\n\n\nI apologized repeatedly, but to little avail.\n\n我一再道歉，但丝毫没有奏效。\n\n\n\n2.VERB接受（提议）；利用（机会）If you avail yourself of an offer or an opportunity, you accept the offer or make use of the opportunity. \n\nGuests should feel at liberty to avail themselves of your facilities.\n\n宾客们应该可以随意使用你们的各种设施。\n\n\n
thrust@\n1.VERB猛推；猛塞；刺；戳If you thrust something or someone somewhere, you push or move them there quickly with a lot of force. \n\nThey thrust him into the back of a jeep...\n\n他们把他硬塞进吉普车后座。\n\n\nShe grabs a stack of baby photos and thrusts them into my hands.\n\n她抓起一沓婴儿照片塞到我手里。\n\n\nThrust is also a noun.\n\nTwo of the knife thrusts were fatal.\n\n有两处刀伤是致命的。\n\n\n\n\n2.VERB挤；推；扎If you thrust your way somewhere, you move there, pushing between people or things which are in your way. \n\nShe thrust her way into the crowd...\n\n她一头扎进人群。\n\n\nHe reached the garden gate and thrust his way through it.\n\n他来到花园门口，挤了进去。\n\n\n\n3.VERB露在外面；凸出来If something thrusts up or out of something else, it sticks up or sticks out in a noticeable way. \n\nAn aerial thrust up from the grass verge...\n\n一根天线在草地边上竖立着。\n\n\nA ray of sunlight thrust out through the clouds.\n\n一缕阳光透过云层照射下来。\n\n\n\n4.N-UNCOUNT（车辆等的）推力，反压力，侧向压力Thrust is the power or force that is required to make a vehicle move in a particular direction.\n\nIt provides the thrust that makes the craft move forward.\n\n它提供了飞机前进所需的推力。\n\n\n\n5.N-SING（活动、思想的）要点，主要内容，要旨The thrust of an activity or of an idea is the main or essential things it expresses. \n\nThe real thrust of the film is its examination of New York's Hasidic community...\n\n这部电影的真正要旨是它审视了纽约的哈西德教徒。\n\n\nThe main thrust of the research will be the study of the early Universe and galaxy formation...\n\n此项研究的核心是早期宇宙和银河系的形成。\n\n\nThe conductor brought home the full thrust of the work's emotional resolution.\n\n指挥将该作品情感上的毅然决然这一主旨充分表现了出来。\n\n\n
unprecedented@\n1.ADJ前所未有的；空前的；没有先例的If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before.\n\nSuch a move is rare, but not unprecedented...\n\n这种做法很罕见，但也不是没有先例的。\n\n\nIn 1987 the Socialists took the unprecedented step of appointing a civilian to command the force.\n\n1987年，社会党人史无前例地任命了一位非军队出身的人来指挥军队。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED（质量、数量、规模）很高的，很大的If you describe something as unprecedented, you are emphasizing that it is very great in quality, amount, or scale. \n\nEach home boasts an unprecedented level of quality throughout...\n\n每家的质量都堪称一流。\n\n\nThe scheme has been hailed as an unprecedented success.\n\n这个计划广受好评，被认为是一个巨大的成功。\n\n\n
kinship@1.N-UNCOUNT亲属关系,血缘关系Kinship is the relationship between members of the same family.\n\nThe ties of kinship may have helped the young man find his way in life.\n\n亲情可能帮这个年轻人找到了生活的方向。\n\n\n...her kinship to the English King.\n\n她同英格兰国王的亲属关系\n\n\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT（因背景、感觉或想法相似而产生的）亲切感If you feel kinship with someone, you feel close to them, because you have a similar background or similar feelings or ideas.\n\nShe evidently felt a sense of kinship with the woman.\n\n她明显地感到对这个女人有一种亲切感。\n\n\n...the warmth and kinship one farmer feels for another.\n\n农民相互之间的温暖和亲切感\n\n\n
unhinge@v. 使发狂, 使错乱\n1.VERB使精神错乱（或失常）If you say that an experience has unhinged someone, you mean that it has affected them so deeply that they have become mentally ill. \n\nThe stress of war temporarily unhinged him.\n\n战争的压力让他一时丧失了神志。\n\n\n\nunhinged\n\n...feelings that make you feel completely unhinged and crazy.\n\n令人彻底发疯发狂的情绪\n\n\n
fervent@\n1.ADJ-GRADED热情的；热忱的；热烈的A fervent person has or shows strong feelings about something, and is very sincere and enthusiastic about it. \n\n...a fervent admirer of Morisot's work.\n\n摩里索作品热忱的欣赏者\n\n\n...the fervent hope that matters will be settled promptly.\n\n对事情将迅速得到解决的热切希望\n\n\n\nfervently\n\nTheir claims will be fervently denied.\n\n他们的要求将遭到严词拒绝。\n\n\n
reclaim@\n1.VERB要求归还（或恢复）；收回If you reclaim something that you have lost or that has been taken away from you, you succeed in getting it back. \n\nIn 1986, they got the right to reclaim South African citizenship...\n\n1986年，他们取得了恢复南非公民身份的权利。\n\n\n'I've come to reclaim my property,' she announced to the desk clerk.\n\n“我来要求归还我的房产，”她向接待人员宣布。\n\n\n\n2.VERB收回；拿回；申请退（税）If you reclaim an amount of money, for example tax that you have paid, you claim it back. \n\nThere are an estimated eight million people currently thought to be eligible to reclaim income tax.\n\n估计现在有800万人有资格申请所得税退税。\n\n\n\n3.VERB开垦（荒地）；开拓（耕地或建筑用地）When people reclaim land, they make it suitable for a purpose such as farming or building, for example by draining it or by building a barrier against the sea. \n\nThe Netherlands has been reclaiming farmland from water.\n\n荷兰人一直在围海造地。\n\n\n...a scheme to build a residential development on 1,100 acres of reclaimed land in Tokyo Bay.\n\n在东京湾通过围海造地开拓的1，100英亩土地上建造住宅区的计划\n\n\n\n4.VERB使（农田、建筑用地）重新变成（沙漠、森林或海洋）If a piece of land that was used for farming or building is reclaimed by a desert, forest, or the sea, it turns back into desert, forest, or sea. \n\nThe diamond towns are gradually being reclaimed by the desert...\n\n这些钻石城镇正逐渐重归沙漠。\n\n\nThis method of spraying would allow the land to be reclaimed by the rain forests.\n\n这种喷洒法可以使土地重新变成雨林。\n\n\n\n5.VERB挽救；感化If you reclaim a person who has been involved in bad or criminal behaviour, you cause them to stop acting in that way. \n\nHe set out to fight the drug infestation of Omaha by reclaiming a youth from the local gangs.\n\n他从挽救当地帮派的一个年轻人入手着力消除奥马哈的毒品泛滥问题。\n\n\n
unadulterated@adj. 无搀杂的, 道地的, 纯粹的\n1.ADJ未掺杂的；纯的Something that is unadulterated is completely pure and has had nothing added to it.\n\nOrganic food is unadulterated food produced without artificial chemicals or pesticides.\n\n有机食品是未使用人工化学制剂和杀虫剂的纯净食品。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ（常用于强调不好的品质）十足的，纯粹的，地道的You can also use unadulterated to emphasize a particular quality, often a bad quality. \n\nIt was pure, unadulterated hell.\n\n那里简直就是个不折不扣的地狱。\n\n\n
gun down@1.PHRASAL VERB枪杀；开枪射伤If someone is gunned down, they are shot and severely injured or killed. \n\nHe had been gunned down and killed at point-blank range.\n\n他被近距离开枪射杀。\n\n
racetrack@n. 跑道\n1.N-COUNT赛马跑道；赛马场A racetrack is a track on which horses race. \n\n\nin BRIT, use 英国英语用 racecourse\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（赛车、比赛等的）赛道，赛场A racetrack is a track for races, for example car or bicycle races.\n
sentiment@n. 感情, 情趣, 意见，观点, 多愁善感\n1.N-VAR（基于思想或情感的）态度，情绪A sentiment that people have is an attitude which is based on their thoughts and feelings. \n\nPublic sentiment rapidly turned anti-American...\n\n公众情绪迅速转变，开始反对美国。\n\n\nHe's found growing sentiment for military action.\n\n他发现支持采取军事行动的情绪日益高涨。\n\n\n...nationalist sentiments that threaten to split the country.\n\n可能会造成国家分裂的民族主义情绪\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（用言辞表达的）见解，感想A sentiment is an idea or feeling that someone expresses in words. \n\nI must agree with the sentiments expressed by John Prescott...\n\n我不得不对约翰·普雷斯科特的见解表示赞同。\n\n\nThe Foreign Secretary echoed this sentiment.\n\n外交大臣附和了这一看法。\n\n\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT（尤指对过去的事过度而无谓的）感伤，眷恋Sentiment is feelings such as pity or love, especially for things in the past, and may be considered exaggerated and foolish.\n\nLaura kept that letter out of sentiment...\n\n劳拉因无法释怀而一直保留着那封信。\n\n\nThe coronation was an occasion for extravagant myth and sentiment.\n\n加冕典礼是极尽奢华和怀旧的仪式。\n\n\n
antique@adj. 古代的\nn. 古物, 古董,古玩
disciple@n. 弟子, 门徒1.N-COUNT信徒；门徒；追随者；崇奉者If you are someone's disciple, you are influenced by their teachings and try to follow their example. \n\n...a disciple of Freud.\n\n弗洛伊德的门徒\n\n\n...one of the disciples of Christ.\n\n耶稣的门徒之一\n\n
longing@n. 渴望,热望,憧憬\nadj. 渴望的,热望的\nvbl. 渴望,渴慕,热望1.N-VAR渴望；热望；憧憬If you feel longing or a longing for something, you have a rather sad feeling because you want it very much. \n\nHe felt a longing for the familiar...\n\n他渴望找到知交。\n\n\nImelda spoke of her longing to return home...\n\n伊美尔达说她期望能够回家。\n\n\nI was overwhelmed with longing for those innocent days of early childhood.\n\n我内心充满着对纯真的童年时光的怀念。\n\n
masquerade@\n1.VERB化装；伪装；冒充To masquerade as someone or something means to pretend to be that person or thing, particularly in order to deceive other people. \n\nHe masqueraded as a doctor and fooled everyone.\n\n他冒充医生，骗过了所有人。\n\n\n...vices masquerading as virtues.\n\n披着美德外衣的丑恶\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT虚假的行为；掩饰；欺骗A masquerade is an attempt to deceive people about the true nature or identity of something.\n\nHe told a news conference that the elections would be a masquerade.\n\n他在新闻发布会上说选举将是一场骗人的把戏。\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT化装晚会A masquerade is an event such as a party or dance where people dress up in disguise and wear masks.\n\n...a masquerade ball.\n\n化装舞会\n\n\n
coincidence@adj. 同时发生的\nn. 巧合\n1.N-VAR巧合；巧事A coincidence is when two or more similar or related events occur at the same time by chance and without any planning.\n\nMr. Berry said the timing was a coincidence and that his decision was unrelated to Mr. Roman's departure...\n\n贝里先生说这是时间上的巧合，他的决定与罗曼先生的离开没有关系。\n\n\n...a string of amazing coincidences...\n\n一连串惊人的巧合\n\n\nThe premises of Chabert and Sons were situated by the river and, by coincidence, not too far away from where Eric Talbot had met his death.\n\n查伯特父子公司的经营场所位于河边，碰巧的是，那儿离埃里克·塔尔博特身亡的地方不太远。\n\n\n
indebted@adj. 负债的(受惠的)\n1.ADJ-GRADED感激的；感恩的If you say that you are indebted to someone for something, you mean that you are very grateful to them for something. \n\nI am deeply indebted to him for his help.\n\n我非常感激他对我的帮助。\n\n\n\nindebtedness\n\nMortimer recounted his indebtedness to her in his autobiography.\n\n莫蒂默在他的自传里讲述了对她的感激。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED负债的Indebted countries, organizations, or people are ones that owe money to other countries, organizations, or people. \n\nAmerica's treasury secretary identified the most heavily indebted countries.\n\n美国财政部长指出了负债最多的那些国家。\n\n\n\nindebtedness\n\nThe company has reduced its indebtedness to just $15 million.\n\n公司把负债降低到仅仅 1，500 万美元。\n\n\n
derivative@adj. 引出的,系出的\nn. 引出之物,系出物,衍生字\nn. 导数, 微商\n1.N-COUNT派生物；衍生物A derivative is something which has been developed or obtained from something else.\n\n...a poppy-seed derivative similar to heroin...\n\n类似海洛因的罂粟籽制剂\n\n\nThis isn't an entirely new car, but a new derivative of the Citroen XM.\n\n这不是一款全新的车，而是雪铁龙XM系列的派生车型。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED模仿他人的；缺乏创意的If you say that something is derivative, you are criticizing it because it is not new or original but has been developed from something else. \n\n...their dull, derivative debut album...\n\n他们沉闷乏味、缺乏创意的首张专辑\n\n\nA lot of what you see in stand-up comedy today is very derivative.\n\n如今人们看到的单人喜剧表演好多内容都是沿袭前人。\n\n\n
dazzle@v. 使眼花，使惊奇，目眩，耀眼\nn. 耀眼的光，令人惊叹的事物\n1.VERB使惊叹；使叹服；使倾倒If someone or something dazzles you, you are extremely impressed by their skill, qualities, or beauty. \n\nGeorge dazzled her with his knowledge of the world...\n\n乔治的洞察世情令她叹服。\n\n\nThe movie's special effects fail to dazzle.\n\n这部电影的特效未能出彩。\n\n\n\n2.N-SING辉煌；灿烂；艳丽；令人赞叹的特质The dazzle of something is a quality it has, such as beauty or skill, which is impressive and attractive. \n\nThe dazzle of stardom and status attracts them.\n\n明星的光彩和地位吸引着他们。\n\n\n\n3.VERB（强光等）使目眩，使眼花If a bright light dazzles you, it makes you unable to see properly for a short time. \n\nThe sun, glinting from the pool, dazzled me...\n\n在太阳的照射下，池面上泛起粼粼波光，让我一时睁不开眼。\n\n\nKelly was dazzled by the lights.\n\n灯光照得凯莉有些眼晕。\n\n\n\n4.N-UNCOUNT（光的）炫目，耀眼，闪耀The dazzle of a light is its brightness, which makes it impossible for you to see properly for a short time. \n\nThe sun's dazzle on the water hurts my eyes.\n\n水面上耀眼的阳光刺痛了我的眼睛。\n\n\n...a filter that can cut dazzle.\n\n可以去除眩光的滤光片\n\n\n
zip@\n1.N-COUNT拉锁；拉链A zip or zip fastener is a device used to open and close parts of clothes and bags. It consists of two rows of metal or plastic teeth which separate or fasten together as you pull a small tag along them. \n\nHe pulled the zip of his leather jacket down slightly.\n\n他稍稍往下拉了拉皮夹克的拉链。\n\n\n\nin AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 zipper\n\n\n2.VERB拉上…的拉链When you zip something, you fasten it using a zip. \n\nShe zipped her jeans...\n\n她拉上了牛仔裤的拉链。\n\n\nI slowly zipped and locked the heavy black nylon bags.\n\n我慢慢地把那些沉重的黑色尼龙袋的拉链拉上并锁好。\n\n\n\n3.VERB压缩（文档）To zip a computer file means to compress it so that it needs less space for storage on disk and can be transmitted more quickly. \n\nZip up means the same as zip .zip up 同 zip\n\nThese files have been zipped up to take up less disk space.\n\n这些文档已经进行了压缩，以节省磁盘空间。\n\n\n\n\n4.VERB快速移动；飞速行动If you say that something or someone zips somewhere, you mean that they move there very quickly. \n\nMy craft zipped across the bay...\n\n我的小艇飞速驶过海湾。\n\n\nMax zips back and forth across the living room.\n\n马克斯在客厅里快速地来回走动。\n\n\n\n5.N-UNCOUNT精力；活力；热情If you say that someone or something has zip, you mean that they show a lot of energy and enthusiasm. \n\nShare options will play a bigger role in future, putting zip into the performance of middle managers...\n\n认股权在未来会发挥更大的作用，将激发中层管理者的工作热情，使其有更出色的表现。\n\n\nTommy Tune gives the choreography his usual class and zip.\n\n汤米·图恩在编排的舞蹈中注入其一贯的优雅和活力。\n\n\n
claw@\n1.N-COUNT（鸟兽的）爪，脚爪The claws of a bird or animal are the thin, hard, curved nails at the end of its feet. \n\nThe cat tried to cling to the edge by its claws.\n\n猫试图用爪子抓住边缘。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（龙虾、螃蟹、蝎子等的）螯，钳The claws of a lobster, crab, or scorpion are the two pointed parts at the end of its legs which are used for holding things. \n\n\n3.VERB（用爪子）抓（破），撕（伤），挠（坏）If an animal claws at something, it scratches or damages it with its claws. \n\nThe wolf clawed at the tree and howled the whole night.\n\n这匹狼用爪子挠着树，嚎叫了整晚。\n\n\n\n4.VERB使劲抓住；用力抓住To claw at something mean to try very hard to get hold of it. \n\nHis fingers clawed at Blake's wrist...\n\n他的手指紧紧抓住布莱克的手腕。\n\n\nHe stumbled, clawed wildly at the air and fell backwards into the water.\n\n他绊了一脚，双手在空中胡乱抓了几下，然后仰天栽进了水里。\n\n\n\n5.VERB（抓住东西）费力前进If you claw your way somewhere, you move there with great difficulty, trying desperately to find things to hold on to. \n\nSome did manage to claw their way up iron ladders to the safety of the upper deck.\n\n的确有人设法抓住铁梯爬上了顶层甲板，脱离了危险。\n\n\n\n6.VERB不畏艰险地拼搏；坚持不懈地奋斗If someone claws their way to a successful position, they achieve it with great determination in spite of many difficulties. \n\nGino clawed his way out of underworld obscurity to become a millionaire hotelier.\n\n吉诺从底层社会的无名小卒一步步奋斗成为拥有百万家财的酒店大亨。\n\n\n\n7.N-PLURAL影响别人的言行；（尤指）尖刻的言行，令人不愉快的言行If someone gets their claws into another person, they start doing or saying things, especially unpleasant things, which affect that person. \n\nShe should take her claws out of Tom and let him get on with his life.\n\n她不该再死死地缠着汤姆，应该让他继续自己的生活。\n\n\n
incessant@adj. 不断的,不绝的,无尽的\n1.ADJ-GRADED不停的；连续的；持续不断的An incessant process or activity is one that continues without stopping. \n\n...incessant rain.\n\n阴雨连绵\n\n\n...his incessant demands for affection.\n\n他对感情的不断索取\n\n\n\nincessantly\n\nDee talked incessantly.\n\n迪伊一直说个不停。\n\n\n
putrid@1.ADJ-GRADED腐烂的；腐臭的Something that is putrid has decayed and smells very unpleasant. \n\n...a foul, putrid stench.\n\n难闻的腐臭\n\n
puppet@\n1.N-COUNT木偶A puppet is a doll that you can move, either by pulling strings which are attached to it or by putting your hand inside its body and moving your fingers.\n\n\n2.N-COUNT傀儡；受人操纵者You can refer to a person or country as a puppet when you mean that their actions are controlled by a more powerful person or government, even though they may appear to be independent. \n\nWhen the invasion occurred he ruled as a puppet of the occupiers...\n\n外敌入侵时，他作为占领者的傀儡行使统治。\n\n\nHe warned there would be a 'social explosion' if the army installed another puppet prime minister.\n\n他警告说如果军方再安插一个新的傀儡首相，将会引发“社会暴动”。\n\n\n
psychokinesis@n. 精神致动，念力1.N-UNCOUNT意志移物；念力；心灵致动Psychokinesis is the ability, which some people believe exists, to move objects using the power of your mind.
likewise@\n1.ADV同样地；类似地You use likewise when you are comparing two methods, states, or situations and saying that they are similar. \n\nThese requests are ignored. His requests for rent are likewise sometimes ignored...\n\n这些要求被置之不理。他关于支付租金的要求有时也同样未被理睬。\n\n\nThe V2 was not an ordinary weapon: it could only be used against cities. Likewise the atom bomb.\n\nV2火箭并非普通武器：它只能用于对付城市。原子弹也是这样。\n\n\n\n2.ADV照样地If you do something and someone else does likewise, they do the same or a similar thing. \n\nHe lent money, made donations and encouraged others to do likewise.\n\n他又借钱又捐款捐物，并且鼓励别人也这样做。\n\n\n
whip up@激起/增强/促进(激情、兴趣等),催促\n1.PHRASAL VERB激起，煽动（仇恨等危险情感）If someone whips up an emotion, especially a dangerous one such as hatred, or if they whip people up into an emotional state, they deliberately cause and encourage people to feel that emotion. \n\nHe accused politicians of whipping up anti-foreign sentiments in order to win right-wing votes...\n\n他谴责那些政客为了获得右翼人士的选票而煽动排外情绪。\n\n\nJoe McCarthy whipped up Americans into a frenzy of anti-Communist activity in the Fifties.\n\n20世纪50年代，乔·麦卡锡使美国人卷入了疯狂的反共运动之中。\n\n\n\n2.PHRASAL VERB（风）激起，吹起（尘土或水）If a force such as the wind whips up dust or water, it makes it rise up. \n\nIn 1346 a hurricane whipped up the sea to destroy the town.\n\n1346 年的飓风引起海啸并摧毁了城镇。\n\n\n...clouds of smoke and sand whipped up by a strong wind.\n\n大风卷起的大团的烟雾和沙石\n\n\n\n3.PHRASAL VERB很快做好（尤指一顿饭）If you whip up something, especially a meal, you make it quickly. \n\nI used to entertain at home quite a lot, and I can still whip up a fairly decent dinner party.\n\n我原来经常在家自娱自乐，现在也还能迅速准备好一顿颇为像样的晚宴。\n\n\n
intruder@n. 侵入者, 闯入者,干扰者, 妨碍者
disembodied@adj. 无实体的, 空洞的\n动词disembody的过去式和过去分词形式\n1.ADJ似脱离人而存在的；无实体的；脱离现实的Disembodied means seeming not to be attached to or to come from anyone. \n\nA disembodied voice sounded from the back of the cabin.\n\n从柜子后面传来了一个不见其人的声音。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ脱离肉体的；与躯体分离的Disembodied means separated from or existing without a body. \n\n...a disembodied head.\n\n一颗与躯体分离的头颅\n\n\n
shred@\n1.VERB切碎；撕碎If you shred something such as food or paper, you cut it or tear it into very small, narrow pieces. \n\nThey may be shredding documents...\n\n他们可能是在粉碎文件。\n\n\nFinely shred the carrots, cabbage and cored apples.\n\n将胡萝卜、卷心菜切成细丝并给苹果去核。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（撕或切成的）细条，碎片If you cut or tear food or paper into shreds, you cut or tear it into small, narrow pieces. \n\nCut the cabbage into fine long shreds.\n\n将卷心菜切成又细又长的丝。\n\n\n\n3.N-COUNT极少量；些许；一丁点儿If there is not a shred of something, there is not even a small amount of it. \n\nHe said there was not a shred of evidence to support such remarks...\n\n他说没有丝毫证据证明这样的说法。\n\n\nThere is not a shred of truth in the story...\n\n这则报道中没有一句实话。\n\n\nHe was left without a shred of self-esteem.\n\n他的自尊荡然无存。\n\n\n\n4.PHRASE把…批得体无完肤If you tear someone to shreds or rip them to shreds, you criticize them very thoroughly and severely. \n
par@\n1.PHRASE与…同样；与…相似If you say that two people or things are on a par with each other, you mean that they are equally good or bad, or equally important. \n\nParts of Glasgow are on a par with the worst areas of London and Liverpool for burglaries.\n\n格拉斯哥部分地区的入室盗窃案与伦敦、利物浦最乱的地区一样猖狂。\n\n\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT（高尔夫球的）标准杆数In golf, par is the number of strokes that a good player should take to get the ball into a hole or into all the holes on a particular golf course. \n\nHe was five under par after the first round.\n\n第一轮过后，他低于标准杆5杆。\n\n\n\n3.PHRASE不符合标准的；不如预期的If you say that someone or something is below par or under par, you are disappointed in them because they are below the standard you expected. \n\nDuffy's primitive guitar playing is well below par...\n\n达菲粗糙的吉他演奏技巧远不够水平。\n\n\nA teacher's job is relatively safe, even if they perform under par in the classroom.\n\n教师的职业相对稳定，即使他们的课上得不怎么好。\n\n\n...a below par effort.\n\n低于预期的尝试\n\n\n\n4.PHRASE达到标准的；合格的If you say that someone or something is not up to par, you are disappointed in them because they are below the standard you expected. \n\nHis performance was not up to par...\n\n他的表演不合格。\n\n\nIt's a constant struggle to try to keep them up to par.\n\n要让他们达标，需要不断努力。\n\n\n\n5.PHRASE不在状态；感觉不如平常好If you feel below par or under par, you feel tired and unable to perform as well as you normally do. \n\n\n6.PHRASE（不快之事）不出所料，在意料之中If you say that something that happens is par for the course, you mean that you are not pleased with it but it is what you expected to happen. \n\nHe said long hours are par for the course.\n\n他说时间之久是意料之中的。\n\n\n
mincemeat@n. 苹果等切碎混拌碎肉的东西，甜馅\n1.N-UNCOUNT百果馅（用切碎的干果混合而成，用于制百果馅饼）Mincemeat is a sticky mixture of small pieces of dried fruit. It is usually cooked in pastry to make mince pies.\n\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT同 minceMincemeat is the same as mince . \n\n\nin AM, use 美国英语用 ground beef, hamburger meat\n\n\n3.PHRASE（在辩论、打斗、竞争中）彻底击败，把…打得落花流水If you make mincemeat of someone or make mincemeat out of them, you defeat them completely in an argument, fight, or competition. \n\nI can imagine a defence lawyer making mincemeat of him if we ever put him up in court.\n\n要是我们让他出庭，我能够想象出辩护律师把他驳斥得体无完肤的情形。\n\n\n
embodiment@n. 化身, 体现1.N-SING（品质、思想等的）典型，化身If you say that someone or something is the embodiment of a quality or idea, you mean that that is their most noticeable characteristic or the basis of all they do. \n\nA baby is the embodiment of vulnerability.\n\n婴儿极为脆弱。\n\n
resonate@\n1.VERB发出嘹亮的声音；回响；回荡If something resonates, it vibrates and produces a deep, strong sound. \n\nThe bass guitar began to thump so loudly that it resonated in my head.\n\n低音电吉他开始砰砰作响，巨大的声音一直在我的脑海里回响。\n\n\n\n2.VERB有特殊意义；引起共鸣You say that something resonates when it has a special meaning or when it is particularly important to someone. \n\nLondon is confident and alive, resonating with all the qualities of a civilised city.\n\n伦敦洋溢着自信和活力，呈现出一个文明城市的所有特性。\n\n\n
incomparable@\n1.ADJ极其好的；令人叫绝的If you describe someone or something as incomparable, you mean that they are extremely good or impressive.\n\n...a play starring the incomparable Edith Evans...\n\n由演技精湛的伊迪丝·埃文斯主演的戏剧\n\n\nThe views from the house are incomparable.\n\n从房子里向外看到的景色非常优美。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ绝伦的；无比的；无双的You use incomparable to emphasize that someone or something has a good quality to a great degree. \n\nIt was a performance of incomparable brilliance.\n\n那是场精彩绝伦的演出。\n\n\n...an area of incomparable beauty.\n\n有绝世美景的地区\n\n\n\nincomparably\n\n...incomparably good brakes.\n\n绝好的刹车\n\n\n
clash@\n1.V-RECIP发生冲突；打斗；争论；意见不合When people clash, they fight, argue, or disagree with each other. \n\nA group of 400 demonstrators clashed with police...\n\n400名示威者与警察发生了冲突。\n\n\nBehind the scenes, Parsons clashed with almost everyone on the show...\n\n在幕后，帕森斯几乎和剧组的所有人都发生过冲突。\n\n\nThe United States and Israel clashed over demands for a UN investigation into the killings.\n\n美国和以色列在要求联合国对屠杀事件开展调查这一问题上意见相左。\n\n\nClash is also a noun.\n\nThere have been a number of clashes between police in riot gear and demonstrators.\n\n防暴警察和示威人群已发生多起冲突。\n\n\n\n\n2.V-RECIP（信仰、观点、特性）相互冲突，相互抵触，不相容Beliefs, ideas, or qualities that clash with each other are very different from each other and therefore are opposed. \n\nDon't make any policy decisions which clash with official company thinking...\n\n所作的任何决策都不要和公司官方理念相冲突。\n\n\nHere, morality and good sentiments clash headlong.\n\n在这个问题上，道德和良知互不相容。\n\n\nClash is also a noun.\n\nInside government, there was a clash of views.\n\n政府内部意见不一。\n\n\n\n\n3.VERB（两件事）时间上冲突，撞期If one event clashes with another, the two events happen at the same time so that you cannot attend both of them. \n\nThe detective changed his holiday dates when his flight was brought forward and it now clashed with the trial.\n\n由于航班提前，侦探更改了度假日期，但是这样一来就和审判冲突了。\n\n\n\n4.V-RECIP（色彩或风格）不协调，不搭配If one colour or style clashes with another, the colours or styles look ugly together. You can also say that two colours or styles clash . \n\nThe red door clashed with the soft, natural tones of the stone walls...\n\n红门和石墙柔和的自然色调不协调。\n\n\nSo what if the colours clashed?\n\n那么，要是色彩不搭怎么办？\n\n\n\n5.V-RECIP（体育用语中尤用来指热情高涨的比赛双方）交锋，交手，厮杀Sports journalists sometimes say that two individuals or teams who compete against each other clash, especially when a lot of feeling is involved. \n\nLewis has recently recovered his fitness and will clash with Christie in the 4x100m relay...\n\n刘易斯近来恢复了状态，将在4×100米接力赛中和克里斯蒂一决雌雄。\n\n\nThe two sides will clash there only if Chelsea beat Sunderland in their quarter-final replay.\n\n只有切尔西队在四分之一决赛的重赛中击败桑德兰队，双方才会交锋。\n\n\nClash is also a noun.\n\nAustralia's rugby union team for the return clash with New Zealand is weakened by injury.\n\n将再次和新西兰队交手的澳大利亚业余英式橄榄球队由于球员受伤实力削弱了。\n\n\n\n\n6.VERB（金属相互碰撞）发出当啷当啷声，发出撞击声When metal objects clash, they make a lot of noise by being hit together. \n\nThe golden bangles on her arms clashed and jingled.\n\n她手臂上的金手镯丁零当啷地响。\n\n\nClash is also a noun.\n\n...a noise like the clash of cymbals.\n\n类似钹打出的铿锵声\n\n\n\n
verify@\n1.VERB核实；查证；查清If you verify something, you check that it is true by careful examination or investigation. \n\nI verified the source from which I had that information...\n\n我核实了我所获消息的来源。\n\n\nA clerk simply verifies that the payment and invoice amount match.\n\n职员只是核实付款和发票上的数额是否一致。\n\n\n\nverification\n\nAll charges against her are dropped pending the verification of her story.\n\n在她的事情核实之前，所有针对她的指控都已撤回。\n\n\n...the agency's verification procedures.\n\n该机构的核查程序\n\n\n\n2.VERB证实；证明If you verify something, you state or confirm that it is true. \n\nThe government has not verified any of those reports...\n\n政府还没有证实那些报告中的任何一个。\n\n\nI can verify that it takes about thirty seconds.\n\n我能证明，这大约要用30秒的时间。\n\n\n
genetic@\n1.ADJ遗传的；基因的You use genetic to describe something that is concerned with genetics or with genes.\n\nCystic fibrosis is the most common fatal genetic disease in the United States.\n\n囊性纤维化是美国最常见的致命遗传疾病。\n\n\n\ngenetically\n\nSome people are genetically predisposed to diabetes.\n\n有些人由于遗传的原因容易患糖尿病。\n\n\n...fetuses that are genetically abnormal.\n\n基因异常的胎儿\n\n\n
makeup@\n1.N-UNCOUNT化妆品Make-up consists of things such as lipstick, eye shadow, and powder which some women put on their faces to make themselves look more attractive or which actors use to change or improve their appearance.\n\nNormally she wore little make-up...\n\n她一般不怎么化妆。\n\n\nShe checked her makeup one last time, and then walked out with a spring in her step.\n\n她最后检查了一下妆容，然后步履轻盈地走了出去。\n\n\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT天性；性格Some-one's make-up is their nature and the various qualities in their character. \n\nThere was some fatal flaw in his makeup, and as time went on he lapsed into long silences or became off-hand.\n\n他的性格有致命的缺陷，随着时间的推移，他陷入了久久的沉默，或者变得漠然。\n\n\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT组成成分；构成方式The make-up of something consists of its different parts and the way these parts are arranged. \n\nThe ideological make-up of the unions is now radically different from what it had been.\n\n协会的思想观念与过去截然不同。\n\n\n...the chemical make-up of the oceans and atmosphere.\n\n海洋与大气的化学构造\n\n\n
kidnap@\nin AM, also use 美国英语亦用 kidnaped\n\n\n1.VERB劫持；绑架To kidnap someone is to take them away illegally and by force, and usually to hold them prisoner in order to demand something from their family, employer, or government. \n\nPolice in Brazil uncovered a plot to kidnap him...\n\n巴西警方发现了有人要绑架他的阴谋。\n\n\nThey were intelligent and educated, yet they chose to kidnap and kill...\n\n他们聪明且有教养，却选择去绑架和杀人。\n\n\nThe kidnapped man was said to have been seized by five people.\n\n据说那名男子是被5个人绑架的。\n\n\n\nkidnapper\n\nHis kidnappers have threatened that they will kill him unless three militants are released from prison.\n\n绑架他的绑匪威胁说，如果不释放3名激进分子他们就杀了他。\n\n\n\nkidnapping\n\nTwo youngsters have been arrested and charged with kidnapping.\n\n已有两名年轻人被逮捕并被控绑架。\n\n\n\n2.N-VAR绑架罪Kidnap or a kidnap is the crime of taking someone away by force.\n\nStewart denies attempted murder and kidnap...\n\n斯图尔特否认对其谋杀未遂和绑架的指控。\n\n\nHe was charged with the kidnap of a 25 year-old woman.\n\n他被指控绑架一名25岁的女子。\n\n\n
whereabouts@n. 下落, 所在之处\n=whereabout\nconj. 靠近何处\nPronounced /'weərəbaʊts/ for meaning 1, and /ˌweərə'baʊts/ for meanings 2 and 3. 义项1读作 /'weərəbaʊts/，义项2和3读作 /ˌweərə'baʊts/。\n\n\n1.N-SING-COLL（人或物的）行踪，下落，所在之处If you refer to the whereabouts of a particular person or thing, you mean the place where that person or thing may be found. \n\nThe police are anxious to hear from anyone who may know the whereabouts of the firearms...\n\n警方急盼任何可能知道这批武器下落的人提供线索。\n\n\nOnce he knew his father's name, finding his whereabouts proved surprisingly easy.\n\n一旦他知道了父亲的名字，查找他父亲的下落就变得出奇地容易。\n\n\n\n2.QUEST（用于疑问句）具体在哪里You use whereabouts in questions when you are asking precisely where something is.\n\nWhereabouts in Liverpool are you from?...\n\n你从利物浦什么地方来的？\n\n\nWhereabouts are you living?...\n\n你的详细住址是哪里？\n\n\n'I actually live near Chester.' — 'Whereabouts?'\n\n“我实际上住在切斯特附近。”——“具体在哪里？”\n\n\n\n3.CONJ-SUBORD（尤用于某些动词和形容词后，引导表示具体处所的从句）具体在哪里You use whereabouts after certain words, especially verbs and adjectives, to introduce a clause in which you mention precisely where something is situated or happens.\n\nI live in a village near to Germaine Greer and know whereabouts she lives.\n\n我住在杰曼·格里尔家附近的村子里，知道她具体住在哪儿。\n\n\n
gory@adj. 血淋淋的,满是血的,血污的1.ADJ-GRADED血淋淋的；令人毛骨悚然的；骇人听闻的Gory situations involve people being injured or dying in a horrible way. \n\n...the gory details of Mayan human sacrifices.\n\n玛雅人使用活人祭祀的骇人听闻的细节\n\n\n...the gory death scenes.\n\n令人不寒而栗的死亡现场\n\n
anonymous@\n1.ADJ匿名的；无名的；不知名的If you remain anonymous when you do something, you do not let people know that you were the person who did it.\n\nYou can remain anonymous if you wish...\n\n你愿意的话可以不透露姓名。\n\n\nAn anonymous benefactor stepped in to provide the prize money.\n\n一个匿名捐助者施以援手提供了奖金。\n\n\n...anonymous phone calls.\n\n匿名电话\n\n\n\nanonymity\n\nBoth mother and daughter, who have requested anonymity, are doing fine.\n\n这对不愿意透露姓名的母女俩目前情况良好。\n\n\n\nanonymously\n\nThe latest photographs were sent anonymously to the magazine's Paris headquarters.\n\n最新的照片以匿名方式寄到了该杂志的巴黎总部。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ不记名的；不具名的Something that is anonymous does not reveal who you are. \n\nOf course, that would have to be by anonymous vote.\n\n当然，那必须通过不记名投票的方式。\n\n\n\nanonymity\n\nHe claims many more people would support him in the anonymity of a voting booth.\n\n他声称会有更多的人通过投票站匿名投票的方式来支持他。\n\n\n\n3.ADJ-GRADED无特色的；平淡无奇的If you describe a place as anonymous, you dislike it because it has no unusual or interesting features and seems unwelcoming. \n\n...the most anonymous part of north-west Washington...\n\n华盛顿西北部最无特色的地区\n\n\nIt's nice to stay in a home rather than in an anonymous holiday villa.\n\n呆在家里比呆在单调乏味的度假别墅里要惬意得多。\n\n\n\nanonymity\n\n...the anonymity of the rented room.\n\n租住的房间的单调无趣\n\n\n
commemorate@\n1.VERB纪念To commemorate an important event or person means to remember them by means of a special action, ceremony, or specially created object. \n\nOne room contained a gallery of paintings commemorating great moments in baseball history...\n\n有一个房间里陈列着很多纪念棒球史上伟大时刻的画作。\n\n\nThe 200th anniversary of Mozart's death is being commemorated around the world with concerts featuring his work.\n\n世界各地将举办以莫扎特的作品为主题的音乐会，以纪念他逝世200周年。\n\n\n\ncommemoration\n\n...the 50th Anniversary Commemoration of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising.\n\n华沙犹太区起义50周年纪念\n\n\n...a service of commemoration.\n\n纪念仪式\n\n\n...a march in commemoration of Malcolm X.\n\n纪念马尔科姆·艾克斯的游行\n\n\n
centaur@n. [希神]人首马身的怪物1.N-COUNT（古希腊神话中的）半人半马的怪物，马人In classical mythology, a centaur is a creature with the head, arms, and body of a man, and the body and legs of a horse.
Minotaur@n. 人身牛头怪物\n2. 弥诺陶洛斯\n\n\n3. 米诺陶\n\n
quantum@\n1.ADJ量子的In physics, quantum theory and quantum mechanics are concerned with the behaviour of atomic particles. \n\nBoth quantum mechanics and chaos theory suggest a world constantly in flux.\n\n量子力学和混沌理论都表明世界永远处于不断变化中。\n\n\n\n2.ADJ巨变；猛增；飞跃；突飞猛进A quantum leap or quantum jump in something is a very great and sudden increase in its size, amount, or quality. \n\nThe vaccine represents a quantum leap in healthcare...\n\n这种疫苗的问世是医疗保健领域的重大突破。\n\n\nThe scale of migration took a quantum leap in the early 1970s.\n\n20世纪70年代初，移民的规模骤然扩大。\n\n\n
causal@adj. 原因的,关于因果的1.ADJ有因果关系的；存在因果联系的If there is a causal relationship between two things, one thing is responsible for causing the other thing. \n\nRawlins stresses that it is impossible to prove a causal link between the drug and the deaths...\n\n罗林斯强调无法证明这种药物和多起死亡事件之间存在因果关系。\n\n\nHe would dearly love to show a causal relationship between culture and imperialism, but cannot.\n\n他倒是十分想揭示文化与帝国主义之间的因果联系，可是却无能为力。\n\n
inconsistency@\n1.N-UNCOUNT（行为的）反复无常，易变If you refer to someone's inconsistency, you are criticizing them for not behaving in the same way every time a similar situation occurs. \n\nHis worst fault was his inconsistency...\n\n他最大的缺点就是反复无常。\n\n\nThe report accuses the judicial system of inconsistency and partiality.\n\n报告指责司法系统执法前后不一且有失公正。\n\n\n\n2.N-VAR前后矛盾；不一致If there are inconsistencies in two statements, one cannot be true if the other is true.\n\nWe were asked to investigate the alleged inconsistencies in his evidence.\n\n我们被要求对他证词中的前后矛盾之处进行调查。\n\n\n...the complete inconsistency of his argument.\n\n他的论点全然自相矛盾\n\n\n
apron@\n1.N-COUNT围裙；工作裙An apron is a piece of clothing that you put on over the front of your normal clothes and tie round your waist, especially when you are cooking, in order to prevent your clothes from getting dirty.\n\nIf you say that someone is tied to another person's apron strings, you mean that they are controlled or influenced too much by the other person.（深受）&hellip；的影响，&hellip；的控制\n\nIf you try to keep him under control and tethered to your apron strings there will almost certainly be a row.\n\n如果你试图控制他，让他什么都听你的，十有八九你们会吵架。\n\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT停机坪At an airport, the apron is the area of hard ground where aircraft are parked. \n
chore@n. 零工,琐事\n1.N-COUNT杂务；琐事A chore is a task that you must do but that you find unpleasant or boring. \n\nShe sees exercise primarily as an unavoidable chore...\n\n她基本上把锻炼看做是不得不做的琐事。\n\n\nMaking pasta by hand with a rolling pin can be a real chore.\n\n用擀面杖擀意大利面会是个非常枯燥乏味的活儿。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT家务活；家庭琐事Chores are tasks such as cleaning, washing, and ironing that have to be done regularly at home. \n\nMy husband and I both go out to work so we share the household chores.\n\n我和丈夫都出去工作，所以我们家务活分摊。\n\n\n
muzzle@\n1.N-COUNT（动物的）口鼻部The muzzle of an animal such as a dog is its nose and mouth.\n\nThe mongrel presented his muzzle for scratching.\n\n那只杂种狗张嘴要伤人。\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT（罩住狗的口鼻的）嘴套，口套A muzzle is an object that is put over a dog's nose and mouth so that it cannot bite people or make a noise.\n\n...dogs like pit bulls which have to wear a muzzle.\n\n像比特犬这种得戴嘴套的狗\n\n\n\n3.VERB给（狗等） 戴上嘴套If you muzzle a dog or other animal, you put a muzzle over its nose and mouth. \n\nHe was convicted of failing to muzzle a pit bull.\n\n他因没能给比特犬戴嘴套而被判有罪。\n\n\n\n4.VERB使缄默；迫使…保持沉默If you say that someone is muzzled, you are complaining that they are prevented from expressing their views freely. \n\nHe complained of being muzzled by the chairman...\n\n他抱怨主席不让他发言。\n\n\nShe was opposed to new laws to muzzle the press.\n\n她反对钳制新闻界言论的新法律。\n\n\n\n5.N-COUNT枪口；炮口The muzzle of a gun is the end where the bullets come out when it is fired.\n
sergeant@\n1.N-COUNT; N-TITLE; N-VOC（陆军、海军陆战队或空军的）中士A sergeant is a non-commissioned officer of middle rank in the army, marines, or air force.\n\nA sergeant with a detail of four men came into view.\n\n一名中士和一个四人小分队出现在眼前。\n\n\n...Sergeant Black.\n\n布莱克中士\n\n\n\n2.N-COUNT; N-TITLE; N-VOC（英国警察中的）巡佐；（美国警察中的）警佐，警司In the British police force, a sergeant is an officer with the next to lowest rank. In American police forces, a sergeant is an officer with the rank immediately below a captain.\n\n... the unit headed by Sergeant Bell.\n\n由贝尔巡佐带领的分队。\n\n\n
bloodbath@1.N-COUNT大屠杀；血洗If you describe an event as a bloodbath, you are emphasizing that a lot of people were killed very violently. \n\nThe war degenerated into a bloodbath of tribal killings.\n\n这场战争演变为一场部落之间的大屠杀。\n\n
stench@1.N-COUNT臭味；恶臭A stench is a strong and very unpleasant smell. \n\nThe stench of burning rubber was overpowering.\n\n烧焦的橡胶臭气熏天。\n\n
