raid@    1.VERBSee also:air raid；突袭；突击When soldiers raid a place, they make a sudden armed attack against it, with the aim of causing damage rather than occupying any of the enemy's land. \n\n        The guerrillas raided banks and destroyed a police barracks and an electricity substation.\n\n        游击队突袭了银行，摧毁了一处警察驻地和一个变电站。\n\n        Raid is also a noun.\n\n            The rebels attempted a surprise raid on a military camp...\n\n            叛军试图突袭一处军营。\n\n            Its planes are carrying out heavy bombing raids against the guerrillas.\n\n            其飞机正在对游击队实施密集轰炸。\n    2.VERB（警察）突击搜捕，搜查If the police raid a building, they enter it suddenly and by force in order to look for dangerous criminals or for evidence of something illegal, such as drugs or weapons. \n\n        Fraud squad officers raided the firm's offices.\n\n        反欺诈小组的工作人员突击搜查了这家公司的办公室。\n\n        Raid is also a noun.\n\n            They were arrested early this morning after a raid on a house by thirty armed police.\n\n            今天早上30名武装警察突击搜查一所房子后将他们逮捕。\n    3.VERB（入室）抢劫；打劫If someone raids a building or place, they enter it by force in order to steal something. \n\n        A 19-year-old man has been found guilty of raiding a bank.\n\n        一个19岁的男子被判抢劫银行罪。\n\n        Raid is also a noun.\n\n            ...an armed raid on a small Post Office...\n\n            对一家小邮局实施的武装抢劫\n\n            He carried out a series of bank raids.\n\n            他实施了一系列的银行抢劫。\n    4.VERB扫荡（冰箱、食品柜等处）的食物If you raid the fridge or the larder, you take food from it to eat instead of a meal or in between meals. \n\n        She made her way to the kitchen to raid the fridge.\n\n        她走向厨房去扫荡冰箱。
vulture@n. 秃鹰, 兀鹰    1.N-COUNT兀鹫；秃鹫A vulture is a large bird which lives in hot countries and eats the flesh of dead animals.\n    2.N-COUNT趁火打劫的人；乘人之危的人If you describe a person as a vulture, you disapprove of them because you think they are trying to gain from another person's troubles. \n\n        With no buyer in sight for the company as a whole, the vultures started to circle.\n\n        由于公司目前找不到买主，趁火打劫者开始围攻。
defuse@vt. 拆除(炸弹等)的雷管, 消除危险, 缓和    1.VERB化解，缓和，平息（危险或紧张局势）If you defuse a dangerous or tense situation, you calm it. \n\n        The organization helped defuse potentially violent situations...\n\n        该组织帮忙化解了可能出现的暴力局面。\n\n        Officials will hold four days of talks aimed at defusing tensions over trade.\n\n        官员们将举行为期 4 天旨在消除贸易紧张关系的会谈。\n    2.VERB拆除（炸弹等）的引信If someone defuses a bomb, they remove the fuse so that it cannot explode. \n\n        Police have defused a bomb found in a building in London.\n\n        警方已经拆除了一枚在伦敦一所大楼内发现的炸弹的引信。
diabolical@adj. 恶魔的    1.ADJ-GRADED糟透的；极其恶劣的；非常讨厌的If you describe something as diabolical, you are emphasizing that it is very bad, extreme, or unpleasant. \n\n        It was a diabolical error, a schoolboy error...\n\n        那是个十分低级的错误，一个小学生才会犯的错误。\n\n        The pain was diabolical.\n\n        疼痛异常剧烈。\n\n    diabolically\n\n        ...diabolically difficult clues.\n\n        极端难解的线索\n    2.ADJ邪恶的；罪恶的Diabolical is used to emphasize how evil something is. \n\n        ...sins committed in a spirit of diabolical enjoyment...\n\n        为了罪恶的享乐而犯下的罪孽\n\n        One speaker today called the plan diabolical and sinister.\n\n        今天一名发言人称该计划阴险恶毒。
downhill@    1.ADV向山下；在山下If something or someone is moving downhill or is downhill, they are moving down a slope or are located towards the bottom of a hill. \n\n        He headed downhill towards the river...\n\n        他朝山下的河流走去。\n\n        The lake itself lies only a few hundred yards off to your right and slightly downhill...\n\n        湖本身就在你右侧仅几百码的地方，稍微向山下走几步。\n\n        It was a clearing just downhill from a peak of eight thousand feet.\n\n        那片空地就在8，000英尺高的山峰下。\n\n        Downhill is also an adjective.\n\n            Bessie was on the downhill path.\n\n            贝茜在下山的小路上。\n\n            ...downhill ski runs...\n\n            下坡滑雪道\n\n            We began a steady downhill run.\n\n            我们开始了一场匀速的下山赛跑。\n    2.ADV走下坡路地；恶化地；每况愈下If you say that something is going downhill, you mean that it is becoming worse or less successful. \n\n        Since I started to work longer hours things have gone steadily downhill...\n\n        自从我开始加班以来，事情日趋恶化。\n\n        For the movie business, it was all downhill from there...\n\n        电影业从那时就开始完全走下坡路了。\n\n        His career was heading downhill fast.\n\n        他的事业迅速下滑。\n    3.ADJ（与前段时间相比）容易的If you say that a task or situation is downhill after a particular stage or time, you mean that it is easy to deal with after that stage or time. \n\n        Well, I guess it's all downhill from here.\n\n        嗯，我猜从此以后就容易了。
culprit@n. 犯人,罪犯,刑事被告,肇事者,罪魁祸首    1.N-COUNT罪犯；犯错的人When you are talking about a crime or something wrong that has been done, you can refer to the person who did it as the culprit . \n\n        All the men were being deported even though the real culprits in the fight have not been identified.\n\n        尽管真凶尚未查出，所有参与斗殴的男子均被驱逐出境。\n    2.N-COUNT引起问题（或不利情势）的事物When you are talking about a problem or bad situation, you can refer to its cause as the culprit .\n\n        About 10% of Japanese teenagers are overweight. Nutritionists say the main culprit is increasing reliance on Western fast food.\n\n        大约10%的日本青少年超重。营养学家指出主要原因是对西式快餐越来越依赖。
unfetter@v. 解开脚链,释放,使自由    1.ADJ自由的；不受拘束的If you describe something as unfettered, you mean that it is not controlled or limited by anyone or anything. \n\n        ...unfettered free trade...\n\n        不受限制的自由贸易\n\n        Unfettered by the bounds of reality, my imagination flourished.\n\n        跳出现实的束缚，我的想象力天马行空。\n\n        ...city slums, where drug traffickers reign virtually unfettered.\n\n        毒贩横行无忌的城市贫民窟
insurgent@adj. 叛乱的, 起事的\nn. 叛乱分子，反对派    1.N-COUNT起义者；暴动者；叛乱者Insurgents are people who are fighting against the government or army of their own country. \n\n        By early yesterday, the insurgents had taken control of the country's main military air base.\n\n        到昨天清晨为止，叛乱者已经控制了该国的主要空军基地。
footage@    1.N-UNCOUNT电影片段；镜头Footage of a particular event is a film of it or the part of a film which shows this event.\n\n        They are planning to show exclusive footage from this summer's festivals.\n\n        他们准备播放今年夏天节日庆典的独家镜头。
genome@n. [生]基因组, 染色体组1.N-COUNT基因组；染色体组In biology and genetics, a genome is the particular number and combination of certain chromosomes necessary to form the single nucleus of a living cell
tease out@    1.PHRASAL VERB套取，套出，巧妙获得（信息或答案）If you tease out information or a solution, you succeed in obtaining it even though this is difficult. \n\n        They try to tease out the answers without appearing to ask...\n\n        他们试图不动声色地套出答案。\n\n        There had to be an answer — he was sure he could tease it out if only he had time.\n\n        一定会有答案——他肯定，只要他有时间就一定能弄个清楚。
inference@    1.N-COUNT推断结果；结论An inference is a conclusion that you draw about something by using information that you already have about it.\n\n        There were two inferences to be drawn from her letter.\n\n        由她的信可以得出两个结论。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT推论；推理；推断Inference is the act of drawing conclusions about something on the basis of information that you already have.\n\n        It had an extremely tiny head and, by inference, a tiny brain.\n\n        它的头极小，由此推断其脑容量也非常小。
texture@    1.N-VAR（摸上去的）质地，质感，纹理The texture of something is the way that it feels when you touch it, for example how smooth or rough it is.\n\n        Aloe Vera is used in moisturisers to give them a wonderfully silky texture...\n\n        芦荟用于润肤霜中，使之具有美妙的丝般润滑感。\n\n        Her skin is pale, the texture of fine wax.\n\n        她肤色苍白，肤质细腻如蜡。\n    2.N-VAR（尤指食品、土壤的）结构，构造The texture of something, especially food or soil, is its structure, for example whether it is light with lots of holes, or very heavy and solid.\n\n        This cheese has an open, crumbly texture with a strong flavour...\n\n        这种奶酪多孔松脆，风味浓郁。\n\n        Earthworms consume large amounts of soil, and produce a rich humus, perfect in texture.\n\n        蚯蚓吃下大量土壤，排出肥力丰富、物理结构理想的腐殖质。\n    3.N-VAR（音乐、文学作品的）神韵，谐和统一（感）The texture of a piece of music or a work of literature is the impression that it makes on you as a result of the way that its different elements are combined. \n\n        The very texture of his prose bears the influence of his familiarity with drugs.\n\n        他独特的散文风韵显示出他常常在毒品的影响下进行创作的痕迹。
encounter@    1.VERB遇到，遭遇（问题、困难）If you encounter problems or difficulties, you experience them. \n\n        Every day of our lives we encounter stresses of one kind or another...\n\n        我们在每天的生活中会面临这样或那样的压力。\n\n        Environmental problems they found in Poland were among the worst they encountered.\n\n        他们在波兰发现的环境问题是他们遇到过的最严重的。\n    2.VERB偶遇；邂逅If you encounter someone, you meet them, usually unexpectedly. \n\n        Did you encounter anyone in the building?...\n\n        你在大楼里遇到谁了么？\n\n        Renata wrote him that she had encountered her long-estranged father.\n\n        雷娜塔写信告诉他说她碰到了分离多年的父亲。\n    3.N-COUNT偶遇；邂逅；（重要的）相逢An encounter with someone is a meeting with them, particularly one that is unexpected or significant. \n\n        The author tells of a remarkable encounter with a group of South Vietnamese soldiers.\n\n        作者讲述了和一群南越士兵的奇遇。\n    4.N-COUNT特殊经历；特殊体验An encounter is a particular type of experience. \n\n        ...a sexual encounter.\n\n        性体验\n\n        ...his first serious encounter with alcohol.\n\n        他第一次正儿八经喝酒的经历
confront@vt. 面临, 对抗, 遭遇    1.VERB（问题、任务或困难）降临，使面临If you are confronted with a problem, task, or difficulty, you have to deal with it. \n\n        She was confronted with severe money problems...\n\n        她面临严峻的资金问题。\n\n        Ministers underestimated the magnitude of the task confronting them.\n\n        部长们低估了他们所面临的任务的艰巨性。\n    2.VERB勇敢地面对；正视If you confront a difficult situation or issue, you accept the fact that it exists and try to deal with it. \n\n        We are learning how to confront death...\n\n        我们正在学习如何直面死亡。\n\n        NATO countries have been forced to confront fundamental moral questions.\n\n        北约国家被迫正视基本的道德问题。\n    3.VERB使面对（有威胁性或困难的事）If you are confronted by something that you find threatening or difficult to deal with, it is there in front of you. \n\n        I was confronted with an array of knobs, levers, and switches.\n\n        我面对的是一大堆旋钮、控制杆和开关。\n    4.VERB与…对峙；与…对抗If you confront someone, you stand or sit in front of them, especially when you are going to fight, argue, or compete with them. \n\n        She pushed her way through the mob and confronted him face to face...\n\n        她挤过骚动的人群，与他当面对峙。\n\n        They don't hesitate to open fire when confronted by police...\n\n        他们遭遇警察时毫不犹豫地开火。\n\n        The candidates confronted each other during a televised debate.\n\n        候选人在电视辩论中当面交锋。\n    5.VERB与…当面对证（或对质）If you confront someone with something, you present facts or evidence to them in order to accuse them of something. \n\n        She had decided to confront Kathryn with what she had learnt...\n\n        她决定拿自己了解的事实与凯瑟琳当面对证。\n\n        I could not bring myself to confront him about it...\n\n        我不忍心就这事和他对质。\n\n        His confronting me forced me to search for the answers.\n\n        他对我的当面质询迫使我思索如何作答。
heliport@1.N-COUNT直升机机场；直升机航站A heliport is an airport for helicopters.
creepy@adj. (使人)毛骨悚然的,令人不寒而栗的
replenish@vt. 补充,再装满\nvi. 补充    1.VERB补充；重新装满If you replenish something, you make it full or complete again. \n\n        Three hundred thousand tons of cereals are needed to replenish stocks...\n\n        需要30万吨谷类补充库存。\n\n        The insurance fund will need to be replenished.\n\n        保险基金将需要进行补充。
sturdy@adj. 强健的, 健全的    1.ADJ-GRADED坚固的；结实的；强壮的Someone or something that is sturdy looks strong and is unlikely to be easily injured or damaged.\n\n        She was a short, sturdy woman in her early sixties...\n\n        她是个 60 岁出头、身材矮小结实的女人。\n\n        The camera was mounted on a sturdy tripod.\n\n        相机固定在一个坚固的三脚架上。\n\n    sturdily\n\n        It was a good table too, sturdily constructed of elm.\n\n        这也是张很不错的桌子，榆木的，很结实。
towel@in AM, use 美国英语用 toweling, toweled\n1.N-COUNT毛巾A towel is a piece of thick soft cloth that you use to dry yourself.\n\n    ...a bath towel.\n\n    浴巾\n\n2.VERB用毛巾擦（干）If you towel something or towel it dry, you dry it with a towel. \n\n    James came out of his bedroom, toweling his wet hair...\n\n    詹姆斯从卧室出来，用毛巾擦着他湿漉漉的头发。\n\n    I towelled myself dry...\n\n    我用毛巾把身体擦干。\n\n    He stepped out of the shower and began towelling himself down.\n\n    他走出淋浴间，开始用毛巾把身子擦干。\n\n3.PHRASE承认失败；认输If you throw in the towel, you stop trying to do something because you realize that you cannot succeed. \n\n    It seemed as if the police had thrown in the towel and were abandoning the investigation.\n\n    警方似乎已经认输，打算放弃调查。
judicious@    1.ADJ-GRADED明智的；有见地的；审慎的If you describe an action or decision as judicious, you approve of it because you think that it shows good judgment and sense. \n\n        The President authorizes the judicious use of military force to protect our citizens.\n\n        总统授权可以明智而审慎地动用军队保护我们的公民。\n\n    judiciously\n\n        Modern fertilisers should be used judiciously.\n\n        使用现代化肥应该非常谨慎。
tense@1.ADJ-GRADED（局势、时期）令人紧张的，让人焦虑的A tense situation or period of time is one that makes people anxious, because they do not know what is going to happen next.\n\n    This gesture of goodwill did little to improve the tense atmosphere at the talks...\n\n    这一友好姿态基本上没有改善会谈的紧张气氛。\n\n    After three very tense weeks he phoned again...\n\n    过了紧张不安的 3 个星期，他又一次打来电话。\n\n    There was a tense silence.\n\n    有一阵令人局促不安的沉默。\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED紧张的；焦虑的；无法放松的If you are tense, you are anxious and nervous and cannot relax.\n\n    Dart, who had at first been very tense, at last relaxed.\n\n    起初，达特非常紧张，最后终于放松了下来。\n\ntensely\n\n    She waited tensely for the next bulletin...\n\n    她焦虑地等候着下一期公告。\n\n    'Tony, I can explain everything,' she said tensely.\n\n    “托尼，这一切我都可以解释，”她紧张地说。\n\ntenseness\n\n    McKay walked slowly toward this screen, feeling a growing tenseness.\n\n    麦凯缓缓地朝这个屏幕走来，每走一步心情都更加紧张。\n\n3.ADJ-GRADED（肌肉）紧张的，绷紧的If your body is tense, your muscles are tight and not relaxed.\n\n    She lay, eyes shut, body tense...\n\n    她躺着，双目紧闭，全身绷直。\n\n    A bath can relax tense muscles.\n\n    洗个澡可以放松紧张的肌肉。\n\ntenseness\n\n    If you feel a tenseness around the eyes, relax your muscles.\n\n    你要是觉得两眼周围紧绷，就放松一下肌肉。\n\n4.V-ERG（使）（肌肉）紧张，绷紧If your muscles tense, if you tense, or if you tense your muscles, your muscles become tight and stiff, often because you are anxious or frightened. \n\n    Newman's stomach muscles tensed...\n\n    纽曼的腹肌绷紧了。\n\n    He tensed as the big West Indian gripped his shoulder...\n\n    那个大块头西印度群岛土著人抓住他的肩膀时，他浑身紧张起来。\n\n    Jane tensed her muscles to stop them from shaking.\n\n    简把肌肉绷紧，不让它们颤抖。\n\n    Tense up means the same as tense .tense up 同 tense\n\n        When we are under stress our bodies tend to tense up...\n\n        人一紧张，身体就会变僵硬。\n\n        I tried not to tense up, or become obviously wary...\n\n        我尽量不让自己紧张，或者表现得非常警觉。\n\n        Tense up the muscles in both of your legs.\n\n        把两腿的肌肉绷紧。\n\n5.N-COUNT（动词的）时，时态The tense of a verb group is its form, which usually shows whether you are referring to past, present, or future time.\n\n    It was as though Corinne was already dead: they were speaking of her in the past tense.\n\n    科琳娜好像已经去世了：他们谈论她时用的是过去时。
toxic@adj. 有毒的\nn. 有毒物质    1.ADJ-GRADED有毒的；毒性的；引起中毒的A toxic substance is poisonous.\n\n        ...the cost of cleaning up toxic waste...\n\n        清除有毒废弃物的成本\n\n        These products are not toxic to humans.\n\n        这些产品对人类没有毒性。\n\n    toxicity\n\n        ...data on the toxicity of chemicals.\n\n        有关化学品毒性的数据
breach@    1.VERB违反，破坏（条约、法律或承诺）If you breach an agreement, a law, or a promise, you break it. \n\n        The newspaper breached the code of conduct on privacy...\n\n        该报违反了保护隐私的行为准则。\n\n        The film breached the criminal libel laws.\n\n        这部电影触犯了刑事诽谤法。\n    2.N-VAR（对条约、法律或承诺的）违反，破坏A breach of an agreement, a law, or a promise is an act of breaking it.\n\n        The congressman was accused of a breach of secrecy rules.\n\n        这位议员被控违反了保密规定。\n\n        ...a $1 billion breach of contract suit.\n\n        一起违约金达10亿美元的合同违约诉讼案\n    3.N-COUNT（关系的）裂痕，破裂A breach in a relationship is a serious disagreement which often results in the relationship ending. \n\n        Their actions threatened a serious breach in relations between the two countries.\n\n        他们的行动使两国关系面临严重恶化的危险。\n\n        ...the breach between Tito and Stalin.\n\n        铁托和斯大林之间的不和\n    4.VERB突破；攻破；给…造成缺口If someone or something breaches a barrier, they make an opening in it, usually leaving it weakened or destroyed. \n\n        The limestone is sufficiently fissured for tree roots to have breached the roof of the cave...\n\n        石灰岩上有许多缝隙，故而树根能从岩洞顶部长出来。\n\n        Fire may have breached the cargo tanks and set the oil ablaze.\n\n        大火当时有可能把货船上的油罐烧漏了，从而引燃原油。\n    5.VERB突破，攻破（防卫）If you breach someone's security or their defences, you manage to get through and attack an area that is heavily guarded and protected. \n\n        The bomber had breached security by hurling his dynamite from a roof overlooking the building.\n\n        这名爆炸手从一个俯瞰这座大楼的楼顶上投下炸药，破坏了安保系统。\n\n        Breach is also a noun.\n\n            ...widespread breaches of security at Ministry of Defence bases.\n\n            国防部各基地普遍存在的安全系统遭到攻破的现象\n    6.PHRASE临时代替；临时顶替If you step into the breach, you do a job or task which someone else was supposed to do or has done in the past, because they are suddenly unable to do it. \n\n        I was persuaded to step into the breach temporarily when they became too ill to continue.\n\n        在他们病得很重无法坚持的情况下，我被劝服去临时顶替他们。
detain@vt. 扣留,拘押,耽搁    1.VERB拘留；扣押When people such as the police detain someone, they keep them in a place under their control. \n\n        The act allows police to detain a suspect for up to 48 hours...\n\n        该法令允许警方将嫌疑犯扣押最多48小时。\n\n        He was arrested and detained for questioning.\n\n        他遭到逮捕、拘留以接受问讯。\n    2.VERB阻留；耽搁To detain someone means to delay them, for example by talking to them. \n\n        Thank you. We won't detain you any further.\n\n        非常感谢。我们就不再耽搁您的时间了。
intense@    1.ADJ-GRADED强烈的；剧烈的；极度的Intense is used to describe something that is very great or extreme in strength or degree.\n\n        He was sweating from the intense heat... \n\n        高温酷热让他大汗淋漓。\n\n        Suddenly the room filled with intense light...\n\n        突然，刺眼的强光照亮了整个房间。\n\n        Stevens's murder was the result of a deep-seated and intense hatred...\n\n        史蒂文斯遭谋杀源于深仇宿怨。\n\n    intensely\n\n        The fast-food business is intensely competitive.\n\n        快餐业竞争非常激烈。\n\n    intensity\n\n        The attack was anticipated but its intensity came as a shock.\n\n        攻击是预料之中的，但攻势之猛烈令人震惊。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED认真的；集中的；紧张的If you describe an activity as intense, you mean that it is very serious and concentrated, and often involves doing a great deal in a short time.\n\n        The battle for third place was intense...\n\n        第三名的争夺紧张激烈。\n\n        The military on both sides are involved in intense activity.\n\n        双方的武装力量都有密集动作。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED（目光）有穿透力的，洞悉一切的If you describe the way someone looks at you as intense, you mean that they look at you very directly and seem to know what you are thinking or feeling.\n\n        I felt so self-conscious under Luke's mother's intense gaze...\n\n        在卢克母亲审视的目光下，我感到极不自在。\n\n        He gazed at me with those intense blue eyes.\n\n        他用那双深邃的蓝眼睛凝视着我。\n\n    intensely\n\n        He sipped his drink, staring intensely at me.\n\n        他慢酌浅饮，仿佛洞悉一切地紧盯着我。\n    4.ADJ-GRADED热情的；热切的；激动的If you describe a person as intense, you mean that they appear to concentrate very hard on everything that they do, and they feel and show their emotions in a very extreme way.\n\n        I know he's an intense player, but he does enjoy what he's doing...\n\n        我知道他是个拼命三郎，但他确实喜欢自己所做的事。\n\n        She is taller than I imagined, more adult, more intense.\n\n        她比我想象的更高、更成熟、更热切。\n\n    intensity\n\n        His intensity and the ferocity of his feelings alarmed me.\n\n        他感情之激烈和狂暴都让我惊恐。
whatsoever@adv. (用于否定句中以加强语气)任何\npron.&amp;adj. 无论什么    1.ADV（用于名词词组后，强调否定陈述）丝毫，任何，无论什么You use whatsoever after a noun group in order to emphasize a negative statement. \n\n        My school did nothing whatsoever in the way of athletics...\n\n        我的学校在体育方面无所作为。\n\n        I don't think they'll have any idea how I'm feeling. None whatsoever...\n\n        我认为他们并不了解我的感受，一点儿都不了解。\n\n        There is absolutely no doubt whatsoever that this woman was a totally devoted and caring mother.\n\n        毫无疑问这位女士是一位无私的慈母。
exquisite@    1.ADJ-GRADED精美的；精致的Something that is exquisite is extremely beautiful or pleasant, especially in a delicate way.\n\n        The Indians brought in exquisite beadwork to sell...\n\n        印第安人带了精美的珠饰来卖。\n\n        Mr Zhang's photography is exquisite.\n\n        张先生的摄影作品非常精美。\n\n        ...her exquisite manners.\n\n        她优雅的举止\n\n    exquisitely\n\n        ...exquisitely crafted dolls' houses.\n\n        做工精致的娃娃屋\n\n        ...an exquisitely beautiful young woman.\n\n        宛若天仙的年轻女子\n    2.ADJ剧烈的；极度的Exquisite is used to emphasize that a feeling or quality is very great or intense. \n\n        The words issuing from her lips gave exquisite pleasure as they flowed over him...\n\n        听到从她嘴里说出来的话，他感到极大的快乐。\n\n        She peeled it with exquisite care.\n\n        她小心翼翼地削皮。
standstill@    1.N-SING停止；停顿；停滞If movement or activity comes to or is brought to a standstill, it stops completely. \n\n        Abruptly the group ahead of us came to a standstill...\n\n        我们前面的小组突然停了下来。\n\n        Production is more or less at a standstill.\n\n        生产几乎处于停顿状态。
manpower@n. 人力\nManpower\nn. 公司(财富500强公司之一, 总部所在地美国, 主要经营临时帮助)    1.N-UNCOUNT人力；劳动力Workers are sometimes referred to as manpower when they are being considered as a part of the process of producing goods or providing services.\n\n        ...the shortage of skilled manpower in the industry...\n\n        该行业熟练劳动力的短缺\n\n        These people do not have the equipment or the manpower to cut down the trees.\n\n        这些人没有设备或者人手砍伐这些树。
immobile@    1.ADJ-GRADED固定的；静止的Someone or something that is immobile is completely still. \n\n        Joe remained as immobile as if he had been carved out of rock.\n\n        乔一动不动，仿佛一尊石头雕像。\n\n    immobility\n\n        Hyde maintained the rigid immobility of his shoulders.\n\n        海德保持双肩一动不动。\n    2.ADJ瘫痪的；不能移动的Someone or something that is immobile is unable to move or unable to be moved. \n\n        A riding accident left him immobile.\n\n        一场骑马意外事故导致他瘫痪。\n\n        ...a very heavy or immobile object.\n\n        非常沉重或难以移动的物体\n\n    immobility\n\n        Again, the pain locked me into immobility.\n\n        我又一次痛得动弹不得。
infiltrate@    1.VERB渗透，潜入（地方、组织中等）If people infiltrate a place or organization, or infiltrate into it, they enter it secretly in order to spy on it or influence it. \n\n        Activists had infiltrated the student movement...\n\n        激进分子已经渗入到了学生运动中。\n\n        The street protests had been infiltrated by people bent on violence...\n\n        街头抗议的人群中已经渗入了一些倾向于暴力的人。\n\n        A reporter tried to infiltrate into the prison.\n\n        一名记者试图混入监狱。\n\n    infiltration\n\n        ...an inquiry into alleged infiltration by the far left group...\n\n        对所谓极左翼团体的渗入问题所作的调查\n\n        The security zone was set up to prevent guerrilla infiltrations.\n\n        设立了安全区以防止游击队员的渗入。\n    2.VERB使渗入；使渗透To infiltrate people into a place or organization means to get them into it secretly in order to spy on it or influence it. \n\n        Some countries have infiltrated their agents into the Republic.\n\n        一些国家已派间谍渗入了该共和国内部。
retrieve@    1.VERB取回；找回If you retrieve something, you get it back from the place where you left it. \n\n        He reached over and retrieved his jacket from the back seat...\n\n        他伸手从后座上取回了自己的夹克。\n\n        The men were trying to retrieve weapons left when the army abandoned the island.\n\n        士兵们正试图找回军队从该岛撤退时留下的武器。\n    2.VERB使重新回到，挽回（某种局面）If you manage to retrieve a situation, you succeed in bringing it back into a more acceptable state. \n\n        He is the one man who could retrieve that situation.\n\n        他是唯一能挽回局面的人。\n    3.VERB（计算机、大脑）检索，搜索（信息）To retrieve information from a computer or from your memory means to get it back. \n\n        Computers can instantly retrieve millions of information bits...\n\n        计算机可以立即检索到数百万条信息。\n\n        As the child gets older, so his or her strategies for storing and retrieving information improve.\n\n        随着孩子们长大，他们储存和检索信息的能力也会提高。
condense@    1.VERB压缩，精简（尤指文章或讲话）If you condense something, especially a piece of writing or speech, you make it shorter, usually by including only the most important parts. \n\n        We have learnt how to condense serious messages into short, self-contained sentences...\n\n        我们已经学会了如何把重要的信息压缩成简短独立的句子。\n\n        The English translation may have been condensed into a single more readable book.\n\n        英译本可能被压缩成了更具可读性的单行本。\n    2.V-ERG（使）冷凝；（使）凝结When a gas or vapour condenses, or is condensed, it changes into a liquid. \n\n        Water vapour condenses to form clouds...\n\n        水蒸气凝结形成云。\n\n        The compressed gas is cooled and condenses into a liquid...\n\n        压缩气体经冷却凝结成液态。\n\n        As the air rises it becomes colder and moisture condenses out of it.\n\n        随着空气上升，其温度降低，凝结出水分。
conspiracy@    1.N-VAR密谋；阴谋Conspiracy is the secret planning by a group of people to do something illegal. \n\n        Seven men, all from Bristol, admitted conspiracy to commit arson...\n\n        7个人都来自布里斯托尔，他们承认了合谋纵火。\n\n        He believes there probably was a conspiracy to kill President Kennedy in 1963.\n\n        他认为1963年肯尼迪总统遇刺身亡可能是一个阴谋。\n    2.N-COUNT阴谋A conspiracy is an agreement between a group of people which other people think is wrong or is likely to be harmful. \n\n        It's all part of a conspiracy to dispense with the town centre all together and move everything out to Meadowhall...\n\n        彻底抛开市中心而把所有东西都搬到梅多霍尔购物中心，这完全是一场阴谋的一部分。\n\n        There was no evidence to link the brigade to any conspiracy against Mr Bush.\n\n        没有证据表明这帮人对布什先生图谋不轨。\n    3.PHRASE（为了私利）保持缄默的密约If there is a conspiracy of silence about something, people who know about it have agreed that they will not talk publicly about it, although it would probably be a good thing if people in general knew about it.\n\n        Detectives have run into a conspiracy of silence in the tight-knit communities of the peninsula.\n\n        侦探们犯了难，半岛上各个群体抱成一团，达成了保持缄默的密约。
distress@    1.N-UNCOUNT悲伤；痛苦；忧虑Distress is a state of extreme sorrow, suffering, or pain.\n\n        Jealousy causes distress and painful emotions.\n\n        嫉妒会带来忧虑和痛苦。\n\n        Her mouth grew stiff with pain and distress.\n\n        疼痛和悲伤让她嘴巴发僵。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT危难；危急；危险Distress is the state of being in extreme danger and needing urgent help. \n\n        He expressed concern that the ship might be in distress.\n\n        他担心船可能会遇险。\n\n        The constable received a distress call, and saw two youths attacking his colleague.\n\n        这名警察收到了求救呼叫，看见两个年轻人正在殴打他的同事。\n    3.VERB使忧虑；使悲伤；使苦恼If someone or something distresses you, they cause you to be upset or worried. \n\n        The idea of Toni being in danger distresses him enormously.\n\n        想到托尼正处于危险中，他心急如焚。\n\n        I did not want to frighten or distress the horse.\n\n        我并不想吓到马或惹怒它。
thesis@    1.N-COUNT命题；论点A thesis is an idea or theory that is expressed as a statement and is discussed in a logical way.\n\n        This thesis does not stand up to close inspection.\n\n        这个命题经不起仔细推敲。\n\n        ...proponents of the thesis that computers can be programmed to do anything which a human mind does.\n\n        对电脑经过程序设计可完成人脑一切活动这一观点表示支持的人\n    2.N-COUNT论文；学位论文A thesis is a long piece of writing based on your own ideas and research that you do as part of a university degree, especially a higher degree such as a PhD.\n\n        He was awarded his PhD for a thesis on industrial robots.\n\n        他凭一篇研究工业机器人的论文获得博士学位。
tedium@n. 沉闷；枯燥；乏味；无聊
impromptu@adj. 即席的, 即兴的\nadv. 即兴的(地), 无准备的(地)    1.ADJ即兴的；事先无准备的An impromptu action is one that you do without planning or organizing it in advance. \n\n        This afternoon the Palestinians held an impromptu press conference...\n\n        今天下午巴勒斯坦方面临时召开了记者招待会。\n\n        The children put on an impromptu concert for the visitors.\n\n        孩子们为来访者即兴献上了一场音乐会。
peeping Tom@1.N-COUNT偷窥者，窥视狂（尤指偷看别人脱衣服的人）If you refer to someone as a Peeping Tom, you mean that they secretly watch other people, especially when those people are taking their clothes off.
closet@1.N-COUNT壁橱A closet is a piece of furniture with doors at the front and shelves inside, which is used for storing things. \n\nin BRIT, use 英国英语用 cupboard\n2.N-COUNT（尤指不带窗户的）小储藏间A closet is a very small room for storing things, especially one without windows. \n\n3.ADJ（信仰、习惯、情感）隐蔽的，不公开的Closet is used to describe a person who has beliefs, habits, or feelings which they keep secret, often because they are embarrassed about them. Closet is also used of their beliefs, habits, or feelings. \n\n    He is a closet Fascist.\n\n    他是个秘密的法西斯分子。\n\n    ...closet misogyny.\n\n    内心对女性的仇视\n\n4.PHRASE公开同性恋身份；出柜If someone comes out of the closet, they tell people that they are homosexual after having kept this a secret. \n\n5.PHRASE公开（或谈论）以前保密的事；（问题）公开If someone comes out of the closet, they reveal or discuss something which they have previously kept secret. You can also say that an issue comes out of the closet when it starts to be publicly discussed. 
shove@    1.VERB猛推；乱挤；推撞If you shove someone or something, you push them with a quick, violent movement. \n\n        He shoved her out of the way... \n\n        他一把将她推开。\n\n        He was then shoved face down on the pavement...\n\n        接着他被一把推倒，脸朝下趴在了人行道上。\n\n        He's the one who shoved me...\n\n        他就是那个推撞我的人。\n\n        Shove is also a noun.\n\n            She gave Gracie a shove towards the house.\n\n            她猛地将格蕾西朝房子那边推了一把。\n    2.VERB乱放；乱塞；随便放；胡乱丢If you shove something somewhere, you push it there quickly and carelessly. \n\n        We shoved a copy of the newsletter beneath their door...\n\n        我们往他们门下塞了一份时事通讯。\n\n        He shoved a cloth in my hand.\n\n        他往我手中塞了块布。\n    3.PHRASE情况不妙时；别无选择时；形势十分糟糕时If you talk about what you think will happen if push comes to shove, you are talking about what you think will happen if a situation becomes very bad or difficult. \n\n        If push comes to shove, if you should lose your case in the court, what will you do?...\n\n        如果情况不妙，法庭上败诉，你会怎么办？\n\n        When push comes to shove, you are on your own.\n\n        如果形势糟糕，你就只能靠自己了。
doomed@adj. 命中注定的\n动词doom的过去式和过去分词    1.ADJ注定的；命定的If something is doomed to happen, or if you are doomed to a particular state, something unpleasant is certain to happen, and you can do nothing to prevent it. \n\n        Their plans seemed doomed to failure...\n\n        他们的计划好像注定要失败。\n\n        He knew that if he lived, he would be doomed to spend the war as a prisoner.\n\n        他知道如果他活下来，他将注定以战俘的身份度过战争。\n    2.ADJ注定要失败（或毁灭）的Someone or something that is doomed is certain to fail or be destroyed.\n\n        Fireman battled through the smoke in a doomed attempt to rescue the children...\n\n        消防队员奋力穿过烟雾企图去救孩子们，而这注定是要失败的。\n\n        I used to pour time and energy into projects that were doomed from the start.\n\n        我过去常常将大量时间和精力投入到从开始就注定要失败的计划中。
gunner@n. 炮手, 枪手1.N-COUNT炮手；炮兵A gunner is an ordinary soldier in an artillery regiment.
cruiser@1.N-COUNTSee also:cabin cruiser；（可供住宿的）舱式游艇A cruiser is a motor boat which has an area for people to live or sleep. \n\n    ...a motor cruiser.\n\n    电动游艇\n\n2.N-COUNT巡洋舰A cruiser is a large fast warship.\n\n    Italy had lost three cruisers and two destroyers.\n\n    意大利损失了3艘巡洋舰和2艘驱逐舰。\n\n3.N-COUNT巡逻警车A cruiser is a police car. 
destroyer@    1.N-COUNT驱逐舰A destroyer is a small, heavily armed warship.\n    2.N-COUNT破坏者；毁灭者；消灭者Something or someone that is described as a destroyer destroys things or people. \n\n        The company is the world's largest destroyer of tropical forests.\n\n        该公司对热带雨林的破坏位居世界之首。
twisted@adj. 扭曲的, 恶毒的\n动词twist的过去式和过去分词    1.ADJ-GRADED心理扭曲的；变态的If you describe a person as twisted, you dislike them because you think they are strange in an unpleasant way. \n\n        ...a twisted man who shot at the president...\n\n        向总统开枪的一个心理不正常的人\n\n        The letter showed horribly clearly the workings of a twisted mind.\n\n        那封信非常清楚地表明了一个变态者的思维方式。
cellular@adj. 细胞的
radioactivity@n. 放射性，辐射    1.ADJ-GRADED放射性的；有辐射的Something that is radioactive contains a substance that produces energy in the form of powerful and harmful rays.\n\n        The government has been storing radioactive waste at Fernald for 50 years.\n\n        政府在弗纳德存放放射性废料已达50年之久。\n\n    radioactivity\n\n        ...waste which is contaminated with low levels of radioactivity.\n\n        受到低度放射性污染的废料
half-life@ n. 半衰期
fall for@vt. 信以为真(对...倾倒),受骗,上当
supremacy@    1.N-UNCOUNT至高无上；最大权力；霸权If one group of people has supremacy over another group, they have more political or military power than the other group. \n\n        The conservative old guard had re-established its political supremacy...\n\n        守旧的保守派已经重新掌控了政治大权。\n\n        The president has been able to assert his ultimate supremacy over the prime minister.\n\n        总统行使了高于总理的最高决策权。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT优势If someone or something has supremacy over another person or thing, they are better. \n\n        In the United States Open final, Graf retained overall supremacy.\n\n        在美国网球公开赛决赛中，格拉芙始终保持优势。
advantageous@ADJ.有利的；有助的；有益的If something is advantageous to you, it is likely to benefit you. \n\n        Free exchange of goods was advantageous to all.\n\n        商品自由交换惠泽八方。\n\n        ...an opportunity to purchase a set of tools at very advantageous prices.\n\n        以非常优惠的价格购买一套工具的机会\n\n    advantageously\n\n        They acquire the land in order to be able to sell it advantageously to the government.\n\n        他们购下这块土地，目的是在转手给政府时能够从中渔利。
superior@    1.ADJ-GRADED比…好的；比…强的；优于…的If one thing or person is superior to another, the first is better than the second. \n\n        We have a relationship infinitely superior to those of many of our friends...\n\n        我们的关系要比我们其他许多朋友的关系好得多。\n\n        ...a woman greatly superior to her husband in education and sensitivity...\n\n        学历和悟性都比她丈夫高出许多的女人\n\n        Long-term stock market investments have produced superior returns compared with cash deposits.\n\n        股票市场长期投资的收益比现金存款要高。\n\n    superiority\n\n        The technical superiority of laser discs over tape is well established.\n\n        激光影碟相对于磁带的技术优势早已牢牢确立。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED优良的；优秀的；优等的If you describe something as superior, you mean that it is good, and better than other things of the same kind.\n\n        A few years ago it was virtually impossible to find superior quality coffee in local shops...\n\n        几年前在当地商店里几乎买不到优质咖啡。\n\n        Lulu was said to be of very superior intelligence.\n\n        大家都说露露智力出众。\n    3.ADJ（在重要性上）更高级的，上级的A superior person or thing is more important than another person or thing in the same organization or system. \n\n        ...negotiations between the mutineers and their superior officers...\n\n        哗变士兵和他们的上司长官间的谈判\n\n        Locally passed laws are of superior authority to those laws passed in Moscow.\n\n        当地法律高于莫斯科颁布的全国法律。\n    4.N-COUNT上级；上司；级别更高的人Your superior in an organization that you work for is a person who has a higher rank than you. \n\n        Other army units are completely surrounded and cut-off from communication with their superiors...\n\n        其他陆军部队被重重包围，和上级的联系也被切断了。\n\n        The company president, and my immediate superior, was the dynamic Harry Stokes.\n\n        公司的董事长，也就是我的直接上司，是精力充沛的哈里·斯托克斯。\n    5.ADJ-GRADED有优越感的；高傲的；傲慢的If you describe someone as superior, you disapprove of them because they behave as if they are better, more important, or more intelligent than other people. \n\n        Finch gave a superior smile...\n\n        芬奇高傲地笑了笑。\n\n        You can stand there and feel superior as you point and laugh at them.\n\n        你站在那儿指指点点、嘲笑他们时，会觉得自己高人一等。\n\n    superiority\n\n        ...a false sense of his superiority over mere journalists.\n\n        他在微不足道的记者面前所表现出的一种虚妄的优越感\n    6.ADJ-GRADED（人数）占优的，居多的If one group of people has superior numbers to another group, the first has more people than the second, and therefore has an advantage over it. \n\n        The demonstrators fled when they saw the authorities' superior numbers...\n\n        看到当局派出人员人数占优，示威者就四散逃跑了。\n\n        His men were far superior numerically.\n\n        他手下的士兵在人数上占了绝对优势。\n    7.N-COUNT（某一活动的）能人，高手If you describe someone as your superior in a particular activity, you mean that they are better than you at that activity. \n\n        Anthony sometimes felt that his mistress was his superior in willpower...\n\n        有时安东尼感觉他的情妇比他更有意志力。\n\n        Among his immediate rivals was Arnold Matters, probably his superior in comic roles.\n\n        在他的直接竞争者中，阿诺德·马特斯也许在喜剧表演上比他更胜一筹。
resemble@    1.VERB类似；与…相似；与…相像If one thing or person resembles another, they are similar to each other. \n\n        Some of the commercially produced venison resembles beef in flavour...\n\n        有些商业化养殖的鹿肉味道和牛肉很相似。\n\n        She so resembles her mother.\n\n        她很像她母亲。
swarm@    1.N-COUNT-COLL（蜜蜂等昆虫的）一大群，一大窝A swarm of bees or other insects is a large group of them flying together. \n    2.VERB（蜜蜂等）成群飞行When bees or other insects swarm, they move or fly in a large group. \n\n        A dark cloud of bees comes swarming out of the hive.\n\n        黑压压的一大群蜜蜂从蜂巢中飞出来。\n    3.VERB（人）成群地涌动，蜂拥When people swarm somewhere, they move there quickly in a large group. \n\n        People swarmed to the shops, buying up everything in sight.\n\n        人们成群地涌向商店，见什么买什么。\n    4.N-COUNT-COLL（快速移动的）人群A swarm of people is a large group of them moving about quickly. \n\n        A swarm of people encircled the hotel...\n\n        一大群人围住了这个酒店。\n\n        Today at the crossing there were swarms of tourists taking photographs.\n\n        今天在十字路口有大群的游客在拍照。\n    5.VERB挤满，聚集（来来往往的人）If a place is swarming with people, it is full of people moving about in a busy way. \n\n        Within minutes the area was swarming with officers who began searching a nearby wood.\n\n        几分钟内很多警察就来到了这一地区，开始搜查附近的树林。
roil@vt. 搅浑, 激怒\nvi. 动荡    1.VERB（水）激荡，翻滚，翻腾If water roils, it is rough and disturbed. \n\n        The water roiled to his left as he climbed carefully at the edge of the waterfall.\n\n        当他在瀑布边缘小心攀爬时，水就在他左边奔腾。\n    2.VERB扰乱；搅乱；使混乱Something that roils a state or situation makes it disturbed and confused. \n\n        Times of national turmoil generally roil a country's financial markets.\n\n        在国家动荡不安的时代，该国的金融市场一般都会出现混乱。
encrypt@    1.VERB把…编码；把…加密If a document or piece of information is encrypted, it is written in a special code, so that only certain people can read it. \n\n        Account details are encrypted to protect privacy.\n\n        账户资料被加密，以保护隐私。\n\n        ...a program that will encrypt the information before sending.\n\n        在发送前会对信息进行加密的程序\n\n        ...encrypted signals.\n\n        加密信号\n\n    encryption\n\n        It is currently illegal to export this encryption technology from the US.\n\n        从美国出口这种加密技术在当前是违法的。
algorithm@1.N-COUNT（尤指电脑程序中的）算法，运算法则An algorithm is a series of mathematical steps, especially in a computer program, which will give you the answer to a particular kind of problem or question.
extraction@n. 抽出, 取出, 抽出物\nn.血统    1.N-UNCOUNT血统；家世If you say, for example, that someone is of French extraction, you mean that they or their family originally came from France. \n\n        Her real father was of Italian extraction...\n\n        她的亲生父亲是意大利裔。\n\n        He married a young lady of Indian extraction.\n\n        他娶了一位年轻的印度裔女子。
haul@    1.VERB（用力地）拉，拖If you haul something which is heavy or difficult to move, you move it using a lot of effort. \n\n        A crane had to be used to haul the car out of the stream...\n\n        只好用了起重机，才将轿车从河里拖出来。\n\n        He hauled himself to his feet...\n\n        他吃力地站了起来。\n\n        She hauled up her bedroom window and leaned out.\n\n        她拉开卧室的窗户，探出身去。\n    2.VERB使出庭受审；使去见掌权者If someone is hauled before a court or someone in authority, they are made to appear before them because they are accused of having done something wrong. \n\n        She was hauled before magistrates for refusing to reveal her age to a policeman...\n\n        她因拒绝告诉警察自己的年龄而被地方法院传讯。\n\n        He was hauled before the managing director and fired.\n\n        他被叫去见总裁，然后就被解雇了。\n\n        Haul up means the same as haul .同 haul\n\n            He was hauled up before the Board of Trustees...\n\n            他被带到了理事会那里。\n\n            She was late for the interview after being hauled up for speeding.\n\n            由于超速驾车被拦下，她面试迟到了。\n    3.N-COUNT（警方或海关查获的）一批赃物，一批违禁品A haul is a quantity of things that are stolen, or a quantity of stolen or illegal goods found by police or customs. \n\n        The size of the drugs haul shows that the international trade in heroin is still flourishing...\n\n        本次查获的毒品量表明，海洛因在国际上的交易仍很猖獗。\n\n        Another break-in yielded a £4,000 haul of jewellery.\n\n        另一次入室盗窃偷得了价值4，000英镑的首饰。\n    4.PHRASESee also:long-haul；费时费力的事；耗时累人的行程If you say that a task or a journey is a long haul, you mean that it takes a long time and a lot of effort.\n\n        Revitalising the Romanian economy will be a long haul.\n\n        罗马尼亚经济的复兴将是一项长期而艰巨的工作。
hyperspace@ n. 多维空间
junction@    1.N-COUNT; N-IN-NAMES（公路的）交叉路口；（公路或铁路的）汇合处，枢纽站A junction is a place where roads or railway lines join. \n\n        Follow the road to a junction and turn left...\n\n        沿着这条路到交叉路口，然后左转。\n\n        Leave the M1 at junction 25...\n\n        在25号交叉路口驶离1号高速公路。\n\n        There's a good British Rail link at Clapham Junction.\n\n        在克拉珀姆枢纽站有条很不错的英国铁路线。\n\n    in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 intersection
weird@    1.ADJ-GRADED奇怪的；不寻常的；奇异的If you describe something or someone as weird, you mean that they are strange. \n\n        That first day was weird... \n\n        第一天有些怪异。\n\n        He's different. He's weird...\n\n        他与众不同，有点怪。\n\n        Drugs can make you do all kinds of weird things...\n\n        毒品可以让你做出各种各样奇怪的事情。\n\n    weirdly\n\n        ...weirdly wonderful sculptures.\n\n        奇妙的雕刻品\n\n        ...difficult men who dressed weirdly.\n\n        穿着怪异、难以相处的男人\n\n    weirdness\n\n        The weirdness of Hollywood suits him well.\n\n        好莱坞的光怪陆离非常适合他。
shatter@1.V-ERG（使）粉碎；（使）破碎；（使）碎裂If something shatters or is shattered, it breaks into a lot of small pieces. \n\n    ...safety glass that won't shatter if it's broken...\n\n    被打破后也不会碎裂的安全玻璃\n\n    The car shattered into a thousand burning pieces in a 200mph crash...\n\n    汽车在时速为 200 英里时发生撞车，炸成了数以千计燃烧的碎片。\n\n    One bullet shattered his skull.\n\n    一颗子弹打穿了他的头颅。\n\nshattering\n\n    ...the shattering of glass.\n\n    玻璃的破碎\n\n2.VERB使（梦想、希望或信念）粉碎；（使）破灭If something shatters your dreams, hopes, or beliefs, it completely destroys them. \n\n    A failure would shatter the hopes of many people...\n\n    一次失败会使很多人希望破灭。\n\n    Something like that really shatters your confidence.\n\n    那样的事情会让人的信心严重受挫。\n\n    ...broken hearts and shattered dreams.\n\n    破碎的心和破灭的梦想\n\n3.VERB使非常惊愕；使受到极大打击If someone is shattered by an event, it shocks and upsets them very much. \n\n    He had been shattered by his son's death.\n\n    儿子的死让他大受打击。\n\n    ...the tragedy which had shattered his life.\n\n    给他的生活造成重创的悲剧
instinctual@    1.ADJ本能的；天性的；直觉的An instinctual feeling, action, or idea is one based on instinct. \n\n        The relationship between a parent and a child is instinctual and stems from basic human nature.\n\n        父母与孩子的关系是天生的，源于基本的人性。
provision@n. 规定, 条款; 供应(品); 预备\nn. (pl.) 食物\nvt. 向...供应食物    1.N-UNCOUNT供应；提供The provision of something is the act of giving it or making it available to people who need or want it. \n\n        The department is responsible for the provision of residential care services.\n\n        该部门负责提供家庭护理服务。\n\n        ...nursery provision for children with special needs.\n\n        为有特殊需要的儿童提供护理\n    2.N-VAR预备；准备；预先采取的措施If you make provision for something that might happen or that might need to be done, you make arrangements to deal with it. \n\n        Mr King asked if it had ever occurred to her to make provision for her own pension...\n\n        金先生问她是否曾想过要为自己的养老金预先作安排。\n\n        There is no provision for funding performance-related pay rises.\n\n        没有为与业绩挂钩的加薪预作资金准备。\n    3.N-UNCOUNT赡养；供养If you make provision for someone, you support them financially and make sure that they have the things that they need. \n\n        Special provision should be made for children...\n\n        应给孩子在经济上专门作好安排。\n\n        There are very generous provisions for the mother.\n\n        这位母亲在物质上得到了很好的赡养。\n    4.N-COUNT（法律或协议的）条文，条款，规定A provision in a law or an agreement is an arrangement which is included in it.\n\n        He backed a provision that would allow judges to delay granting a divorce decree in some cases...\n\n        他赞成一项允许法官在一些情况下延迟作出离婚判决的法律条款。\n\n        The bill's provision for the sale and purchase of land faces stiff opposition from conservatives.\n\n        该法案关于土地买卖的规定遭到保守派的强硬反对。\n    5.N-PLURAL食品供应Provisions are supplies of food. \n\n        On board were enough provisions for two weeks.\n\n        船上有足够两周吃的食物。
drastic@    1.ADJ-GRADED（行为）严厉的，极端的If you have to take drastic action in order to solve a problem, you have to do something extreme and basic to solve it.\n\n        Drastic measures are needed to clean up the profession...\n\n        行业清理整顿需要严厉的措施。\n\n        He's not going to do anything drastic about economic policy.\n\n        他不打算对经济政策作任何重大调整。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（变化）激烈的，巨大的A drastic change is a very great change.\n\n        Elderly people are not in a position to make drastic changes at this stage of their life...\n\n        上了年纪的人在他们这个人生阶段不会再有什么实质性的改变。\n\n        ...a drastic reduction in the numbers of people dying.\n\n        死亡人数的大幅下降\n\n    drastically\n\n        As a result, services have been drastically reduced.\n\n        结果是服务业急剧萎缩。
camouflage@    1.N-UNCOUNT（军事上的）伪装，隐蔽Camouflage consists of things such as leaves, branches, or brown and green paint, which are used to make it difficult for an enemy to see military forces and equipment. \n\n        They were dressed in camouflage and carried automatic rifles.\n\n        他们身穿迷彩服，携带自动步枪。\n\n        ...a camouflage jacket.\n\n        迷彩夹克\n\n        ...the mottled green camouflage scheme of most military vehicles.\n\n        多数军车采用的绿色斑驳伪装图案\n    2.VERB对（军事建筑或车辆）进行伪装；掩饰If military buildings or vehicles are camouflaged, things such as leaves, branches, or brown and green paint are used to make it difficult for an enemy to see them. \n\n        You won't see them from the air. They'd be very well camouflaged...\n\n        你从空中是看不见它们的，它们会被精心伪装起来。\n\n        They walked through the trees to a second hut, cunningly camouflaged against air surveillance.\n\n        他们穿过树林来到第二个棚子；这个棚子经过巧妙伪装，空中侦察不到。\n    3.VERB掩饰；隐瞒If you camouflage something such as a feeling or a situation, you hide it or make it appear to be something different. \n\n        He has never camouflaged his desire to better himself...\n\n        他从不掩饰自己的上进心。\n\n        I think that there has been an attempt to camouflage what really happened.\n\n        我认为，有人试图掩盖事情的真相。\n\n        Camouflage is also a noun.\n\n            The constant partygoing of her later years was a desperate camouflage for her grief.\n\n            她晚年不停地参加各种聚会，其实是在竭力掩饰心中的悲痛。\n    4.N-UNCOUNT（动物的）伪装（术），保护色Camouflage is the way in which some animals are coloured and shaped so that they cannot easily be seen in their natural surroundings. \n\n        Confident in its camouflage, being the same colour as the rocks, the lizard stands still when it feels danger.\n\n        由于和岩石颜色一样，蜥蜴对自己的保护色充满信心；遇到危险时，它便一动不动。
fancier@    1.N-COUNTSee also:fancy；饲养者；培育者；动植物爱好者An animal or plant fancier is a person who breeds animals or plants of a particular type or who is very interested in them. \n\n        ...pigeon fanciers.\n\n        养鸽迷
embark@    1.VERB着手；开始做If you embark on something new, difficult, or exciting, you start doing it. \n\n        He's embarking on a new career as a writer...\n\n        他即将开始新的职业生涯——当一名作家。\n\n        The government embarked on a programme of radical economic reform.\n\n        政府开始实施一项彻底的经济改革计划。\n    2.VERB登（船）；上（船）When someone embarks on a ship, they go on board before the start of a journey. \n\n        They travelled to Portsmouth, where they embarked on the battle cruiser HMS Renown...\n\n        他们行至朴次茅斯，在那里登上了英国皇家海军“声望号”战列巡洋舰。\n\n        Bob ordered brigade HQ to embark.\n\n        鲍勃命令旅指挥部登船。\n\n    embarkation\n\n        Embarkation was scheduled for just after 4 pm.\n\n        计划下午4点一过即登船。
hideout@n. 隐匿处1.N-COUNT躲藏处；隐藏处A hideout is a place where someone goes secretly because they do not want anyone to find them, for example if they are running away from the police.
limber up@vt. 在剧烈运动前作准备活动    1.PHRASAL VERB（比赛等前）做准备活动，热身If you limber up, you prepare for an energetic physical activity such as a sport by moving and stretching your body. \n\n        Next door, 200 girls are limbering up for their ballet exams...\n\n        隔壁屋里，200名女孩正在为她们的芭蕾考试做热身。\n\n        She ran a little way, limbering up...\n\n        她跑了一小段，活动一下身子。\n\n        A short walk will limber up the legs.\n\n        散一小会儿步能放松腿部。
intent@    1.ADJ-GRADED坚决的；下决心的If you are intent on doing something, you are eager and determined to do it. \n\n        The rebels are obviously intent on keeping up the pressure...\n\n        叛乱分子显然决心继续施压。\n\n        The play starred a well-known retired actress who was intent on a come-back.\n\n        该剧由一名志在复出的著名隐退女演员主演。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED专心的；专注的If someone does something in an intent way, they pay great attention to what they are doing. \n\n        She looked from one intent face to another...\n\n        她看着一张张专注的面孔。\n\n        Rodney had been intent on every word.\n\n        罗德尼字字留心。\n\n    intently\n\n        He listened intently, then slammed down the phone.\n\n        他专心地听着，然后砰地挂上电话。\n    3.N-VAR意图；目的A person's intent is their intention to do something. \n\n        ...a strong statement of intent on arms control...\n\n        决心实施军备控制的有力声明\n\n        Two men will appear before Birmingham magistrates' court today charged with possession of arms with intent to endanger life.\n\n        两名男子今天将在伯明翰地方法庭受审，他们被控持有武器，企图危害他人生命。\n    4.PHRASE差不多等于；几乎在一切方面You say to all intents and purposes to suggest that a situation is not exactly as you describe it but the effect is the same as if it were. \n\n        To all intents and purposes he was my father.\n\n        他几乎可以称得上是我的父亲。
ounce@1.N-COUNT盎司（英国和美国的重量单位，1磅合16盎司，1盎司等于28。35克）An ounce is a unit of weight used in Britain and the USA. There are sixteen ounces in a pound and one ounce is equal to 28.35 grams. \n\n    ...four ounces of sugar.\n\n    4盎司糖\n\n2.N-SING少许；少量；一点点You can refer to a very small amount of something, such as a quality or characteristic, as an ounce . \n\n    If only my father had possessed an ounce of business sense...\n\n    要是我父亲有一点点经商的头脑就好了。\n\n    I spent every ounce of energy trying to hide.\n\n    我费尽力气想藏起来。
interior@    1.N-COUNT内部The interior of something is the inside part of it. \n\n        The interior of the house was furnished with heavy, old-fashioned pieces...\n\n        房子里摆放着笨重的旧式家具。\n\n        The boat's interior badly needed painting.\n\n        该船内部亟需油漆。\n    2.ADJ（建筑物、车辆等）内部的You use interior to describe something that is inside a building or vehicle. \n\n        The interior walls were painted green...\n\n        内墙漆成了绿色。\n\n        There is more interior space than in some rival cars...\n\n        车内空间比有些同类车宽敞。\n\n        He pulled the car over, turned on the interior light, examined the map.\n\n        他把车开到路边，打开车内的照明灯查看地图。\n    3.N-SING内地；腹地；内陆The interior of a country or continent is the central area of it. \n\n        ...a 5-day hike into the interior.\n\n        为期 5 天、深入内地的远足\n\n        ...the unknown interior of South America...\n\n        南美洲不为人知的腹地\n\n        Many areas in the country's interior are unable to report Aids cases immediately.\n\n        该国内地的很多地区无法即时报告艾滋病病例。\n    4.ADJ国内的；内政的；内务的A country's interior minister, ministry, or department deals with affairs within that country, such as law and order. \n\n        The French Interior Minister has intervened in a scandal over the role of a secret police force.\n\n        法国内政部长对一起涉及秘密警察部队所扮演角色的丑闻进行了干预。\n    5.N-SING内政A country's minister or ministry of the interior deals with affairs within that country, such as law and order.\n\n        An official from the Ministry of the Interior said six people had died.\n\n        内政部的一位官员说已有 6 人丧生。\n    6.ADJ内心的；心灵的Interior thoughts or processes go on inside someone's head and are not expressed aloud. \n\n        She depicted the interior life of human beings, and particularly their moral stresses and strains.\n\n        她描写人类的内心生活，尤其是他们所承受的道德压力。\n\n        ...the mind's interior space.\n\n        心灵的内在空间
dispatch@    in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 despatch\n    1.VERB派遣；调遣If you dispatch someone to a place, you send them there for a particular reason. \n\n        He dispatched scouts ahead...\n\n        他派侦察兵打头阵。\n\n        The Italian government was preparing to dispatch 4,000 soldiers to search the island.\n\n        意大利政府正准备派遣 4，000 名士兵搜索该岛。\n\n        Dispatch is also a noun.\n\n            The despatch of the task force is purely a contingency measure.\n\n            派出特遣部队纯粹是应急之举。\n    2.VERB发送，发出（信息、信件或包裹）If you dispatch a message, letter, or parcel, you send it to a particular person or destination. \n\n        The victory inspired him to dispatch a gleeful telegram to Roosevelt...\n\n        胜利促使他给罗斯福发了封喜报。\n\n        Free gifts are dispatched separately so please allow 28 days for delivery.\n\n        赠品会分开发送，所以请预留28天的送货期。\n\n        Dispatch is also a noun.\n\n            We have 125 cases ready for dispatch.\n\n            我们有125个待发的箱子。\n    3.N-COUNT（身在另一城市或国家的记者发送的）电讯，新闻报道A dispatch is a special report that is sent to a newspaper or broadcasting organization by a journalist who is in a different town or country.\n\n        ...this despatch from our West Africa correspondent.\n\n        我台驻西非记者发来的这一报道\n    4.N-COUNT（军官或政府官员发送给总部的）急件，快信A dispatch is a message or report that is sent, for example, by army officers or government officials to their headquarters. \n\n        I was carrying dispatches from the ambassador.\n\n        我正拿着大使的急件。\n\n        If a soldier is mentioned in dispatches, he or she is considered to have been extremely brave in a battle, and is recommended for a medal.\n\n            He was hailed as a hero, mentioned in dispatches and finally given a medal.\n\n            他被誉为英雄，得到了通报表彰，最后还获得了一枚勋章。\n    5.VERB处决；杀死To dispatch a person or an animal means to kill them. \n\n        The fox takes his chance with a pack of hounds which may catch him and despatch him immediately.\n\n        那只狐狸和一群随时可能置其于死地的猎狗冒险周旋。\n    6.VERB迅速处理；迅速办妥To dispatch a job or task means to finish it quickly and efficiently without wasting time. \n\n        Amy sat outside in the sun while Gerald despatched his business.\n\n        埃米坐在外面晒太阳，而杰拉尔德则忙着处理个人事务。\n    7.N-UNCOUNT迅速；急速If you do something with dispatch, you do it very quickly. \n\n        He feels we should act with despatch.\n\n        他觉得我们应该迅速行动。
necessitate@    1.VERB使成为必需；需要If something necessitates an event, action, or situation, it makes it necessary. \n\n        A prolonged drought had necessitated the introduction of water rationing...\n\n        由于持续干旱，用水需要实行配给了。\n\n        Frank was carrying out fuel-system tests which necessitated turning the booster pumps off.\n\n        弗兰克在做燃料系统测试，这一测试需要关掉升压泵。
resort@    1.VERB诉诸；采取If you resort to a course of action that you do not really approve of, you adopt it because you cannot see any other way of achieving what you want. \n\n        His punishing work schedule had made him resort to drugs...\n\n        异常紧张的工作安排使他开始吸毒。\n\n        Some schools have resorted to recruiting teachers from overseas.\n\n        有些学校不得不开始从海外招收老师。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT采取；凭借；诉诸；求助If you achieve something without resort to a particular course of action, you succeed without carrying out that action. To have resort to a particular course of action means to have to do that action in order to achieve something. \n\n        Congress has a responsibility to ensure that all peaceful options are exhausted before resort to war.\n\n        国会有责任确保只有在所有和平手段都不奏效的情况下才会诉诸战争。\n    3.N-COUNT（度假）胜地A resort is a place where a lot of people spend their holidays. \n\n        ...the ski resorts.\n\n        滑雪胜地\n    4.PHRASE最后的办法；最终手段If you do something as a last resort, you do it because you can find no other way of getting out of a difficult situation or of solving a problem. \n\n        Nuclear weapons should be used only as a last resort...\n\n        不到万不得已时不能选择使用核武器。\n\n        As a last resort you may have to accept their point of view.\n\n        最终，你可能不得不接受他们的观点。\n    5.PHRASE最终You use in the last resort when stating the most basic or important fact that will still be true in a situation whatever else happens. \n\n        They would in the last resort support their friends whatever they did.\n\n        无论他们的朋友做了什么，他们最终都会支持他们的朋友。
cannon@    1.N-COUNT加农炮；大炮A cannon is a large gun, usually on wheels, which used to be used in battles.\n    2.N-COUNT（尤指机载的）自动机关炮A cannon is a heavy automatic gun, especially one that is fired from an aircraft.\n    3.VERB碰撞；猛撞If one person or thing cannons into another, they bump into them with great force. \n\n        One of the reporters cannoned into Arnold...\n\n        一个记者和阿诺德撞了个满怀。\n\n        The ball cannoned off the back of a Spartak defender and into the net.\n\n        球打在斯巴达克队一名防守队员的背上后反弹入网。\n    4.PHRASESee also:water cannon；为所欲为的人；冒失鬼If someone is a loose cannon, they do whatever they want and nobody can predict what they are going to do. \n\n        Max is a loose cannon politically.\n\n        马克斯在政治上我行我素。
crocodilian@ adj.鳄鱼的,鳄鱼一样的&lt;br /&gt;n.鳄鱼
apace@    1.ADV高速地；迅速地If something develops or continues apace, it is developing or continuing quickly. \n\n        Land reclamation continues apace...\n\n        土地开垦继续快速进行。\n\n        The plan is proceeding apace, with another 13 superstores opened in the first half of this year.\n\n        该计划进展迅速，在今年上半年又增开了13家大型超市。
pledge@    1.N-COUNT保证；诺言；誓言When someone makes a pledge, they make a serious promise that they will do something. \n\n        The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of the region.\n\n        会议以承诺加快这一地区六国间的合作而结束。\n\n        ...a £1.1m pledge of support from the Spanish ministry of culture.\n\n        来自西班牙文化部110万英镑的资助许诺\n    2.VERB保证，许诺，发誓（做）；保证给予When someone pledges to do something, they promise in a serious way to do it. When they pledge something, they promise to give it. \n\n        Mr Dudley has pledged to give any award to charity...\n\n        达德利先生已承诺将任何所获的损害赔偿额都捐给慈善机构。\n\n        Philip pledges support and offers to help in any way that he can...\n\n        菲利普保证给予支持，并主动提出尽其所能提供帮助。\n\n        I pledge that by next year we will have the problem solved.\n\n        我保证来年之前我们将解决这个问题。\n    3.VERB许诺拨（款）；许诺给予If you pledge a sum of money to an organization or activity, you promise to pay that amount of money to it at a particular time or over a particular period. \n\n        The French President is pledging $150 million in French aid next year...\n\n        法国总统许诺为法国明年的援助经费拨款1。5亿美元。\n\n        The government has now pledged £170m over the next six years for improving primary care.\n\n        为了改善初级卫生保健工作，政府已承诺在未来6年内拨款1。7亿英镑。\n\n        Pledge is also a noun.\n\n            ...a pledge of forty two million dollars a month.\n\n            每月拨款4，200万美元的承诺\n    4.VERB使保证，使许诺，使发誓（遵循或支持）If you pledge yourself to something, you commit yourself to following a particular course of action or to supporting a particular person, group, or idea. \n\n        The President pledged himself to increase taxes for the rich but not the middle classes...\n\n        总统保证增加对富人而非中产阶级的税收。\n\n        Tony Cottee has pledged himself to Everton Football Club for another three years...\n\n        托尼·科蒂已答应同埃弗顿足球俱乐部再续约3年。\n\n        The treaties renounce the use of force and pledge the two countries to co-operation.\n\n        条约声明放弃使用武力，并保证两国将进行合作。\n    5.VERB用…抵押；以…典押If you pledge something such as a valuable possession or a sum of money, you leave it with someone as a guarantee that you will repay money that you have borrowed. \n\n        He asked her to pledge the house as security for a loan.\n\n        他要她拿房子来抵押贷款。
eternal@    1.ADJ永久的；永恒的；永远的Something that is eternal lasts for ever.\n\n        Whoever believes in Him shall have eternal life.\n\n        所有相信上帝的人都会获得永生。\n\n        ...the quest for eternal youth.\n\n        对永葆青春的追求\n\n    eternally\n\n        She is eternally grateful to her family for their support...\n\n        她永远感激家人们给予她的支持。\n\n        The whole universe exists eternally in that one infinite being.\n\n        整个宇宙在无限的空间中永生。\n    2.ADJ无休止的；没完没了的If you describe something as eternal, you mean that it seems to last for ever, often because you think it is boring or annoying.\n\n        In the background was that eternal hum.\n\n        背景音是没完没了的嗡嗡声。\n    3.ADJ（真理、价值、问题等）永恒的，不朽的Eternal truths, values, and questions never change and are believed to be always true and to be relevant in all situations. \n\n        ...the eternal truths of the Indian subcontinent.\n\n        印度次大陆的永恒真理\n\n        ...the eternal question.\n\n        永恒的问题
latent@    1.ADJ潜在的；潜藏的；隐伏的Latent is used to describe something which is hidden and not obvious at the moment, but which may develop further in the future. \n\n        Advertisements attempt to project a latent meaning behind an overt message.\n\n        广告的意图是以公开的信息传达隐含之意。
coalition@    1.N-COUNT联合政府A coalition is a government consisting of people from two or more political parties. \n\n        Since June the country has had a coalition government...\n\n        从6月份起，该国一直由一个联合政府执掌政权。\n\n        It took five months for the coalition to agree on and publish a medium-term economic programme.\n\n        联合政府花了5个月的时间才达成并公布了一项中期经济计划。\n    2.N-COUNT（政党、社团等的）同盟，联盟A coalition is a group consisting of people from different political or social groups who are co-operating to achieve a particular aim. \n\n        He had been opposed by a coalition of about 50 civil rights, women's and Latino organizations.\n\n        大约有50个民权组织、女性社团和拉丁裔社团联合起来反对他。
loom@n. 织布机,若隐若现的现象\nvi. 朦胧地出现,隐约可见,可怖地出现1.VERB（庞然大物或形状模糊之物）耸现，出现If something looms over you, it appears as a large or unclear shape, often in a frightening way. \n\n    Vincent loomed over me, as pale and grey as a tombstone.\n\n    文森特赫然耸现在我面前，面色灰白得像一块墓碑。\n\n    ...the bleak mountains that loomed out of the blackness and towered around us.\n\n    黑暗中若隐若现、耸立在我们四周的荒山\n\n2.VERB迫近；逼近；即将爆发If a worrying or threatening situation or event is looming, it seems likely to happen soon. \n\n    Another government spending crisis is looming in the United States...\n\n    另一场政府开支危机在美国一触即发。\n\n    The threat of renewed civil war looms ahead.\n\n    内战战火重燃的威胁正迫在眉睫。\n\n    ...the looming threat of recession.\n\n    日益迫近的经济衰退的威胁\n\n3.PHRASE（尤指问题或忧虑）挥之不去，萦绕心中，显得突出If something, especially a problem or worry looms large, it occupies a lot of your thoughts and seems important. \n\n    ...the terrible problem of armed crime now looming large in our society...\n\n    已日渐成为我们当今社会一块心病的严重的持械犯罪问题\n\n    As such tensions increase, they loom larger in Russia's domestic politics.\n\n    这种紧张关系的不断加剧使其在俄罗斯国内政治中愈发凸显。\n\n4.N-COUNT织机；织布机A loom is a machine that is used for weaving thread into cloth.
scatter@1.VERB撒；撒播；撒于…上If you scatter things over an area, you throw or drop them so that they spread all over the area. \n\n    She tore the rose apart and scattered the petals over the grave...\n\n    她掰开玫瑰花，将花瓣撒在坟墓上。\n\n    They've been scattering toys everywhere...\n\n    他们总是把玩具扔得到处都是。\n\n    He began by scattering seed and putting in plants.\n\n    他从播种和栽苗开始。\n\n2.V-ERG（使）（人群）分散；（使）散布在各处；（使）散开If a group of people scatter or if you scatter them, they suddenly separate and move in different directions. \n\n    After dinner, everyone scattered...\n\n    用餐后，大家各奔东西。\n\n    The cavalry scattered them and chased them off the field.\n\n    骑兵驱散了他们并把他们逐出了战场。\n\n3.N-SING（散放的）摊，堆A scatter of things is a number of them spread over an area in an irregular way. \n\n    On the table was a pile of books and a scatter of papers.\n\n    桌子上放着一摞书和零落的几份报纸。
jerk@n. (口语)笨蛋,性情古怪的人,急拉,肌肉抽搐\nvt. &amp;vi. 痉挛,急拉,急推,急动1.V-ERG（向某个方向）急拉，猛推；（使）猝然一动If you jerk something or someone in a particular direction, or they jerk in a particular direction, they move a short distance very suddenly and quickly. \n\n    Mr Griffin jerked forward in his chair... \n\n    格里芬先生坐在椅子上猛地向前一凑。\n\n    The car jerked to a halt...\n\n    车猛地停住了。\n\n    'This is Brady Coyne,' said Sam, jerking his head in my direction...\n\n    “这位是布雷迪·科因，”萨姆突然转头对我说。\n\n    Jerk is also a noun.\n\n        He indicated the bedroom with a jerk of his head.\n\n        他扭头指了指卧室的方向。\n\n2.N-COUNT傻瓜；笨蛋；混蛋If you call someone a jerk, you are insulting them because you think they are stupid or you do not like them. 
ascend@1.VERB攀登；登上If you ascend a hill or staircase, you go up it. \n\n    Mrs Clayton had to hold Lizzie's hand as they ascended the steps...\n\n    拾级而上的时候克莱顿夫人不得不抓着莉齐的手。\n\n    Then we ascend steeply through forests of rhododendron.\n\n    然后我们在杜鹃花丛中沿着陡坡向上爬。\n\n2.VERB（楼梯、路）上升，升高If a staircase or path ascends, it leads up to a higher position. \n\n    A number of staircases ascend from the cobbled streets onto the ramparts.\n\n    一段石阶从鹅卵石路上一直向上直通城墙。\n\n    ...an ascending spiral path leading to a tower.\n\n    螺旋上升的通向一座塔的路\n\n3.VERB（通常指垂直地）上升If something ascends, it moves up, usually vertically or into the air. \n\n    Keep the drill steady while it ascends and descends...\n\n    打钻和提钻时要保持钻头平稳。\n\n    Nott and Dickinson set a new altitude record when they ascended 55,900 feet in their balloon.\n\n    诺特和迪金森乘坐热气球上升了55，900英尺，创造了一项新的高度纪录。\n\n4.VERB升迁；升职；（君主）登基，即位If someone ascends to an important position, they achieve it or are appointed to it. When someone ascends a throne, they become king, queen, or pope. \n\n    ...the same year he ascended to power...\n\n    同年，他上台掌权。\n\n    Before ascending to the bench, she was a lawyer in a large New York firm.\n\n    在升为法官之前，她是纽约一家大型律所的律师。\n\n    ...a few years before Sixtus V ascended the papal throne.\n\n    在西克斯图斯五世登上教皇宝座的几年之前\n\n5.VERB（事业、社会地位）提高；晋升If you ascend in your career or in society, you gradually achieve success or a higher status. \n\n    Mobutu ascended through the ranks, eventually becoming commander of the army...\n\n    蒙博托出身行伍，通过一级级晋升，最终成为了陆军司令。\n\n    They move freely from one department to another as they ascend the civil service ladder.\n\n    随着仕途晋升，他们可以在部门间随意调动。\n\n6.VERB（在某些宗教中指灵魂）升天，进入天堂In some religions, when someone's soul goes to heaven, you can say that they ascend to heaven. \n\n    ...the belief that the souls of the faithful and virtuous would ascend to heaven.\n\n    虔诚和善良的灵魂会升入天堂的信仰\n\n7.VERB（境界）上升；升华If something or someone ascends to a higher level, they reach a state that is better than the one they were in before. \n\n    The story ascends from a gothic tragedy to a miraculous fairy-tale.\n\n    故事从一个哥特式悲剧升华为神奇的童话。
nightmare@    1.N-COUNT恶梦；噩梦；梦魇A nightmare is a very frightening dream.\n\n        All the victims still suffered nightmares...\n\n        所有受害者仍然被恶梦困扰。\n\n        Jane did not eat cheese because it gives her nightmares.\n\n        简没吃奶酪，因为那会让她做恶梦。\n    2.N-COUNT令人恐怖的处境；可怕的情景If you refer to a situation as a nightmare, you mean that it is very frightening and unpleasant.\n\n        The years in prison were a nightmare.\n\n        监狱里的那些年是一场噩梦。\n    3.N-COUNT恼人的情景；惹人烦的局面If you refer to a situation as a nightmare, you are saying in a very emphatic way that it is irritating because it causes you a lot of trouble. \n\n        Taking my son Peter to a restaurant was a nightmare...\n\n        带我儿子彼得外出吃饭简直糟糕透了。\n\n        In practice a graduate tax is an administrative nightmare.\n\n        毕业税具体操作起来不啻一场行政噩梦。
progression@    1.N-COUNT进展；发展；演变A progression is a gradual development from one state to another. \n\n        Both drugs slow the progression of HIV, but neither cures the disease...\n\n        这两种药物都可以延缓艾滋病病情发展，但是都不能治愈这种疾病。\n\n        I think they saw it as a natural progression for me.\n\n        我想他们认为这对我来说是顺理成章的。\n    2.N-COUNT（事件的）一连串，一系列，连续A progression of things is a number of things which come one after the other. \n\n        ...a progression of habitats from dry meadows through marshes to open water.\n\n        从干燥的草地到沼泽地再到开阔的水面的一系列栖息地
prop@1.VERB架；搁；靠If you prop an object on or against something, you support it by putting something underneath it or by resting it somewhere. \n\n    He rocked back in the chair and propped his feet on the desk...\n\n    他往椅背上一靠，把脚搭在桌子上。\n\n    He propped his bike against the bus.\n\n    他把自行车靠在公共汽车上。\n\n    Prop up means the same as prop .prop up同prop\n\n        Sam slouched back and propped his elbows up on the bench behind him...\n\n        萨姆懒洋洋地往后仰着，肘部支在身后的长椅上。\n\n        If you have difficulty sitting like this, prop up your back against a wall.\n\n        如果这么坐着有困难，就背靠墙坐吧。\n\n2.N-COUNT支柱；撑棒；支撑物A prop is a stick or other object that you use to support something.\n\n3.N-COUNT支持者；后盾；靠山To be a prop for a system, institution, or person means to be the main thing that keeps them strong or helps them survive.\n\n    The army is one of the main props of the government...\n\n    军队是政府的主要后盾之一。\n\n    I had two props in my life; one was alcohol, the other work.\n\n    我生命中有两大支柱：一个是酒，另一个是工作。\n\n4.N-COUNT（戏剧或电影中的）道具The props in a play or film are all the objects or pieces of furniture that are used in it. \n\n    ...the backdrop and props for a stage show.\n\n    一场舞台剧的背景幕和道具\n\n    ...stage props.\n\n    舞台道具\n\n5.N-COUNT（橄榄球争球时的）第一排边锋In rugby, a prop or prop forward is one of the two players who position themselves in the front row when a group called a scrum is formed. 
simulation@n. 模拟,仿真,赝品    1.N-VAR模仿；模拟；仿真品Simulation is the process of simulating something or the result of simulating it.\n\n        Training includes realistic simulation of casualty procedures.\n\n        培训包括对急救过程的真实模拟。\n\n        ...a simulation of the greenhouse effect.\n\n        对温室效应的模拟
division@    1.N-UNCOUNT分开；划分；分隔The division of a large unit into two or more distinct parts is the act of separating it into these parts. \n\n        ...the unification of Germany, after its division into two states at the end of World War Two.\n\n        二战结束时曾被一分为二的德国实现了统一\n    2.N-UNCOUNT分配；分派The division of something among people or things is its separation into parts which are distributed among the people or things. \n\n        The current division of labor between workers and management will alter.\n\n        当前工人与管理部门的分工将会改变。\n    3.N-UNCOUNT（算术中的）除法Division is the arithmetical process of dividing one number into another number.\n\n        I taught my daughter how to do division at the age of six.\n\n        女儿6岁时我就教她如何做除法了。\n    4.N-VAR分歧；争议；差异A division is a significant distinction or argument between two groups, which causes the two groups to be considered as very different and separate. \n\n        The division between the prosperous west and the impoverished east remains.\n\n        繁荣的西部和贫穷的东部之间的差距仍然存在。\n    5.N-COUNT（大机构的）部门In a large organization, a division is a group of departments whose work is done in the same place or is connected with similar tasks. \n\n        ...the bank's Latin American division.\n\n        该银行的拉丁美洲分部\n\n        ...the sales division.\n\n        销售部\n    6.N-COUNT（军队编制中的）师A division is a group of military units which fight as a single unit. \n\n        Several armoured divisions are being moved from Germany.\n\n        正从德国调动几个装甲师。\n    7.N-COUNT（英国议会中的）分组表决In the British Parliament, a division is a vote where the Members of Parliament go into separate rooms in order to record their vote.\n    8.N-COUNT（足球等体育运动中联赛的）级In some sports, such as football, baseball, and basketball, a division is one of the groups of teams which make up a league. The teams in each division are considered to be approximately the same standard, and they all play against each other during the season. \n\n        Villa had just been relegated from the First Division.\n\n        维拉队刚刚从甲级联赛中降级。\n\n        ...the Scottish Premier Division leaders, Dundee United.\n\n        苏格兰超级联赛的领头羊，邓迪联队
interactive@adj. 相互作用的\n[计算机] 交互的    1.ADJ-GRADED交互的；人机对话的An interactive computer program or television system is one which allows direct communication between the user and the machine.\n\n        This will make videogames more interactive than ever.\n\n        这将使电子游戏的互动性更胜以往。\n\n    interactivity\n\n        ...cable broadcast companies that offer interactivity.\n\n        提供交互服务的有线广播公司\n    2.ADJ-GRADED互动的；互相交流的If you describe a group of people or their activities as interactive, you mean that the people communicate with each other.\n\n        ...flexible, interactive teaching in the classroom.\n\n        课堂上灵活互动的教学
corporate@adj.社团的, 法人的, 共同的, 全体的1.ADJ公司的Corporate means relating to business corporations or to a particular business corporation. \n\n    ...top US corporate executives. \n\n    美国顶级公司经理人\n\n    ...the UK corporate sector.\n\n    英国企业界\n\n    ...a corporate lawyer...\n\n    公司律师
cheongsam@ n. 旗袍
terrorize@v. 令人恐怖, 实施恐怖统治    in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 terrorise\n    1.VERB使惊恐；恐吓；威胁If someone terrorizes you, they keep you in a state of fear by making it seem likely that they will attack you. \n\n        Bands of gunmen have hijacked food shipments and terrorized relief workers.\n\n        几伙持枪歹徒劫持了运输的食品，还恐吓了救援人员。\n\n        ...pensioners terrorised by anonymous telephone calls.\n\n        受到匿名电话恐吓的领取养老金的人
mission@n. 任务,代表团,使命,传教\nvt. 传教\n[计算机] 使命    1.N-COUNT（尤指赴他国的）使命，重要任务A mission is an important task that people are given to do, especially one that involves travelling to another country. \n\n        Salisbury sent him on a diplomatic mission to North America...\n\n        索尔兹伯里派他到北美执行一项外交任务。\n\n        He has been on a mission to help end Lebanon's political crisis.\n\n        他已经被派执行一项旨在帮助结束黎巴嫩政治危机的使命。\n\n        ...the most crucial stage of his latest peace mission.\n\n        他最近执行的和平使命中最关键的一个阶段\n    2.N-COUNT驻外使团；出国代表团A mission is a group of people who have been sent to a foreign country to carry out an official task. \n\n        ...the head of the mission in South Africa.\n\n        驻南非代表团团长\n\n        ...a senior member of a diplomatic mission.\n\n        外交使团的高级成员\n    3.N-COUNT（军用飞机或航天火箭的）飞行任务A mission is a special journey made by a military aeroplane or space rocket. \n\n        ...a bomber that crashed during a training mission in the west Texas mountains.\n\n        在得克萨斯州西部山区执行训练任务时坠毁的轰炸机\n\n        ...the first shuttle mission.\n\n        首次航天飞行任务\n    4.N-SING使命；天职If you say that you have a mission, you mean that you have a strong commitment and sense of duty to do or achieve something. \n\n        He viewed his mission in life as protecting the weak from the evil...\n\n        他认为自己毕生的使命就是保护弱者不受邪恶势力的欺凌。\n\n        There is an enormous sense of mission in his speech and gesture.\n\n        他的一言一行都带着强烈的使命感。\n    5.N-COUNT（基督教徒的）传教，布道A mission is the activities of a group of Christians who have been sent to a place to teach people about Christianity.\n\n        They say God spoke to them and told them to go on a mission to the poorest country in the Western Hemisphere.\n\n        他们说上帝让他们去西半球最贫困的国家传播教义。\n    6.N-COUNT传教区；布道所A mission is a building or group of buildings in which missionary work is carried out.\n\n        I reside at the mission at St Michael's.\n\n        我住在圣·米歇尔教堂的传道会里。\n\n        ...schools, monasteries and other mission buildings.\n\n        学校、修道院及其他布道场所
refresher@ n. 进修, 使人清新的事物
posture@1.N-VAR（坐、立的）姿势，姿态Your posture is the position in which you stand or sit.\n\n    You can make your stomach look flatter instantly by improving your posture...\n\n    通过采取更好的坐姿，你的腹部马上就会看起来平坦一些。\n\n    Exercise, fresh air, and good posture are all helpful...\n\n    锻炼、新鲜空气和好的坐立姿势都很有益。\n\n    Sit in a relaxed upright posture.\n\n    保持放松、直立的坐姿。\n\n2.N-COUNT态度；立场A posture is an attitude that you have towards something. \n\n    The military machine is ready to change its defensive posture to one prepared for action...\n\n    军方随时准备由防御立场转向备战立场。\n\n    None of the banks changed their posture on the deal as a result of the inquiry.\n\n    没有一家银行因为这次调查而对该交易改变立场。\n\n3.VERB故作姿态；装腔作势；装模作样You can say that someone is posturing when you disapprove of their behaviour because you think they are trying to give a particular impression in order to deceive people. \n\n    She says the President may just be posturing.\n\n    她说总统也许只是在做样子而已。
proportional@adj. 成比例的,相称的\nn. [数]比例项    1.ADJ与…成比例的If one amount is proportional to another, the two amounts increase and decrease at the same rate so there is always the same relationship between them. \n\n        Loss of weight is directly proportional to the rate at which the disease is progressing.\n\n        体重的下降与病情发展的速度成正比。\n\n        ...a proportional fee based on the final sale price.\n\n        与最后销售价格成比例的费用\n\n    proportionally\n\n        You have proportionally more fat on your thighs and hips than anywhere else on your body...\n\n        相应地，你的大腿和臀部的脂肪比身体其他部位要多。\n\n        Candidates would be elected proportionally.\n\n        候选人将按比例进行选举。
reflex@    1.N-COUNT本能反应；习惯性动作A reflex or a reflex action is something that you do automatically and without thinking, as a habit or as a reaction to something.\n\n        Walsh fumbled in his pocket, a reflex from his smoking days...\n\n        沃尔什在口袋里摸索着，这是他抽烟时养成的习惯动作。\n\n        I turned to look inside the house in a reflex action.\n\n        我习惯性地转过身往房子里看了看。\n    2.N-COUNT条件反射；反射性动作A reflex or a reflex action is a normal, uncontrollable reaction of your body to something that you feel, see, or experience.\n\n        ...tests for reflexes, like tapping the knee or the heel with a rubber hammer.\n\n        如用橡胶槌敲击膝盖或脚跟那样的反射性动作测试\n\n        ...the stress hormone adrenaline, released by reflex action from the adrenal glands.\n\n        肾上腺条件反射释放出来的应激荷尔蒙肾上腺素\n    3.N-PLURAL反应力；应激能力Your reflexes are your ability to react quickly with your body when something unexpected happens, for example when you are involved in sport or when you are driving a car.\n\n        It takes great skill, cool nerves and the reflexes of an athlete.\n\n        那需要运动员有高超的技巧、冷静的头脑和迅速的反应能力。
withhold@    1.VERB拒绝给予；扣留If you withhold something that someone wants, you do not let them have it. \n\n        Police withheld the dead boy's name yesterday until relatives could be told...\n\n        警方昨天拒绝在通知亲属前透露死亡男孩的姓名。\n\n        Financial aid for Britain has been withheld...\n\n        向英国提供的经济援助已经被扣。\n\n        The captain decided to withhold the terrible news even from his officers.\n\n        船长决定哪怕是对高级船员也要封锁这个可怕的消息。\n\n    withholding\n\n        The withholding of property from the market may cause prices to be higher than normal.\n\n        捂盘可能导致房价过高。
drain@1.V-ERG排出；（使）流出If you drain a liquid from a place or object, you remove the liquid by causing it to flow somewhere else.
