If a liquid drains somewhere, it flows there. \n\n    Miners built the tunnel to drain water out of the mines... \n\n    矿工们开凿了一条地道，以排出矿井里的水。\n\n    Now the focus is on draining the water...\n\n    现在的重点是把水排走。\n\n    Springs and rivers that drain into lakes carry dissolved nitrates and phosphates...\n\n    流入湖中的泉水和河水携带了溶于水的硝酸盐和磷酸盐。\n\n2.V-ERG（使）流干；（使）排干If you drain a place or object, you dry it by causing water to flow out of it. If a place or object drains, water flows out of it until it is dry. \n\n    Vast numbers of people have been mobilised to drain flooded land...\n\n    大量的人力被动员去排干受涝的土地。\n\n    The soil drains freely and slugs aren't a problem.\n\n    土壤排水畅通，鼻涕虫就不会造成什么麻烦。\n\n3.V-ERG（使）（水分）滤去，滤干If you drain food or if food drains, you remove the liquid that it has been in, especially after it has been cooked or soaked in water. \n\n    Drain the pasta well, arrange on four plates and pour over the sauce...\n\n    将意大利面中的水分滤干，放在4个盘子里再淋上调味汁。\n\n    Wash the leeks thoroughly and allow them to drain.\n\n    彻底清洗韭葱，再沥去水分。\n\n4.N-COUNT下水道；排水管；阴沟A drain is a pipe that carries water or sewage away from a place, or an opening in a surface that leads to the pipe.\n\n    Tony built his own house and laid his own drains.\n\n    托尼自己盖了房子并铺设了下水管道。\n\n    ...storm drains.\n\n    排洪管\n\n5.VERB喝干；喝光If someone drains a glass, they empty it by drinking what is in it. \n\n    Pamela drained her glass and refilled it.\n\n    帕梅拉喝完后又续了一杯。\n\n6.V-ERG（使）（脸上血色）消失，消退If the colour or the blood drains or is drained from someone's face, they become very pale. You can also say that someone's face drains or is drained of colour. \n\n    Harry felt the colour drain from his face... \n\n    哈里觉得他脸上的血色在消失。\n\n    Thacker's face drained of colour...\n\n    撒克面无人色。\n\n    Jock's face had been suddenly drained of all colour...\n\n    乔克的脸突然变得煞白。\n\n7.V-ERG（情感）消失，消散If a feeling drains or is drained out of you, it gradually becomes less strong until you no longer feel it. \n\n    And then, suddenly, the euphoria began to drain away...\n\n    随后，狂喜的感觉突然开始消失了。\n\n    She felt the tension drain out of her...\n\n    她感到紧张情绪在消失。\n\n    The happiness and the excitement had been drained completely from her voice.\n\n    幸福和激动已经完全从她的声音中消失了。\n\n8.VERB使精疲力竭；使心力交瘁If something drains you, it leaves you feeling physically and emotionally exhausted. \n\n    My emotional turmoil had drained me.\n\n    纷乱的情绪让我心力交瘁。\n\ndrained\n\n    United left the pitch looking stunned and drained.\n\n    曼联队离开球场时看上去备受打击，身心俱疲。\n\ndraining\n\n    This work is physically exhausting and emotionally draining.\n\n    这项工作让人身心交瘁。\n\n9.V-ERG（使）（精力）耗尽If energy drains or is drained from you, you lose all energy and become very tired. \n\n    As his energy drained away, his despair and worry grew...\n\n    当他的精力耗尽时，他的绝望和担心也增加了。\n\n    I can help resolve conflicts that drain energy.\n\n    我可以帮助解决消耗精力的冲突。\n\ndrained\n\n    He could rest only when he was too drained of energy to fret further.\n\n    只有当他精疲力竭无力再操心时他才能得以休息。\n\n10.N-SINGSee also:brain drain；（金钱或资源的）大量消耗，耗竭，耗费If you say that something is a drain on an organization's finances or resources, you mean that it costs the organization a large amount of money, and you do not consider that it is worth it. \n\n    ...an ultra-modern printing plant, which has been a big drain on resources...\n\n    资源消耗很大的超现代印刷厂\n\n    Fraud trials are often complex and have become an expensive drain on the public purse.\n\n    诈骗案通常错综复杂，会给公共资金造成巨大损失。\n\n11.VERB用尽；耗尽；用完If you say that a country's or a company's resources or finances are drained, you mean that they are used or spent completely. \n\n    The state's finances have been drained by war...\n\n    国家财力已经被战争消耗殆尽。\n\n    The company has steadily drained its cash reserves.\n\n    公司已逐渐用完了其现金储备。\n\n12.PHRASE被毁掉；被浪费掉If you say that something is going down the drain, you mean that it is being destroyed or wasted. \n\n    They were aware that their public image was rapidly going down the drain...\n\n    他们意识到他们的公众形象正迅速被毁掉。\n\n    He lamented that four years of his life had gone down the drain because of an injury to his groin.\n\n    他痛惜他四年的生活就因大腿根部的伤被毁掉了。\n\n13.PHRASE破产；倒闭If you say that a business is going down the drain, you mean that it is failing financially. \n\n    Small local stores are going down the drain.\n\n    当地的小店都倒闭了。
coordinate@n. 同等的人物; (色调, 图案, 样式等)配套服装\nadj. 同等的, 等位的; (大学)男女分院制的\nv. 协调, 整合; 使一致\n[计算机] 坐标    The verb is pronounced /kəʊ'ɔːdɪneɪt/. The noun is pronounced /kəʊ'ɔːdɪnət/. 动词读作 /kəʊ'ɔːdɪneɪt/，名词读作 /kəʊ'ɔːdɪnət/。\n    1.VERB协调；调和If you co-ordinate an activity, you organize the various people and things involved in it. \n\n        Government officials visited the earthquake zone on Thursday morning to co-ordinate the relief effort.\n\n        星期四上午，政府官员视察地震灾区，以协调救援工作。\n\n        ...the setting up of an advisory committee to co-ordinate police work.\n\n        建立咨询委员会以协调警务工作\n\n    co-ordinated\n\n        ...a rapid and well co-ordinated international rescue operation.\n\n        迅速而且协调有序的国际救援行动\n\n    co-ordinator\n\n        ...the party's campaign co-ordinator, Mr Peter Mandelson.\n\n        该党的竞选协调人，彼得·曼德尔森先生\n    2.V-RECIP-ERG（使）和谐；（使）协调If you co-ordinate clothes or furnishings that are used together, or if they co-ordinate, they are similar in some way and look nice together. \n\n        She'll show you how to co-ordinate pattern and colours... \n\n        她会教你如何搭配款式和颜色。\n\n        Tie it with fabric bows that co-ordinate with other furnishings...\n\n        系上与其他装饰相配的布质蝴蝶结。\n\n        Colours and looks must fit the themes of the seasons so that the shops co-ordinate well.\n\n        颜色和外观必须符合季节的主题，这样各个商家看起来才会比较协调。\n    3.N-PLURAL套装；配套的装饰Co-ordinates are pieces of clothing or soft furnishings which are similar and which are intended to be worn or used together.\n\n        ...new lingerie co-ordinates.\n\n        新的内衣套装\n    4.VERB使（身体各部分）协调If you co-ordinate the different parts of your body, you make them work together efficiently to perform particular movements. \n\n        They spend several weeks each year undergoing intensive treatment which enables them to coordinate their limbs better.\n\n        他们每年都花费几周的时间接受强化治疗，以使四肢能够更好地协调。\n    5.N-COUNT坐标The co-ordinates of a point on a map or graph are the two sets of numbers or letters that you need in order to find that point. \n\n        Can you give me your co-ordinates?\n\n        您能告诉我您的坐标吗？\n\n        ...the latitude and longitude co-ordinates of any location in the world.\n\n        世界各地的经纬坐标
bodice@n. 女人穿的紧身上衣，妇女紧身马甲，妇女紧身胸衣    1.N-COUNT（连衣裙）上身The bodice of a dress is the part above the waist.\n\n        ...dress with a fitted bodice and circle skirt.\n\n        贴身束胸并搭配圆形下摆的连衣裙
askew@adj. 歪斜的\nadv. 斜地\nv. 歪斜,弯曲    1.ADJ-GRADED斜的；歪的；不平的Something that is askew is not straight or not level with what it should be level with. \n\n        She stood there, hat askew...\n\n        她站在那里，歪戴着帽子。\n\n        There were no shutters at the windows, and some of the doors hung askew.\n\n        窗户上没有百叶窗，有几扇门也歪歪扭扭的。
startle@    1.VERB惊吓；使吓一跳If something sudden and unexpected startles you, it surprises and frightens you slightly. \n\n        The telephone startled him...\n\n        电话铃声吓了他一跳。\n\n        Sorry, I didn't mean to startle you...\n\n        对不起，我不是故意想吓你一跳的。\n\n        The news will startle the City.\n\n        这个消息会让伦敦商业区的人们大吃一惊。\n\n    startled\n\n        Martha gave her a startled look.\n\n        玛莎吃惊地看了她一眼。
tranquil@    1.ADJ-GRADED平静的；安静的；宁静的Something that is tranquil is calm and peaceful.\n\n        The tranquil atmosphere of The Connaught allows guests to feel totally at home...\n\n        康诺特酒店的宁静氛围让客人完全找到了宾至如归的感觉。\n\n        The place was tranquil and appealing.\n\n        那个地方恬静宜人。\n\n    tranquillity\n\n        The hotel is a haven of peace and tranquillity.\n\n        这家宾馆是一个安谧的憩息之所。
fluffy@    1.ADJ-GRADED绒毛似的；松软的；蓬松的If you describe something such as a towel or a toy animal as fluffy, you mean that it is very soft.\n\n        ...fluffy white towels...\n\n        柔软的白毛巾\n\n        It's a very fluffy kind of wool.\n\n        这种羊毛质地非常柔软。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（食物）松软的A cake or other food that is fluffy is very light because it has a lot of air in it.\n\n        Cream together the margarine and sugar with a wooden spoon until light and fluffy.\n\n        用一只木勺把人造黄油和糖搅拌成稀松的糊状。
laundry@1.N-UNCOUNT将要（或正在）洗的衣物；刚洗好的衣物Laundry is used to refer to clothes, sheets, and towels that are about to be washed, are being washed, or have just been washed.\n\n    I'll do your laundry...\n\n    我来帮你洗衣服。\n\n    ...the room where I hang the laundry...\n\n    我晾挂衣服的房间\n\n    He'd put his dirty laundry in the clothes basket.\n\n    他会把自己的脏衣服扔进洗衣篮里。\n\n2.N-COUNT洗衣公司；洗衣店A laundry is a firm that washes and irons clothes, sheets, and towels for people.\n\n    We had to have the washing done at the laundry.\n\n    我们得把衣服拿到洗衣店去洗。\n\n3.N-COUNT洗衣间；洗衣房A laundry or a laundry room is a room in a house, hotel, or institution where clothes, sheets, and towels are washed. \n\n    He worked in the laundry at Oxford prison.\n\n    他在牛津监狱的洗衣房工作。
motif@    1.N-COUNT（作为装饰的）图形，图式A motif is a design which is used as a decoration or as part of an artistic pattern. \n\n        ...a rose motif.\n\n        玫瑰图案\n    2.N-COUNT主题；中心思想A motif is a theme or idea that is frequently repeated throughout a piece of literature or music.\n\n        The motif of these volumes is that 'solitude is the richness of the soul, loneliness is its poverty.'\n\n        这几卷的主题是“孤独是灵魂的财富，寂寞是灵魂的贫瘠”。
deposit@    1.N-COUNT订金；保证金A deposit is a sum of money which is part of the full price of something, and which you pay when you agree to buy it. \n\n        A £50 deposit is required when ordering, and the balance is due upon delivery.\n\n        订货时需要交50英镑的订金，货到后余款结清。\n    2.N-COUNT（租赁的）押金A deposit is a sum of money which you pay when you start renting something. The money is returned to you if you do not damage what you have rented. \n\n        It is common to ask for the equivalent of a month's rent as a deposit.\n\n        要求交一个月的房租作押金是很常见的。\n    3.N-COUNT（尤指定期）存款A deposit is a sum of money which is in a bank account or savings account, especially a sum which will be left there for some time.\n    4.N-COUNT竞选保证金（参加议会或欧洲选举时提交，如获一定比例选票便可返还）A deposit is a sum of money which you have to pay if you want to be a candidate in a parliamentary or European election. The money is returned to you if you receive more than a certain percentage of the votes. \n\n        The Tory candidate lost his deposit.\n\n        这名托利党候选人连竞选保证金都搭进去了。\n    5.N-COUNT沉淀物；沉积物A deposit is an amount of a substance that has been left somewhere as a result of a chemical or geological process. \n\n        After 10 minutes the surplus material is washed away and any remaining deposit examined with ultra violet light.\n\n        10分钟后剩余的物质被冲洗掉，任何残留的沉淀物则会用紫外线进行检测。\n\n        ...underground deposits of gold and diamonds.\n\n        地下金矿和金刚石矿\n\n        ...mineral deposits.\n\n        矿藏\n    6.VERB放下；放置；丢下To deposit someone or something somewhere means to put them or leave them there. \n\n        Someone was seen depositing a packet...\n\n        有人看见一个人放下了件小包裹。\n\n        Fritz deposited a glass and two bottles of beer in front of Wolfe...\n\n        弗里茨把一个玻璃杯和两瓶啤酒放在沃尔夫面前。\n\n        Imagine if you were suddenly swept up and deposited in Morocco. How well could you cope with the language, the weather, the people, and so on?\n\n        设想一下你突然被带走丢到了摩洛哥。你能多好地适应那里的语言、天气和人等等？\n    7.VERB存放；寄存If you deposit something somewhere, you put it where it will be safe until it is needed again. \n\n        You are advised to deposit valuables in the hotel safe.\n\n        建议把贵重物品存放在宾馆的保险箱里。\n    8.VERB将（钱）存入银行（或储蓄）账户If you deposit a sum of money, you pay it into a bank account or savings account. \n\n        The customer has to deposit a minimum of £100 monthly.\n\n        顾客必须每月至少存 100 英镑。\n    9.VERB使沉淀；使沉积If a substance is deposited somewhere, it is left there as a result of a chemical or geological process. \n\n        The phosphate was deposited by the decay of marine microorganisms.\n\n        海洋微生物腐烂后沉积形成磷酸盐。
graffiti@n. (sing为graffito)涂鸦    1.N-UNCOUNT-COLL（在公共场所的）涂画，涂鸦Graffiti is words or pictures that are written or drawn in public places, for example on walls or posters.\n\n        Buildings old and new are thickly covered with graffiti...\n\n        新老建筑上都有密密麻麻的涂鸦。\n\n        There's no vandalism, no graffiti, no rubbish left lying about.\n\n        没有损害公共财物的行为，也没有涂鸦和随处丢弃的垃圾。
earful@    1.N-SING（长时间的）训斥，数落If you say that you got an earful, you mean that someone spoke angrily to you for quite a long time. \n\n        I bet Sue gave you an earful when you got home.\n\n        我敢说你到家时休肯定训了你一顿。
peekaboo@ n. (和小孩子玩的)躲猫猫游戏\nadj. 用透明薄织物制的，用网眼刺绣镶边的
lingerie@1.N-UNCOUNT女式贴身内衣裤；女内衣；女睡衣Lingerie is women's underwear and nightclothes.
frosty@    1.ADJ-GRADED霜冻的；严寒的If the weather is frosty, the temperature is below freezing.\n\n        ...sharp, frosty nights.\n\n        寒冷刺骨的夜晚\n    2.ADJ-GRADED结霜的；被霜覆盖的You describe the ground or an object as frosty when it is covered with frost.\n\n        The street was deserted except for a cat lifting its paws off the frosty stones.\n\n        街上空无一人，只有一只猫在结霜的石砖上拾爪而行。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED冷淡的；冷若冰霜的If you describe someone's behaviour as frosty, you think it is unfriendly.\n\n        The president may get a frosty reception in New Hampshire...\n\n        总统在新罕布什尔州可能会受到冷遇。\n\n        The relationship has obviously become frosty.\n\n        很明显关系已经变冷了。\n\n    frostily\n\n        The Prime Minister smiled again, this time a trifle frostily.\n\n        首相又笑了笑，这回有点儿冷冰冰的。\n\n    frostiness\n\n        There was a certain frostiness in his smile.\n\n        他的笑容带着些许冷漠。
valiant@    1.ADJ-GRADED勇敢的；果决的；无畏的A valiant action is very brave and determined, though it may lead to failure or defeat. \n\n        Despite valiant efforts by the finance minister, inflation rose to 36%.\n\n        尽管财政部部长采取了一系列果决措施，通货膨胀率还是涨到了36%。\n\n        ...a valiant attempt to keep the business going.\n\n        为把生意维持下去而作的勇敢尝试\n\n    valiantly\n\n        He suffered further heart attacks and strokes, all of which he fought valiantly.\n\n        他还曾遭受心脏病和中风的折磨，但他都顽强地挺了过来。
marksmanship@1.N-UNCOUNT枪法；射击术Marksmanship is the ability to shoot accurately.
abysmal@adj. 深不可测的, 无底的，糟透了的    1.ADJ-GRADED极坏的；糟透的If you describe a situation or the condition of something as abysmal, you think that it is very bad or poor in quality.\n\n        ...our abysmal record at producing a scientifically trained workforce...\n\n        我们在培育具有科学素养的专业人才方面惨不忍睹的记录\n\n        The general standard of racing was abysmal.\n\n        竞赛总体水平极糟。\n\n    abysmally\n\n        The standard of education was abysmally low...\n\n        教育水平极低。\n\n        As the chart shows, it has failed abysmally.\n\n        如图表所示，它一败涂地。
whistle@1.VERB吹口哨；用口哨吹出（曲调）When you whistle or when you whistle a tune, you make a series of musical notes by forcing your breath out between your lips, or your teeth. \n\n    He whistled and sang snatches of songs...\n\n    他吹口哨并唱了几段小曲。\n\n    He was whistling softly to himself...\n\n    他轻声吹着口哨。\n\n    As he washed he whistled a tune.\n\n    他边洗边用口哨吹着小曲。\n\n2.VERBSee also:wolf-whistle；（吃惊、唤狗、赞叹等时）发出口哨声When someone whistles, they make a sound by forcing their breath out between their lips or their teeth. People sometimes whistle when they are surprised or shocked, or to call a dog, or to show that they are impressed. \n\n    He whistled, surprised but not shocked...\n\n    他吹了声口哨，很是惊讶但没有被吓住。\n\n    Jenkins whistled through his teeth, impressed at last...\n\n    詹金斯吹了声口哨，最终被打动了。\n\n    Women don't enjoy being whistled at.\n\n    女士不喜欢别人冲她们吹口哨。\n\n    Whistle is also a noun.\n\n        Jackson gave a low whistle.\n\n        杰克逊低声吹了下口哨。\n\n3.VERB（火车）鸣汽笛；（水开时水壶）发出尖啸声If something such as a train or a kettle whistles, it makes a loud, high sound. \n\n    Somewhere a train whistled...\n\n    不知哪里的火车在鸣汽笛。\n\n    ...the whistling car radio.\n\n    车载收音机的尖啸声\n\nwhistling\n\n    ...the whistling of the wind.\n\n    风声飕飕\n\n4.VERB（风、子弹等）呼啸而过If something such as the wind or a bullet whistles somewhere, it moves there, making a loud, high sound. \n\n    The wind was whistling through the building...\n\n    风呼啸着穿过大楼。\n\n    As I stood up a bullet whistled past my back.\n\n    我起身时一颗子弹嗖的一声从我背后擦过。\n\n5.N-COUNT（空气或液流通过狭窄孔洞时发出的）呼啸声；（物体在空气中快速移动时的）呼呼声A whistle is a loud sound produced by air or steam being forced through a small opening, or by something moving quickly through the air. \n\n    Hugh listened to the whistle of a train.\n\n    休听着火车呼啸而过。\n\n    ...the whistle of the wind.\n\n    呼啸的风声\n\n    ...a shrill whistle from the boiling kettle.\n\n    水壶在水开时发出的尖啸声\n\n6.N-COUNT哨子A whistle is a small metal tube which you blow in order to produce a loud sound and attract someone's attention.\n\n    On the platform, the guard blew his whistle...\n\n    平台上的警卫吹响了哨子。\n\n    The referee blew his whistle for a penalty.\n\n    裁判鸣哨判罚。\n\n7.N-COUNT上下班的哨声Some factories and other places where people work have a whistle which signals the beginning and the end of the working day.\n\n    Every night you could hear the whistles of the steel mill.\n\n    每晚你都会听见炼钢厂的下班哨声。\n\n8.N-COUNTSee also:tin whistle；口哨（一种乐器）A whistle is a simple musical instrument in the shape of a metal pipe with holes.\n\n9.PHRASESee also:whistle-blower；（尤指向当权者）告发，揭发If you blow the whistle on someone, or on something secret or illegal, you tell another person, especially a person in authority, what is happening. \n\n    Companies should protect employees who blow the whistle on dishonest workmates and work practices.\n\n    公司应该保护那些检举不诚实的工友及工作行为的员工。
jack up@    1.PHRASAL VERB用千斤顶托起（汽车等）If you jack up a heavy object such as a car, you raise it off the ground using a jack. \n\n        They jacked up the car...\n\n        他们用千斤顶托起了汽车。\n\n        All I had to do was jack the car up and put on the spare.\n\n        我要做的就是用千斤顶把汽车托起来，再把备胎换上。\n    2.PHRASAL VERB不合理地抬高，哄抬（价格）；大幅度增加（数量）To jack up the price or amount of something means to increase it to an unreasonable or unacceptable level. \n\n        The plan would cost so much that the company would have to jack up its prices...\n\n        这一计划耗资巨大，公司将不得不大幅度提高价格。\n\n        Inflation has jacked up the rate of unemployment.\n\n        通货膨胀导致了失业率的大幅攀升。
prohibit@    1.VERB（法律或掌权者）禁止，不允许If a law or someone in authority prohibits something, they forbid it or make it illegal. \n\n        ...a law that prohibits tobacco advertising in newspapers and magazines...\n\n        禁止在报刊杂志上刊登香烟广告的法律\n\n        Fishing is prohibited...\n\n        禁止钓鱼。\n\n        Federal law prohibits foreign airlines from owning more than 25% of any U.S. airline.\n\n        联邦法律禁止外国航空公司拥有任何一家美国航空公司超过25%的股权份额。\n\n    prohibition\n\n        ...the prohibition of women on air combat missions.\n\n        禁止女性参加空中作战任务
personnel@    1.N-PLURAL（组织中的）人员，职员The personnel of an organization are the people who work for it. \n\n        Five other US military personnel were killed in various incidents...\n\n        另有5名美军士兵死于各种意外。\n\n        There has been very little renewal of personnel in higher education...\n\n        从事高等教育的人员新老更替极其缓慢。\n\n        If you need help at work, your Personnel Manager should be able to help.\n\n        如果你工作中需要帮助，人事经理应该能帮上忙。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT人事部门Personnel is the department in a large company or organization that deals with employees, keeps their records, and helps with any problems they might have. \n\n        Her first job was in personnel.\n\n        她的第一份工作是人事方面的。
authorize@1.VERB授权；委托；批准；准许；认可If someone in a position of authority authorizes something, they give their official permission for it to happen. \n\n    It would certainly be within his power to authorize a police raid like that...\n\n    他绝对有权批准那样的一次警方突袭行动。\n\n    We are willing to authorize the president to use force if necessary.\n\n    我们愿意授权总统在必要的时候使用武力。\n\nauthorization\n\n    The United Nations will approve his request for authorization to use military force to deliver aid.\n\n    联合国将批准他动用军队运送救援物资的请求。
coffin@    1.N-COUNT棺材；灵柩A coffin is a box in which a dead body is buried or cremated.\n    2.PHRASE促使…失败（或完结）的因素If you say that one thing is a nail in the coffin of another thing, you mean that it will help bring about its end or failure. \n\n        A fine would be the final nail in the coffin of the airline.\n\n        罚款将会是对这家航空公司的最后致命一击。
pin@1.N-COUNT别针；大头针Pins are very small thin pointed pieces of metal. They are used in sewing to fasten pieces of material together until they have been sewn.\n\n    ...needles and pins...\n\n    针和别针\n\n    Use pins to keep the braid in place as you work.\n\n    工作时，用别针把辫子固定住。\n\n2.VERB（用别针等）别住；（用图钉等）钉住If you pin something on or to something, you attach it with a pin, a drawing pin, or a safety pin. \n\n    They pinned a notice to the door...\n\n    他们把通知钉在门上。\n\n    Everyone was supposed to dance with the bride and pin money on her dress...\n\n    每个人都要和新娘跳舞，并把钱别在她的衣服上。\n\n    He had pinned up a map of Finland.\n\n    他把一张芬兰地图钉在了墙上。\n\n3.VERB按住；压住；使动弹不得If someone pins you to something, they press you against a surface so that you cannot move. \n\n    I pinned him against the wall...\n\n    我把他按在墙上。\n\n    I'd try to get away and he'd pin me down, saying he would kill me...\n\n    我曾试图逃脱，可他把我摁倒在地，并说会杀了我。\n\n    She fought at the bulk that pinned her.\n\n    她与压着她的大块头进行了搏斗。\n\n4.N-COUNT（尤指把两件东西固定在一起的）销，栓，楔，钉A pin is any long narrow piece of metal or wood that is not sharp, especially one that is used to fasten two things together.\n\n    ...the 18-inch steel pin holding his left leg together.\n\n    把他的左腿固定在一起的一枚18英寸的钢钉\n\n    ...a two-pin continental adaptor.\n\n    欧洲大陆标准的双脚转换插头\n\n5.VERB（常指不公正地）把…归罪于，把…归咎于If someone tries to pin something on you or to pin the blame on you, they say, often unfairly, that you were responsible for something bad or illegal. \n\n    They're trying to pin it on us...\n\n    他们想把那件事归罪于我们。\n\n    The trade unions are pinning the blame for the violence on the government.\n\n    工会把暴力事件的责任推在政府身上。\n\n6.VERB把（希望、信心等）寄托在…上If you pin your hopes on something or pin your faith on something, you hope very much that it will produce the result you want. \n\n    The Democrats are pinning their hopes on the next election.\n\n    民主党人把希望寄托在下次选举上。\n\n7.VERB用发夹把（头发）别住If someone pins their hair up or pins their hair back, they arrange their hair away from their face using hair pins. \n\n    Cleanse your face thoroughly and pin back your hair...\n\n    把脸彻底洗干净，再把头发往后别起。\n\n    In an effort to look older she has pinned her fair hair into a French pleat.\n\n    为了看上去显得成熟一些，她把金发别成了一个法式髻。\n\n8.N-COUNT胸针；饰针；（背面有别针的）徽章，像章A pin is something worn on your clothing, for example as jewellery, which is fastened with a pointed piece of metal. \n\n    ...necklaces, bracelets, and pins.\n\n    项链、手镯和胸针\n\n9.N-COUNT（手榴弹的）保险针，保险销A pin is the part of a hand grenade that is pulled out in order to make the grenade explode.
approximately@    The adjective is pronounced /ə'prɒksɪmət/. The verb is pronounced /ə'prɒksɪmeɪt/. 形容词读作 /ə'prɒksɪmət/，动词读作 /ə'prɒksɪ- meɪt/。\n    1.ADJ-GRADED大约的；大概的An approximate number, time, or position is close to the correct number, time, or position, but is not exact.\n\n        The approximate cost varies from around £150 to £250...\n\n        费用大概介于150至250英镑之间。\n\n        The times are approximate only.\n\n        这些只是大致的时间。\n\n    approximately\n\n        Approximately $150 million is to be spent on improvements.\n\n        大约1。5亿美元将用于作出改善。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED近似的；粗略的An idea or description that is approximate is not intended to be precise or accurate, but to give some indication of what something is like.\n\n        They did not have even an approximate idea what the Germans really wanted.\n\n        他们完全不清楚德国人真正想要什么。\n    3.VERB近似于If something approximates to something else, it is similar to it but is not exactly the same. \n\n        Something approximating to a fair outcome will be ensured...\n\n        保证会有大致公正的结果。\n\n        By about 6 weeks of age, most babies begin to show something approximating a day/night sleeping pattern.\n\n        到6个星期大时，大多数婴儿开始表现出近似于日夜分明的睡觉模式。
bleak@    1.ADJ-GRADED（情形）没有希望的，前景暗淡的If a situation is bleak, it is bad, and seems unlikely to improve.\n\n        The immediate outlook remains bleak...\n\n        近期前景依然暗淡。\n\n        Many predicted a bleak future.\n\n        很多人都预测前景暗淡。\n\n    bleakness\n\n        The continued bleakness of the American job market was blamed.\n\n        美国就业市场的持续低迷被视为罪魁祸首。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（地方）凄清的，荒凉的，萧瑟的If you describe a place as bleak, you mean that it looks cold, empty, and unattractive.\n\n        The island's pretty bleak.\n\n        这座岛屿一片荒凉。\n\n        ...bleak inner-city streets.\n\n        凄清的旧城区街道\n    3.ADJ-GRADED（天气）阴冷的，寒冷的When the weather is bleak, it is cold, dull, and unpleasant.\n\n        The weather can be quite bleak on the coast.\n\n        沿海地区的天气会非常阴冷。\n    4.ADJ-GRADED（人）无精打采的，沮丧的，阴郁的If someone looks or sounds bleak, they look or sound depressed, as if they have no hope or energy.\n\n        His face was bleak...\n\n        他脸色阴郁。\n\n        Alberg gave him a bleak stare.\n\n        阿尔伯格沮丧地凝视着他。
confidential@    1.ADJ-GRADED秘密的；机密的Information that is confidential is meant to be kept secret or private.\n\n        She accused them of leaking confidential information about her private life...\n\n        她指责他们泄露其私生活的秘密。\n\n        We'll take good care and keep what you've told us strictly confidential, Mr. Lane.\n\n        莱恩先生，我们会非常小心，对您告诉我们的事严格保密。\n\n    confidentially\n\n        People can phone in the knowledge that any information they give will be treated confidentially.\n\n        人们尽可放心地打电话来，他们提供的任何信息都会被保密。\n\n    confidentiality\n\n        ...the confidentiality of the client-solicitor relationship.\n\n        委托人与律师之间的保密关系\n    2.ADJ-GRADED悄悄的；隐秘的If you talk to someone in a confidential way, you talk to them quietly because what you are saying is secret or private. \n\n        'Look,' he said in a confidential tone, 'I want you to know that me and Joey are cops.'...\n\n        “听着，”他悄声说，“我想让你知道我和乔伊是警察。”\n\n        His face suddenly turned solemn, his voice confidential.\n\n        他脸上的神情突然严肃起来，声音也压低了。\n\n    confidentially\n\n        Nash hadn't raised his voice, still spoke rather softly, confidentially.\n\n        纳什没有提高嗓门，依然悄声说着，相当轻柔。
equinox@    1.N-COUNT二分时刻，昼夜平分日（指春分或秋分）An equinox is one of the two days in the year when day and night are of equal length. \n\n        In the Chinese calendar, the Spring Equinox always occurs in the second month.\n\n        在中国历法中，春分总是出现在2月。
enrage@    1.VERB激怒；使非常愤怒If you are enraged by something, it makes you extremely angry. \n\n        He was enraged by news of plans to demolish the pub...\n\n        看到计划拆除酒馆的新闻，他非常愤怒。\n\n        He enraged the government by renouncing the agreement.\n\n        他否认那项协议，从而激怒了政府。\n\n    enraged\n\n        I began getting more and more enraged at my father...\n\n        我开始变得越来越生父亲的气了。\n\n        The enraged crowd stoned the car, then set it on fire.\n\n        愤怒的人群向那辆车扔石头，然后放火烧它。
fright@1.N-UNCOUNT（尤指令人不快的事意外发生造成的）惊骇，恐惧Fright is a sudden feeling of fear, especially the fear that you feel when something unpleasant surprises you.\n\n    The steam pipes rattled suddenly, and Franklin uttered a shriek and jumped with fright...\n\n    蒸汽管突然发出咯咯的响声，富兰克林尖叫一声，吓得跳了起来。\n\n    The birds smashed into the top of their cages in fright...\n\n    鸟儿惊恐地冲过去，撞到了笼子顶上。\n\n    To hide my fright I asked a question.\n\n    为了掩饰自己的恐惧，我问了个问题。\n\n2.N-COUNT惊吓；恐怖的体验A fright is an experience which makes you suddenly afraid. \n\n    The snake picked up its head and stuck out its tongue which gave everyone a fright...\n\n    蛇突然昂起头，吐出芯子，每个人都吓了一跳。\n\n    The last time you had a real fright, you nearly crashed the car.\n\n    上一次你吓得够呛，差点儿把车撞烂了。\n\n3.PHRASE（因…）受惊吓If a person or animal takes fright at something, they are suddenly frightened by it, and want to run away or to stop doing what they are doing. \n\n    An untrained horse had taken fright at the sound of gunfire...\n\n    一匹未经训练的马听到枪响受了惊。\n\n    When costs soared, the studio took fright and recalled the company from Rome.\n\n    成本一路狂飙，制片厂受惊之余撤回了罗马的公司。
cityscape@ n. 城市风光，城市景色
crimson@n. 深红色\nadj. 深红色的\nv. 变为深红色, 脸红    1.COLOUR深红色；暗红色Something that is crimson is deep red in colour.\n\n        ...a mass of crimson flowers.\n\n        一大片火红的花\n\n        ...the lurid, crimson glow of the blast furnaces.\n\n        鼓风炉里耀眼、通红的火光\n    2.ADJ（因生气或害羞）脸通红的If a person goes crimson, their face becomes red because they are angry or embarrassed. \n\n        I used to refuse invitations to parties because I knew I'd go crimson every time someone talked to me.\n\n        我过去总是拒绝聚会邀请，因为我知道每当有人和我说话，我就会脸红。
terminus@    1.N-COUNT（公共汽车、火车的）终点站On a bus or train route, the terminus is the last stop, where the bus or train turns round or starts a journey in the opposite direction.\n\n        ...the London terminus of the Channel Tunnel rail link.\n\n        英吉利海峡隧道连接铁路的伦敦终点站
immortality@n. 不朽, 永生    1.ADJ不朽的；流芳百世的Someone or something that is immortal is famous and likely to be remembered for a long time. \n\n        ...the immortal Reverend Dr Spooner.\n\n        不朽的斯普纳牧师\n\n        ...Wuthering Heights, Emily Bronte's immortal love story...\n\n        《呼啸山庄》，艾米莉·勃朗特不朽的爱情小说\n\n        Maybe my work is not immortal, but it will live for a while.\n\n        也许我的作品不能流芳百世，但它能流传一阵子。\n\n        An immortal is someone who is immortal.不朽人物；流芳百世的人物\n\n            He called Moore 'one of the immortals of soccer'.\n\n            他把摩尔称作“足球伟人之一”。\n\n    immortality\n\n        Some people want to achieve immortality through their works.\n\n        有些人想通过其作品流芳百世。\n    2.ADJ不死的；长生的Someone or something that is immortal will live or last for ever and never die or be destroyed. \n\n        The pharaohs were considered gods and therefore immortal.\n\n        法老们被视为神灵，且长生不死。\n\n        An immortal is an immortal being.神仙；长生不死者\n\n            ...porcelain figurines of the Chinese immortals.\n\n            瓷制的中国神仙塑像\n\n    immortality\n\n        The Greeks accepted belief in the immortality of the soul.\n\n        希腊人相信灵魂不灭。\n    3.ADJ（语句）著名的，不朽的If you refer to someone's immortal words, you mean that what they said is well-known, and you are usually about to quote it. \n\n        ...Roosevelt's immortal words, 'Speak softly and carry a big stick.'\n\n        罗斯福的不朽名言——“说话温和，手持大棒”\n\n        I keep remembering Hannah Pakula's immortal line: 'Hollywood is no place for a woman over forty with a library card.'\n\n        我一直谨记汉娜·帕库拉的名言：“好莱坞不是年过四十手拿图书证的女人呆的地方。”
combustion@    1.N-UNCOUNTSee also:internal combustion engine；燃烧；燃烧过程Combustion is the act of burning something or the process of burning. \n\n        The energy is released by combustion on the application of a match...\n\n        火柴点燃后在燃烧过程中释放能量。\n\n        The two principal combustion products are water vapor and carbon dioxide.\n\n        两种主要的燃烧产物是水蒸气和二氧化碳。
submarine@1.N-COUNT潜艇（亦使用缩略形式sub）A submarine is a type of ship that can travel both above and below the surface of the sea. The abbreviation sub is also used.\n\n    ...a nuclear submarine.\n\n    核潜艇\n\n2.ADJ水下的；海底的Submarine means existing below the surface of the sea. \n\n    ...submarine caves.\n\n    海底洞穴\n\n    ...submarine plants.\n\n    海底植物\n\n3.N-COUNT潜艇三明治，长卷三明治（亦使用缩略形式sub）A submarine sandwich is a long soft bread roll filled with a combination of things such as meat, cheese, eggs, and salad. The abbreviation sub is also used.
fodder@n. 饲料, 草料，原料\nvt. 供草料    1.N-UNCOUNT饲料；草料；秣Fodder is food that is given to cows, horses, and other animals.\n\n        ...fodder for horses...\n\n        马饲料\n\n        The alfalfa plant is widely used as animal fodder.\n\n        苜蓿科植物广泛用作动物饲料。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT素材；材料If you say that something is fodder for a particular purpose, you mean that it is useful for that purpose and perhaps nothing else. \n\n        The press conference simply provided more fodder for another attack on his character...\n\n        记者招待会只不过是提供了更多的再次击他人格的口实。\n\n        Old movies were the cheapest broadcast fodder.\n\n        老电影是最廉价的播放素材。
commend@    1.VERB赞扬；赞许If you commend someone or something, you praise them formally. \n\n        I commended her for that action... \n\n        我赞扬了她的那一举动。\n\n        I commend Ms. Orth on writing such an informative article...\n\n        我对奥思太太写出内容如此翔实的文章表示赞许。\n\n        The book was widely commended for its candour...\n\n        这本书以其直言不讳而广受好评。\n\n    commendation\n\n        The Company received a commendation from the Royal Society of Arts.\n\n        公司受到了皇家艺术协会的赞扬。\n    2.VERB推荐；举荐If someone commends a person or thing to you, they tell you that you will find them good or useful. \n\n        I can commend it to him as a realistic course of action.\n\n        我可以把这作为一个切实可行的处理方法推荐给他。\n    3.VERB被接受；得到认可If something commends itself to you, you approve of it. \n\n        The Rousseau model commended itself to a lot of early socialists.\n\n        卢梭提出的模式被很多早期的社会主义者接受。\n    4.PHRASE令人称道/乏善可陈If you say that something has much to commend it, you approve of it. If you say that something has little to commend it, you disapprove of it. \n\n        The Prime Minister's initiative has much to commend it.\n\n        首相的新方案有不少令人赞许之处。
subspecies@    1.N-COUNT（动植物的）亚种A sub-species of a plant or animal is one of the types that a particular species is divided into. \n\n        Several other sub-species of gull are found in the region.\n\n        在该地区还发现了海鸥的其他亚种。
apprentice@    1.N-COUNT学徒；徒弟An apprentice is a young person who works for someone in order to learn their skill. \n\n        I started off as an apprentice and worked my way up...\n\n        我从学徒开始干起，逐步上升。\n\n        He left school at 15 and trained as an apprentice carpenter.\n\n        他15岁辍学，当上木工学徒。\n    2.VERB使拜师于；使当…的学徒If a young person is apprenticed to someone, they go to work for them in order to learn their skill. \n\n        I was apprenticed to a builder when I was fourteen.\n\n        14岁时，我拜一个建筑工人为师当学徒。
dispense@1.VERB分配；分发；施与If someone dispenses something that they own or control, they give or provide it to a number of people. \n\n    The Union had already dispensed £40,000 in grants...\n\n    工会已经拨款4万英镑。\n\n    The local welfare office is where government dispenses many of its services...\n\n    地方福利部门就是政府贯彻实施其众多服务的窗口。\n\n    I thought of myself as a patriarch, dispensing words of wisdom to all my children.\n\n    我把自己当作在向子女传授至理名言的一家之长。\n\n2.VERB（机器自动）提供（货物等）If you obtain a product by getting it out of a machine, you can say that the machine dispenses the product. \n\n    For two weeks, the cash machine was unable to dispense money.\n\n    该自动取款机已有两个星期不能提供现金。\n\n    The lotion is dispensed by a handy pump action spray.\n\n    洗液由一个使用方便的按压式皂液器提供。\n\n3.VERB配（药）；配（方）；发（药）When a chemist dispenses medicine, he or she prepares it, and gives or sells it to the patient or customer. \n\n    Some shops gave wrong or inadequate advice when dispensing homeopathic medicines...\n\n    有些药店在配发顺势疗法的药物时给出了错误或不当的建议。\n\n    Four out of five prescriptions are dispensed free to people who are exempt...\n\n    五分之四的处方是免费配给那些免除了医疗费的病人的。\n\n    Doctors confine themselves to prescribing rather than dispensing.\n\n    医生仅仅是开药而不配药。\n\n    1.PHRASAL VERB摒弃；省却；不用If you dispense with something, you stop using it or get rid of it completely, especially because you no longer need it. \n\n        Many households have dispensed with their old-fashioned vinyl turntable.\n\n        很多家庭都将老式的黑胶唱机束之高阁了。
succumb@v. 屈从, 死    1.VERB屈从于，屈服于，抵挡不住（诱惑或压力）If you succumb to temptation or pressure, you do something that you want to do, or that other people want you to do, although you feel it might be wrong. \n\n        Don't succumb to the temptation to have just one cigarette...\n\n        不要经不住诱惑，只抽一支烟也不行。\n\n        The Minister said his country would never succumb to pressure.\n\n        首相说他的国家永远都不会屈服于压迫。\n    2.VERB感染，死于（疾病）If you succumb to an illness, you become affected by it or die from it. \n\n        A few years later, Katya succumbed to cancer in London...\n\n        几年后，卡佳因患癌症在伦敦病逝。\n\n        I was determined not to succumb to the virus.\n\n        我坚决不向病毒屈服。
shadowy@    1.ADJ-GRADED阴暗的；幽暗的；被阴影笼罩的A shadowy place is dark or full of shadows. \n\n        I watched him from a shadowy corner.\n\n        我躲在一个阴暗的角落里观察他。\n\n        ...a broad, shadowy room.\n\n        一间宽敞阴暗的房间\n    2.ADJ-GRADED昏暗的；模糊的；蒙的A shadowy figure or shape is someone or something that you can hardly see because they are in a dark place. \n\n        ...a tall, shadowy figure silhouetted against the pale wall.\n\n        灰白的墙上映出一个高大而模糊的人影\n\n        ...the shadowy shape of a big barge loaded with logs.\n\n        装满木材的巨大驳船的模糊轮廓\n    3.ADJ鲜为人知的；神秘莫测的You describe activities and people as shadowy when very little is known about them.\n\n        ...the shadowy world of spies.\n\n        间谍的神秘世界\n\n        ...a shadowy group calling itself the People's Army.\n\n        一个自称为“人民军队”的神秘组织
squirm@vi. (因不舒适、羞愧或紧张而)蠕动    1.VERB（通常指因紧张不安或不适而）扭动，动来动去If you squirm, you move your body from side to side, usually because you are nervous or uncomfortable. \n\n        He had squirmed and wriggled and screeched when his father had washed his face...\n\n        父亲给他洗脸时，他扭来扭去，尖声喊叫。\n\n        He gave a feeble shrug and tried to squirm free...\n\n        他无力地耸耸肩，扭动身体想要挣脱。\n\n        He squirmed out of the straps of his backpack.\n\n        他扭动身体，挣开背包的肩带。\n    2.VERB窘迫不安；难为情If you squirm, you are very embarrassed or ashamed. \n\n        Mentioning religion is a sure way to make him squirm.\n\n        一提宗教就肯定会让他感到窘迫不安。\n\n        ...the type of awful occasion that makes politicians squirm with embarrassment.\n\n        使政客尴尬不安的那种糟糕场合
soak@1.VERB浸；泡If you soak something or leave it to soak, you put it into a liquid and leave it there. \n\n    Soak the beans for 2 hours...\n\n    将豆子浸泡 2 小时。\n\n    He turned off the water and left the dishes to soak.\n\n    他关上水龙头，让盘子浸泡在水中。\n\n2.VERB使湿透；浸湿If a liquid soaks something or if you soak something with a liquid, the liquid makes the thing very wet. \n\n    The water had soaked his jacket and shirt...\n\n    水浸湿了他的夹克和衬衫。\n\n    Soak the soil around each bush with at least 4 gallons of water.\n\n    用至少 4 加仑的水浸湿每株灌木周围的土。\n\n3.VERB渗透If a liquid soaks through something, it passes through it. \n\n    There was so much blood it had soaked through my boxer shorts...\n\n    血流得太多，渗透了我的平脚短裤。\n\n    Rain had soaked into the sand.\n\n    雨水渗入了沙地。\n\n4.VERB（长时间地）泡热水澡If someone soaks, they spend a long time in a hot bath, because they enjoy it. \n\n    What I need is to soak in a hot tub.\n\n    我需要在热腾腾的澡盆里好好地泡一泡。\n\n    Soak is also a noun.\n\n        I was having a long soak in the bath.\n\n        我在浴缸里泡了很长时间。
spatter@v. 溅, 洒\nvt. 诬蔑\nn. 泼溅的污迹1.V-ERG溅；洒If a liquid spatters a surface or you spatter a liquid over a surface, drops of the liquid fall on an area of the surface. \n\n    He stared at the rain spattering on the glass... \n\n    他凝视着雨点溅落在玻璃上。\n\n    Gently turn the fish, being careful not to spatter any hot butter on yourself...\n\n    轻轻地把鱼翻过来，小心别把滚烫的黄油溅到自己身上。\n\n    Blood spattered the dark concrete...\n\n    鲜血溅落在黑色的水泥地上。
loathsome@adj. 讨厌的, 可恶的, 令人呕吐的    1.ADJ-GRADED令人憎恶的；让人恶心的；讨厌的If you describe someone or something as loathsome, you are indicating how much you dislike them or how much they disgust you.\n\n        ...the loathsome spectacle we were obliged to witness.\n\n        我们不得不目睹的令人恶心的场面。
communal@    1.ADJ群体的；社区的；团体的Communal means relating to particular groups in a country or society. \n\n        Communal violence broke out in different parts of the country.\n\n        在该国不同的地区发生了群体暴力事件。\n\n        ...inter-communal relations.\n\n        不同群体之间的关系\n    2.ADJ公共的；公用的You use communal to describe something that is shared by a group of people. \n\n        The inmates ate in a communal dining room.\n\n        囚犯们在公共餐厅吃饭。\n\n        ...communal ownership.\n\n        公共所有\n\n    communally\n\n        Meals are taken communally in the dining room.\n\n        大家在餐厅集体用餐。
fizzy@adj. 发嘶嘶声的,起泡的    1.ADJ-GRADED（饮料）起泡的，充气的，冒泡的Fizzy drinks are drinks that contain small bubbles of carbon dioxide. They make a sound like a long 's' when you pour them. \n\n        ...fizzy water.\n\n        汽水\n\n        ...a can of fizzy drink.\n\n        一罐汽水\n\n    in AM, use 美国英语用carbonated
alteration@    1.N-COUNT改变；变更An alteration is a change in or to something. \n\n        Making some simple alterations to your diet will make you feel fitter...\n\n        对日常饮食做些简单的调整就会让你身体更健康。\n\n        The structural alterations made to the house were planned with Gail's help.\n\n        对房屋结构调整的规划是在盖尔的帮助下完成的。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT更改；改动The alteration of something is the process of changing it.\n\n        Her jacket was at the boutique waiting for alteration.\n\n        她的短上衣放在时装店里，要做些改动。
chew out@    1.PHRASAL VERB叱责；训斥If you chew someone out, you tell them off in a very angry way. \n\n        He chewed out the player, who apologized the next time I saw him...\n\n        他训斥了那个球员，我再次看见那个球员时，他道了歉。\n\n        When Tom got back to Dallas, Perot called him over and chewed him out.\n\n        汤姆回到达拉斯时，佩罗把他叫过去，骂了他一顿。
cramped@    1.ADJ-GRADED狭窄的；狭小的A cramped room or building is not big enough for the people or things in it.\n\n        There are hundreds of families living in cramped conditions on the floor of the airport lounge...\n\n        数百个家庭住在机场候机室拥挤的地板上。\n\n        In later years he lived in a rather cramped little flat in Bristol.\n\n        他晚年住在布里斯托尔一间相当狭小的公寓内。
sensation@    1.N-COUNT（身体上的）感觉，知觉A sensation is a physical feeling. \n\n        Floating can be a very pleasant sensation...\n\n        漂浮会是一种非常惬意的感觉。\n\n        A sensation of burning or tingling may be experienced in the hands.\n\n        双手可能会有种刺痛感或灼热感。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT（尤指）触觉；感觉能力；知觉Sensation is your ability to feel things physically, especially through your sense of touch. \n\n        The pain was so bad that she lost all sensation.\n\n        太疼了，疼得她都失去了知觉。\n\n        ...nerve damage which can lead to loss of sensation in the limbs.\n\n        会导致四肢麻木的神经损伤\n    3.N-COUNT（某种经历所产生的）整体感觉，总体印象You can use sensation to refer to the general feeling or impression caused by a particular experience. \n\n        It's a funny sensation to know someone's talking about you in a language you don't understand.\n\n        知道有人正用一种你听不懂的语言谈论你，这种感觉很奇怪。\n    4.N-COUNT引起轰动的人（或事件、情况）If a person, event, or situation is a sensation, it causes great excitement or interest.\n\n        ...the film that turned her into an overnight sensation.\n\n        使她一夜间名声大噪的影片\n    5.N-SING轰动；哗然If a person, event, or situation causes a sensation, they cause great interest or excitement. \n\n        She was just 14 when she caused a sensation at the Montreal Olympics.\n\n        她在蒙特利尔奥运会上引起轰动时才 14 岁。
commandeer@    1.VERB（军队）征用，强征If the armed forces commandeer a vehicle or building owned by someone else, they officially take charge of it so that they can use it. \n\n        The soldiers commandeered vehicles in the capital and occupied the television station...\n\n        士兵们征用首都的车辆，并且占领了电视台。\n\n        They drove in convoy round the city in commandeered cars.\n\n        他们开着征用的小车，在城里结队而行。\n    2.VERB强占；强取To commandeer something owned by someone else means to take charge of it so that you can use it. \n\n        He decides to commandeer their room...\n\n        他决定强行占用他们的房间。\n\n        The hijacker commandeered the plane on a domestic flight.\n\n        劫机者劫持了这架国内客机。
conducive@  1.ADJ-GRADED有助（于…）的；有益（于…）的If one thing is conducive to another thing, it makes the other thing likely to happen. \n\n        Make your bedroom as conducive to sleep as possible...\n\n        尽量把卧室布置得适宜睡眠。\n\n        Sometimes the home environment just isn't conducive to reading.\n\n        有时候，家里的环境确实不适合看书。
delusion@    1.N-COUNT错觉；谬见；误会A delusion is a false idea. \n\n        I was under the delusion that he intended to marry me.\n\n        我误认为他要娶我。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT妄想；幻想Delusion is the state of believing things that are not true.\n\n        This was not optimism, it was delusion.\n\n        这不是乐观，这是妄想。\n    3.PHRASE妄自尊大；自以为是If someone has delusions of grandeur, they think and behave as if they are much more important or powerful than they really are. \n\n        He suggested that we suffer delusions of grandeur as a football nation.\n\n        他暗示我们妄自尊大地以为自己是个足球民族。\n\n        ...mansions built by men with delusions of grandeur.\n\n        自以为是的人建造的豪宅
navigate@    1.V-ERG为（船只、飞机等）导航；确定…的航行方向；（船只、飞机等）驶向When someone navigates a ship or an aircraft somewhere, they decide which course to follow and steer it there. You can also say that a ship or an aircraft navigates somewhere. \n\n        Captain Cook safely navigated his ship without accident for 100 voyages...\n\n        库克船长驾驶的船安全出航100次无事故。\n\n        The purpose of the visit was to navigate into an ice-filled fiord.\n\n        这次出行是为了能驶入冰雪覆盖的峡湾。\n\n        ...the new navigation system which will enable aircraft to navigate with total pinpoint accuracy.\n\n        将使飞机能够精确定位飞行的新导航系统\n\n    navigation\n\n        The expedition was wrecked by bad planning and poor navigation.\n\n        这次探险因计划不周和导航不利而失败。\n\n        ...the boat's navigation system.\n\n        船只的导航系统\n    2.VERB（船只）航行于，横渡When a ship or boat navigates an area of water, it sails on or across it. \n\n        ...a lock system to allow sea-going craft to navigate the upper reaches of the river...\n\n        使海轮可以进入河流上游地区航行的河闸控制系统\n\n        Such boats can navigate on the Nile.\n\n        这种船可以在尼罗河上航行。\n    3.VERB（驾车者）确定行车路线When someone in a car navigates, they decide what roads the car should be driven along in order to get somewhere. \n\n        When travelling on fast roads at night it is impossible to drive and navigate at the same time.\n\n        晚上在高速路上行驶时根本做不到边开车边找路。\n\n        ...the relief at successfully navigating across the Golden Gate Bridge to arrive here...\n\n        驾车成功驶过金门桥抵达这里后的轻松\n\n        They had just navigated their way through Maidstone on their way to the coast.\n\n        他们开车去海滨的路上刚刚经过了梅德斯通。\n    4.VERB（鱼、动物或昆虫）找到正确的行动方向When fish, animals, or insects navigate somewhere, they find the right direction to go and travel there. \n\n        In tests, the bees navigate back home after being placed in a field a mile away.\n\n        在多次试验中，放置于一英里以外田野中的蜜蜂都能飞回蜂巢。\n    5.VERB小心翼翼地绕过（障碍）If you navigate an obstacle, you move carefully in order to avoid hitting the obstacle or hurting yourself. \n\n        He was not able to walk without a cane and could only navigate steps backwards...\n\n        没有手杖他无法走路，只能小心翼翼地向后退。\n\n        In the corridors he let her navigate her own way round the trolleys and other obstacles...\n\n        在通道里，他让她自己小心地绕过小推车和其他障碍物。\n\n        If guests wished to use the sofa, they had first to navigate around chairs in the middle of the room.\n\n        如果客人想坐沙发，他们得先绕过屋中间的那几把椅子。\n    6.VERB驾驭，成功应付（困难处境）If you manage to navigate a difficult situation, you deal with it successfully. \n\n        During childhood each of us has to navigate a pathway through a series of developmental stages...\n\n        我们每个人在童年时都要经历和应对不同的成长阶段。\n\n        This outlook helped her to navigate through her later years with success.\n\n        这种观念帮她安度了晚年。
fluster@n. 慌乱, 狼狈, 混乱\nv. 使酩醉, 慌张, 混乱    1.VERB使紧张；使慌张If you fluster someone, you make them feel nervous and confused by rushing them and preventing them from concentrating on what they are doing. \n\n        The General refused to be flustered...\n\n        将军没有乱了方寸。\n\n        She was a very calm person. Nothing could fluster her.\n\n        她是个非常沉着的人。没什么能让她惊慌的。\n\n    flustered\n\n        She was so flustered that she forgot her reply.\n\n        她太紧张了，都忘记了该如何作答。
preliminary@n. 初步行动, 准备, 初步措施\nadj. 初步的, 开始的, 预备的    1.ADJ预备的；初步的Preliminary activities or discussions take place at the beginning of an event, often as a form of preparation. \n\n        Preliminary results show the Republican party with 11 percent of the vote...\n\n        初步结果显示共和党获得了11%的选票。\n\n        Preliminary talks on the future of the bases began yesterday.\n\n        昨天开始了关于基地未来的初步讨论。\n    2.N-COUNT准备工作；初步行动A preliminary is something that you do at the beginning of an activity, often as a form of preparation. \n\n        It had taken about ten minutes to cover the preliminaries...\n\n        准备工作大概花了10分钟。\n\n        A background check is normally a preliminary to a presidential appointment.\n\n        总统任命前通常要进行背景审查的准备工作。\n    3.N-COUNT预赛；初赛；初试A preliminary is the first part of a competition to see who will go on to the main competition.\n\n        The winner of each preliminary goes through to the final.\n\n        每场初赛的获胜者进入决赛。
unseat@    1.VERB把…革职；罢免When people try to unseat a person who is in an important job or position, they try to remove him or her from that job or position. \n\n        It is still not clear who was behind Sunday's attempt to unseat the President...\n\n        目前还不清楚星期天发动的企图推翻总统的行动的幕后指使人是谁。\n\n        Only two US representatives were unseated.\n\n        只有两位美国代表被免职。\n    2.VERB使从马上摔下If a horse unseats its rider, it causes him or her to fall off. \n\n        Crystal Spirit unseated his rider in the Berkshire Hurdle at Newbury...\n\n        在纽伯里举行的伯克郡障碍赛中“水玉精灵”把骑师掀了下来。\n\n        She was unseated on her first ride.\n\n        她第一次骑马就从马上摔了下来。
teeming@adj. 丰富的，充满的\n动词teem的现在分词形式    1.VERB充满，充斥（人或动物）If you say that a place is teeming with people or animals, you mean that it is crowded and the people and animals are moving around a lot. \n\n        For most of the year, the area is teeming with tourists.\n\n        一年中大部分时间里，这个地区游人如织。
scribble@1.VERB潦草地写；匆匆地写If you scribble something, you write it quickly and roughly. \n\n    She scribbled a note to tell Mum she'd gone out...\n\n    她匆匆写了个便条告诉妈妈她已外出。\n\n    As I scribbled in my diary the light went out.\n\n    我正草草地写着日记，灯灭了。\n\n2.VERB乱涂；乱画To scribble means to make meaningless marks or rough drawings using a pencil or pen. \n\n    When Caroline was five she scribbled on a wall.\n\n    卡罗琳 5 岁时在墙上乱涂乱画。\n\n3.N-VAR潦草的字迹；涂鸦Scribble is something that has been written or drawn quickly and roughly.\n\n    I'm sorry what I wrote was such a scribble.\n\n    很抱歉我写得如此潦草。
gripe@    1.VERB抱怨；发牢骚If you say that someone is griping, you mean they are annoying you because they keep on complaining about something. \n\n        Why are football players griping when the average salary is half a million dollars?...\n\n        足球运动员的平均薪水已达50万美金，他们为什么还要抱怨呢？\n\n        They were always griping about high prices.\n\n        他们总是抱怨物价太高。\n\n    griping\n\n        Still, the griping went on.\n\n        怨声依旧未止。\n    2.N-COUNT抱怨；牢骚A gripe is a complaint about something. \n\n        My only gripe is that one main course and one dessert were unavailable.\n\n        我唯一不满的就是连一道主菜和一份甜点都没有。
qualification@    1.N-COUNT（通过考试获得的）资格，学历；资格考试Your qualifications are the examinations that you have passed. \n\n        They will be encouraged to mix academic A-levels with vocational qualifications...\n\n        将鼓励他们在取得优秀学习成绩的同时也要获得一定的职业资质。\n\n        Lucy wants to study medicine but needs more qualifications.\n\n        露西希望学医，但是需要通过更多的资格考试。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT（通过考试后）取得资格，合格，达到标准Qualification is the act of passing the examinations you need to work in a particular profession.\n\n        Following qualification, he worked as a social worker.\n\n        通过资格考试认证之后，他做了一名社会工作者。\n    3.N-COUNT（完成某项活动或任务所需的）素质，技能，资历The qualifications you need for an activity or task are the qualities and skills that you need to be able to do it.\n\n        Responsibility and reliability are necessary qualifications...\n\n        有责任感、值得信赖是必备的素质。\n\n        That time with him is my qualification to write this book.\n\n        我和他曾经相处过一段时间，所以才能写出这本书。\n    4.N-VAR限制条件；限定事项A qualification is a detail or explanation that you add to a statement to make it less strong or less general. \n\n        The empirical evidence considered here is subject to many qualifications...\n\n        此处提及的实验证据有诸多限制条件。\n\n        This statement requires qualification and clarification.\n\n        这份陈述需要进行限定和澄清。\n\n        If something is stated or accepted without qualification, it is stated or accepted as it is, without the need for any changes.无条件地；毫无保留地\n\n            The government conceded to their demands almost without qualification.\n\n            政府几乎是无条件地同意了他们的要求。
grooming@n. 修饰, 美容，（动物）梳理毛发    1.N-UNCOUNT打扮；装束；梳洗Grooming refers to the things that people do to keep themselves clean and make their face, hair, and skin look nice. \n\n        ...a growing concern for personal grooming.\n\n        对个人打扮的日趋重视\n\n        ...five new men's grooming products.\n\n        5款新型男士护理产品
armor@1.N-UNCOUNT（旧时的）盔甲，铠甲In former times, armour was special metal clothing that soldiers wore for protection in battle.\n\n    ...the collection of weapons and armour in the historic White Tower.\n\n    历史古迹白塔中所收藏的武器和盔甲\n\n    ...knights in armour.\n\n    身穿盔甲的骑士\n\n    ...a medieval suit of armour.\n\n    一套中世纪的盔甲\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT装甲部队（作战中使用的坦克等军用车辆的总称）Armour consists of tanks and other military vehicles used in battle. \n\n    ...the biggest movement of heavy British armour since the Second World War.\n\n    二战以来规模最大的英国重型装甲部队调动\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT（车辆的）装甲，铁甲，装甲钢板Armour is a hard, usually metal, covering that protects a vehicle against attack.\n\n    ...a formidable warhead that can penetrate the armour of most tanks.\n\n    能穿透大多数坦克装甲的威力巨大的弹头\n\n    ...armour-piercing missiles.\n\n    穿甲导弹
invulnerability@    1.ADJ-GRADED不会受伤害的；刀枪不入的；攻不破的If someone or something is invulnerable, they cannot be harmed or damaged. \n\n        Many daughters assume that their mothers are invulnerable.\n\n        很多女儿都认为她们的母亲无比坚强。\n\n        ...a system that would make the U.S. invulnerable to nuclear attack.\n\n        会使美国免受核袭击的系统\n\n    invulnerability\n\n        They have a sense of invulnerability to disease.\n\n        他们似乎百病不侵。
alias@    1.N-COUNT（尤指罪犯使用的）化名，别名An alias is a false name, especially one used by a criminal.\n\n        Using an alias, he had rented a house in Fleet, Hampshire.\n\n        他用化名在汉普郡的舰队街租了间房子。\n    2.PREP（尤指罪犯或演员的）别名，又名You use alias when you are mentioning another name that someone, especially a criminal or an actor, is known by. \n\n        ...the defendant Pericles Pericleous, alias Peter Smith.\n\n        被告佩里克莱斯·佩里克利奥斯，又名彼得·史密斯
proverbial@    1.ADJ谚语的；出自谚语的；常说的You use pro- verbial to show that you know the way you are describing something is one that is often used or is part of a popular saying. \n\n        The limousine sped off down the road in the proverbial cloud of dust...\n\n        豪华轿车沿公路飞驰而去，那真是卷起一路风尘。\n\n        My audience certainly isn't the proverbial man in the street.\n\n        我的观众当然不是街上的平头百姓。\n    2.ADJ出名的；众所周知的Something that is proverbial is very well-known by a lot of people.\n\n        His mastery of the French language was proverbial.\n\n        他对法语的精通是众所周知的。
extrapolate@    1.VERB推断；推知If you extrapolate from known facts, you use them as a basis for general statements about a situation or about what is likely to happen in the future. \n\n        Extrapolating from his American findings, he reckons about 80% of these deaths might be attributed to smoking...\n\n        根据他在美国的调查结果推断，他估计这些人中约有80％可能死于吸烟。\n\n        It is unhelpful to extrapolate general trends from one case.\n\n        根据一个案例来推断总的趋势是没有用的。\n\n    extrapolation\n\n        His estimate of half a million HIV positive cases was based on an extrapolation of the known incidence of the virus.\n\n        他估计有50万个HIV阳性病例，这是根据已知的病毒感染率作出的推论。
hierarchy@    1.N-VAR等级制度A hierarchy is a system of organizing people into different ranks or levels of importance, for example in society or in a company. \n\n        Like most other American companies with a rigid hierarchy, workers and managers had strictly defined duties...\n\n        和其他多数拥有严格等级制度的美国公司一样，这里的工人和管理人员都有界定严格的职责。\n\n        She rose up the Tory hierarchy by the local government route...\n\n        她通过地方政府的渠道在保守党的等级制度中一步步地晋升。\n\n        Even in the desert there was a kind of social hierarchy.\n\n        即便在沙漠中也存在某种社会等级制度。\n    2.N-COUNT-COLL（组织中的）掌权集团，统治集团The hierarchy of an organization such as the Church is the group of people who manage and control it. \n    3.N-COUNT（思想、信仰的）等级体系，分级结构A hierarchy of ideas and beliefs involves organizing them into a system or structure. \n\n        ...the notion of 'cultural imperialism' implies a hierarchy of cultures, some of which are stronger than others.\n\n        “文化扩张主义”意味着一种文化等级体系的存在，其中有些文化要比其他文化更强大。
pin down@确定, 下结论, 用针固定住, 压住    1.PHRASAL VERB确定；证实If you try to pin something down, you try to discover exactly what, where, or when it is. \n\n        It has taken until now to pin down its exact location...\n\n        直到现在才确定了它的准确位置。\n\n        I can only pin it down to between 1936 and 1942...\n\n        我只能确定是在1936至1942年期间。\n\n        If we cannot pin down exactly what we are supposed to be managing, how can we manage it?\n\n        如果我们都不能确切地知道自己该管理什么，那又怎么去管理呢？\n    2.PHRASAL VERB迫使…作出决定（或明确表态）If you pin someone down, you force them to make a decision or to tell you what their decision is, when they have been trying to avoid doing this. \n\n        She couldn't pin him down to a date...\n\n        她没有办法强迫他答应约会。\n\n        ...their repeated efforts to pin him down on a number of topics...\n\n        他们迫使他对一系列问题明确表态的再三努力\n\n        If you pin people down, they will tell you some puzzling things about stress.\n\n        如果非让他们说的话，人们会告诉你一些有关压力的令人费解的事情。
demise@n. 死亡,转让房产,让位\nvt. 让渡,遗赠,转让\nvi. 遗赠,死亡    1.N-SING终止；消亡；死亡The demise of something or someone is their end or death. \n\n        ...the demise of the reform movement...\n\n        改革运动的消亡\n\n        Smoking, rather than genetics, was the cause of his early demise.\n\n        导致他英年早逝的原因是吸烟而非遗传。
chow@1.N-UNCOUNT食物Food can be referred to as chow . \n\n    Help yourself to some chow.\n\n    吃什么请自便。\n\n2.N-COUNT狮子狗；松狮犬A chow is a kind of dog that has a thick coat and a curled tail. Chows originally came from China.
immune@    1.ADJ（对疾病）免疫的，有免疫力的If you are immune to a particular disease, you cannot be affected by it. \n\n        This blood test will show whether or not you're immune to the disease...\n\n        这个血检会显示你是否对这种疾病具有免疫力。\n\n        Most adults are immune to Rubella.\n\n        大多数成人对风疹具有免疫力。\n\n    immunity\n\n        Birds in outside cages develop immunity to airborne bacteria.\n\n        养在户外笼子里的鸟会对空气传播的细菌产生免疫力。\n    2.ADJ（反应等）免疫的，免疫系统的An immune response or reaction is a reaction by the body's immune system to something harmful that is affecting it. \n\n        It is hoped the procedure will trigger an immune response that will wipe out HIV-infected cells while leaving non-infected cells unharmed.\n\n        希望这一治疗会激发免疫反应，清除感染了艾滋病病毒的细胞，同时又不损伤未感染细胞。\n    3.ADJ不受影响的If you are immune to something that happens or is done, you are not affected by it. \n\n        Whilst Marc did gradually harden himself to the poverty, he did not become immune to the sight of death...\n\n        尽管马克逐渐对贫困现象无动于衷，但他对于死亡的惨象还是不免动容。\n\n        Football is not immune to economic recession.\n\n        足球不可能不受到经济衰退的影响。\n    4.ADJ免除的；豁免的Someone or something that is immune from a particular process or situation is able to escape it. \n\n        Members of the Bundestag are immune from prosecution for corruption...\n\n        德国联邦议院的成员可免受贪腐罪的起诉。\n\n        No one is immune from scandal.\n\n        谁都难免会有丑闻。\n\n    immunity\n\n        The police are offering immunity to witnesses.\n\n        警方对证人将免予起诉。
extinguisher@n. 灭火器(熄灭者,消除器)1.N-COUNT同 fire extinguisherAn extinguisher is the same as a fire extinguisher .
scuff@    1.V-ERG（使）磨损；（使）磨坏If you scuff something or if it scuffs, you mark the surface by scraping it against other things or by scraping other things against it. \n\n        Constant wheelchair use will scuff almost any floor surface...\n\n        任何地板上经常有轮椅走动几乎都会有所磨损。\n\n        Molded plastic is almost indestructible, but scuffs easily.\n\n        注塑几乎弄不坏，但是容易磨损。\n\n    scuffed\n\n        ...scuffed brown shoes.\n\n        几双磨坏的棕色鞋\n    2.VERB拖着脚走If you scuff your feet, you pull them along the ground as you walk. \n\n        Polly, bewildered and embarrassed, dropped her head and scuffed her feet.\n\n        波莉既困惑又尴尬，低下头拖着脚走开了。\n    1.N-COUNT（光滑平面上的）擦痕，磨痕Scuff marks are marks made on a smooth surface when something is rubbed against it. \n\n        Scuff marks from shoes are difficult to remove.\n\n        鞋上的擦痕很难除掉。
premiere@    1.N-COUNT首映；首演；初次公演The premiere of a new play or film is the first public performance of it.\n\n        A new Czechoslovak film has had its premiere at the Karlovy Vary film festival.\n\n        一部捷克斯洛伐克新电影在卡罗维发利电影节上首映。\n\n        ...a royal film premiere.\n\n        盛大的电影首映\n    2.V-ERG（使）首映；（使）首演；（使）初次公演When a film or show premieres or is premiered, it is shown to an audience for the first time. \n\n        The documentary premiered at the Jerusalem Film Festival...\n\n        这部纪录片在耶路撒冷电影节首映。\n\n        The opera is due to be premiered by ENO next year.\n\n        这部歌剧将于明年在英国国家歌剧院首演。
chilly@    1.ADJ-GRADED阴冷的；寒冷的Something that is chilly is unpleasantly cold.→see usage note at:cold \n\n        It was a chilly afternoon...\n\n        那是个阴冷的下午。\n\n        The rooms had grown chilly.\n\n        房间慢慢变得阴冷起来。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED冷的；有寒意的If you feel chilly, you feel rather cold. \n\n        I'm a bit chilly.\n\n        我有点冷。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED（人际关系、反应）冷淡的，冷冰冰的，不热情的You say that relations between people are chilly or that a person's response is chilly when they are not friendly, welcoming, or enthusiastic.\n\n        I was slightly afraid of their chilly distant politeness.\n\n        他们那种冷冰冰的、敬而远之的客套让我有点憷头。
conjecture@    1.N-VAR推测；猜测A conjecture is a conclusion that is based on information that is not certain or complete. \n\n        That was a conjecture, not a fact...\n\n        那只是猜测，不是事实。\n\n        There are several conjectures...\n\n        存在着几种猜测。\n\n        The attitudes of others were matters of conjecture although there were plenty of rumours about how individuals had behaved.\n\n        尽管对个人的表现存在很多谣传，但他人的看法还只是一些猜测。\n    2.VERB推测；猜测；揣测When you conjecture, you form an opinion or reach a conclusion on the basis of information that is not certain or complete. \n\n        He conjectured that some individuals may be able to detect major calamities...\n\n        他猜测说有些人也许能够察觉重大灾难。\n\n        This may be true or partly true; we are all conjecturing here.\n\n        这可能属实或者部分属实，我们都是在这儿揣测。
mold@in AM, use 美国英语用 mold\n1.N-COUNT模子；铸模；模具A mould is a hollow container that you pour liquid into. When the liquid becomes solid, it takes the same shape as the mould.\n\n    Spoon the mixture carefully into the mould...\n\n    用勺小心地把混合物舀起，倒入模具内。\n\n    The moulds for the foundry are made in the tool-room area.\n\n    铸造车间的模具是在工具间生产的。\n\n    ...jelly moulds.\n\n    果冻模具\n\n2.N-COUNT（性格、态度、行为或生活方式的）模式，类型If a person fits into or is cast in a mould of a particular kind, they have the characteristics, attitudes, behaviour, or lifestyle that are typical of that type of person. \n\n    At first sight, Joe Pesci is not exactly cast in the leading man mould...\n\n    第一眼看上去，乔·佩希并不是当领袖的料。\n\n    He was from the same mould as the men she had gazed at worshipfully when a child: rich, handsome, of impeccable social standing.\n\n    他富有、英俊，有无可挑剔的社会地位，是她孩提时就仰慕的那种男人。\n\n    If you say that someone breaks the mould, you mean that they do completely different things from what has been done before or from what is usually done.打破模式；打破程式\n\n        Memorial services have become tedious and expected. I would like to help break the mould...\n\n        纪念仪式已变得令人生厌且毫无新意，我想为打破这种既有模式做点什么。\n\n        When they first started, they said they were going to break the mould of British politics.\n\n        刚开始时他们说他们将打破英国政治的原有格局。\n\n3.VERB塑造；把…塑制成If you mould a soft substance such as plastic or clay, you make it into a particular shape or into an object. \n\n    Using 2 spoons, mould the cheese mixture into small balls or ovals...\n\n    用两把小匙将奶酪混合物塑成圆球或椭圆球形状。\n\n    Before we left the camp, my twin brother and I moulded a chair out of mud.\n\n    离开营地前，我和孪生弟弟用泥巴做了一把椅子。\n\n4.VERB影响；改变To mould someone or something means to change or influence them over a period of time so that they develop in a particular way. \n\n    She was only 17 at the time and the experience moulded her personality...\n\n    那时她只有17岁，那次经历影响了她的性格。\n\n    Here we outline some of the sometimes conflicting forces moulding the debate...\n\n    在此我们概述一些有时影响争论的相互对立的力量。\n\n    Too often we try to mold our children into something they do not wish to be.\n\n    我们常常试图把孩子塑造成他们自己不想成为的样子。\n\n5.V-ERG（使）轮廓吻合，紧贴When something moulds to an object or when you mould it there, it fits round the object tightly so that the shape of the object can still be seen. \n\n    You need a malleable pillow that will mould to the curves of your neck...\n\n    你需要一个柔韧性好、能与你的颈椎弯曲弧度相吻合的枕头。\n\n    She stood there, the wind moulding the dress around her.\n\n    她站在那儿，风把套裙吹得紧紧裹在身上。\n\n6.N-MASSSee also:leaf mould；霉；霉菌Mould is a soft grey, green, or blue substance that sometimes forms in spots on old food or on damp walls or clothes.
phew@int. 唷！呸！（表示不快，惊讶的声音）    1.EXCLAM唷，咳（书面语中用来表示吃惊、松口气或酷热难耐等）Phew is used in writing to represent the soft whistling sound that you make when you breathe out quickly, for example when you are relieved or shocked about something or when you are very hot.\n\n        Phew, what a relief!\n\n        唷，真是大松一口气！
sinus@    1.N-COUNT鼻窦Your sinuses are the spaces in the bone behind your nose. \n\n        I still suffer from catarrh and sinus problems.\n\n        我仍然患有黏膜炎和鼻窦炎。
pupillary@ adj. 小学生的\nadj. 瞳孔的
covert@adj. 隐蔽的, 偷偷摸摸的, 隐密的n. 藉口, 树丛, 蔽覆羽翮基部的羽毛1.ADJ-GRADED秘密的；隐藏的；暗中的Covert activities or situations are secret or hidden. \n\n    They have been supplying covert military aid to the rebels...\n\n    他们一直在暗地里向叛乱者提供军事支援。\n\n    The depth of covert racism in my own profession frightens me.\n\n    我所从事的职业中暗藏着如此深的种族主义偏见，这让我感到害怕。\n\ncovertly\n\n    They covertly observed Lauren, who was sitting between Ned and Algie at a nearby table.\n\n    他们偷偷地观察旁边一张桌子上坐在内德和阿尔吉中间的劳伦。\n\n2.N-COUNT（小动物或猎禽可藏身的）矮树丛，灌木丛A covert is a group of small trees or bushes very close to each other where small animals or game birds can hide.
carbine@1.N-COUNT卡宾枪A carbine is a light automatic rifle.
denim@n. 粗斜纹布\n(复数)denims:工作服，牛仔裤    1.N-UNCOUNT（通常为蓝色、用来做牛仔裤等的）粗斜纹棉布，劳动布，牛仔布Denim is a thick cotton cloth, usually blue, which is used to make clothes. Jeans are made from denim. \n\n        ...a light blue denim jacket...\n\n        浅蓝色的牛仔布夹克Dennis was dressed in denim jeans。 丹尼斯穿了一条劳动布牛仔裤。
refreshing@    1.ADJ-GRADED使人耳目一新的；新鲜的You say that something is refreshing when it is pleasantly different from what you are used to.\n\n        It's refreshing to hear somebody speaking common sense...\n\n        听到有人说话通情达理真是令人耳目一新。\n\n        It made a refreshing change to see a good old-fashioned movie.\n\n        换换口味，看一部经典的老式电影会让人觉得耳目一新。\n\n    refreshingly\n\n        He was refreshingly honest.\n\n        他诚实得让人欣喜。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（沐浴或饮料）使人精神焕发的，提神的，清凉的A refreshing bath or drink makes you feel energetic or cool again after you have been tired or hot.\n\n        Herbs have been used for centuries to make refreshing drinks.\n\n        草药用于调制提神饮品已有好几个世纪了。
replica@    1.N-COUNT复制品；仿制品A replica of something such as a statue, building, or weapon is an accurate copy of it. \n\n        ...a human-sized replica of the Statue of Liberty...\n\n        真人大小的自由女神像复制品\n\n        Royce Hall was an exact replica of the basilica of Sant Ambrogio in Milan...\n\n        罗伊斯大厅是位于米兰的圣安布洛乔大教堂的原样复制建筑。\n\n        It was a replica gun, for display only.\n\n        那是一把仿真枪，仅供展示。\n    2.N-COUNT翻版；酷似的人If you say that one person is a replica of another, you mean that the first person looks very like the second. \n\n        Tina as a child was a replica of her mother.\n\n        蒂娜小的时候和她妈妈简直一模一样。
prototype@    1.N-COUNT原型；样品；样本A prototype is a new type of machine or device which is not yet ready to be made in large numbers and sold. \n\n        Chris Retzler has built a prototype of a machine called the wave rotor.\n\n        克里斯·雷茨勒已制造出了一种叫波转子的机器的样机。\n\n        ...the first prototype aircraft.\n\n        第一架飞机样机\n    2.N-COUNT模范；典型If you say that someone or something is a prototype of a type of person or thing, you mean that they are the first or most typical one of that type. \n\n        He was the prototype of the elder statesman.\n\n        他是老一辈政治家的典型。
authentic@    1.ADJ真的；真正的；真实的；真诚的An authentic person, object, or emotion is genuine. \n\n        ...authentic Italian food...\n\n        真正的意大利食品\n\n        She has authentic charm whereas most people simply have nice manners...\n\n        她散发出真正的魅力，而大多数人只是举止优雅。\n\n        They have to look authentic.\n\n        它们必须得看上去像真的。\n\n    authenticity\n\n        There are factors, however, that have cast doubt on the statue's authenticity.\n\n        然而，有些因素让人对该雕塑的真伪产生了怀疑。\n\n    authentically\n\n        Consumers are increasingly interested in the authentically exotic tastes...\n\n        消费者对于真正的异国风味越来越情有独钟。\n\n        The enamel gives new brass an authentically tarnished finish.\n\n        用瓷釉作末道漆使新的黄铜器看似自然地失去了光泽。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（仿制品）能够以假乱真的，逼真的If you describe something as authentic, you mean that it is such a good imitation that it is almost the same as or as good as the original. \n\n        ...patterns for making authentic frontier-style clothing.\n\n        制造仿潮流服装所用的图案\n\n    authentically\n\n        The team decided to try and replicate the missing curtains as authentically as possible.\n\n        小组决定尽可能照原样重新制作丢失的幕帘。\n    3.ADJ（信息或记述）准确的，可靠的，可信的An authentic piece of information or account of something is reliable and accurate. \n\n        I had obtained the authentic details about the birth of the organization.\n\n        我已经掌握了有关该组织诞生的可靠的详细资料。\n\n    authentically\n\n        The book authentically and intimately describes the small details of her daily life.\n\n        本书翔实地记述了她日常生活中的小细节。\n\n    authenticity\n\n        The film's authenticity of detail has impressed critics.\n\n        电影在细节上的真实性给影评人士留下了深刻的印象。
knight@    1.N-COUNT（中世纪的）骑士In medieval times, a knight was a man of noble birth, who served his king or lord in battle.\n    2.VERB封…为爵士If someone is knighted, they are given a knighthood. \n\n        He was knighted in the Queen's birthday honours list in June 1988.\n\n        他于1988年6月被封为爵士，是女王生日宴会上的受勋者之一。\n    3.N-COUNT爵士A knight is a man who has been knighted.\n    4.N-COUNT（国际象棋中的）马In chess, a knight is a piece which is shaped like a horse's head.\n    5.PHRASE救人于危难之中的勇士If you refer to someone as a knight in shining armour, you mean that they are kind and brave, and likely to rescue you from a difficult situation. \n\n        Love songs trick us into believing in knights in shining armor.\n\n        情歌哄骗我们去相信有勇救美人的英雄。
pack a punch@vi. 重击(具有强烈效果)13.PHRASE产生巨大影响；震撼If something packs a punch, it has a very powerful effect. \n\n    W. Somerset Maugham's novel still packs an emotional punch.\n\n    威廉·萨默塞特·毛姆的小说仍具有强烈的情感冲击力。\n\n    ...drinks that pack a punch.\n\n    烈酒
hostage@    1.N-COUNT人质A hostage is someone who has been captured by a person or organization and who may be killed or injured if people do not do what that person or organization demands.\n\n        It is hopeful that two hostages will be freed in the next few days.\n\n        有两名人质可望在几天后获释。\n    2.PHRASE被扣作人质If someone is taken hostage or is held hostage, they are captured and kept as a hostage. \n\n        He was taken hostage while on his first foreign assignment as a television journalist.\n\n        他第一次作为电视记者出国采访时就被扣作人质。\n    3.N-VAR受限制的人；不由自主的人If you say you are hostage to something, you mean that your freedom to take action is restricted by things that you cannot control. \n\n        With the reduction in foreign investments, the government will be even more a hostage to the whims of the international oil price...\n\n        随着外资的减少，政府将更加受制于起伏不定的国际油价。\n\n        Wine growers say they've been held hostage to the interests of the cereal and soybean farmers.\n\n        葡萄种植兼酿酒者说他们一直都为谷物和大豆种植者的利益所绑架。
suspicion@1.N-VAR怀疑；疑心Suspicion or a suspicion is a belief or feeling that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong. \n\n    There was a suspicion that this runner attempted to avoid the procedures for dope testing... \n\n    这名赛跑选手涉嫌有意逃避兴奋剂检验。\n\n    The police said their suspicions were aroused because Mr Owens had other marks on his body...\n\n    警方说欧文斯先生尸体上的其他伤痕引起了他们的怀疑。\n\n    Scotland Yard had assured him he was not under suspicion...\n\n    伦敦警察厅已经向他保证，他没有被视为可疑分子。\n\n2.N-VAR疑心；疑忌；猜疑If there is suspicion of someone or something, people do not trust them or consider them to be reliable. \n\n    ...the traditional British suspicion of psychotherapy...\n\n    英国人传统上对心理疗法的猜忌\n\n    He may have had some suspicions of Michael Foster, the editor of the journal...\n\n    他可能对杂志主编迈克尔·福斯特有些怀疑。\n\n    I was always regarded in the Army with a certain amount of suspicion because of my left-wing tendencies.\n\n    由于我的左翼倾向，在军队中我总是受到一些猜疑。\n\n3.N-COUNT感觉；预感A suspicion is a feeling that something is probably true or is likely to happen. \n\n    I have a sneaking suspicion that they are going to succeed...\n\n    我隐约觉得他们将要成功了。\n\n    Astronomers will have to collect more spectra from these stars to confirm their suspicions.\n\n    天文学家们必须要从这些恒星上采集更多的光谱来证实他们的推想。\n\n4.N-SING些许；少量；一点A suspicion of something is a very small amount of it. \n\n    ...large blooms of white with a suspicion of pale pink.\n\n    一朵朵略带淡粉色的大白花
payoff@    1.N-COUNT优势；收益；收效；回报The payoff from an action is the advantage or benefit that you get from it. \n\n        If such materials became generally available to the optics industry the payoffs from such a breakthrough would be enormous...\n\n        如果这些材料能够普遍用于光学产业，那么这一突破带来的收益将非常巨大。\n\n        You're doing what you really love to do, which is making music — that's the payoff.\n\n        你现在做着你真正喜欢做的事情，也就是音乐制作——这就是回报。\n    2.N-COUNT（用于避免麻烦的）封口费，贿赂A payoff is a payment which is made to someone, often secretly or illegally, so that they will not cause trouble. \n\n        Soldiers in both countries supplement their incomes with payoffs from drugs exporters.\n\n        两国士兵都用毒品走私贩的贿赂来贴补收入。\n    3.N-COUNT解约金；遣散费A payoff is a large payment made to someone by their employer when the person has been forced to leave their job.\n\n        The ousted chairman received a £1.5 million payoff from the loss-making oil company.\n\n        被解职的主席从亏损的石油公司那里拿到了150万英镑的解约金。
solitude@n. 孤独\n独居, 荒僻之地, 幽静的地方    1.N-UNCOUNT（尤指平静愉快的）独居，独处Solitude is the state of being alone, especially when this is peaceful and pleasant.\n\n        He enjoyed his moments of solitude before the pressures of the day began...\n\n        他喜欢在白天的压力到来之前享受独处的时光。\n\n        Imagine long golden beaches where you can wander in solitude.\n\n        想象一下那长长的金色海滩吧，在那里你可以独自徜徉。
prayer@    1.N-UNCOUNT祈祷；祷告Prayer is the activity of speaking to God.\n\n        They had joined a religious order and dedicated their lives to prayer and good works...\n\n        他们已加入一个宗教团体，终生都将祈祷和行善。\n\n        The night was spent in prayer.\n\n        整个晚上都在祷告。\n    2.N-COUNT祈祷文；祷词A prayer is the words a person says when they speak to God.\n\n        They should take a little time and say a prayer for the people on both sides.\n\n        他们应该花点时间，为双方的人祈祷。\n\n        ...prayers of thanksgiving.\n\n        感恩节祈祷文\n    3.N-COUNT祈求的事；祈望You can refer to a strong hope that you have as your prayer . \n\n        This drug could be the answer to our prayers.\n\n        这种药或许可以满足我们的祈望。\n    4.N-PLURAL祈祷仪式A short religious service at which people gather to pray can be referred to as prayers .\n\n        He promised that the boy would be back at school in time for evening prayers.\n\n        他保证男孩会及时回到学校参加晚祈祷。\n\n        ...Muslims attending prayers in the main mosque.\n\n        在大清真寺参加祈祷的穆斯林\n    5.PHRASE不可能成功If you say that someone hasn't got a prayer, you mean that it is impossible for them to succeed in what they are trying to do. \n\n        She'd been caught from behind and hadn't a prayer of freeing herself.\n\n        有人从后面抓住她，她不可能脱身。
beam@1.VERB眉开眼笑；笑容满面If you say that someone is beaming, you mean that they have a big smile on their face because they are happy, pleased, or proud about something. \n\n    Frances beamed at her friend with undisguised admiration...\n\n    弗朗西丝开心地对自己的朋友笑着，毫不掩饰她的羡慕之情。\n\n    'Welcome back,' she beamed.\n\n    “欢迎回来，”她满面笑容地说。\n\n    ...the beaming face of a 41-year-old man on the brink of achieving his dreams.\n\n    即将实现自己梦想的41岁男人的笑脸\n\n2.N-COUNT（能量、放射线或粒子的）束，柱A beam is a line of energy, radiation, or particles sent in a particular direction. \n\n    ...high-energy laser beams.\n\n    高能激光束\n\n    ...a beam of neutrons.\n\n    一束中子\n\n3.V-ERG（通过电子设备）发送，发射If something beams radio signals or television pictures or they are beamed somewhere, they are sent there by means of electronic equipment. \n\n    The interview was beamed live across America...\n\n    这次访谈向全美国现场直播。\n\n    The live satellite broadcast was beamed into homes across America.\n\n    此次卫星直播被发送到美国的千家万户。\n\n    ...a ship which is due to begin beaming radio broadcasts to South East Asia.\n\n    预定将对东南亚进行无线电广播的船只\n\n4.N-COUNT（光）束；（光）线A beam of light is a line of light that shines from an object such as a lamp. \n\n5.VERB照耀；照射If something such as the sun or a lamp beams down, it sends light to a place and shines on it. \n\n    A sharp white spotlight beamed down on a small stage...\n\n    聚光灯的强烈白光照在小舞台上。\n\n    All you see of the outside world is the sunlight beaming through the cracks in the roof.\n\n    而外面的世界，你所能看见的就只是透过房顶缝隙射进来的阳光。\n\n6.N-COUNT梁；横梁A beam is a long thick bar of wood, metal, or concrete, especially one used to support the roof of a building.\n\n    The ceilings are supported by oak beams.\n\n    房顶用橡木横梁支撑。\n\n7.N-SING（体操中的）平衡木In gymnastics, the beam is a piece of equipment that consists of a narrow wooden bar on which gymnasts balance and perform movements.
heartfelt@    1.ADJ-GRADED诚挚的；衷心的；真心实意的Heartfelt is used to describe a deep or sincere feeling or wish. \n\n        My heartfelt sympathy goes out to all the relatives.\n\n        我对所有的亲人表示由衷的慰问。
fertilizer@    in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 fertiliser\n    1.N-MASS肥料；化肥Fertilizer is a substance such as solid animal waste or a chemical mixture that you spread on the ground in order to make plants grow more successfully.\n\n        ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide...\n\n        不购买使用化学药剂、肥料或杀虫剂的耕种\n\n        Work in a balanced fertiliser before planting.\n\n        种植前加入养分均衡的肥料。
greenery@n. 绿树, 绿色植物，暖房    1.N-UNCOUNT绿色植物；青葱的草木Plants that make a place look attractive are referred to as greenery .\n\n        They have ordered a bit of greenery to brighten up the new wing at Guy's Hospital.\n\n        他们订购了一些绿色植物，以给盖伊医院的新配楼增添一抹亮色。
cavalry@    1.N-SING装甲部队The cavalry is the part of an army that uses armoured vehicles for fighting.\n\n        The Cavalry were exercising on Salisbury Plain.\n\n        装甲部队在索尔兹伯里平原进行演习。\n\n        ...the US Army's 1st Cavalry Division.\n\n        美国陆军第一装甲师\n    2.N-SING骑兵The cavalry is the group of soldiers in an army who ride horses.\n\n        ...a young cavalry officer.\n\n        年轻的骑兵军官
