point-blank@adj. 近距离平射的, 短射程的, 直截了当的, 坦白的\nadv. 直接地,  正面地, 坦白地    1.ADV直截了当地；断然地If you say something point-blank, you say it very directly or rudely, without explaining or apologizing. \n\n        The army apparently refused point blank to do what was required of them...\n\n        军队貌似断然拒绝做他们分内的事情。\n\n        Mr Patterson was asked point blank if he would resign.\n\n        帕特森先生被直接问到他是否会辞职。\n\n        Point-blank is also an adjective.\n\n            ...a point-blank refusal.\n\n            断然拒绝\n    2.ADV近距离地；抵近地If someone or something is shot point-blank, they are shot when the gun is touching them or extremely close to them. \n\n        He fired point-blank at Bernadette.\n\n        他近距离朝贝尔纳黛特开了枪。\n\n        Point-blank is also an adjective.\n\n            He had been shot at point-blank range in the back of the head.\n\n            他被人近距离开枪击中后脑。
slug@n. 动作缓慢的人    1.N-COUNT蛞蝓；鼻涕虫A slug is a small slow-moving creature with a long soft body and no legs, like a snail without a shell.\n    2.N-COUNT（酒的）一大口If you take a slug of an alcoholic drink, you take a large mouthful of it. \n\n        Edgar took a slug of his drink.\n\n        埃德加喝了一大口。\n    3.VERB猛击If you slug someone, you hit them hard. \n\n        She slugged her right in the face...\n\n        她重重地打在她的脸上。\n\n        He felt as if he had been slugged by a piece of lead pipe.\n\n        他觉得自己像被一根铅管击中了。\n    4.N-COUNT子弹；枪弹A slug is a bullet. \n    5.PHRASE一决雌雄；一比高低If two or more people slug it out, they work very hard to try to be the one who is successful or has their ideas and wishes accepted. \n\n        Four candidates are slugging it out in a dirty campaign.\n\n        4名候选人将在一场肮脏的竞选中一决高下。
commission@1.VERB正式委托；委托（做）If you commission something or commission someone to do something, you formally arrange for someone to do a piece of work for you. \n\n    The Ministry of Agriculture commissioned a study into low-input farming...\n\n    农业部委托对低投入耕作进行研究。\n\n    You can commission them to paint something especially for you.\n\n    你可以委托他们专门为你画点什么。\n\n    ...specially commissioned reports.\n\n    特别委托撰写的报告\n\n    Commission is also a noun.\n\n        Our china can be bought off the shelf or by commission...\n\n        我们的瓷器可现货购买，也可以委托制作。\n\n        He approached John Wexley with a commission to write the screenplay of the film.\n\n        他找到约翰·韦克斯利，委托他创作这部电影的剧本。\n\n-commissioned\n\n    ...Government-commissioned research.\n\n    政府委托进行的研究\n\n2.N-COUNT受托之事；（接受报酬的）任务A commission is a piece of work that someone is asked to do and is paid for.\n\n    Just a few days ago, I finished a commission.\n\n    就在几天前，我完成了一项委托创作任务。\n\n3.N-VAR佣金；回扣Commission is a sum of money paid to a salesperson for every sale that he or she makes. If a salesperson is paid on commission, the amount they receive depends on the amount they sell. \n\n    The salesmen work on commission only...\n\n    销售人员只根据销售量提取佣金。\n\n    He also got a commission for bringing in new clients.\n\n    他还因为带来了很多新客户拿到一笔佣金。\n\n4.N-UNCOUNT（银行或公司收取的）服务费，手续费If a bank or other company charges commission, they charge a fee for providing a service, for example for exchanging money or issuing an insurance policy. \n\n    Travel agents charge 1 per cent commission on sterling cheques...\n\n    旅行社对英镑支票收取1%的服务费。\n\n    Sellers pay a fixed commission fee.\n\n    卖方支付固定的服务费。\n\n5.N-COUNT-COLL委员会；调查团A commission is a group of people who have been appointed to find out about something or to control something.\n\n    The authorities have been asked to set up a commission to investigate the murders.\n\n    当局被敦促成立一个委员会负责调查这些谋杀案。\n\n    ...the Press Complaints Commission.\n\n    媒体投诉委员会\n\n6.N-UNCOUNT犯（罪）The commission of a crime is the act of committing a crime. \n\n    If a person uses a gun in the commission of a crime, then he should be given an additional penalty.\n\n    如果使用枪支进行犯罪，就应该受到额外的惩罚。\n\n7.N-COUNT（军队的）任职令If a member of the armed forces receives a commission, he or she becomes an officer.\n\n    He accepted a commission as a naval officer.\n\n    他接受任命成为一名海军军官。\n\n8.VERB委任；任命…为军官If a member of the armed forces is commissioned, he or she is made an officer. \n\n    He was commissioned as second lieutenant in the Air Force...\n\n    他被任命为空军少尉。\n\n    Only commissioned officers qualify for the Military Cross.\n\n    只有持委任状的军官才有资格获得十字勋章。\n\n9.PHRASE（船、设备等）坏了的，不能使用的If something, for example a ship or a piece of equipment, is out of commission, it is broken and cannot be used until it is repaired. \n\n    The operator expects the ship to be out of commission until the end of September.\n\n    技工预计这艘船到9月底才能修好。
plateau@   1.N-COUNT高原A plateau is a large area of high and fairly flat land.\n\n        A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.\n\n        一条宽阔的山谷展现在眼前，通往一处平整的开垦地高原。\n    2.N-COUNT（活动或进程中的）稳定阶段，停滞时期If you say that an activity or process has reached a plateau, you mean that it has reached a stage where there is no further change or development.\n\n        The US heroin market now appears to have reached a plateau...\n\n        美国的海洛因市场现在似乎已到了停滞期。\n\n        I think the economy is stuck on a kind of plateau of slow growth.\n\n        我认为经济将停留在缓慢发展的阶段。\n    3.VERB（活动、进程、成本等）达到稳定阶段，进入停滞时期If something such as an activity, process, or cost plateaus or plateaus out, it reaches a stage where there is no further change or development. \n\n        Evelyn's career is accelerating, and mine is plateauing out a bit...\n\n        伊夫琳的职业生涯蒸蒸日上，而我的则停滞不前。\n\n        The shares plateaued at 153p.\n\n        股票稳定在153便士。
bunny@n. 小兔子1.N-COUNT（儿语）兔子A bunny or a bunny rabbit is a child's word for a rabbit.
daring@    1.ADJ-GRADED大胆的；敢于冒险的；勇于创新的People who are daring are willing to do or say things which are new or which might shock or anger other people.\n\n        Bergit was probably more daring than I was...\n\n        伯吉特可能比我更敢于冒险。\n\n        He realized this to be a very daring thing to ask.\n\n        他意识到这是一个非常大胆的问题。\n\n        ...one of the most daring political theatres in Prague.\n\n        布拉格最大胆的政治剧场之一\n\n    daringly\n\n        'Cheers,' he said and winked daringly at her.\n\n        “干杯，”他边说边大胆地向她使眼色。\n\n        ...a daringly low-cut dress.\n\n        领口开得奇低的礼服\n    2.ADJ-GRADED大胆的；勇敢的；英勇的A daring person is willing to do things that might be dangerous. \n\n        ...the heroic and daring Charlie Pierce...\n\n        英勇无畏的查利·皮尔斯\n\n        His daring rescue saved the lives of the youngsters.\n\n        他的大胆营救保住了那些年轻人的性命。\n    3.N-UNCOUNT胆量；勇气；冒险精神Daring is the courage to do things which might be dangerous or which might shock or anger other people.\n\n        His daring may have cost him his life.\n\n        他的冒险可能让他断送了性命。
puffy@    1.ADJ-GRADED（尤指脸部）肿胀的，浮肿的If a part of someone's body, especially their face, is puffy, it has a round, swollen appearance.\n\n        Her cheeks were puffy with crying.\n\n        她哭得面颊浮肿。\n\n        ...dark-ringed puffy eyes.\n\n        眼圈发黑、眼泡肿起\n\n    puffiness\n\n        He noticed some slight puffiness beneath her eyes.\n\n        他注意到她的眼袋略有浮肿。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（云朵）白色棉团状的If you describe a cloud as puffy, you mean that it looks like a large ball of white cotton wool. Puffy clouds appear during fine weather. \n\n        The sea was blue, and white puffy clouds sailed by.\n\n        大海一片蔚蓝，朵朵白云飘过。
adorable@    1.ADJ-GRADED可爱的；讨人喜爱的If you say that someone or something is adorable, you are emphasizing that they are very attractive and you feel great affection for them. \n\n        We have three adorable children.\n\n        我们有3个可爱的孩子。
ribosomal@ adj.[生化] 核醣体的
vertical@    1.ADJ垂直的；直立的Something that is vertical stands or points straight up.\n\n        The climber inched up a vertical wall of rock...\n\n        攀登者慢慢爬上了陡直的石壁。\n\n        The gadget can be attached to any vertical or near vertical surface.\n\n        该装置可以装在任何垂直或近似垂直的平面上。\n\n    vertically\n\n        Cut each bulb in half vertically.\n\n        将每个球茎竖切成两半。\n    2.N-SING垂直方向The vertical is the direction that points straight up, at an angle of 90 degrees to a flat surface. \n\n        Pluto seems to have suffered a major collision that tipped it 122 degrees from the vertical.\n\n        冥王星似乎受到过严重撞击，倾斜了122度。\n    3.N-COUNT垂直线；垂直面A vertical is a line or structure that is vertical.\n\n        As long as the verticals align, the design will look regular.\n\n        只要所有垂直面在一条线上，图案看起来就会很整齐。
horizontal@    1.ADJ水平的；横的Something that is horizontal is flat and level with the ground, rather than at an angle to it. \n\n        The board consists of vertical and horizontal lines...\n\n        板上画着横纵的线条。\n\n        Swing the club back until it is horizontal.\n\n        将球杆向后挥至水平位置。\n\n        Horizontal is also a noun.\n\n            Do not raise your left arm above the horizontal.\n\n            左臂不要举过水平高度。\n\n    horizontally\n\n        The wind was cold and drove the snow at him almost horizontally.\n\n        寒风凛冽，雪花几乎是朝他扑面而来。\n\n        ...a horizontally striped tie.\n\n        横条领带\n    2.N-COUNT水平线；横线；水平结构A horizontal is a line or structure that is horizontal.\n\n        The undulating planes of the countryside provide relief from the hard horizontals and verticals of the urban scene.\n\n        乡村起伏不平的地势使人们摆脱了城市刻板的横平竖直景象。
trade-off@n. (对不能同时兼顾的因素)权衡, 物物交换\n取舍    1.N-COUNT权衡；协调；交易；交换A trade-off is a situation where you make a compromise between two things, or where you exchange all or part of one thing for another. \n\n        The newspaper's headline indicates that there was a trade-off at the summit.\n\n        报纸的大字标题表明峰会上大家作出了妥协。\n\n        ...the trade-off between inflation and unemployment.\n\n        在通货膨胀与失业之间求得平衡\n\n        …the tradeoff of territory or land for peace.\n\n        以领土或土地换取和平的交易
reproductive@adj. 复制的, 生殖的\nn. （尤指群居昆虫的）母体    1.ADJ繁殖的；生殖的Reproductive processes and organs are concerned with the reproduction of living things. \n\n        ...the female reproductive system.\n\n        女性生殖系统
instinctive@    1.ADJ本能的；天性的；直觉的An instinctive feeling, idea, or action is one that you have or do without thinking or reasoning.\n\n        It's an absolutely instinctive reaction—if a child falls you pick it up...\n\n        这完全是本能的反应——如果一个孩子摔倒了你会把他扶起来。\n\n        Ms Senatorova showed an instinctive feel for market economics.\n\n        谢纳托罗娃女士对市场经济学有一种天生的敏感。\n\n    instinctively\n\n        Jane instinctively knew all was not well with her 10-month old son.\n\n        简凭直觉知道她 10 个月大的儿子情况不对劲。
metamorphose@1.V-ERGSee also:metamorphosis；（使）完全变形；（使）彻底改变To metamorphose or be metamorphosed means to develop and change into something completely different. \n\n    ...hysterical laughter which gradually metamorphoses into convulsive sobs... \n\n    歇斯底里的笑声渐渐地变成了剧烈的抽泣\n\n    The group is having to metamorphose from a loose collection of businesses into a fully integrated multinational...\n\n    该集团将不得不由一个松散的企业联合组织转变成一个全面整合的跨国集团。\n\n    I was going to metamorphose the movies into an art...\n\n    我准备把电影业转变为一门艺术。
nip@v. 捏, 夹，咬，剪断，夹断，冻伤，偷\nv. 小饮\nn. 捏, 夹\nn. 少量，小口（尤指烈酒）    1.VERB迅速前往；急忙赶往If you nip somewhere, usually somewhere nearby, you go there quickly or for a short time. \n\n        Should I nip out and get some groceries?...\n\n        要我赶紧出去一趟买些食品吗？\n\n        Wayne is always nipping down to the corner shop for him...\n\n        韦恩总是一溜烟跑到街角商店找他。\n\n        Beasley told me he'd seen you, so I nipped straight home.\n\n        比斯利告诉我他看到你了，所以我就赶快直接回家了。\n    2.VERB轻咬；轻掐；轻捏If an animal or person nips you, they bite you lightly or squeeze a piece of your skin between their finger and thumb. \n\n        I have known cases where dogs have nipped babies...\n\n        我知道有一些狗咬婴儿的事情。\n\n        He nipped Billy's cheek with two rough fingers.\n\n        他用两个粗糙的手指捏了捏比利的脸蛋。\n\n        Nip is also a noun.\n\n            Some ants can give you a nasty nip.\n\n            一些蚂蚁会咬得你很疼。\n    3.N-COUNT（烈性酒的）一小口，一呷，少量A nip is a small amount of a strong alcoholic drink.\n\n        She had a habit of taking an occasional nip from a flask of cognac.\n\n        她有偶尔喝一小口干邑的习惯。\n    4.to nip something in the bud→see:bud；
nip in the bud@消灭于萌芽状态, 刚开始就消灭掉6.PHRASE把…消灭在萌芽状态；防（患）于未然If you nip something such as bad behaviour in the bud, you stop it before it can develop very far. \n\n    It is important to recognize jealousy and to nip it in the bud before it gets out of hand.\n\n    重要的是要甄辨出嫉妒情绪并尽早消除这种心理，以免其一发不可收拾。
gestation@    1.N-UNCOUNT怀孕（期）；妊娠（期）Gestation is the process in which babies grow inside their mother's body before they are born. \n\n        ...the seventeenth week of gestation...\n\n        妊娠第17周\n\n        The gestation period can be anything between 95 and 150 days.\n\n        妊娠期从95天至150天不等。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT（想法等的）构思，酝酿，孕育Gestation is the process in which an idea or plan develops. \n\n        ...the prolonged period of gestation of this design.\n\n        这项设计漫长的构思阶段
scenario@n. 情节梗概, 剧本1.N-COUNT设想；可能发生的情况If you talk about a likely or possible scenario, you are talking about the way in which a situation may develop.\n\n    ...the nightmare scenario of a divided and irrelevant Royal Family...\n\n    对于王室四分五裂、无足轻重的可怕设想\n\n    In the worst-case scenario, you could become a homeless person...\n\n    最坏的情况是你可能会无家可归。\n\n    Try to imagine all the possible scenarios and what action you would take.\n\n    努力想象所有可能出现的情况并考虑一下你会采取什么行动。\n\n2.N-COUNT（电影的）剧情梗概The scenario of a film is a piece of writing that gives an outline of the story.
confession@n. 自认, 自白, 招供    1.N-COUNT供状；供词A confession is a signed statement by someone in which they admit that they have committed a particular crime.\n\n        They forced him to sign a confession.\n\n        他们强迫他在一份供词上签名。\n    2.N-VAR（对使自己羞愧或尴尬之事的）承认，坦白Confession is the act of admitting that you have done something that you are ashamed of or embarrassed about.\n\n        The diaries are a mixture of confession and observation...\n\n        这些日记既有自白，也有评论。\n\n        I have a confession to make.\n\n        我有件事要坦白。\n    3.N-VAR声明；告白；表白If you make a confession of your beliefs or feelings, you publicly tell people that this is what you believe or feel. \n\n        ...Tatyana's confession of love.\n\n        塔季扬娜爱的告白\n    4.N-VAR（天主教会等的）忏悔，告解，办神工In the Catholic church and in some other churches, if you go to confession, you privately tell a priest about your sins and ask for forgiveness.\n\n        He never went to Father Porter for confession again.\n\n        他再也没有向波特神甫作过告解。
operative@    1.ADJ运作（或运转）着的；起作用的；产生影响的A system or service that is operative is working or having an effect. \n\n        The commercial telephone service was no longer operative...\n\n        商业电话服务已不再运营。\n\n        The Youth Training Scheme was operative by the end of 1983.\n\n        青年培训计划一直持续到1983年底。\n    2.N-COUNT工人；（尤指）技工，操作员An operative is a worker, especially one who does work with their hands. \n\n        In an automated car plant there is not a human operative to be seen.\n\n        在自动化汽车制造厂看不到一个工人。\n    3.N-COUNT特工；间谍；密探；情报人员An operative is someone who works for a government agency such as the intelligence service. \n\n        Naturally the CIA wants to protect its operatives.\n\n        美国中央情报局当然想保护其特工。\n    4.PHRASE关键词If you describe a word as the operative word, you want to draw attention to it because you think it is important or exactly true in a particular situation. \n\n        As long as the operative word is 'greed', you can't count on people keeping the costs down...\n\n        只要“贪婪”仍是一切的出发点，就别指望人们会降低成本。\n\n        A small dram of whisky may be prescribed by doctors for those over 60 to help them sleep. It is vital though to emphasize that 'small' is the operative word.\n\n        医生可以建议60岁以上的老人少量地喝点威士忌以改善睡眠，然而至关重要的是必须强调“少量”这个关键词。
realm@    1.N-COUNT（活动、兴趣或思想的）领域，范围You can use realm to refer to any area of activity, interest, or thought. \n\n        ...the realm of politics...\n\n        政治领域\n\n        Students' interests are mostly limited to the academic realm.\n\n        学生们的兴趣大多限于学术领域。\n    2.N-COUNT王国A realm is a country that has a king or queen. \n\n        Defence of the realm is crucial.\n\n        王国的国防至关重要。\n    3.PHRASE可能的范围If you say that something is not beyond the realms of possibility, you mean that it is possible. \n\n        A fall of 50 per cent or more on prices is not beyond the realms of possibility...\n\n        降价50%或更多并非不可能。\n\n        This is a target which is surely within the realm of possibility.\n\n        这是一个完全有可能实现的目标。
boundless@adj. 无限的(无穷的, 无边无际的)    1.ADJ无止境的；无限的If you describe something as boundless, you mean that there seems to be no end or limit to it.\n\n        The work demanded boundless energy and theatrical imagination...\n\n        这种工作需要具备无限的精力和夸张的想象力。\n\n        His reforming zeal was boundless.\n\n        他对于改革热情无限。
howl@1.VERB（狼、狗等）长嚎，嗥叫If an animal such as a wolf or a dog howls, it makes a long, loud, crying sound. \n\n    Somewhere in the streets beyond a dog suddenly howled, baying at the moon.\n\n    远处的街上，有只狗突然对月长嚎起来。\n\n    Howl is also a noun.\n\n        The dog let out a savage howl and, wheeling round, flew at him.\n\n        那只狗发出一声凶猛的狂吠，突然转身向他扑去。\n\n2.VERB（人因疼痛、愤怒、愁苦而）吼叫，嚎哭，哀号If a person howls, they make a long, loud cry expressing pain, anger, or unhappiness. \n\n    He howled like a wounded animal as blood spurted from the gash...\n\n    当血从伤口中喷出时，他像一只受伤的动物一样嚎叫起来。\n\n    The baby was howling for her 3am feed.\n\n    宝宝哀号着要吃凌晨3点的那顿奶。\n\n    Howl is also a noun.\n\n        With a howl of rage, he grabbed the neck of a broken bottle and advanced.\n\n        他一声怒吼，抓起一个破瓶子的瓶颈冲上前来。\n\n3.VERB（风）呼啸，怒号When the wind howls, it blows hard and makes a loud noise. \n\n    The wind howled all night, but I slept a little...\n\n    风整夜怒号着，但我还是睡了一会儿。\n\n    It sank in a howling gale.\n\n    它在呼啸的狂风中沉没了。\n\n4.VERB（人）高声嚷，大声呼叫If you howl something, you say it in a very loud voice. \n\n    'Get away, get away, get away' he howled...\n\n    “滚开，滚开，都滚开”他高声嚷道。\n\n    The crowd howled its approval.\n\n    人群高声欢呼，以示赞同。\n\n5.VERB放声（大笑）If you howl with laughter, you laugh very loudly. \n\n    Joe, Pink, and Booker howled with delight...\n\n    乔、平克和布克高兴得放声大笑。\n\n    The crowd howled, delirious.\n\n    人群笑声震天，欣喜若狂。\n\n    Howl is also a noun.\n\n        His stories caused howls of laughter.\n\n        他讲的故事引起了阵阵大笑。
wretched@adj. 可怜的, 不幸的, 卑鄙的，质量差的，恶劣的    1.ADJ-GRADED不幸的；可怜的；苦难的You describe someone as wretched when you feel sorry for them because they are in an unpleasant situation or have suffered unpleasant experiences. \n\n        You have built up a huge property empire by buying from wretched people who had to sell or starve.\n\n        你靠从那些不卖房就得挨饿的可怜人手里买下房子后建立起了庞大的房产帝国。\n\n    wretchedly\n\n        The country's 37 million people are wretchedly poor.\n\n        该国3，700万人一贫如洗。\n\n        ...prisoners living in wretchedly overcrowded conditions.\n\n        生活在拥挤不堪的环境中的囚徒\n\n    wretchedness\n\n        He does deserve some good luck after so much wretchedness.\n\n        经过这么多苦难之后，他应该行点好运了。\n    2.ADJ讨厌的；混账的；该死的You use wretched to describe someone or something that you dislike or feel angry with. \n\n        Wretched woman, he thought, why the hell can't she wait?...\n\n        他想，可恶的女人，她怎么就不能等一等呢？\n\n        Theft is something that really disgusts me. It makes me feel hateful towards this whole wretched island.\n\n        偷窃是让我深恶痛绝的事情，它让我对这整个该死的岛都充满仇视。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED苦恼的；难过的；哀伤的Someone who feels wretched feels very unhappy. \n\n        I feel really confused and wretched...\n\n        我觉得十分迷惘，难过极了。\n\n        The wretched look on the little girl's face made him sorry.\n\n        小女孩脸上痛苦的表情让他很难受。\n\n    wretchedly\n\n        His marriage was wretchedly unhappy...\n\n        他的婚姻很不幸福。\n\n        'I made it all up,' she said wretchedly.\n\n        “这都是我编出来的。”她难过地说。\n\n    wretchedness\n\n        ...their shared wretchedness at Werner's death.\n\n        他们对沃纳之死共同的哀伤\n    4.ADJ-GRADED恶劣的；低劣的If you describe something as wretched, you are emphasizing that it is very bad or of very poor quality. \n\n        What a wretched excuse...\n\n        多么拙劣的借口！\n\n        The pay has always been wretched.\n\n        薪水总是少得可怜。
dissipate@    1.V-ERG（使）消失；消除；驱散When something dissipates or when you dissipate it, it becomes less or becomes less strong until it disappears or goes away completely. \n\n        The tension in the room had dissipated...\n\n        房间里的紧张气氛消失了。\n\n        He wound down the windows to dissipate the heat.\n\n        他摇下窗子来散热。\n\n    dissipation\n\n        ...heat dissipation.\n\n        散热\n    2.VERB浪费（金钱、时间或精力）；挥霍When someone dissipates money, time, or effort, they waste it in a foolish way. \n\n        He is dissipating his time and energy on too many different things...\n\n        他在太多不同的事情上浪费时间和精力。\n\n        Her father had dissipated her inheritance.\n\n        她父亲已经挥霍掉了她继承的遗产。\n\n    dissipation\n\n        ...the dissipation of my wealth.\n\n        对我财富的挥霍
bugger@n. &lt;律&gt;鸡奸者，&lt;口&gt; 讨厌的人，家伙\nv. &lt;律&gt;与（某人）鸡奸，鸡奸1.N-COUNT蠢货；笨蛋Some people use bugger to describe a person who has done something annoying or stupid. \n\n2.N-SING麻烦事；棘手的事Some people say that a job or task is a bugger when it is difficult to do. \n\n3.VERB（用于单词或短语前，强调对所指称的人或物不感兴趣）去他的Some people use bugger in expressions such as bugger him or bugger the cost in order to emphasize that they do not care about the person or thing that the word or phrase refers to. \n\n4.VERB鸡奸To bugger someone means to have anal intercourse with them.\n\n5.EXCLAM混蛋；该死Some people say bugger it or bugger when they are angry that something has gone wrong. \n\n6.EXCLAM哎呀！天哪！（表示惊讶）Some people say bugger me to emphasize that they are very surprised about something.
pincer@1.N-PLURAL钳子；胡桃钳Pincers consist of two pieces of metal that are hinged in the middle. They are used as a tool for gripping things or for pulling things out. \n\n    His surgical instruments were a knife and a pair of pincers.\n\n    他的外科手术器械是一把刀和一把钳子。\n\n2.N-COUNT（蟹、虾等的）螯The pincers of an animal such as a crab or a lobster are its front claws.
pinch@    1.VERB捏；拧；掐；夹If you pinch a part of someone's body, you take a piece of their skin between your thumb and first finger and give it a short squeeze. \n\n        She pinched his arm as hard as she could...\n\n        她使出浑身的力气拧他的胳膊。\n\n        We both kept pinching ourselves to prove that it wasn't all a dream.\n\n        我们两个都一直在掐自己，证明这不是在做梦。\n\n        Pinch is also a noun.\n\n            She gave him a little pinch.\n\n            她轻轻地捏了他一下。\n    2.N-COUNT（一）撮；少量A pinch of an ingredient such as salt is the amount of it that you can hold between your thumb and your first finger. \n\n        Put all the ingredients, including a pinch of salt, into a food processor.\n\n        把包括一撮盐在内的所有配料放入食品加工机。\n\n        ...a pinch of nutmeg.\n\n        一撮肉豆蔻\n    3.VERB偷取，偷盗（尤指不贵重的物品）To pinch something, especially something of little value, means to steal it. \n\n        Do you remember when I pinched your glasses?\n\n        你还记得我偷你眼镜的事儿吗？\n\n        ...pickpockets who pinched his wallet.\n\n        偷走他钱包的扒手\n    4.PHRASE必要时；在紧要关头If you say that something is possible at a pinch, or in American English if you say that something is possible in a pinch, you mean that it would be possible if it was necessary, but it might not be very comfortable or convenient. \n\n        Six people, and more at a pinch, could be seated comfortably at the table.\n\n        这张桌子可以很舒服地坐6个人，而且必要时多坐几个也不会挤。\n    5.PHRASE感到手头拮据；感到囊中羞涩If a person or company is feeling the pinch, they do not have as much money as they used to, and so they cannot buy the things they would like to buy. \n\n        Consumers are spending less and traders are feeling the pinch.\n\n        消费者支出在减少，商人感觉手头拮据。\n    6.PHRASE身处困境；处境艰难If you are in a pinch, you are in a difficult situation. \n\n        I'd trust her in a pinch...\n\n        身处困境时，我信任她。\n\n        Everyone knew he was in a pinch.\n\n        每个人都知道他境况艰难。
Mayday@n. 国际遇险无线电呼救信号1.N-COUNT（飞机或船只遇险时发出的）无线电呼救信号If someone in a plane or ship sends out a Mayday or a Mayday message, they send out a radio message calling for help because they are in serious difficulty.\n\n    He raced to pick up the lifejackets while his stepmother sent out a Mayday call.\n\n    他的继母发出无线电求救信号的时候，他飞跑着去拿救生衣。\n\n2.CONVENTION（无线电求救信号中的求救内容）“求救！求救！”'Mayday! Mayday!' is the phrase that is used in Mayday messages to indicate that help is needed.
catapult@n. 弹弩,发射机    1.N-COUNT弹弓A catapult is a device for shooting small stones. It is made of a Y-shaped stick with a piece of elastic tied between the two top parts. \n\n    in AM, use 美国英语用 slingshot\n    2.N-COUNT（航空母舰上弹射飞机升空的）弹射装置，弹射器A catapult is a device that is used to send aircraft into the air from an aircraft carrier.\n    3.V-ERG（将…）弹出；（使）射出If someone or something catapults or is catapulted through the air, they are thrown very suddenly, quickly, and violently through it. \n\n        We've all seen enough dummies catapulting through windscreens in TV warnings to know the dangers of not wearing seat belts...\n\n        在电视里，假人穿过挡风玻璃飞出去的警示镜头我们见得多了，知道不系安全带的危险。\n\n        He was catapulted into the side of the van.\n\n        他被弹飞出去，撞在货车的侧面。\n    4.V-ERG（使）突然处于…境地；（使）忽然身处…情况下If something catapults you into a particular state or situation, or if you catapult there, you are suddenly and unexpectedly caused to be in that state or situation. \n\n        'Basic Instinct' catapulted her to top status among Hollywood's glamour goddesses...\n\n        《本能》使她跃至一线，成功跻身好莱坞耀眼的女明星之列。\n\n        Suddenly she was catapulted into his jet-set lifestyle...\n\n        突然间，她过上了他那种阔佬生活。\n\n        Affleck catapulted to fame after picking up an Oscar.\n\n        摘得奥斯卡奖后，阿弗莱克一举成名。
colonel@n. 上校    1.N-COUNT; N-TITLE; N-VOC（陆军、空军或海军陆战队的）上校A colonel is a senior officer in an army, air force, or the marines.\n\n        This particular place was run by an ex-Army colonel.\n\n        这个地方以前由一位前陆军上校经管。\n\n        ...Colonel Edward Staley.\n\n        爱德华·斯特利上校
let in on@vt. 告诉(让 ... 知道, 让 ... 参与)    1.PHRASAL VERB让…得知；向…透露If you let someone in on something that is a secret from most people, you allow them to know about it. \n\n        I'm going to let you in on a little secret...\n\n        我要告诉你一个小秘密。\n\n        He has not yet been let in on the bad news.\n\n        他还不知道这个不幸的消息。
be better off@17.PHRASE（用于建议）不如，最好If you say that someone would be better off doing something, you are advising them to do it or expressing the opinion that it would benefit them to do it. \n\n    If you've got bags you're better off taking a taxi...\n\n    你要是大包小包的，不如打的算了。\n\n    Their stance seems to be that a baby or child is better off in its country of birth.\n\n    他们似乎认为婴儿或者小孩还是呆在自己出生的国家为好。
magazine@1.N-COUNT杂志A magazine is a publication with a paper cover which is issued regularly, usually every week or every month, and which contains articles, stories, photographs, and advertisements.\n\n    Her face is on the cover of a dozen or more magazines.\n\n    她的面孔出现在十几种杂志的封面上。\n\n2.N-COUNT（广播、电视上融合多种话题的）杂志型节目，板块节目On radio or television, a magazine or a magazine programme is a programme consisting of several items about different topics, people, and events. \n\n    ...a live arts magazine.\n\n    直播的艺术板块节目\n\n    ...'Science In Action', a weekly science magazine programme.\n\n    《当下科学》——一个每周一期的科学新闻杂志型节目\n\n3.N-COUNT（枪的）子弹夹，弹匣，弹仓In an automatic gun, the magazine is the part that contains the bullets.\n\n4.N-COUNT军火库；弹药库A magazine is a building in which things such as guns, bullets, and explosives are kept.
radius@    1.N-SING半径范围；半径距离The radius around a particular point is the distance from it in any direction. \n\n        Nigel has searched for work in a ten-mile radius around his home.\n\n        奈杰尔一直在他家周围10英里的范围内找工作。\n    2.N-COUNT半径The radius of a circle is the distance from its centre to its outside edge.\n\n        He indicated a semicircle with a radius of about thirty miles.\n\n        他标示出了一个半径大约为30英里的半圆形。
pile@n. 堆,桩,大量,核反应堆\nvi. 形成堆,拥挤进入\nvt. 堆积,装载1.N-COUNT（上窄下宽的）堆A pile of things is a mass of them that is high in the middle and has sloping sides. \n\n    ...a pile of sand...\n\n    一堆沙子\n\n    ...a little pile of crumbs...\n\n    一小堆面包屑\n\n    The leaves had been swept into huge piles.\n\n    树叶被扫成了一大堆一大堆的。\n\n2.N-COUNT（一个压着一个摆放整齐的）叠，摞A pile of things is a quantity of things that have been put neatly somewhere so that each thing is on top of the one below. \n\n    ...a pile of boxes...\n\n    一叠盒子\n\n    We sat in Sam's study, among the piles of books...\n\n    我们坐在萨姆的书房里，身边是一堆一堆的书。\n\n    The clothes were folded in a neat pile.\n\n    衣服叠放成整齐的一摞。\n\nUsage Note:\n\nA pile of things can be tidy or untidy. …a neat pile of clothes. A heap is usually untidy, and often has the shape of a hill or mound. Now, the house is a heap of rubble. A stack is usually tidy, and often consists of flat objects placed directly on top of each other. …a neat stack of dishes.\n\npile既可指整齐的一叠，也可指杂乱的一堆：a neat pile of clothes（整齐的一叠衣服）。heap 通常指杂乱的、常呈小山或土墩状的一堆：Now， the house is a heap of rubble（现在，房子成了一堆瓦砾）。stack通常指整齐的、常是扁平物体叠放在一起的一摞：a neat stack of dishes（整齐的一摞盘子）。\n3.VERB堆放；堆积；叠架If you pile things somewhere, you put them there so that they form a pile. \n\n    He was piling clothes into the suitcase...\n\n    他在把衣服一件件叠放进手提箱中。\n\n    A few newspapers and magazines were piled on a table.\n\n    几份报纸和杂志堆在桌上。\n\n4.VERB成堆地盖住（或装满）If something is piled with things, it is covered or filled with piles of things. \n\n    Tables were piled high with local produce.\n\n    桌上高高堆放着当地的农产品。\n\n    ...trucks piled with luggage.\n\n    塞满成堆行李的卡车\n\n5.QUANT一大堆；大量If you talk about a pile of something or piles of something, you mean a large amount of it. \n\n    I've got a pile of questions afterwards for you.\n\n    我有一大堆的问题等着过后问你。\n\n    ...a whole pile of disasters.\n\n    灾难迭至\n\n6.VERB拥进/拥出；挤进/挤出If a group of people pile into or out of a vehicle, they all get into it or out of it in a disorganized way. \n\n    They all piled into Jerrold's car...\n\n    他们一窝蜂地挤进杰罗尔德的车里。\n\n    A fleet of police cars suddenly arrived. Dozens of officers piled out.\n\n    突然开来一队警车，数十个警察一拥而出。\n\n7.N-COUNT（尤指富人或要人居住的）高大宏伟的建筑物You can refer to a large impressive building as a pile, especially when it is the home of a rich important person.\n\n    ...some stately pile in the country.\n\n    乡下某座恢宏气派的建筑\n\n8.N-COUNT（房屋和桥梁的）桩，桩柱Piles are wooden, concrete, or metal posts which are pushed into the ground and on which buildings or bridges are built. Piles are often used in very wet areas so that the buildings do not flood. \n\n    ...settlements of wooden houses, set on piles along the shore.\n\n    建在沿岸桩柱上的木制房屋居住区\n\n9.N-PLURAL痔疮Piles are painful swellings that can appear in the veins inside a person's anus.\n\n10.N-SING（地毯或织物的）绒面，绒毛，绒头The pile of a carpet or of a fabric such as velvet is its soft surface. It consists of a lot of little threads standing on end.\n\n    ...the carpet's thick pile.\n\n    地毯的厚绒\n\n11.PHRASE处于（社会或某组织的）下层/上层Someone who is at the bottom of the pile is low down in society or low down in an organization. Someone who is at the top of the pile is high up in society or high up in an organization.
bunker@n. 煤仓, [高尔夫]沙坑\nv. 击入沙坑, 陷入穷境, 将燃料装入（燃料仓）    1.N-COUNT（通常建于地下的）掩体；地堡A bunker is a place, usually underground, that has been built with strong walls to protect it against heavy gunfire and bombing.\n\n        ...an extensive network of fortified underground bunkers.\n\n        四通八达的地下防御工事\n    2.N-COUNT煤箱；燃料箱A bunker is a container for coal or other fuel.\n    3.N-COUNT（高尔夫球场上的）沙坑On a golf course, a bunker is a large area filled with sand, which is deliberately put there as an obstacle that golfers must try to avoid.\n    4.VERB（高尔夫球运动中）把球击入沙坑In golf, if you bunker a shot, you hit your ball into the bunker. \n\n        She bunkered her second shot.\n\n        她第二次击球把球打进了沙坑。
combat@    The noun is pronounced /'kɒmbæt/. The verb is pronounced /kəm'bæt/. 名词读作 /'kɒm-bæt/。动词读作 /kəm'bæt/。\n    1.N-UNCOUNT战斗Combat is fighting that takes place in a war.\n\n        Over 16 million men had died in combat...\n\n        1，600多万人在战斗中牺牲。\n\n        Yesterday saw hand-to-hand combat in the city.\n\n        昨天该市发生了肉搏战。\n\n        ...combat aircraft.\n\n        战斗机\n    2.N-COUNT斗争；格斗A combat is a battle, or a fight between two people.\n\n        It was the end of a long combat.\n\n        这是一场长期斗争的结束。\n    3.VERB与…作斗争；打击If people in authority combat something, they try to stop it happening. \n\n        Congress has criticised new government measures to combat crime.\n\n        国会对政府打击犯罪的新措施提出了批评。
close quarters@n. 近距离 eg：close-quarters combat/conflict/situations etc.
bloodstain@1.N-COUNT血迹；血污；血痕A bloodstain is a mark on a surface caused by blood.
die down@渐渐消失，平息，变弱    1.PHRASAL VERB减弱；逐渐平息If something dies down, it becomes very much quieter or less intense. \n\n        The rain remained steady though the wind had died down...\n\n        尽管风势已经减弱，雨还是下个不停。\n\n        The controversy is unlikely to die down.\n\n        争议不大可能平息。
perpetrate@    1.VERB犯（罪）；做（错事）；干（坏事）If someone perpetrates a crime or any other immoral or harmful act, they do it. \n\n        A high proportion of crime in any country is perpetrated by young males in their teens and twenties...\n\n        在任何国家的犯罪者中，十几二十几岁的青年男性都占了很高的比例。\n\n        Tremendous wrongs were being perpetrated on the poorest and least privileged human beings...\n\n        对最贫穷和最没有特权的人们犯下了大量罪行。\n\n        You begin to ask yourself what kind of person perpetrated this crime.\n\n        你开始自问是什么样的人犯下这样的罪行。\n\n    perpetration\n\n        ...a very small minority who persist in the perpetration of these crimes.\n\n        继续从事这些犯罪行为的少数人\n\n    perpetrator\n\n        The perpetrator of this crime must be traced.\n\n        对这起案件的凶手必须要一查到底。
refine@    1.VERB提炼；精炼When a substance is refined, it is made pure by having all other substances removed from it. \n\n        Oil is refined to remove naturally occurring impurities.\n\n        油经过提炼去除天然存在的杂质。\n\n    refining\n\n        ...oil refining.\n\n        炼油\n    2.VERB改进，改善，改良（过程、理论或机器）If something such as a process, theory, or machine is refined, it is improved by having small changes made to it. \n\n        Surgical techniques are constantly being refined.\n\n        外科手术的技术不断得到完善。
affiliated@    1.ADJ隶属的；附属的If an organization is affiliated with another larger organization, it is officially connected with the larger organization or is a member of it. \n\n        There are 73 unions affiliated to the Trades Union Congress.\n\n        共有73家工会隶属于英国职工大会。\n\n        ...the United Nations and its affiliated organisations.\n\n        联合国及其附属机构\n\n        -affiliated combines with nouns to form adjectives that describe which organization something or someone is affiliated to.（与名词连用构成形容词，表示某物或某人所隶属的组织）\n\n            ...church-affiliated schools in Oregon.\n\n            俄勒冈隶属于教会的学校\n    2.ADJ（专业人员如医生或律师）与…有正式关系的，为…工作的If a professional person, such as a lawyer or doctor, is affiliated with an organization, they are officially connected with that organization or do some official work for it. \n\n        He will remain affiliated with the firm as a special associate director.\n\n        他将作为特别副经理继续为该公司工作。\n\n        ...our affiliated members.\n\n        我们所有的正式成员
cordon off@用警戒线隔离    1.PHRASAL VERB（设置警戒线）包围，警戒，封锁If police or soldiers cordon off an area, they prevent people from entering or leaving it, usually by forming a line or ring. \n\n        Police cordoned off part of the city centre...\n\n        警察封锁了市中心的部分地区。\n\n        The police cordoned everything off.\n\n        警察将一切都封锁了。
bioterrorism@    1.N-UNCOUNT生物恐怖主义Bioterrorism is terrorism that involves the use of biological weapons.\n\n        ...the threat of bioterrorism.\n\n        生物恐怖主义威胁\n\n    bioterrorist\n\n        ...the war against bioterrorists.\n\n        抗击生物恐怖分子的战争\n\n        ...a bioterrorist attack.\n\n        生物恐怖主义袭击
outrageous@adj. 暴虐的,极无礼的,可恶的\n 惊人的,肆无忌惮的,毫无节制的    1.ADJ-GRADED令人无法容忍的；骇人的If you describe something as outrageous, you are emphasizing that it is unacceptable or very shocking. \n\n        I must apologise for my outrageous behaviour...\n\n        我必须为自己极端无礼的行为道歉。\n\n        Charges for local telephone calls are particularly outrageous.\n\n        本地电话资费贵得出奇。\n\n    outrageously\n\n        Car-parks are few, crammed, and outrageously expensive...\n\n        停车场数量少，车位挤，并且停车费高得离谱。\n\n        She flirted with him outrageously at times.\n\n        她有时露骨地跟他调情。
domain@1.N-COUNT（尤指某人有控制力、影响力或权利的）领域，范围，范畴A domain is a particular field of thought, activity, or interest, especially one over which someone has control, influence, or rights. \n\n    ...the great experimenters in the domain of art...\n\n    艺术领域伟大的实验者们\n\n    This information should be in the public domain.\n\n    这一消息应该为公众所知。\n\n2.N-COUNT领土；势力范围Someone's domain is the area they own or have control over. \n\n    ...the mighty king's domain.\n\n    势力强大的国王的领土\n\n3.N-COUNT（因特网上的）域On the Internet, a domain is a set of addresses that shows, for example, the category or geographical area that an Internet address belongs to.
solitary@adj. 孤独的,独立的,荒凉的\nn. 隐士,    1.ADJ-GRADED（人或动物）独处的，独居的A person or animal that is solitary spends a lot of time alone. \n\n        Paul was a shy, pleasant, solitary man...\n\n        保罗是一个羞怯、友善、惯于独处的男人。\n\n        They often have a lonely and solitary life to lead.\n\n        他们常常过一种独居的孤独生活。\n    2.ADJ（行动）单独的，独自的A solitary activity is one that you do alone. \n\n        His evenings were spent in solitary drinking.\n\n        他晚上的时间都是靠独自喝闷酒打发。\n    3.ADJ（人或物）孤单的，孤零零的A solitary person or object is alone, with no others near them. \n\n        ...the occasional solitary figure making a study of wildflowers or grasses.\n\n        偶尔出现的研究野花野草的孤单身影\n    4.N-UNCOUNT同 solitary confinementSolitary is the same as solitary confinement . \n\n        Tom was in solitary across the way from me.\n\n        汤姆在我对面被单独监禁。
solitary confinement@    1.N-UNCOUNT单独监禁A prisoner who is in solitary confinement is being kept alone away from all other prisoners, usually as a punishment. \n\n        Last night he was being held in solitary confinement in Douglas jail.\n\n        昨晚他被单独监禁在道格拉斯的监狱里。
top brass@    1.N-SING-COLL高级军官；高管；要员In the army or in other organizations, the top brass are the people in the highest positions. \n\n        ...a reshuffle of the army's top brass.\n\n        军队高级军官的调整\n\n        …a press conference attended by top brass from Sony Records.\n\n        索尼唱片公司的高管参加的新闻发布会\n\n    in AM, use 美国英语用 brass
resolute@    1.ADJ-GRADED坚决的；坚定的；果断的If you describe someone as resolute, you approve of them because they are very determined not to change their mind or not to give up a course of action. \n\n        Voters perceive him as a decisive and resolute international leader...\n\n        投票者认为他是一位坚定果断的国际领导人。\n\n        He described the situation as very dangerous and called for resolute action.\n\n        他将形势描述得非常危险，并号召采取果断行动。\n\n    resolutely\n\n        He resolutely refused to speak English unless forced to...\n\n        除非迫不得已，否则他坚决不说英语。\n\n        The United States remains resolutely opposed to this.\n\n        美国对此仍然坚决反对。
conjure up@以魔法召唤，使在脑海中显现1.PHRASAL VERB使浮现于脑海；想起If you conjure up a memory, picture, or idea, you create it in your mind. \n\n    When he closed his eyes, he could conjure up in exact colour almost every event of his life...\n\n    他闭上眼睛时，几乎他一生中经历的每一件事情都会真切地浮现在他的脑海。\n\n    When we think of adventurers, many of us conjure up images of larger-than-life characters trekking to the North Pole.\n\n    一想到探险者，我们很多人脑海中浮现的便是长途跋涉前往北极的非凡人物形象。\n\n2.PHRASAL VERB（字词、声音等）使想起，使联想到If something such as a word or sound conjures up particular images or ideas, it makes you think of them. \n\n    Jimmy Buffett's music conjures up a warm night in the tropics...\n\n    吉米·巴菲特的音乐让人想起热带地区温暖的夜晚。\n\n    What does the word 'feminist' conjure up for you?\n\n    “女权主义者”这个词会让你想到什么？
advance@    1.VERB（常指为攻击而）前进，推进To advance means to move forward, often in order to attack someone. \n\n        Reports from Chad suggest that rebel forces are advancing on the capital...\n\n        来自乍得的报告显示叛军正向首都推进。\n\n        The water is advancing at a rate of 5cm a day...\n\n        水位正以每天5厘米的速度上升。\n\n        ...a picture of a man throwing himself before an advancing tank.\n\n        一名男子冲向迎面开来的坦克的一幅照片\n    2.VERBSee also:advanced；（尤指知识）发展，进步To advance means to make progress, especially in your knowledge of something. \n\n        Medical technology has advanced considerably...\n\n        医学技术突飞猛进。\n\n        Japan has advanced from a rural, feudal society to an urban, industrial power.\n\n        日本已从封建农业社会发展成一个城市化工业强国。\n    3.VERB贷给；预付；预支If you advance someone a sum of money, you lend it to them, or pay it to them earlier than arranged. \n\n        I advanced him some money, which he would repay on our way home...\n\n        我先借给他一些钱，在我们回家的路上他会还给我的。\n\n        The bank advanced $1.2 billion to help the country with debt repayments.\n\n        银行预支12亿美元帮助该国偿还债务。\n    4.N-COUNT贷款；预付款An advance is money which is lent or paid to someone before they would normally receive it.\n\n        She was paid a £100,000 advance for her next two novels.\n\n        她接下来的两部小说得到了10万英镑的预付稿费。\n    5.VERB提前（未来事件的日期）；使（未来事件）提前发生To advance an event, or the time or date of an event, means to bring it forward to an earlier time or date. \n\n        Too much protein in the diet may advance the ageing process...\n\n        饮食中摄入过量蛋白质可能会加速衰老。\n\n        The country's election commission has advanced the date of parliamentary elections by three days.\n\n        该国的选举委员会将议会选举日期提前了3天。\n    6.VERB促进，推动（事业、利益或主张）；使加速If you advance a cause, interest, or claim, you support it and help to make it successful. \n\n        When not producing art of his own, Oliver was busy advancing the work of others.\n\n        奥利弗在不搞自己的艺术创作时，就会忙着帮助别人完成作品。\n    7.VERB提出（理论、论点）When a theory or argument is advanced, it is put forward for discussion. \n\n        Many theories have been advanced as to why some women suffer from depression...\n\n        就一些女性患抑郁症的原因，各种说法纷至沓来。\n\n        An important set of ideas have been advanced by the biologist Rupert Sheldrake.\n\n        生物学家鲁珀特·谢尔德雷克已提出了一整套重要的观点。\n    8.N-VAR（常指军事行动中的）前进，行进，推进An advance is a forward movement of people or vehicles, usually as part of a military operation.\n\n        ...an advance on enemy positions...\n\n        向敌方阵地推进\n\n        The defences are intended to obstruct any advance by tanks and other vehicles.\n\n        这些防御工事用于阻止坦克等车辆前进。\n    9.N-PLURAL挑逗；勾引If you make advances to someone, you try to start a sexual relationship with them. \n\n        Mark had for some time been making advances towards her...\n\n        马克追她已经有一段时间了。\n\n        She rejected his advances during the trip to Cannes.\n\n        在去往戛纳的途中，她拒绝了他的挑逗。\n    10.N-VAR进步；进展An advance in a particular subject or activity is progress in understanding it or in doing it well.\n\n        Air safety has not improved since the dramatic advances of the 1970s...\n\n        航空安全自从20世纪70年代得到显著提高之后，至今再没有任何改善。\n\n        Their progress at work was mirrored by their children's educational advance.\n\n        子女在学业上有所进步，他们在工作上也就会有所起色。\n    11.N-SING改进；改善If something is an advance on what was previously available or done, it is better in some way. \n\n        This could be an advance on the present situation.\n\n        这样可能会改善当前状况。\n    12.ADJ预先的；事先的Advance booking, notice, or warning is done or given before an event happens. \n\n        They don't normally give any advance notice about which building they're going to inspect...\n\n        他们一般不会预先通知检查哪座大楼。\n\n        The event received little advance publicity.\n\n        关于该事件事先几乎没有报道。\n    13.ADJ先行的；先遣的An advance party or group is a small group of people who go on ahead of the main group. \n\n        The 20-strong advance party will be followed by another 600 soldiers as part of UN relief efforts.\n\n        作为联合国救援行动的一部分，在这支由20多人组成的先头部队之后还将增派600名士兵。\n    14.PREP-PHRASE在…的前面；在…之前If one thing happens or is done in advance of another, it happens or is done before the other thing.\n\n        I had asked everyone to submit questions in advance of the meeting.\n\n        我已请每个人在会议之前提交问题。\n    15.PHRASE提前；事先If you do something in advance, you do it before a particular date or event. \n\n        The subject of the talk is announced a week in advance.\n\n        会谈的主题已提前一周宣布。
ramp up@v. 巩固，提高，加强
groan@    1.VERB呻吟；叹息If you groan, you make a long, low sound because you are in pain, or because you are upset or unhappy about something. \n\n        Slowly, he opened his eyes. As he did so, he began to groan with pain...\n\n        他慢慢地睁开眼睛，并发出痛苦的呻吟。\n\n        They glanced at the man on the floor, who began to groan...\n\n        他们瞥了一眼躺在地上的男人，那人现在开始呻吟起来。\n\n        She was making small groaning noises.\n\n        她发出轻轻的呻吟声。\n\n        Groan is also a noun.\n\n            She heard him let out a pitiful, muffled groan...\n\n            她听到他发出一声令人悲悯的低沉的呻吟声。\n\n            As his ball flew wide, there was a collective groan from the stands.\n\n            他将球踢飞了，看台上一片叹息声。\n    2.VERB不高兴地低声说；咕哝If you groan something, you say it in a low, unhappy voice. \n\n        'My leg — I think it's broken,' Eric groaned.\n\n        “我的腿——我想是断了，”埃里克咕哝着说。\n    3.VERB抱怨；发牢骚If you groan about something, you complain about it. \n\n        His parents were beginning to groan about the price of college tuition.\n\n        他的父母开始抱怨大学的学费太贵。\n\n        Groan is also a noun.\n\n            Listen sympathetically to your child's moans and groans about what she can't do.\n\n            当你的孩子因不能做某些事情而发牢骚的时候，你应该抱着一颗理解的心去倾听。\n    4.VERB（树木等）发出嘎吱声If wood or something made of wood groans, it makes a loud sound when it moves. \n\n        The timbers groan and creak and the floorboards shift.\n\n        这些木头在吱吱嘎嘎作响，木地板有些摇晃。\n    5.VERB堆满，摆满，装满（食物）If you say that something such as a table groans under the weight of food, you are emphasizing that there is a lot of food on it. \n\n        The bar counter groans under the weight of huge plates of the freshest fish.\n\n        吧台上摆满了大碟大碟非常新鲜的鱼。\n\n        ...a table groaning with food.\n\n        堆满了食物的桌子\n    6.VERB受…重压；受…折磨；不堪重负If you say that someone or something is groaning under the weight of something, you think there is too much of that thing. \n\n        Consumers were groaning under the weight of high interest rates...\n\n        高利率令消费者不堪重负。\n\n        Bookshelves groan under the burden of books on threats to the environment.\n\n        书架上摆满了有关环境威胁的书，不堪重负。
ferocity@    1.N-UNCOUNT凶猛；狂暴；激烈The ferocity of something is its fierce or violent nature.\n\n        The armed forces seem to have been taken by surprise by the ferocity of the attack.\n\n        进攻非常猛烈，武装部队似乎被打了个措手不及。
utmost@  1.ADJ极度的；最大的You can use utmost to emphasize the importance or seriousness of something or to emphasize the way that it is done. \n\n        It is a matter of the utmost urgency to find out what has happened to these people... \n\n        当务之急是要弄清楚这些人出了什么事。\n\n        Security matters are treated with the utmost seriousness...\n\n        安全问题的处理极其严肃。\n\n        You should proceed with the utmost caution...\n\n        你应该小心行事。\n    2.N-SING极度；极限；最大可能If you say that you are doing your utmost to do something, you are emphasizing that you are trying as hard as you can to do it. \n\n        He would have done his utmost to help her, of that she was certain...\n\n        他肯定会尽最大努力帮她，这一点她非常肯定。\n\n        He will try his utmost to help them by means of his conventional medical knowledge.\n\n        他将会用自己的传统医学知识尽全力帮助他们。\n    3.PHRASE尽力；极度If you say that something is done to the utmost, you are emphasizing that it is done to the greatest extent, amount, or degree possible. \n\n        My limited diplomatic skills were tested to the utmost...\n\n        我有限的外交手腕儿受到了极其严峻的考验。\n\n        The best plan is to continue to attack him to the utmost of our power.\n\n        最佳方案就是继续不遗余力地攻击他。
toll@n. 通行费,代价,伤亡人数,钟声\nvi. 徵收通行税,呜钟\nvt. 向某人征税,钟响,引诱    1.V-ERG（缓慢反复地）敲（钟），鸣（丧钟）；（钟）鸣响When a bell tolls or when someone tolls it, it rings slowly and repeatedly, often as a sign that someone has died. \n\n        Church bells tolled and black flags fluttered...\n\n        教堂丧钟敲响，黑色的旗帜飘动。\n\n        The pilgrims tolled the bell.\n\n        朝圣者缓缓敲响了钟。\n    2.N-COUNT（桥梁、道路的）通行费A toll is a small sum of money that you have to pay in order to use a particular bridge or road.\n    3.N-COUNT（公路、桥梁的）收费A toll road or toll bridge is a road or bridge where you have to pay in order to use it. \n    4.N-COUNTSee also:death toll；（死亡、事故或灾难的）总数A toll is a total number of deaths, accidents, or disasters that occur in a particular period of time. \n\n        There are fears that the casualty toll may be higher.\n\n        有人担心伤亡总数可能会更高。\n\n        …the second highest annual murder toll in that city's history.\n\n        年谋杀案件总数处于该市历史上的第二高位\n    5.PHRASE造成恶果（或不利影响、痛苦等）If you say that something takes its toll or takes a heavy toll, you mean that it has a bad effect or causes a lot of suffering. \n\n        Winter takes its toll on your health...\n\n        冬天对健康不利。\n\n        Higher fuel prices took their toll.\n\n        燃料提价产生了恶果。\n\n        …a high exchange rate took a heavy toll on industry.\n\n        高汇率使工业蒙受了严重损失。
intercept@    1.VERB拦截；截住；截击If you intercept someone or something that is travelling from one place to another, you stop them before they get to their destination. \n\n        Gunmen intercepted him on his way to the airport...\n\n        持枪歹徒在他去机场的路上截击了他。\n\n        Dodd intercepted a ball intended for Smith...\n\n        多德拦截了给史密斯的球。\n\n        His letter was intercepted by the Secret Service.\n\n        他的信被特工处截获了。\n\n    interception\n\n        ...the interception of a ship off the west coast of Scotland.\n\n        对苏格兰西海岸外一艘船只的拦截
demolish@    1.VERB摧毁，拆毁，拆除（建筑物等）To demolish something such as a building means to destroy it completely. \n\n        A storm moved directly over the island, demolishing buildings and flooding streets...\n\n        暴风雨径直席卷该岛，摧毁了建筑，淹没了街道。\n\n        The building is now being demolished to make way for a motorway.\n\n        为修建高速公路，现正拆除这栋建筑。\n    2.VERB驳倒，推翻（某人的观点或论点）If you demolish someone's ideas or arguments, you prove that they are completely wrong or unreasonable. \n\n        Our intention was to demolish the rumours that have surrounded him...\n\n        我们的目的是要彻底击破围绕他的那些谣言。\n\n        The myth that Japan is not open to concerns from outside has, I think, been demolished at a stroke.\n\n        关于日本对外界的关注不予理会的谬论，我认为，一下子就被驳倒了。\n    3.VERB大败，打垮（对手）If a person or team demolishes their opponents, they defeat them by a great amount. \n\n        Millwall demolished Notts County 6-0 on Saturday.\n\n        周六米尔沃尔队以 6 比 0 大败诺茨郡队。
turbine@n. 涡轮1.N-COUNT涡轮机；透平机A turbine is a machine or engine which uses a stream of air, gas, water, or steam to turn a wheel and produce power.
safeguard@    1.VERB保护；保卫；维护；捍卫To safeguard something or someone means to protect them from being harmed, lost, or badly treated. \n\n        They will press for international action to safeguard the ozone layer...\n\n        他们将督促国际社会采取行动保护臭氧层。\n\n        The interests of minorities will have to be safeguarded under a new constitution...\n\n        新宪法必须能保护少数群体的利益。\n\n        They are taking precautionary measures to safeguard their forces from the effects of chemical weapons.\n\n        他们正采取预防措施保护其军队免受化学武器的伤害。\n    2.N-COUNT预防性条款（或法规）；保障措施A safeguard is a law, rule, or measure intended to prevent someone or something from being harmed. \n\n        Many people took second jobs as a safeguard against unemployment...\n\n        许多人为防失业都干两份工作。\n\n        A system like ours lacks adequate safeguards for civil liberties.\n\n        我们这样的制度缺乏有效保护公民自由的条款。
crew@    1.N-COUNT-COLL（飞机、轮船、飞船等上的）全体工作人员The crew of a ship, an aircraft, or a spacecraft is the people who work on and operate it.\n\n        The mission for the crew of the space shuttle Endeavour is essentially over...\n\n        “奋进号”航天飞机上全体机组人员的任务基本上已经完成了。\n\n        Despite their size, these vessels carry small crews, usually of around twenty men...\n\n        这些船虽然体积庞大，但能够承载的船员却很少，通常为20人左右。\n\n        The surviving crew members were ferried ashore.\n\n        幸存下来的船员被运上了岸。\n    2.N-COUNT（有专门技术的）一组工作人员A crew is a group of people with special technical skills who work together on a task or project. \n\n        ...a two-man film crew making a documentary...\n\n        由两人组成的纪录片摄制组\n\n        A paramedic ambulance crew went to the accident scene but were unable to save Mrs Wilson.\n\n        一组急救护理人员赶到事故现场，但没能救活威尔逊太太。\n    3.VERB在…上当船员If you crew a boat, you work on it as part of the crew. \n\n        She was already a keen and experienced sailor, having crewed in both Merlin and Grayling...\n\n        在“默林”号和“格雷林”号上工作过以后，她已经是一名头脑敏捷、经验丰富的水手了。\n\n        There were to be five teams of three crewing the boat.\n\n        该船上将有5组工作人员，每组3人。\n\n        ...a fully crewed yacht.\n\n        人员配备齐全的快艇\n    4.N-SING-COLL（不喜欢的）一帮人You can use crew to refer to a group of people you disapprove of. \n\n        ...the motley crew of failed and aspiring actors who comprised the 'distinguished guests'...\n\n        “贵宾”由一群形形色色的演员组成，有的郁郁不得志，有的胸怀抱负\n\n        This crew of killers and life-wreckers are headed by the mad but cunning Nino Brown.\n\n        这个残害生命的杀人团伙以疯狂而狡猾的尼诺·布朗为首。
perish@    1.VERB（人或动物）惨死，猝死If people or animals perish, they die as a result of very harsh conditions or as the result of an accident. \n\n        Most of the butterflies perish in the first frosts of autumn.\n\n        大多数蝴蝶会在秋天的第一场霜冻来临时纷纷死去。\n\n        ...the ferry disaster in which 193 passengers perished.\n\n        造成193名乘客丧生的渡船事故\n    2.VERB湮灭；毁灭；丧失If something perishes, it comes to an end or is destroyed for ever. \n\n        Buddhism had to adapt to the new world or perish...\n\n        佛教必须适应新时代，否则将会消亡。\n\n        Civilizations do eventually decline and perish.\n\n        各种文明最后都会衰落、消亡。\n    3.VERB（物质或材料）老化，腐烂，脆裂If a substance or material perishes, it starts to fall to pieces and becomes useless. \n\n        Obviously the plaster's just perished and all fallen off...\n\n        很明显灰泥已脆裂老化，全剥落下来了。\n\n        Their tyres are slowly perishing.\n\n        他们的车胎在慢慢老化。\n\n    perished\n\n        ...tattered pieces of ancient, perished leather.\n\n        磨损得破烂不堪的旧皮革\n    4.CONVENTION（表示认为建议不可能、荒谬）想都别想，死了心吧，没门儿If someone says perish the thought, they mean that they think that a suggestion or possibility is unpleasant or ridiculous. \n\n        Me a policeman! Perish the thought!...\n\n        我当警察！想都别想了，不可能！\n\n        We don't have a computer (perish the thought) and have only recently bought an electric typewriter.\n\n        我们没有电脑（死了心吧），只好最近买了台电动打字机。
shield@1.N-COUNT屏障；保护物；保护人Something or someone which is a shield against a particular danger or risk provides protection from it. \n\n    He used his left hand as a shield against the reflecting sunlight.\n\n    他用左手挡住反射过来的阳光。\n\n    ...asbestos heat shields.\n\n    石棉隔热物\n\n2.VERB保护；掩护；庇护If something or someone shields you from a danger or risk, they protect you from it. \n\n    He shielded his head from the sun with an old sack...\n\n    他用一只旧口袋挡住头顶的阳光。\n\n    The company does not bet its own money on equities, and so is shielded from market risk.\n\n    该公司没有把自己的钱押在普通股上，这样就规避了市场风险。\n\n3.VERB（为阻挡阳光直射而）挡住，遮住（眼睛）If you shield your eyes, you put your hand above your eyes to protect them from direct sunlight. \n\n    He squinted and shielded his eyes.\n\n    他眯着眼，用手挡住眼睛。\n\n4.N-COUNT盾；盾牌A shield is a large piece of metal or leather which soldiers used to carry to protect their bodies while they were fighting.\n\n5.N-COUNT（体育运动的）盾形奖牌，盾形徽章A shield is a sports prize or badge that is shaped like a shield.
infest@    1.VERB（昆虫、老鼠等）大批出没于，侵扰When creatures such as insects or rats infest plants or a place, they are present in large numbers and cause damage. \n\n        ...pests like aphids which infest cereal crops.\n\n        像蚜虫这样大肆侵害谷物的害虫\n\n    infested\n\n        The prison is infested with rats...\n\n        监狱里老鼠猖獗。\n\n        In less than seven days the infested plants had recovered.\n\n        不到7天时间，受虫害侵袭的植物就复原了。\n\n    -infested\n\n        ...the rat-infested slums where the plague flourished.\n\n        瘟疫横行、鼠患猖獗的贫民窟\n\n    infestation\n\n        The premises were treated for cockroach infestation...\n\n        因蟑螂成灾，这些房屋集中进行了灭蟑活动。\n\n        Parts of California are suffering from an infestation of oriental fruit flies.\n\n        加利福尼亚的部分地区正遭受东方果蝇的大肆侵袭。\n    2.VERB遍布于；充斥If you say that people or things you disapprove of or regard as dangerous are infesting a place, you mean that there are large numbers of them in that place. \n\n        Crime and drugs are infesting the inner cities.\n\n        市中心充斥着犯罪与毒品。\n\n    infested\n\n        The road further south was infested with bandits.\n\n        这条路再往南更远些的地方有很多土匪出没。\n\n    -infested\n\n        ...the shark-infested waters of the Great Barrier Reef.\n\n        鲨鱼大量出没的大堡礁水域
summit@n. 顶点;最高阶层\nvi. 参加最高级会议,爬到最高点    1.N-COUNT（政府间的）峰会，首脑会议A summit is a meeting at which the leaders of two or more countries discuss important matters.\n\n        ...next week's Washington summit.\n\n        下周的华盛顿峰会 \n\n        ...the NATO summit meeting in Rome.\n\n        在罗马举行的北约峰会\n    2.N-COUNT山顶；顶峰The summit of a mountain is the top of it.\n\n        Snow gleamed on the summit of Mount Simon.\n\n        西蒙山山顶白雪皑皑。
contingent@    1.N-COUNT（警察、军队或军用车辆的）分遣队，小分队A contingent of police, soldiers, or military vehicles is a group of them. \n\n        Nigeria provided a large contingent of troops to the West African Peacekeeping Force...\n\n        尼日利亚向西非维和部队派遣了一大批军队。\n\n        There were contingents from the navies of virtually all EU countries.\n\n        几乎欧盟各国都派出了海军分队。\n    2.N-COUNT代表团；代表队；代表群体A contingent is a group of people representing a country or organization at a meeting or other event. \n\n        The strong British contingent suffered mixed fortunes...\n\n        实力雄厚的英国军团喜忧参半。\n\n        The whistles from the large contingent of England fans away to our left are deafening.\n\n        我们左边一大群英格兰球迷发出震耳欲聋的口哨声。\n    3.ADJ取决于…的；由…决定的If something is contingent on something else, the first thing depends on the second in order to happen or exist. \n\n        In effect, growth is contingent on improved incomes for the mass of the low-income population.\n\n        事实上，发展有赖于大量低收入人群收入的增长。
coordination@    1.N-UNCOUNT协调Co-ordination means organizing the activities of two or more groups so that they work together efficiently and know what the others are doing. \n\n        ...the lack of co-ordination between the civilian and military authorities.\n\n        老百姓和军事当局之间缺乏协调\n\n        ...the co-ordination of economic policy.\n\n        经济政策的协调\n\n        If you do something in co-ordination with someone else, you both organize your activities so that you work together efficiently.与&hellip；协调；与&hellip；协作\n\n            ...operating either in coordination with federal troops or alone.\n\n            要么和联邦军队协作，要么独自行动\n    2.N-UNCOUNT（身体部位的）协调能力Co-ordination is the ability to use the different parts of your body together efficiently.\n\n        ...clumsiness and lack of co-ordination...\n\n        身体笨拙而且缺乏协调能力\n\n        To improve hand-eye co-ordination, practise throwing and catching balls.\n\n        要想提高手眼协调能力，就练习投球和接球。
fjord@n. 峡湾(峭壁间的狭长的海湾)1.N-COUNT（尤指挪威海岸边的）峡湾A fjord is a strip of sea that comes into the land between high cliffs, especially in Norway.
offensive@    1.ADJ-GRADED冒犯的；得罪人的；唐突的；无礼的Something that is offensive upsets or embarrasses people because it is rude or insulting.\n\n        Some friends of his found the play horribly offensive.\n\n        他的一些朋友觉得该剧非常让人反感。\n\n        ...offensive remarks which called into question the integrity of my firm.\n\n        令我公司的诚信遭受质疑的冒犯性言论\n\n    offensively\n\n        The group who had been shouting offensively opened to let her through...\n\n        那群无礼叫嚷的人让开一条路让她通过。\n\n        I thought his glance at me had been offensively bold.\n\n        我觉得他对我的瞥视唐突无礼。\n    2.N-COUNT进攻A military offensive is a carefully planned attack made by a large group of soldiers. \n\n        Its latest military offensive against rebel forces is aimed at reopening important trade routes...\n\n        它对叛军的最新一轮军事进攻旨在重新打开重要的贸易通道。\n\n        The armed forces have launched offensives to recapture lost ground.\n\n        这支武装部队已发动进攻要夺回失去的阵地。\n    3.N-COUNTSee also:charm offensive；（表示愤怒或反对的）强硬行动If you conduct an offensive, you take strong action to show how angry you are about something or how much you disapprove of something. \n\n        Republicans acknowledged that they had little choice but to mount an all-out offensive on the Democratic nominee.\n\n        共和党人承认他们别无选择，只有对获提名的民主党人展开全面攻击。\n\n        ...a diplomatic offensive.\n\n        外交攻势\n    4.ADJ（体育运动中球队）进攻的，攻方的In sports such as American football or basketball, the offensive team is the team which has possession of the ball and is trying to score. \n\n        The worst-ever defeat of this team proved once again that Stanford can be one of the most explosive offensive teams in the country.\n\n        该队前所未有的惨败再次证明斯坦福队是国内最具爆发力的进攻型队伍之一。\n    5.PHRASE采取强势行动；采取攻势If you go on the offensive ,go over to the offensive, or take the offensive, you begin to take strong action against people who have been attacking you. \n\n        The West African forces went on the offensive in response to attacks on them...\n\n        西非部队对袭击者展开全力还击。\n\n        The Foreign Secretary has decided to take the offensive in the discussion on the future of the community.\n\n        外交大臣决定在有关该社群未来的讨论中采取攻势。
collaborate@    1.V-RECIP合作，协作（尤指著书或做研究）When one person or group collaborates with another, they work together, especially on a book or on some research. \n\n        He collaborated with his son Michael on the English translation of a text on food production... \n\n        他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一篇介绍食品生产的文章译成了英文。\n\n        The government is urging Japan's firms to collaborate with foreigners.\n\n        政府正在督促日本的公司进行更多的海外合作。\n\n        ...a place where professionals and amateurs collaborated in the making of music...\n\n        一个专业人士和业余爱好者合作创作音乐的地方\n    2.VERB通（敌）；勾结（敌人）If someone collaborates with an enemy that is occupying their country during a war, they help them. \n\n        He was accused of having collaborated with the secret police.\n\n        他被控与秘密警察勾结。
terrestrial@1.ADJ（动植物）陆地的，陆生的，陆栖的A terrestrial animal or plant lives on land or on the ground rather than in the sea, in trees, or in the air. \n\n    Terrestrial and aquatic fauna may sometimes be found resting together under a loose stone.\n\n    有时在松动的石头下可以同时看见栖息的陆生动物和水生动物。\n\n2.ADJ地球的；地球上的Terrestrial means relating to the planet Earth rather than to some other part of the universe. \n\n    ...terrestrial life forms.\n\n    地球上的各种生命形态\n\n3.ADJ（电视频道）地面的（有别于卫星转播的）Terrestrial television channels are transmitted using equipment situated at ground level, and not by satellite.
stem@    1.VERB起源于；来自；由…造成If a condition or problem stems from something, it was caused originally by that thing. \n\n        All my problems stem from drink...\n\n        我所有的问题都源于酗酒。\n\n        Much of the instability stems from the economic effects of the war.\n\n        不稳定局面多半是由战争对经济的影响造成的。\n    2.VERB阻止；遏制；制止If you stem something, you stop it spreading, increasing, or continuing. \n\n        Austria has sent three army battalions to its border with Hungary to stem the flow of illegal immigrants...\n\n        奥地利已派出 3 个营的兵力去本国和匈牙利交界的边境地区阻止非法移民的流入。\n\n        The authorities seem powerless to stem the rising tide of violence...\n\n        当局似乎无力阻止愈演愈烈的暴力活动。\n\n        He was still conscious, trying to stem the bleeding with his right hand.\n\n        他依然清醒，正试图用右手止血。\n    3.N-COUNT（植物的）秆，茎，梗The stem of a plant is the thin, upright part on which the flowers and leaves grow.\n\n        He stooped down, cut the stem for her with his knife and handed her the flower.\n\n        他弯下腰，用刀替她将花茎割断，然后将花递给她。\n    4.N-COUNT（酒杯的）颈，柄脚The stem of a wine glass is the long thin part which connects the bowl to the base.\n    5.N-COUNT（烟斗）柄The stem of a pipe is the long thin part through which smoke is sucked.\n\n        He chewed the stem of his pipe and eyed her sceptically.\n\n        他嘴里衔着烟斗柄，满腹狐疑地打量着她。\n    6.N-COUNT（语法中的）词干In grammar, the stem of a word is the main part of it, which does not change when the ending changes.\n    7.PHRASE从船首到船尾If something happens from stem to stern on a boat, it involves the whole of the boat. \n\n        A South African television report said the ship was ablaze from stem to stern.\n\n        南非一则电视新闻报道称，那艘船从头到尾都着了火。
metropolitan@    1.ADJ大都会的；大都市的Metropolitan means belonging to or typical of a large busy city. \n\n        ...the metropolitan district of Miami.\n\n        迈阿密的都市区\n\n        ...a dozen major metropolitan hospitals.\n\n        大城市的12家大医院\n\n        ...metropolitan sophistication and rustic naivety.\n\n        大城市的圆滑世故和乡村的天真纯朴\n    2.N-COUNT; N-TITLE（东正教和天主教的）大主教A metropolitan is an important priest in the Orthodox and Catholic Churches. He has authority over other priests and is in charge of a particular area.\n\n        ...the Ukrainian Catholic representatives, Metropolitan Volodymyr and Bishop Sofron.\n\n        乌克兰的天主教代表——弗拉基米尔大主教和索夫龙主教
backup@    1.N-VAR（物资、人员等的）支持，辅助Backup consists of extra equipment, resources, or people that you can get help or support from if necessary.\n\n        There is no emergency back-up immediately available...\n\n        手头无法获得应急支持。\n\n        Alternative treatments can provide a useful back-up to conventional treatment.\n\n        替代疗法能为传统的治疗提供有效的辅助。\n    2.N-VAR备用品；后备计划If you have something such as a second piece of equipment or set of plans as backup, you have arranged for them to be available for use in case the first one does not work.\n\n        Every part of the system has a backup...\n\n        系统的每个部分都有备用元件。\n\n        Computer users should make regular back-up copies of their work.\n\n        计算机使用者应该定期对自己的工作进行备份。
collective@    1.ADJ集体的；共同的Collective actions, situations, or feelings involve or are shared by every member of a group of people. \n\n        It was a collective decision...\n\n        这是集体的决定。\n\n        The country's politicians are already heaving a collective sigh of relief.\n\n        该国的政界人士均已松了口气。\n\n    collectively\n\n        They collectively decided to recognize the changed situation...\n\n        他们集体决定承认形势已经发生改变。\n\n        The Cabinet is collectively responsible for policy.\n\n        内阁集体对政策负责。\n    2.ADJ总的；集合的A collective amount of something is the total obtained by adding together the amounts that each person or thing in a group has. \n\n        Their collective volume wasn't very large.\n\n        他们的总量不是太大。\n\n    collectively\n\n        In 1968 the states collectively spent $2 billion on it.\n\n        1968年，各州在这上面总共花费了20亿美元。\n    3.ADJ集合的；总括的The collective term for two or more types of thing is a general word or expression which refers to all of them. \n\n        Social science is a collective name, covering a series of individual sciences.\n\n        社会科学是一个统称，涵盖一系列的独立学科。\n\n    collectively\n\n        ...other sorts of cells (known collectively as white corpuscles).\n\n        其他类型的细胞（统称为白细胞）\n    4.N-COUNT集体企业；合作农场A collective is a business or farm which is run, and often owned, by a group of people who take an equal share of any profits. \n\n        He will see that he is participating in all the decisions of the collective.\n\n        他会确保自己参与集体企业的各项决策。
staggering@adj. 摇晃的, 惊人的\n动词stagger的现在分词    1.ADJ-GRADED令人大吃一惊的；令人震惊的Something that is staggering is very surprising.\n\n        ...a three-year contract reputed to be worth a staggering £5,000-a-week...\n\n        据称高达每周 5，000 英镑的三年期合同\n\n        The results have been quite staggering.\n\n        结果非常令人震惊。\n\n    staggeringly\n\n        The South Pole expedition proved to be staggeringly successful.\n\n        这次南极探险结果非常成功。
sheer@    1.ADJ（用于强调）纯粹的，完全的，十足的You can use sheer to emphasize that a state or situation is complete and does not involve or is not mixed with anything else. \n\n        His music is sheer delight...\n\n        听他的音乐完全是一种享受。\n\n        Sheer chance quite often plays an important part in sparking off an idea.\n\n        灵感的激发通常纯粹是靠运气。\n\n        ...acts of sheer desperation.\n\n        彻底绝望的行为\n    2.ADJ-GRADED陡峭的；垂直的A sheer cliff or drop is extremely steep or completely vertical. \n\n        There was a sheer drop just outside my window...\n\n        陡坡就在我窗户外面。\n\n        A young man plunged from a sheer rock face to his death.\n\n        一名男青年从陡峭的岩壁上坠崖身亡。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED极薄的；极轻的；精致的Sheer material is very thin, light, and delicate.\n\n        ...sheer black tights.\n\n        极薄的黑色紧身裤
makeshift@n. 临时措施\nadj. 临时的    1.ADJ-GRADED权宜的；临时凑合的Makeshift things are temporary and usually of poor quality, but they are used because there is nothing better available. \n\n        ...the cardboard boxes and makeshift shelters of the homeless.\n\n        无家可归者的纸箱与临时的栖身处\n\n        ...a makeshift coffee table.\n\n        临时代用咖啡桌
spring up@    1.PHRASAL VERB突然出现；突然产生If something springs up, it suddenly appears or begins to exist. \n\n        New theatres and arts centres sprang up all over the country.\n\n        新的剧院和艺术中心突然在全国各地涌现出来。
stricken@    1.（strike 某些义项的过去分词）Stricken is the past participle of some meanings of strike .\n    2.ADJ-GRADED受煎熬的；患病的；遭受挫折的；受灾的If a person or place is stricken by something such as an unpleasant feeling, an illness, or a natural disaster, they are severely affected by it. \n\n        ...a family stricken by genetically inherited cancer...\n\n        受遗传性癌症折磨的一家\n\n        Foreign aid workers will not be allowed into the stricken areas.\n\n        国外救援人员不准进入灾区。\n\n        Stricken is also a combining form.（亦可用于构词）\n\n            He was panic-stricken at the thought he might never play again.\n\n            一想到自己可能永远不能再参加比赛，他就无比恐慌。\n\n            ...a leukaemia-stricken child.\n\n            患白血病的孩子\n\n            ...drought-stricken areas.\n\n            旱灾区
proceed@    The verb is pronounced /prə'siːd/. The plural noun in meaning 5 is pronounced /'prəʊsiːdz/. 动词读作 /prə'siːd/，义项5的复数名词读作 /'prəʊsiːdz/。\n    1.VERB接下来做；接着做If you proceed to do something, you do it, often after doing something else first. \n\n        He proceeded to tell me of my birth...\n\n        他接着给我讲我出生的事。\n\n        He asked for ice for his whiskey and proceeded to get contentedly drunk.\n\n        他要求在威士忌里加冰，接着心满意足地喝了个酩酊大醉。\n    2.VERB继续进行；继续做If you proceed with a course of action, you continue with it. \n\n        The group proceeded with a march they knew would lead to bloodshed...\n\n        这个团体继续示威游行，他们知道这将导致流血事件的发生。\n\n        The trial has been delayed until November because the defence is not ready to proceed.\n\n        因为被告方没有做好应诉的准备，审判已经被延期至11月份。\n    3.VERB（活动、过程或事件）继续，持续，连续不断If an activity, process, or event proceeds, it goes on and does not stop. \n\n        The ideas were not new. Their development had proceeded steadily since the war...\n\n        这些并不是什么新思想，自从战争开始就一直稳定地发展演变。\n\n        Efforts to reform the Interior Ministry have not yet proceeded very far.\n\n        对内政部进行改革的尝试还没有取得很大进展。\n    4.VERB（朝某个方向）前进，行进If you proceed in a particular direction, you go in that direction. \n\n        She climbed the steps and proceeded along the upstairs hallway...\n\n        她爬上楼梯，顺着楼上的走廊走去。\n\n        The freighter was allowed to proceed after satisfying them that it was not breaking sanctions.\n\n        在确认没有违反制裁条例后，货船被放行了。\n    5.N-PLURAL（某个事件或活动的）收入，收益The proceeds of an event or activity are the money that has been obtained from it. \n\n        The proceeds of the arms sales were then funneled to Contra fighters in Central America...\n\n        出售武器所得的收入随后用来支持了中美洲的反政府武装组织。\n\n        The proceeds from the concert will go towards famine relief.\n\n        音乐会的收入将用于救助饥荒。
capture@    1.VERB（尤指在战争中）俘虏，擒获，占领，夺取If you capture someone or something, you catch them, especially in a war. \n\n        The guerrillas shot down one aeroplane and captured the pilot... \n\n        游击队击落了一架飞机，并俘获了飞行员。\n\n        The whole town celebrated when two tanks were captured...\n\n        全城居民庆祝缴获了两辆坦克。\n\n        King Arthur himself captures the beast and cuts off its head...\n\n        亚瑟王亲自捉住怪物，并砍下它的头。\n\n        Capture is also a noun.\n\n            ...the final battles which led to the army's capture of the town...\n\n            军队攻占该城镇前的最后几场战斗\n\n            The shooting happened while the man was trying to evade capture by the security forces.\n\n            那个男子试图逃脱安全部队的抓捕时，有人开了枪。\n    2.VERB代表（特点）；表现，体现（感情、气氛）If something or someone captures a particular quality, feeling, or atmosphere, they represent or express it successfully. \n\n        Chef Idris Caldora offers an inspired menu that captures the spirit of the Mediterranean...\n\n        厨师伊德里斯·卡尔多拉开出一份富有地中海特色的菜单，让人眼前一亮。\n\n        Their mood was captured by one who said, 'Students here don't know or care about campus issues.'\n\n        一个人的话道出了他们的心情，“这儿的学生既不了解也不关心校园问题。”\n    3.VERB吸引（注意力）；激发（想象）；赢得（喜爱）If something captures your attention or imagination, you begin to be interested or excited by it. If someone or something captures your heart, you begin to love them or like them very much. \n\n        ...the great names of the Tory party who usually capture the historian's attention.\n\n        往往会引起历史学家关注的保守党大人物\n\n        ...the issue that has captured the imagination of nearly the whole nation.\n\n        激发了几乎所有国人想象力的争论\n\n        ...one man's undying love for the woman who captured his heart.\n\n        一个男人对他心仪的女人矢志不渝的爱\n    4.VERB拍摄If an event is captured in a photograph or on film, it is photographed or filmed. \n\n        The incident was captured on videotape...\n\n        事件被拍成了录像。\n\n        The images were captured by TV crews filming outside the base.\n\n        这些影像是电视剧组人员在外景地拍摄的。\n\n        ...photographers who captured the traumatic scene.\n\n        拍摄到那一不幸场面的摄影师\n    5.VERB得到；夺得；获得If you capture something that you are trying to obtain in competition with other people, you succeed in obtaining it. \n\n        In 1987, McDonald's captured 19 percent of all fast-food sales...\n\n        1987年，麦当劳占据了整个快餐业销售额的19%。\n\n        The Socialist candidate has captured eighty-five per cent of the vote in the three-way presidential race.\n\n        社会党候选人在这场三人角逐的总统竞选中已经获得85%的选票。
confrontation@    1.N-VAR对抗；冲突；战斗；战役A confrontation is a dispute, fight, or battle between two groups of people. \n\n        The issue has caused great tension between the two countries and could lead to a military confrontation...\n\n        这个问题使得两国关系非常紧张，可能会导致军事对抗。\n\n        The commission remains so weak that it will continue to avoid confrontation with governments.\n\n        该委员会的力量仍然十分薄弱，所以将继续避免与各国政府发生冲突。
lesser@1.ADJ-COMPAR较少的；较轻的；较小的You use lesser in order to indicate that something is smaller in extent, degree, or amount than another thing that has been mentioned. \n\n    No medication works in isolation but is affected to a greater or lesser extent by many other factors...\n\n    药物治疗不可能孤立地发生作用，多多少少会受很多其他因素的影响。\n\n    The more obvious potential allies are Ireland, Denmark and, to a lesser degree, the Netherlands.\n\n    最可能成为盟国的有爱尔兰和丹麦，放宽些还可以把荷兰算上。\n\n    Lesser is also an adverb.\n\n        ...lesser known works by famous artists.\n\n        著名艺术家的不太为人所知的作品\n\n2.ADJ-COMPAR次要的；较不重要的You can use lesser to refer to something or someone that is less important than other things or people of the same type. \n\n    They pleaded guilty to lesser charges of criminal damage...\n\n    他们承认了刑事毁坏的较轻罪名。\n\n    He was feared by other, lesser, men.\n\n    其他那些不如他的男人都很怕他。\n\n3.N-IN-NAMES（用在鸟类、哺乳动物、植物等名称中）小Lesser is used in the names of some species of birds, animals, and plants.\n\n    ...the lesser spotted woodpecker.\n\n    小斑啄木鸟
bring on@    1.PHRASAL VERB引起，导致（疾病、痛苦或某种感觉）If something brings on an illness, pain, or feeling, especially one that you often suffer from, it causes you to have it. \n\n        Severe shock can bring on an attack of acne...\n\n        严重的惊吓会造成痤疮突发。\n\n        Bob died of a heart attack, brought on by his lifestyle.\n\n        鲍勃死于由他的生活方式引起的心脏病突发。
forcible@    1.ADJ强制的；暴力的Forcible action involves physical force or violence. \n\n        Reports are coming in of the forcible resettlement of villagers from the countryside into towns.\n\n        不断有报道称村民被强制从农村迁入城镇定居。\n\n    forcibly\n\n        Two student leaders were forcibly removed from the university president's office.\n\n        两名学生领袖被强行从大学校长办公室赶了出来。
plea bargain@ph. [律](以被告承认犯有轻罪而获从轻处罚的)认罪辩诉协议    1.N-COUNT（一些法律体系中被告承认有罪以减轻刑罚的）认罪辩诉协议In some legal systems, a plea bargain is an agreement that, if an accused person says they are guilty, they will be charged with a less serious crime or will receive a less severe punishment.\n\n        A plea bargain was offered by the state assuring her that she would not go to prison.\n\n        州方提出了一份认罪辩诉协议，保证她不会入狱。\n    2.VERB（被告）接受认罪辩诉协议If an accused person plea bargains, they accept a plea bargain. \n\n        More and more criminals will agree to plea-bargain.\n\n        越来越多的罪犯会同意接受认罪辩诉协议。\n\n    plea bargaining\n\n        ...the introduction of a system of plea bargaining.\n\n        认罪辩诉协议制的引入
subdue@    1.VERB制服；征服；控制If soldiers or the police subdue a group of people, they defeat them or bring them under control by using force. \n\n        Senior government officials admit they have not been able to subdue the rebels.\n\n        政府高级官员承认他们还没能制服反叛者。\n    2.VERB抑制，压制，克制（感情）To subdue feelings means to make them less strong. \n\n        He forced himself to subdue and overcome his fears.\n\n        他强迫自己克制并战胜恐惧心理。
emigrate@    1.VERB移居国外；移民If you emigrate, you leave your own country to live in another country. \n\n        He emigrated to Belgium...\n\n        他移民到比利时。\n\n        They planned to emigrate.\n\n        他们打算移民。\n\n    emigration\n\n        ...the huge emigration of workers to the West.\n\n        工人向西方国家的大规模移民
discerning@    1.ADJ-GRADED有识别力的；有眼力的；有洞察力的If you describe someone as discerning, you mean that they are able to judge which things of a particular kind are good and which are bad. \n\n        ...tailor-made holidays to suit the more discerning traveller...\n\n        为懂行的旅游者量身打造的假期\n\n        Her childhood passion for collecting has not dimmed, but now she is more discerning.\n\n        她孩提时培养起的对收藏的痴迷丝毫未减，现在只是变得更有眼力了。
profound@    1.ADJ-GRADED深刻的；强烈的；巨大的You use profound to emphasize that something is very great or intense. \n\n        ...discoveries which had a profound effect on many areas of medicine. \n\n        对很多医学领域产生了深刻影响的发现\n\n        ...profound disagreement...\n\n        严重的分歧\n\n        The overwhelming feeling is just deep, profound shock and anger...\n\n        最强烈的感觉就是深深的震惊和愤怒。\n\n    profoundly\n\n        This has profoundly affected my life...\n\n        这给我的生活带来了深刻的影响。\n\n        In politics, as in other areas, he is profoundly conservative.\n\n        就像在其他领域一样，他在政治方面也非常保守。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED深刻的；深奥的；知识渊博的A profound idea, work, or person shows great intellectual depth and understanding.\n\n        This is a book full of profound, original and challenging insights.\n\n        这本书充满了深刻、新颖、令人深思的见解。\n\n        ...one of the country's most profound minds.\n\n        该国知识最渊博的人之一
parachute@    1.N-COUNT降落伞A parachute is a device which enables a person to jump from an aircraft and float safely to the ground.
