It consists of a large piece of thin cloth attached to your body by strings. \n\n        They fell 41,000 ft. before opening their parachutes...\n\n        他们下降了41，000英尺后才拉开伞。\n\n        UN troops could be landed by helicopter or even by parachute.\n\n        联合国部队可以乘直升机着陆，甚至可以伞降。\n    2.V-ERG（使）跳伞；（使）空降If a person parachutes or someone parachutes them somewhere, they jump from an aircraft using a parachute. \n\n        He was a courier for the Polish underground and parachuted into Warsaw...\n\n        他是波兰地下组织的情报员，被空降到华沙。\n\n        He was parachuted in.\n\n        他空降进入。\n    3.VERB空投To parachute something somewhere means to drop it somewhere by parachute. \n\n        Planes parachuted food, clothing, blankets, medicine and water into the rugged mountainous border region...\n\n        飞机将食品、衣物、毯子、药品和水空投到崎岖多山的边界地区。\n\n        Supplies were parachuted into the mountains.\n\n        补给物资被空投到山区。\n    4.VERB（使）空降（指突然从机构外调入）If a person parachutes into an organization or if they are parachuted into it, they are brought in suddenly in order to help it. \n\n        ...a consultant who parachutes into corporations and helps provide strategic thinking.\n\n        空降到公司协助制定战略思想的顾问\n\n        There was intense speculation 18 months ago that the former foreign secretary might be parachuted into the Scottish Parliament.\n\n        18个月前，人们普遍猜测前外交大臣可能会空降至苏格兰议会。
espionage@    1.N-UNCOUNTSee also:counter-espionage；间谍行为；谍报活动Espionage is the activity of finding out the political, military, or industrial secrets of your enemies or rivals by using spies. \n\n        The authorities have arrested several people suspected of espionage.\n\n        官方已经逮捕了几个涉嫌从事间谍活动的人。\n\n        ...industrial espionage.\n\n        工业间谍活动
auction@1.N-VAR拍卖An auction is a public sale where goods are sold to the person who offers the highest price. \n\n    Lord Salisbury bought the picture at auction in London some years ago...\n\n    几年前，索尔兹伯里勋爵在伦敦拍得了这幅画。\n\n    Britain's two main auction houses, Sotheby's and Christies, have been involved in valuing the works.\n\n    英国最大的两家拍卖行，苏富比和佳士得参与了对这些作品的估价。\n\n2.VERB拍卖If something is auctioned, it is sold in an auction. \n\n    Eight drawings by French artist Jean Cocteau will be auctioned next week...\n\n    下周法国画家让·科克托的8幅作品将被拍卖。\n\n    The airline plans to auction its international routes to former competitors...\n\n    这家航空公司打算把他们的国际线路拍卖给以前的竞争对手。\n\n    We'll auction them for charity.\n\n    我们将为它们举办慈善拍卖。
bidding war@投标战，出价竞争，竞价战
spark@1.N-COUNT火花；火星A spark is a tiny bright piece of burning material that flies up from something that is burning.\n\n    The fire gradually got bigger and bigger. Sparks flew off in all directions.\n\n    火越燃越烈，火星四溅。\n\n2.N-COUNT电火花；火花放电A spark is a flash of light caused by electricity. It often makes a loud sound.\n\n    He passed an electric spark through a mixture of gases.\n\n    他让一束电火花穿过了一团混合气体。\n\n3.VERB发出火花；闪光If something sparks, sparks of fire or light come from it. \n\n    The wires were sparking above me...\n\n    电线在我头顶上方冒着火花。\n\n    I stared into the flames of the fire as it sparked to life.\n\n    火光在闪烁，我注视着熊熊燃烧的烈焰。\n\n4.VERB引起（大火）If a burning object or electricity sparks a fire, it causes a fire. \n\n    A dropped cigarette may have sparked the fire.\n\n    可能是丢弃的烟头导致了这场大火。\n\n5.N-COUNT微量；一点点A spark of a quality or feeling, especially a desirable one, is a small but noticeable amount of it. \n\n    His music lacked that vital spark of imagination...\n\n    他的音乐缺少非常关键的那一点灵感。\n\n    Even Oliver felt a tiny spark of excitement.\n\n    连奥利弗都感到一丝兴奋。\n\n6.VERB触发；引发If one thing sparks another, the first thing causes the second thing to start happening. \n\n    What was it that sparked your interest in motoring?\n\n    是什么让你对开车产生了兴趣？\n\n    The proposals are expected to spark heated debate.\n\n    这些提议估计会引起激烈的争论。\n\n    ...a row sparked by a comment about his sister.\n\n    由对他姐姐的一句评价引发的争吵\n\n    Spark off means the same as spark .spark off 同 spark\n\n        That incident sparked it off...\n\n        那次事件引发了这件事。\n\n        His book, Animal Liberation, sparked off a revolution in the way we think about animals.\n\n        他的著作《动物解放》引发了一场关于我们该如何看待动物的思想革命。\n\n        ...a political crisis sparked off by religious violence.\n\n        宗教暴力触发的政治危机\n\n7.See also: bright spark；\n8.PHRASE激烈争论；热烈讨论If sparks fly between people, they discuss something in an excited or angry way. \n\n    They are not afraid to tackle the issues or let the sparks fly when necessary.\n\n    他们不怕应对这些问题，也不怕必要时来一番激烈的争论。
faction@    1.N-COUNT（大团体中的）派系，派别，小集团A faction is an organized group of people within a larger group, which opposes some of the ideas of the larger group and fights for its own ideas.\n\n        A peace agreement will be signed by the leaders of the country's warring factions.\n\n        该国各敌对派系领导人将签署和平协议。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT派系之争；内讧Faction is also used to describe argument and disagreement within a group of people.\n\n        Faction and self-interest appear to be the norm.\n\n        派系之争和自私自利看来非常普遍。
bid@    The form bid is used in the present tense and is the past tense and past participle. bid 的过去式和过去分词与原形相同。\n    1.N-COUNT努力；尝试；企图A bid for something or a bid to do something is an attempt to obtain it or do it. \n\n        ...Sydney's successful bid for the 2000 Olympic Games...\n\n        悉尼对2000年奥运会的成功申办\n\n        The Government has already closed down two newspapers in a bid to silence its critics.\n\n        政府已经查禁了两家报纸，试图压制批评人士的言论。\n    2.N-COUNT投标；出价A bid is an offer to pay a particular amount of money for something that is being sold.\n\n        Hanson made an agreed takeover bid of £351 million.\n\n        汉森按协商出价3。51亿英镑接管该公司。\n    3.VERB努力争取；尝试If you bid for something or bid to do something, you try to obtain it or do it. \n\n        Singapore Airlines is rumoured to be bidding for a management contract to run both airports...\n\n        据传，新加坡航空公司正在争取签下两家机场的经营权。\n\n        I don't think she is bidding to be Prime Minister again.\n\n        我想她不会再次竞选首相。\n    4.VERB投标；竞标；出价If you bid for something that is being sold, you offer to pay a particular amount of money for it. \n\n        She decided to bid for a Georgian dressing table...\n\n        她决定参与一个乔治王朝时期风格梳妆台的竞价。\n\n        The bank announced its intention to bid...\n\n        这家银行宣布了参加竞标的意向。\n\n        He certainly wasn't going to bid $18 billion for this company.\n\n        他肯定不会出180亿美元来收购这家公司。\n\n\n\n    American English sometimes uses the form bid for the past tense. 美国英语中，过去式有时用 bid。\n    1.VERB道（别、晚安等）If you bid someone farewell, you say goodbye to them. If you bid them goodnight, you say goodnight to them. \n\n        She bade farewell to her son...\n\n        她和儿子道了别。\n\n        I bade her goodnight.\n\n        我向她道了晚安。\n    2.VERB要求；邀请If you bid someone do something, you ask or invite them to do it. \n\n        They all smiled at him and bade him eat...\n\n        他们都朝他微笑，请他吃饭。\n\n        I dare say he did as he was bidden.\n\n        我敢说他按照要求做了。
RV@&lt;美&gt; Recreational Vehicle ,娱乐车    1.N-COUNT旅行房车；娱乐休闲车An RV is a van which is equipped with such things as beds and cooking equipment, so that people can live in it, usually while they are on holiday. RV is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'recreational vehicle'. \n\n        ...a group of RVs pulled over on the side of the highway.\n\n        停在公路旁边的一些旅行房车\n\n    in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 camper, camper van
extract@The verb is pronounced /ɪk'strækt/. The noun is pronounced /'ekstrækt/. 动词读作 /ɪk'strækt/，名词读作 /'ekstrækt/。\n1.VERB提取；提炼；挖掘To extract a substance means to obtain it from something else, for example by using industrial or chemical processes. \n\n    ...the traditional method of pick and shovel to extract coal...\n\n    用镐和铲挖煤的传统方法\n\n    Citric acid can be extracted from the juice of oranges, lemons, limes or grapefruit.\n\n    柠檬酸可以从橙汁、柠檬汁、酸橙汁或者柚子汁中提取。\n\n    ...looking at the differences in the extracted DNA.\n\n    查看提取出来的DNA之间的差别\n\nextraction\n\n    Petroleum engineers plan and manage the extraction of oil.\n\n    石油工程师规划并管理石油的提炼。\n\n2.VERB取出；抽出If you extract something from a place, you take it out or pull it out. \n\n    He extracted a small notebook from his hip pocket...\n\n    他从屁股兜里摸出一个小笔记本。\n\n    Patterson went straight to the liquor cabinet and extracted a bottle of Scotch...\n\n    帕特森径直走到酒柜前，取出一瓶苏格兰威士忌。\n\n    She reached into the wardrobe and extracted another tracksuit.\n\n    她伸手又从衣橱里取出一件运动服。\n\n3.VERB拔（牙）When a dentist extracts a tooth, they remove it from the patient's mouth. \n\n    A dentist may decide to extract the tooth to prevent recurrent trouble...\n\n    牙医可能会决定拔掉那颗牙，以免反复发作。\n\n    She is to go and have a tooth extracted at 3 o'clock today.\n\n    她今天3点要去拔颗牙。\n\nextraction\n\n    In those days, dentistry was basic. Extractions were carried out without anaesthetic.\n\n    那时候，牙科学刚起步，拔牙都不打麻药。\n\n4.VERB攫取；榨取If you say that someone extracts something, you disapprove of them because they take it for themselves to gain an advantage. \n\n    ...the capitalist system, which extracts huge profits from arms production at the tax-payers' expense...\n\n    牺牲纳税人利益、从武器生产中攫取巨额利润的资本主义制度\n\n    He sought to extract the maximum political advantage from the cut in interest rates...\n\n    他试图从降息中牟取最大的政治好处。\n\n    His development policies have extracted cash from the city centre.\n\n    他的发展政策已经从市中心榨取了收益。\n\n5.VERB设法得到；探出If you extract information or a response from someone, you get it from them with difficulty, because they are unwilling to say or do what you want. \n\n    He made the mistake of trying to extract further information from our director...\n\n    他犯了个错误，不该试图从我们的主管那里打探更多的信息。\n\n    He used her cash card, and the PIN number he had extracted from her, to take £500 from cashpoints.\n\n    他套出了她的现金卡密码，然后用她的卡从自动提款机中取走了500英镑。\n\n6.VERB摘录；提取If you extract a particular piece of information, you obtain it from a larger amount or source of information. \n\n    I've simply extracted a few figures...\n\n    我只是提取了一些数据。\n\n    Britain's trade figures can no longer be extracted from export-and-import documentation at ports.\n\n    英国的贸易数据现在不能再从各港口的进出口单证中提取了。\n\n    ...files of data extracted from the departmental archives.\n\n    从部门档案中提取的数据文件\n\n7.V-PASSIVE（从书中）摘录，节选If part of a book or text is extracted from a particular book, it is printed or published. \n\n    This material has been extracted from 'Collins Good Wood Handbook'.\n\n    这些材料摘自《柯林斯优秀木材手册》。\n\n8.N-COUNT摘录；选段；引文An extract from a book or piece of writing is a small part of it that is printed or published separately. \n\n    Read this extract from an information booklet about the work of an airline cabin crew.\n\n    看看这段从有关航空公司乘务人员工作的信息手册中摘录的文字。\n\n9.N-MASS提取物；精华；汁An extract is a substance that has been obtained from something else, for example by means of a chemical or industrial process. \n\n    Blend in the lemon extract, lemon peel and walnuts.\n\n    调入柠檬汁、柠檬皮和核桃。\n\n    ...fragrances taken from plant extracts.\n\n    从植物提取物中获取的香水
unmatched@    1.ADJ无与伦比的；无可匹敌的If you describe something as unmatched, you are emphasizing that it is better or greater than all other things of the same kind. \n\n        ...a landscape of unmatched beauty...\n\n        无与伦比的美景\n\n        Brian's old-fashioned cuisine was unmatched for flavour.\n\n        布赖恩的传统风味菜肴味道简直无与伦比。
poised@    1.ADJ（身体部位）摆好姿势不动的If a part of your body is poised, it is completely still but ready to move at any moment.\n\n        He studied the keyboard carefully, one finger poised.\n\n        他仔细研究了键盘，一个手指随时准备敲击。\n    2.ADJ作好一切准备的；随时准备行动的If someone is poised to do something, they are ready to take action at any moment. \n\n        Britain was poised to fly medical staff to the country at short notice...\n\n        英国随时准备把医护人员空运到该国。\n\n        US forces are poised for a massive air, land and sea assault.\n\n        美国军队作好了发动大规模海、陆、空攻击的准备。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED镇定的；沉着的；泰然自若的If you are poised, you are calm, dignified, and self-controlled. \n\n        She was self-assured, poised, almost self-satisfied...\n\n        她自信、沉着，几乎有些洋洋自得。\n\n        Rachel appeared poised and calm.\n\n        蕾切尔看上去沉着冷静。
demeanor@n. 【正式】行为(态度,举止)
acquaintance@    1.N-COUNT认识的人；泛泛之交An acquaintance is someone who you have met and know slightly, but not well. \n\n        The proprietor was an old acquaintance of his...\n\n        业主是他的一位旧相识。\n\n        I have a large circle of friends and acquaintances engaged in photography.\n\n        我在摄影界交游甚广。\n    2.N-VAR认识；相识If you have an acquaintance with someone, you have met them and you know them. \n\n        ...a writer who becomes involved in a real murder mystery through his acquaintance with a police officer...\n\n        因为认识一位警官而参与到一件真实谋杀悬案调查的作家\n\n        On first acquaintance she is cool and slightly distant.\n\n        初次相见时她表现冷淡并有点爱搭不理。\n    3.N-UNCOUNT了解；熟悉Your acquaintance with a subject is your knowledge or experience of it. \n\n        They had little or no acquaintance with philosophy or history...\n\n        他们在哲学或是历史方面几乎一无所知。\n    4.PHRASE与（某人）初次相识；结识（某人）When you make someone's acquaintance, you meet them for the first time and get to know them a little. \n\n        I first made his acquaintance in the early 1960s...\n\n        我与他初次相识是在20世纪60年代早期。\n\n        I am so pleased to make your acquaintance, Mr Tweed.\n\n        很高兴认识您，特威德先生。\n    5.PHRASE所认识的A person of your acquaintance is someone who you have met and know. \n\n        ...a highly cultivated woman of our acquaintance.\n\n        我们认识的一位很有修养的女性
linguist@1.N-COUNT通晓数国语言的人A linguist is someone who is good at speaking or learning foreign languages.\n\n    Her brother was an accomplished linguist.\n\n    她的哥哥能熟练地说好几种语言。\n\n2.N-COUNT语言学家A linguist is someone who studies or teaches linguistics.
evolutionary@    1.ADJ进化的；进化论的；发展的Evolutionary means relating to a process of gradual change and development. \n\n        ...an evolutionary process.\n\n        进化过程\n\n        ...a period of evolutionary change.\n\n        演变时期
anthropology@    1.N-UNCOUNT人类学Anthropology is the scientific study of people, society, and culture.\n\n    anthropologist\n\n        ...an anthropologist who had been in China for three years.\n\n        曾在中国呆了3年的人类学家\n\n    anthropological\n\n        ...anthropological research.\n\n        人类学研究
encompass@    1.VERB包括；包含If something encompasses particular things, it includes them. \n\n        ...the extra services, which start next September and encompass a wide range of special interests...\n\n        将从明年9月开始并涵盖各种特殊需求的额外服务\n\n        His repertoire encompassed everything from Bach to Schoenberg.\n\n        他能演奏从巴赫到勋伯格的所有作品。\n    2.VERB包围；围绕；覆盖To encompass a place means to completely surround or cover it. \n\n        Encompassing over a million square miles, this remote and mountainous domain presides over the rest of Asia...\n\n        这片偏远多山的疆土位于亚洲大陆，占地超过100万平方英里。\n\n        The map shows the rest of the western region, encompassing nine states.\n\n        地图上显示了西部地区的其他部分，包括9个州。
prompt@    1.VERB促使；推动；引起To prompt someone to do something means to make them decide to do it. \n\n        Japan's recession has prompted consumers to cut back on buying cars...\n\n        日本经济的不景气使得消费者在购买车辆上减少了开支。\n\n        The need for villagers to control their own destinies has prompted a new plan.\n\n        村民们想要掌握自己的命运，这促成了一项新的计划。\n    2.VERB鼓励，提示（说话者）；给（演员）提词If you prompt someone when they stop speaking, you encourage or help them to continue. If you prompt an actor, you tell them what their next line is when they have forgotten what comes next. \n\n        'Go on,' the therapist prompted him...\n\n        “接着说，”医生鼓励他道。\n\n        How exactly did he prompt her, Mr Markham?\n\n        确切地说，他是怎样提示她的，马卡姆先生？\n\n        Prompt is also a noun.\n\n            Her blushes were saved by a prompt from one of her hosts.\n\n            幸亏一位主持人提示，她才不至于尴尬脸红。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED迅速的；即刻的；立即的；及时的A prompt action is done without any delay. \n\n        It is not too late, but prompt action is needed.\n\n        现在还不算晚，但是需要立即采取行动。\n\n        ...an inflammation of the eyeball which needs prompt treatment.\n\n        需要立即治疗的眼球炎症\n    4.ADJ-GRADED敏捷的；迅速的；及时的If you are prompt to do something, you do it without delay or you are not late. \n\n        You have been so prompt in carrying out all these commissions...\n\n        你执行所有这些命令可真够迅速的。\n\n        We didn't worry because they were always so prompt with their rental payment.\n\n        我们不担心，因为他们交租金总是非常及时。
inmate@n. 同住者, 同室者(特指在医院、监狱), 居民1.N-COUNT被收容者；监犯；（精神病院的）住院者The inmates of a prison or mental hospital are the prisoners or patients who are living there.
simulator@    1.N-COUNT模拟装置A simulator is a device which artificially creates the effect of being in conditions of some kind. Simulators are used in training people such as pilots or astronauts.\n\n        ...pilots practising a difficult landing in a flight simulator.\n\n        在飞行模拟装置中练习高难度着陆的飞行员
unseemly@adj. 不体面的, 不相配的, 不适宜的\nadv. 不适当地    1.ADJ-GRADED不合适的；不得体的If you say that some-one's behaviour is unseemly, you disapprove of it because it is not polite or not suitable for a particular situation or occasion. \n\n        It would be unseemly for judges to receive pay increases when others are having to tighten their belts.\n\n        在其他人正不得不勒紧裤腰带的时候，给法官提高薪水是不合适的。\n\n        ...unseemly drinking, brawling and gambling.\n\n        遭非议的酗酒、争吵和赌博
procedure@n. 程序, 手续, 步骤; 常规的做法    1.N-VAR程序；步骤；手续A procedure is a way of doing something, especially the usual or correct way.\n\n        A biopsy is usually a minor surgical procedure...\n\n        活组织检查通常是一个很小的外科手术。\n\n        Police insist that Michael did not follow the correct procedure in applying for a visa...\n\n        警方坚持称迈克尔没有按照正确的程序申请签证。\n\n        The White House said there would be no change in procedure.\n\n        白宫说程序上不会发生变化。
track down@    1.PHRASAL VERB追踪到；追查到；搜寻到If you track down someone or something, you find them, or find information about them, after a difficult or long search. \n\n        She had spent years trying to track down her parents...\n\n        她已经花了好多年时间试图追寻父母的下落。\n\n        I don't know where that old story came from, I've never been able to track it down.\n\n        我不知道这则旧传闻的出处，我从来没能考证出结果。
whip@1.N-COUNT鞭子A whip is a long thin piece of material such as leather or rope, fastened to a stiff handle. It is used for hitting people or animals.\n\n2.VERB鞭打（人或动物）If someone whips a person or animal, they beat them or hit them with a whip or something like a whip. \n\n    Eyewitnesses claimed Mr Melton whipped the horse up to 16 times...\n\n    目击证人称梅尔顿先生抽打了这匹马16鞭之多。\n\n    He was whipped with a studded belt.\n\n    他被用带有饰钉的皮带抽打。\n\nwhipping\n\n    He threatened to give her a whipping.\n\n    他威胁要抽她一顿。\n\n3.VERB（风等）猛烈地抽打If something, for example the wind, whips something, it strikes it sharply. \n\n    A terrible wind whipped our faces...\n\n    狂风抽打着我们的脸。\n\n    A branch whipped her across the cheek.\n\n    一根树枝抽打到了她的脸颊。\n\n4.VERB（在外力作用下）猛然移动If something flexible whips in a particular way, it moves sharply when it is affected by a force, for example by the wind. \n\n    Blond strands of hair whipped in the wind.\n\n    缕缕金发在风中飘扬。\n\n5.VERB快速移开；快速拿走If someone whips something out or whips it off, they take it out or take it off very quickly and suddenly. \n\n    Bob whipped out his notebook...\n\n    鲍勃迅速掏出他的笔记本。\n\n    Players were whipping their shirts off...\n\n    运动员们在飞快地脱衬衫。\n\n    My waitress whipped the plate away and put down my bill.\n\n    我的服务员麻利地撤走盘子并搁下我的账单。\n\n6.VERB迅速地移动If something or someone whips somewhere, they move there or go there very quickly. \n\n    The wind out here is whipping along at about 30 miles an hour...\n\n    在这里，大风以每小时大约30英里的速度刮着。\n\n    I whipped into a parking space.\n\n    我迅速地驶入一个停车位。\n\n7.VERB搅打（奶油或鸡蛋等）When you whip something liquid such as cream or an egg, you stir it very fast until it is thick or stiff. \n\n    Whip the cream until thick...\n\n    搅打奶油直到它变黏稠。\n\n    Whip the eggs, oils and honey together.\n\n    把鸡蛋、油和蜂蜜搅打在一起。\n\n    ...strawberries and whipped cream.\n\n    草莓和掼奶油\n\n8.VERB（故意）激起（情绪）If you whip people into an emotional state, you deliberately cause and encourage them to be in that state. \n\n    He could whip a crowd into hysteria...\n\n    他能让一群人变得歇斯底里。\n\n    Politicians and businessmen have whipped themselves into a panic.\n\n    政治家和商人们把他们自己弄得十分恐慌。\n\n9.N-COUNTSee also:three-line whip；组织秘书，党鞭（维持党纪并督导该党议员出席议会重要议题的讨论和表决的人）A whip is a member of a political party in a parliament or legislature who is responsible for making sure that party members are present to vote on important issues and that they vote in the appropriate way.
variant@n. 变体\nadj. 不同的    1.N-COUNT变体；变种；变化形式A variant of a particular thing is something that has a different form to that thing, although it is related to it. \n\n        The quagga was a strikingly beautiful variant of the zebra...\n\n        斑驴是一种极美丽的斑马变种。\n\n        An intriguing variant to pipelines would be to carry the water using the existing system of canals...\n\n        除用管道外，利用现有的运河系统来输送水也很值得一试。\n\n        There are so many variant spellings of his name.\n\n        他的名字有很多不同的拼写形式。
ruthless@adj. 残忍的, 无情的    1.ADJ-GRADED无情的；残忍的；冷酷的If you say that someone is ruthless, you mean that you disapprove of them because they are very harsh or cruel, and will do anything that is necessary to achieve what they want. \n\n        The President was ruthless in dealing with any hint of internal political dissent.\n\n        在处理任何内部政治分歧的苗头时，总统都毫不留情。\n\n        ...an invasion by a ruthless totalitarian power...\n\n        残忍的极权主义国家的侵略\n\n        The late newspaper tycoon is condemned for his ruthless treatment of employees.\n\n        已故的报业大亨因为残忍地对待员工而遭到谴责。\n\n    ruthlessly\n\n        The Party has ruthlessly crushed any sign of organised opposition.\n\n        该党派无情地粉碎了任何有组织的反抗的苗头。\n\n    ruthlessness\n\n        ...a powerful political figure with a reputation for ruthlessness.\n\n        以冷酷出名的强权政治人物\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（行为等）坚决的，果断的，不留情面的A ruthless action or activity is done forcefully and thoroughly, without much concern for its effects on other people. \n\n        Her lawyers have been ruthless in thrashing out a divorce settlement...\n\n        她的律师在讨论离婚协议的过程中表现得非常坚决。\n\n        Successfully merging two banks requires a fast and ruthless attack on costs.\n\n        成功合并两家银行需要坚决快速地着手解决费用问题。\n\n    ruthlessly\n\n        ...a ruthlessly efficient woman.\n\n        雷厉风行的女人\n\n    ruthlessness\n\n        ...a woman with a brain and business acumen and a certain healthy ruthlessness.\n\n        有智慧和商业才干、而且非常果断的女人
stealth@    1.N-UNCOUNT暗中行动；偷偷摸摸；鬼鬼祟祟If you use stealth when you do something, you do it quietly and carefully so that no one will notice what you are doing. \n\n        He claimed Tony Blair is trying to get us into the euro by stealth...\n\n        他声称托尼·布莱尔正试图神不知鬼不觉地让我们加入欧元体系。\n\n        Both sides advanced by stealth.\n\n        双方都暗中向前推进。
stimulate@    1.VERB刺激；激励；促使；促起To stimulate something means to encourage it to begin or develop further. \n\n        America's priority is rightly to stimulate its economy...\n\n        美国的首要任务自然是刺激经济。\n\n        The Russian health service has stimulated public interest in home cures.\n\n        俄罗斯的公共医疗服务已经激起了公众对家庭治疗的兴趣。\n\n    stimulation\n\n        ...an economy in need of stimulation.\n\n        需要刺激的经济\n    2.VERB激发；激励；使充满热情If you are stimulated by something, it makes you feel full of ideas and enthusiasm. \n\n        Bill was stimulated by the challenge...\n\n        这个挑战让比尔热情高涨。\n\n        I was stimulated to examine my deepest thoughts.\n\n        我深受启发，开始审视自己内心深处的想法。\n\n    stimulating\n\n        It is a complex yet stimulating book...\n\n        这是一本情节复杂但能振奋人心的书。\n\n        The atmosphere was always stimulating.\n\n        气氛总是那么的令人振奋。\n\n    stimulation\n\n        Many enjoy the mental stimulation of a challenging job.\n\n        很多人喜欢富有挑战性的工作所带来的强烈的精神刺激。\n    3.VERB刺激（身体部位）；使活跃If something stimulates a part of a person's body, it causes it to move or start working. \n\n        Exercise stimulates the digestive and excretory systems...\n\n        锻炼能促进消化和排泄系统的活动。\n\n        The production of melanin in the skin is stimulated by exposure to the sun...\n\n        皮肤暴露在阳光下就很容易生成黑色素。\n\n        The body is stimulated to build up resistance.\n\n        刺激身体以增强抵抗力。\n\n    stimulating\n\n        ...the stimulating effect of adrenaline.\n\n        肾上腺素的兴奋作用\n\n    stimulation\n\n        ...physical stimulation.\n\n        生理刺激\n\n        ...the chemical stimulation of drugs.\n\n        药物的化学刺激作用
respiratory@    1.ADJ呼吸的Respiratory means relating to breathing. \n\n        ...people with severe respiratory problems...\n\n        有严重呼吸问题的人\n\n        If you smoke then the whole respiratory system is constantly under attack.\n\n        如果抽烟，整个呼吸系统就会一直受到损害。
paralysis@    1.N-UNCOUNT麻痹；瘫痪Paralysis is the loss of the ability to move and feel in all or part of your body.\n\n        ...paralysis of the leg.\n\n        腿部麻痹\n    2.N-UNCOUNT瘫痪状态Paralysis is the state of being unable to act or function properly.\n\n        The paralysis of the leadership leaves the army without its supreme command.\n\n        领导层瘫痪导致军队没有最高指挥。\n\n        ...a kind of mental paralysis.\n\n        一种精神瘫痪状态
snatch@1.VERB一把抓住；迅速地夺取If you snatch something or snatch at something, you take it or pull it away quickly. \n\n    Mick snatched the cards from Archie's hand...\n\n    米克一把夺过阿奇手里的牌。\n\n    He snatched up the telephone...\n\n    他迅速地抓起了话筒。\n\n    The thin wind snatched at her skirt.\n\n    一阵小风呼地吹起了她的裙子。\n\n2.VERB强抢；夺走If something is snatched from you, it is stolen, usually using force. If a person is snatched, they are taken away by force. \n\n    If your bag is snatched, let it go...\n\n    要是有人抢你的包，就让他拿去。\n\n    Mr Hillman was snatched by kidnappers last Thursday.\n\n    上周四希尔曼先生被绑匪劫走了。\n\nsnatcher\n\n    Wealthy tourists are tempting targets for bag snatchers.\n\n    富有的游客很容易成为抢包贼的目标。\n\n3.VERB抓住（机会）；抓紧时间（吃东西、休息等）；抽空做If you snatch an opportunity, you take it quickly. If you snatch something to eat or a rest, you have it quickly in between doing other things. \n\n    I snatched a glance at the mirror...\n\n    我乘机瞥了一眼镜子。\n\n    You can even snatch a few hours off...\n\n    你甚至可以抓紧时间休息几个小时。\n\n    He was going out for a run, then snatching a piece of toast and a cup of coffee.\n\n    他准备出去跑步，然后抽空吃上一片面包，喝上一杯咖啡。\n\n4.VERB侥幸获得（胜利）；险胜If you snatch victory in a competition, you defeat your opponent by a small amount or just before the end of the contest. \n\n    The American came from behind to snatch victory by a mere eight seconds...\n\n    美国人后来居上，仅以 8 秒钟的优势赢得了胜利。\n\n    Chesterfield snatched a third goal.\n\n    切斯特菲尔德攻入第三粒进球。\n\n5.N-COUNT（谈话或歌曲的）片段A snatch of a conversation or a song is a very small piece of it. \n\n    I heard snatches of the conversation.\n\n    我听见了一点谈话内容。\n\n6.PHRASE反败为胜/反胜为败If someone snatches victory from the jaws of defeat, they win when it seems that they are certain to lose. If someone snatches defeat from the jaws of victory, they lose when it seems that they are certain to win. 
intensity@n. 激烈,强度,强烈,剧烈    1.ADJ-GRADED强烈的；剧烈的；极度的Intense is used to describe something that is very great or extreme in strength or degree.\n\n        He was sweating from the intense heat... \n\n        高温酷热让他大汗淋漓。\n\n        Suddenly the room filled with intense light...\n\n        突然，刺眼的强光照亮了整个房间。\n\n        Stevens's murder was the result of a deep-seated and intense hatred...\n\n        史蒂文斯遭谋杀源于深仇宿怨。\n\n    intensely\n\n        The fast-food business is intensely competitive.\n\n        快餐业竞争非常激烈。\n\n    intensity\n\n        The attack was anticipated but its intensity came as a shock.\n\n        攻击是预料之中的，但攻势之猛烈令人震惊。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED认真的；集中的；紧张的If you describe an activity as intense, you mean that it is very serious and concentrated, and often involves doing a great deal in a short time.\n\n        The battle for third place was intense...\n\n        第三名的争夺紧张激烈。\n\n        The military on both sides are involved in intense activity.\n\n        双方的武装力量都有密集动作。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED（目光）有穿透力的，洞悉一切的If you describe the way someone looks at you as intense, you mean that they look at you very directly and seem to know what you are thinking or feeling.\n\n        I felt so self-conscious under Luke's mother's intense gaze...\n\n        在卢克母亲审视的目光下，我感到极不自在。\n\n        He gazed at me with those intense blue eyes.\n\n        他用那双深邃的蓝眼睛凝视着我。\n\n    intensely\n\n        He sipped his drink, staring intensely at me.\n\n        他慢酌浅饮，仿佛洞悉一切地紧盯着我。\n    4.ADJ-GRADED热情的；热切的；激动的If you describe a person as intense, you mean that they appear to concentrate very hard on everything that they do, and they feel and show their emotions in a very extreme way.\n\n        I know he's an intense player, but he does enjoy what he's doing...\n\n        我知道他是个拼命三郎，但他确实喜欢自己所做的事。\n\n        She is taller than I imagined, more adult, more intense.\n\n        她比我想象的更高、更成熟、更热切。\n\n    intensity\n\n        His intensity and the ferocity of his feelings alarmed me.\n\n        他感情之激烈和狂暴都让我惊恐。
trajectory@n. 轨道,弹道,轨线    1.N-COUNT轨道；轨迹The trajectory of a moving object is the path that it follows as it moves. \n\n        ...the trajectory of an artillery shell.\n\n        一枚炮弹的弹道\n    2.N-COUNT（事业等的）发展轨迹，起落The trajectory of something such as a person's career is the course that it follows over time. \n\n        ...a relentlessly upward career trajectory.\n\n        扶摇直上的事业轨迹
evade@    1.VERB规避；逃避If you evade something, you find a way of not doing something that you really ought to do. \n\n        By his own admission, he evaded taxes as a Florida real-estate speculator...\n\n        他亲口承认自己在佛罗里达从事房地产投机生意时逃过税。\n\n        Delegates accused them of trying to evade responsibility for the failures of the past five years.\n\n        代表们指责他们企图逃避过去5年中多次失败应负的责任。\n    2.VERB回避，避开（问题、话题等）If you evade a question or a topic, you avoid talking about it or dealing with it. \n\n        Mr Portillo denied he was evading the question...\n\n        波蒂略先生否认自己正在回避那个问题。\n\n        Too many companies, she says, are evading the issue.\n\n        她说太多公司都在回避这个问题。\n    3.VERB躲避；避开If you evade someone or something, you move so that you can avoid meeting them or avoid being touched or hit. \n\n        Under the pretence of lighting a candle, she evades him and disappears...\n\n        她假装点蜡烛，避开他消失了。\n\n        She turned and gazed at the river, evading his eyes...\n\n        她转身凝视着那条河，避开他的目光。\n\n        He managed to evade capture because of the breakdown of a police computer.\n\n        因为警方一台电脑瘫痪，他成功地躲避了抓捕。\n    4.VERB（成功、光荣、爱情等）与…无缘If something such as success, glory, or love evades you, you do not manage to have it. \n\n        Happiness, which had been so elusive in Henry's life, still evaded him...\n\n        亨利生活中过去一直难以捕捉的幸福仍旧与他无缘。\n\n        When she sat down at her desk she found that the words evaded her.\n\n        当她在桌前坐下时，却发现自己不知道该说些什么了。
tremendous@    1.ADJ-GRADED巨大的；极大的；大量的You use tremendous to emphasize how strong a feeling or quality is, or how large an amount is. \n\n        I felt a tremendous pressure on my chest...\n\n        我感到胸口堵得难受。\n\n        There's tremendous tension between the local population and the refugees…\n\n        当地居民与难民之间关系非常紧张。\n\n        That's a tremendous amount of information.\n\n        那是海量的信息。\n\n    tremendously\n\n        The business is tremendously profitable...\n\n        这笔生意利润巨大。\n\n        I enjoyed the show tremendously.\n\n        我非常喜欢那场演出。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED精彩的；出色的；极好的You can describe someone or something as tremendous when you think they are very good or very impressive. \n\n        He was a tremendous person…\n\n        他是个非常了不起的人。\n\n        I thought it was absolutely tremendous.\n\n        我认为它精彩极了。\n\n    tremendously\n\n        I thought they played tremendously well, didn't you?...\n\n        我认为他们踢得非常棒，你不觉得吗？
whittle down@v.削减    1.PHRASAL VERB逐渐减少；逐渐压缩…的人数To whittle down a group or thing means to gradually make it smaller. \n\n        He had whittled eight interviewees down to two...\n\n        他已经逐渐将参加面试的人数由8人减少到2人。\n\n        By September, they will have whittled the list down to a winner...\n\n        9月之前他们会从名单中确定出最后的赢家。\n\n        The president has agreed to whittle down his proposal.\n\n        总统已经同意减少他的提案。
propel@    1.VERB推进；推To propel something in a particular direction means to cause it to move in that direction. \n\n        The tiny rocket is attached to the spacecraft and is designed to propel it toward Mars.\n\n        小火箭捆绑在宇宙飞船上，用于推动飞船飞向火星。\n\n        -propelled combines with nouns to form adjectives which indicate how something, especially a weapon, is propelled.（与名词连用构成形容词）表示&ldquo；&hellip；驱动的&rdquo；，&ldquo；由&hellip；推动的&rdquo；\n\n            ...rocket-propelled grenades.\n\n            火箭推动的榴弹\n\n            ...the first jet-propelled aeroplane.\n\n            首架喷气式飞机\n    2.VERB推动；激励；驱策If something propels you into a particular activity, it causes you to do it. \n\n        It was a shooting star that propelled me into astronomy in the first place...\n\n        最初是一颗流星促使我从事天文学。\n\n        He is propelled by both guilt and the need to avenge his father.\n\n        他受到内疚感和为父报仇之心的双重驱使。
surge@    1.N-COUNT激增；急剧上升；突飞猛进A surge is a sudden large increase in something that has previously been steady, or has only increased or developed slowly. \n\n        Specialists see various reasons for the recent surge in inflation...\n\n        专家们认为目前通货膨胀加剧有多种原因。\n\n        The anniversary is bound to bring a new surge of interest in Dylan's work.\n\n        该周年纪念肯定会再一次激发人们对迪伦作品的浓厚兴趣。\n    2.VERB急剧上升；飞涨；激增If something surges, it increases suddenly and greatly, after being steady or developing only slowly. \n\n        The Freedom Party's electoral support surged from just under 10 per cent to nearly 17 per cent...\n\n        自由党的选举支持率从区区不到 10%骤升至近 17%。\n\n        Surging imports will add to the demand for hard currency.\n\n        进口激增将增加对硬通货的需求。\n    3.VERB（人群）蜂拥，涌动If a crowd of people surge forward, they suddenly move forward together. \n\n        The photographers and cameramen surged forward.\n\n        摄影师和摄像师们蜂拥上前。\n\n        ...the crowd surging out from the church.\n\n        从教堂里涌出的人群\n    4.N-COUNT（风、水等的）奔涌，汹涌A surge is a sudden powerful movement of a physical force such as wind or water. \n\n        The whole car shuddered with an almost frightening surge of power...\n\n        油门猛然加大到几乎让人恐惧的程度，整个汽车剧烈震颤着。\n\n        In the year 1091, London Bridge was destroyed by a tidal surge during a storm.\n\n        伦敦大桥曾于 1091 年在一次暴风雨中被汹涌的潮水冲毁。\n    5.VERB（水等）汹涌；（电）浪涌，骤强If a physical force such as water or electricity surges through something, it moves through it suddenly and powerfully. \n\n        Thousands of volts surged through his car after he careered into a lamp post, ripping out live wires...\n\n        他的车猛地撞到灯柱上，扯断了带电的电线，数千伏高压电流骤然通过车身。\n\n        Fish and seaweed rose, caught motionless in the surging water.\n\n        鱼和海藻浮起来，在汹涌的水流中动弹不得。\n    6.N-COUNT（情感的）突发，涌现，突然出现If you feel a surge of a particular emotion or feeling, you experience it suddenly and powerfully. \n\n        'It must be very difficult,' said Hunter, feeling a surge of embarrassment for Diane's predicament...\n\n        “那肯定不好过，”亨特说，突然为黛安娜的困境感到很为难。\n\n        He was overcome by a sudden surge of jealousy.\n\n        他突然妒火中烧。\n    7.VERB（感情、感觉）突袭，涌动，突发If an emotion or sensation surges in you or through you, you feel it suddenly and powerfully. \n\n        Nausea surged in him and he retched violently...\n\n        他突然觉得恶心，猛烈地干呕起来。\n\n        Panic surged through her.\n\n        她顿时惊慌失措。\n\n        Surge up means the same as surge .surge up 同 surge\n\n            A slow hatred for Hilton began to surge up in him...\n\n            他心里开始对希尔顿渐生恨意。\n\n            Memories surged up in Don's mind.\n\n            一幕幕回忆在唐脑海里涌现。
endurance@n. 忍耐, 忍耐力, 耐性，耐力
incessant@adj. 不断的,不绝的,无尽的    1.ADJ-GRADED不停的；连续的；持续不断的An incessant process or activity is one that continues without stopping. \n\n        ...incessant rain.\n\n        阴雨连绵\n\n        ...his incessant demands for affection.\n\n        他对感情的不断索取\n\n    incessantly\n\n        Dee talked incessantly.\n\n        迪伊一直说个不停。
summon@vt. 召唤,召集,振奋    1.VERB召唤；传唤；召见If you summon someone, you order them to come to you. \n\n        Howe summoned a doctor and hurried over...\n\n        豪叫了医生，然后匆忙赶了过来。\n\n        Suddenly we were summoned to the interview room...\n\n        突然我们被叫进了面试的房间。\n\n        He has been summoned to appear in court on charges of incitement to law-breaking.\n\n        因被控教唆犯罪，他已经被传唤出庭。\n    2.VERB鼓起（勇气）；振作；使出（力气）If you summon a quality, you make a great effort to have it. For example, if you summon the courage or strength to do something, you make a great effort to be brave or strong, so that you will be able to do it. \n\n        It took her a full month to summon the courage to tell her mother.\n\n        她用了整整一个月才鼓足勇气告诉了妈妈。\n\n        Summon up means the same as summon .summon up 同 summon\n\n            Painfully shy, he finally summoned up courage to ask her to a game...\n\n            他太过腼腆，不过最后终于鼓起勇气邀请她一起去看比赛。\n\n            We couldn't even summon up the energy to open the envelope.\n\n            我们甚至连打开信封的力气都没有了。\n    相关词组：summon up
immobilize@v. 使不能动\nvt. 使不动, 使固定    in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 immobilise\n    1.VERB使不动；使停止To immobilize something or someone means to stop them from moving or operating. \n\n        ...a car alarm system that immobilises the engine...\n\n        使发动机无法启动的汽车警报系统\n\n        The knee and ankle joints must be immobilized — this usually means up to six weeks in plaster.\n\n        膝关节和踝关节必须加以固定——这通常意味着要打上 6 个星期的石膏。
portion@    1.N-COUNT部分A portion of something is a part of it. \n\n        Damage was confined to a small portion of the castle... \n\n        城堡仅有一小部分受损。\n\n        I have spent a fairly considerable portion of my life here...\n\n        我生命中相当长的一段时光是在这里度过的。\n\n        I had learnt a portion of the Koran...\n\n        我学过一点儿《古兰经》。\n    2.N-COUNT（饭菜的）一份，一客A portion is the amount of food that is given to one person at a meal.\n\n        Desserts can be substituted by a portion of fresh fruit...\n\n        餐后甜点可以用一份新鲜水果代替。\n\n        The portions were generous.\n\n        每份饭菜分量都很足。\n\n        ...fish and chips at about £2.70 a portion.\n\n        一份炸鱼薯条约2。7英镑
sinister@adj. 不吉利的, 凶恶的,    1.ADJ-GRADED邪恶的；有害的；不祥的Something that is sinister seems evil or harmful.\n\n        There was something sinister about him that she found disturbing.\n\n        他身上有种邪恶的东西让她很不安。\n\n        ...a sinister and frightening place.\n\n        一个邪恶而恐怖的地方\n\n        ...the illegal and sinister trade in stolen cultural artefacts.\n\n        非法而且邪恶的被盗文物买卖
quagmire@    1.N-COUNT（难以避免或摆脱的）复杂局势，困境A quagmire is a difficult, complicated, or unpleasant situation which is not easy to avoid or escape from. \n\n        His people had fallen further and further into a quagmire of confusion...\n\n        他的人民在混乱不安的泥潭里越陷越深。\n\n        We have no intention of being drawn into a political quagmire.\n\n        我们无意卷入一场政治困境。\n    2.N-COUNT沼泽地；泥泞地；泥潭A quagmire is a soft, wet area of land which your feet sink into if you try to walk across it. \n\n        Rain had turned the grass into a quagmire.\n\n        大雨使草地变得一片泥泞。
descent@    1.N-VAR下降；降落A descent is a movement from a higher to a lower level or position.\n\n        Sixteen of the youngsters set off for help, but during the descent three collapsed in the cold and rain.\n\n        16 名年轻人出发去寻求帮助，但在下山过程中有 3 人因寒冷和大雨晕倒了。\n\n        ...the crash of an Airbus A300 on its descent into Kathmandu airport.\n\n        空客 A300 在加德满都机场降落时的坠毁\n    2.N-COUNT斜坡；斜面A descent is a surface that slopes downwards, for example the side of a steep hill.\n\n        On the descents, cyclists spin past cars, freewheeling downhill at tremendous speed.\n\n        在坡道上，自行车手飞驰着超越了一辆辆汽车，靠着惯性一路疾冲下山。\n    3.N-SING（形势的）恶化；（人的）堕落，沦落When you want to emphasize that a situation becomes very bad, you can talk about someone's or something's descent into that situation. \n\n        The only lasting solution lies in a political settlement. Without it, their descent into chaos will be guaranteed.\n\n        唯一的长久之计是通过政治手段解决。否则，他们势必会陷入一片混乱。\n\n        ...his swift descent from respected academic to struggling small businessman.\n\n        他从一名受人尊敬的学者到一个度日艰难的小商人的瞬间沦落\n    4.N-UNCOUNT血统；家世；出身You use descent to talk about a person's family background, for example their nationality or social status. \n\n        All the contributors were of African descent.\n\n        所有的撰稿人都是非裔人士。
circumstance@    1.N-COUNT情况；情形；形势The circumstances of a particular situation are the conditions which affect what happens. \n\n        Recent opinion polls show that 60 percent favor abortion under certain circumstances...\n\n        最近的民意调查显示，60%的人赞成在某些情况下可以堕胎。\n\n        The strategy was too dangerous in the explosive circumstances of the times...\n\n        在当时那种一触即发的形势下，采取那样的策略太危险了。\n\n        I wish we could have met under happier circumstances.\n\n        我真希望我们是在更愉快的情况下相识的。\n    2.N-PLURAL（事件发生的）情形，详情，原委The circumstances of an event are the way it happened or the causes of it. \n\n        I'm making inquiries about the circumstances of Mary Dean's murder...\n\n        我在调查玛丽·迪安谋杀案的详情。\n\n        Hundreds of people had died there in terrible circumstances during and after the revolution.\n\n        在革命期间和其后的恶劣形势下，那里有成百上千的人死去。\n    3.N-PLURAL生活状况；境况；（尤指）经济状况Your circumstances are the conditions of your life, especially the amount of money that you have. \n\n        ...help and support for the single mother, whatever her circumstances...\n\n        不论单身母亲的经济状况如何均为其提供的帮助与扶持\n\n        I wouldn't have expected to find you in such comfortable circumstances.\n\n        我怎么也没有想到你生活这么优裕。\n    4.N-UNCOUNT命运；机缘；客观环境Events and situations which cannot be controlled are sometimes referred to as circumstance .\n\n        There are those, you know, who, by circumstance, end up homeless...\n\n        您知道，会有那么一些人，因为命运捉弄而落得无家可归。\n\n        You might say that we've been victims of circumstance.\n\n        你可以说我们一直不走运吧。\n    5.PHRASE在任何情况下；无论如何You can emphasize that something must not or will not happen by saying that it must not or will not happen under any circumstances . \n\n        Racism is wholly unacceptable under any circumstances...\n\n        无论在何种情况下，种族主义都是千万要不得的。\n\n        She made it clear that under no circumstances would she cancel the trip.\n\n        她明确表示，无论如何她都不会取消旅行。\n    6.PHRASE在那种情况下；情况既然如此You can use in the circumstances or under the circumstances before or after a statement to indicate that you have considered the conditions affecting the situation before making the statement. \n\n        Under the circumstances, a crash was unavoidable...\n\n        在那种情况下，撞车是难以避免的。\n\n        In the circumstances, Paisley's plans looked highly appropriate.\n\n        佩斯利所拟定的计划在当时的情况下看来非常恰当。
territory@n. 领土, 版图, 领域, 范围1.N-VAR领土；领地Territory is land which is controlled by a particular country or ruler.\n\n    The government denies that any of its territory is under rebel control.\n\n    政府否认有领土被反叛分子所控制。\n\n    ...Russian territory.\n\n    俄罗斯领土\n\n2.N-COUNT属地，地区，托管地（指被别国控制的国家或地区）A territory is a country or region that is controlled by another country.\n\n    They just want to return to their families in the occupied territories...\n\n    他们只是想回到在占领区的家人身边。\n\n    He toured some of the disputed territories now under UN control.\n\n    他去一些目前由联合国接管的争议地区巡视了一番。\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT（知识）领域；（经验）范围You can use territory to refer to an area of knowledge or experience. \n\n    Following the futuristic The Handmaid's Tale, Margaret Atwood's seventh novel, Cat's Eye, returns to more familiar territory...\n\n    写完了具有未来色彩的《女仆的故事》之后，玛格丽特·阿特伍德的第七部小说《猫眼》回归到了人们较熟悉的题材上。\n\n    Reading from a tedious technical brief for hours on end, he would stray into difficult territory.\n\n    连续看上几个小时枯燥的技术简报后，他会不自觉地钻起牛角尖来。\n\n4.N-VAR（动物的）领地，地盘An animal's territory is an area which it regards as its own and which it defends when other animals try to enter it. \n\n    The territory of a cat only remains fixed for as long as the cat dominates the area.\n\n    猫的地盘只在它占据那个地方的时候是固定不变的。\n\n5.N-UNCOUNT（具有一定特点的）地带，地区Territory is land with a particular character. \n\n    ...mountainous territory.\n\n    多山地带\n\n    ...a vast and uninhabited territory.\n\n    广阔的无人居住区
ward@n. 守卫, 监护, 病房, 行政区, 由监护人或法院保护的人（尤指儿童）\nvt. 守护, 躲开    1.N-COUNT病房；病室A ward is a room in a hospital which has beds for many people, often people who need similar treatment.\n\n        A toddler was admitted to the emergency ward with a wound in his chest.\n\n        一个蹒跚学步的小孩因胸部受伤被送进急救室。\n    2.N-COUNT区；行政区；选区A ward is a district which forms part of a political constituency or local council.\n\n        ...the marginal wards of Reading Kentwood and Tilehurst West.\n\n        边缘选区雷丁肯特伍德和西泰尔赫斯特\n    3.N-COUNT被监护人A ward or a ward of court is a child who is the responsibility of a person called a guardian, or of a court of law, because their parents are dead or because they are believed to be in need of protection.\n\n        Alex was made a ward of court.\n\n        亚历克斯由法院监护。\n    相关词组：ward off
nasty@1.ADJ-GRADED令人不快的；令人厌恶的；恶劣的Something that is nasty is very unpleasant to see, experience, or feel.\n\n    ...an extremely nasty murder...\n\n    令人发指的谋杀\n\n    This divorce could turn nasty.\n\n    这场离婚可能会撕破脸。\n\nnastiness\n\n    ...the nastiness of war.\n\n    战争的残酷\n\n2.ADJ-GRADED恶毒的；恶意的；凶相的If you describe a person or their behaviour as nasty, you mean that they behave in an unkind and unpleasant way.\n\n    What nasty little snobs you all are...\n\n    你们全都是些可恶的势利小人。\n\n    The guards looked really nasty...\n\n    卫兵们看起来真凶。\n\n    Mummy is so nasty to me when Daddy isn't here.\n\n    爸爸不在这儿时，妈妈对我很凶。\n\nnastily\n\n    She took the money and eyed me nastily...\n\n    她拿了钱，恶狠狠地打量着我。\n\n    Nikki laughed nastily.\n\n    妮基恶毒地笑起来。\n\nnastiness\n\n    As the years went by his nastiness began to annoy his readers.\n\n    年深日久，他恶毒的文字开始让读者生厌。\n\n3.ADJ-GRADED邋遢的；低劣的；下流的；污秽的If you describe something as nasty, you mean it is unattractive, undesirable, or in bad taste.\n\n    ...Emily's nasty little house in Balham...\n\n    埃米莉在巴勒姆的脏乱小屋\n\n    That damned Farrel made some nasty jokes here about Mr. Lane.\n\n    那个该死的法雷尔开了些关于莱恩先生的下流玩笑。\n\n4.ADJ-GRADED令人担忧的；难对付的A nasty problem or situation is very worrying and difficult to deal with. \n\n    A spokesman said this firm action had defused a very nasty situation.\n\n    一位发言人称这一坚决的行动缓和了极为棘手的局面。\n\n5.ADJ-GRADED（伤口、疾病等）严重的，恶性的If you describe an injury or a disease as nasty, you mean that it is serious or looks unpleasant.\n\n    My little granddaughter caught her heel in the spokes of her bicycle — it was a very nasty wound...\n\n    我小孙女的脚跟夹到自行车的轮辐里了，伤得很严重。\n\n    Lili had a nasty chest infection.\n\n    莉莉胸部感染很严重。\n\n6.N-PLURAL令人不快的人（或事）；危害别人的人（或事）Nasties are unpleasant or harmful people or things. \n\n    ...evil organisations, peopled with nasties...\n\n    充斥着恶棍的邪恶组织\n\n    Decaffeinated coffee still contains some stimulants and other nasties linked with cancer.\n\n    脱咖啡因的咖啡仍含一些刺激物和其他可能致癌的有害物质。
blade@1.N-COUNT刃；锋The blade of a knife, axe, or saw is the edge, which is used for cutting.\n\n    Many of these tools have sharp blades, so be careful.\n\n    这些工具中很多都有锋利的刀片，务必小心。\n\n2.N-COUNT（螺旋桨的）叶片The blades of a propeller are the long, flat parts that turn round. \n\n3.N-COUNT桨叶The blade of an oar is the thin flat part that you put into the water.\n\n4.N-COUNT（草的）叶片A blade of grass is a single piece of grass.
rip@1.V-ERG（使）撕开；（使）扯开；（使）撕裂；（使）划破When something rips or when you rip it, you tear it forcefully with your hands or with a tool such as a knife. \n\n    I felt the banner rip as we were pushed in opposite directions...\n\n    当我们被推向相反的方向时，我感觉横幅被撕裂了。\n\n    I tried not to rip the paper as I unwrapped it.\n\n    我把纸打开的时候，尽量不把它撕破。\n\n2.N-COUNT裂口；裂缝；口子A rip is a long cut or split in something made of cloth or paper.\n\n    Looking at the rip in her new dress, she flew into a rage.\n\n    看到新连衣裙上的口子，她勃然大怒。\n\n3.VERB撕去；扯掉；剥去If you rip something away, you remove it quickly and forcefully. \n\n    He ripped away a wire that led to the alarm button...\n\n    他把连着报警按钮的电线扯掉了。\n\n    She ripped off her dress and let it fall to the floor...\n\n    她一把扯下连衣裙，任其滑落到地上。\n\n    He ripped the phone from her hand.\n\n    他把电话从她手中抢了过来。\n\n4.VERB（迅猛地）穿入，穿透，冲过If something rips into someone or something or rips through them, it enters that person or thing so quickly and forcefully that it often goes completely through them. \n\n    A volley of bullets ripped into the facing wall... \n\n    一排子弹射进对面的墙上。\n\n    Their minibus was ripped apart by a bomb...\n\n    他们的面包车被炸弹炸得粉碎。\n\n    The fire ripped through the living room...\n\n    大火吞噬了客厅。\n\n5.PHRASE尽情地做；忘乎所以地做；用尽力气做If you let rip, you do something forcefully and without trying to control yourself. \n\n    Turn the guitars up full and let rip...\n\n    把吉他的音量调到最大，尽情欢乐吧。\n\n    'Yaaaaaaa,' Carla let rip with the cry of the Valkyries.\n\n    “呀——”卡拉放开喉咙，发出女武神瓦尔基里一般的嘶喊声。\n\n6.PHRASE迅速地做；强有力地做；（车辆）全速前进，开足马力If you let something rip, you do it as quickly or as forcefully as possible. You can say 'let it rip' or 'let her rip' to someone when you want them to make a vehicle go as fast as it possibly can. \n\n    The ecological disaster is partly a product of letting everything rip in order to increase production.\n\n    出现生态灾难的部分原因是人们为了增产而不惜一切代价。
penetrate@    1.VERB渗入；进入；穿过；穿透If something or someone penetrates a physical object or an area, they succeed in getting into it or passing through it. \n\n        X-rays can penetrate many objects...\n\n        X射线能够穿透很多物体。\n\n        His men had been ordered to shoot on sight anyone trying to penetrate the area.\n\n        他的部下已经接到命令，见到试图穿越该地区的人就开枪。\n\n    penetration\n\n        The exterior walls are three to three and a half feet thick to prevent penetration by bombs.\n\n        外墙厚3到3。5英尺，以防炸弹穿透。\n\n        ...moves designed to block enemy penetrations.\n\n        旨在阻止敌人渗透的举措\n    2.VERB进入；跻身If someone penetrates an organization, a group, or a profession, they succeed in entering it although it is difficult to do so. \n\n        ...the continuing failure of women to penetrate the higher levels of engineering...\n\n        女性一直未能跻身工程领域的更高层\n\n        The drugs industry is complex and hard to penetrate.\n\n        医药行业非常复杂，很难进入。\n    3.VERB打入，渗透（敌人或竞争对手内部）If someone penetrates an enemy group or a rival organization, they succeed in joining it in order to get information or cause trouble. \n\n        The CIA had requested our help to penetrate a drugs ring operating out of Munich...\n\n        美国中央情报局已请求我们协助其打入在慕尼黑市外活动的贩毒集团。\n\n        The army was one of the few institutions the secret police were not encouraged to penetrate.\n\n        军队是不鼓励秘密警察渗入的少数机构之一。\n\n    penetration\n\n        ...the successful penetration by the KGB of the French intelligence service.\n\n        克格勃对法国情报机构的成功渗透\n    4.VERB进入，打入（市场或地区）If a company or country penetrates a market or area, they succeed in selling their products there. \n\n        There have been around 15 attempts from outside France to penetrate the market.\n\n        大约已经有15家外国公司试图进入法国市场。\n\n    penetration\n\n        ...import penetration across a broad range of heavy industries.\n\n        进口对重工业领域的广泛渗透\n    5.VERB了解；洞察；领悟If you penetrate something that is difficult to understand, you succeed in understanding it. \n\n        ...long answers that were often difficult to penetrate.\n\n        往往难以理解的冗长回答
doom@    1.N-UNCOUNT厄运；劫数；毁灭Doom is a terrible future state or event which you cannot prevent.\n\n        ...his warnings of impending doom.\n\n        他关于大难临头的警告\n\n        ...a wicked mermaid who lured sailors to their doom.\n\n        引诱水手走向灭亡的邪恶的美人鱼\n    2.N-UNCOUNT悲观；沮丧If you have a sense or feeling of doom, you feel that things are going very badly and are likely to get even worse.\n\n        Why are people so full of gloom and doom?...\n\n        为什么人们如此沮丧悲观？\n\n        Attendance figures had been steadily dropping, creating a mood of doom and discouragement among theatre directors.\n\n        上座人数一直持续下降，使得戏剧导演产生悲观泄气的情绪。\n    3.VERB注定；命定；使在劫难逃If a fact or event dooms someone or something to a particular fate, it makes certain that they are going to suffer in some way. \n\n        That argument doomed their marriage to failure.\n\n        那次争吵使他们的婚姻注定要失败。
bash@1.N-COUNT盛会；聚会；庆祝仪式A bash is a party or celebration, especially a large one held by an official organization or attended by famous people. \n\n    He threw one of the biggest showbiz bashes of the year as a 36th birthday party for Jerry Hall.\n\n    为了庆祝杰里·霍尔的36岁生日，他举办了当年演艺圈最盛大的庆祝宴会。\n\n2.VERB痛打；猛揍If someone bashes you, they attack you by hitting or punching you hard. \n\n    If someone tried to bash my best mate they would have to bash me as well...\n\n    如果谁想揍我最好的朋友，那我就跟他拼了。\n\n    I bashed him on the head and dumped him in the cold, cold water...\n\n    我猛击他的头部，然后把他扔进了冰冷冰冷的水里。\n\n    Two women were hurt and the chef was bashed over the head with a bottle.\n\n    两个女人受伤，厨师头部被人用瓶子击中。\n\n3.VERB猛敲；猛撞；用力砸If you bash something, you hit it hard in a rough or careless way. \n\n    Too many golfers try to bash the ball out of sand. That spells disaster...\n\n    太多高尔夫球手都想把球从沙子里敲出来，结果酿成了一场灾难。\n\n    A stand-in drummer bashes on a single snare and a pair of cymbals.\n\n    一名临时顶替的鼓手使劲敲着一根响弦和一对铙钹。\n\n4.N-COUNT重击；猛撞If you get a bash on a part of your body, someone or something hits you hard, or you bump into something. \n\n5.VERB（通常指公开地）痛斥，抨击To bash someone means to criticize them severely, usually in a public way. \n\n    The President could continue to bash Democrats as being soft on crime.\n\n    总统可能会继续抨击民主党人对待犯罪活动心慈手软。\n\n6.N-COUNT努力；尝试If you have a bash at something, you try to do it. \n\n    He's prepared to have a bash at discussing it intelligently.\n\n    他已经准备好尽量巧妙地讨论这个问题。
intact@adj. 尚未被人碰过的,原封不动的,完整的, 完好无缺的    1.ADJ完整无缺的；未受损伤的Something that is intact is complete and has not been damaged or changed. \n\n        Most of the cargo was left intact after the explosion...\n\n        大部分货物在爆炸发生后都完好无损。\n\n        If the family unit is still intact, the patient frequently does very well.\n\n        如果家庭仍然完整，病人常常恢复得很好。
phase@n. 相, 相位,时期,局面,阶段\nv. 逐步执行,实行,按计划进行    1.N-COUNT阶段；时期A phase is a particular stage in a process or in the gradual development of something.\n\n        This autumn, 6000 residents will participate in the first phase of the project...\n\n        今年秋天，将有6000名居民参加该项目的第一阶段。\n\n        The crisis is entering a crucial, critical phase...\n\n        目前危机正进入决定性的关键阶段。\n\n        Most kids will go through a phase of being faddy about what they eat.\n\n        大多数孩子都会经历挑食的阶段。\n    2.VERB把…分阶段If an action or change is phased over a period of time, it is done in stages. \n\n        The redundancies will be phased over two years.\n\n        裁员将在两年内分阶段进行。\n\n        ...a phased withdrawal of American forces from the Philippines.\n\n        美国从菲律宾的分阶段撤军\n    3.PHRASE不同步的（地）/同步的（地）；不协调的（地）/协调的（地）If two things are out of phase with each other, they are not working or happening together as they should. If two things are in phase, they are working or occurring together as they should. \n\n        The Skills Programme is out of phase with the rest of the curriculum.\n\n        技能课程与其他课程不协调。\n\n        ...uncomfortable jet-lag symptoms of indigestion and out-of-phase sleeping and waking.\n\n        消化不良、睡眠时间混乱等不舒服的飞行时差症状\n    相关词组：phase inphase out
emit@v. 发出,放射,吐露\n[计算机] 发射    1.VERB发出，排放，散发（热、光、气或气味）If something emits heat, light, gas, or a smell, it produces it and sends it out by means of a physical or chemical process. \n\n        The new device emits a powerful circular column of light.\n\n        新设备发出明亮的圆形光柱。\n\n        ...the amount of carbon dioxide emitted.\n\n        二氧化碳排放量\n    2.VERB发出（声音或噪音）To emit a sound or noise means to produce it. \n\n        Polly blinked and emitted a long, low whistle.\n\n        波莉眨了眨眼，吹了一声低沉而悠长的口哨。
thrive@    1.VERB欣欣向荣；茁壮成长；兴旺发达If someone or something thrives, they do well and are successful, healthy, or strong. \n\n        Today his company continues to thrive...\n\n        今天，他的公司继续蓬勃发展。\n\n        Lavender thrives in poor soil.\n\n        薰衣草在贫瘠的土壤中茁壮生长。\n\n        ...the river's thriving population of kingfishers.\n\n        那条河上不断繁衍的翠鸟群\n    2.VERB（尤指在别人觉得困难的时候）以…为乐，可以出色应对If you say that someone thrives on a particular situation, you mean that they enjoy it or that they can deal with it very well, especially when other people find it unpleasant or difficult. \n\n        Many people thrive on a stressful lifestyle...\n\n        有许多人喜欢充满压力的生活方式。\n\n        Creative people are usually very determined and thrive on overcoming obstacles.\n\n        富有创造力的人一般都意志非常坚定，能不断克服困难，事业蒸蒸日上。
transform@    1.VERB转换；改变；改造To transform something into something else means to change or convert it into that thing. \n\n        Your metabolic rate is the speed at which your body transforms food into energy...\n\n        新陈代谢率是身体把食物转换为能量的速度。\n\n        Delegates also discussed transforming them from a guerrilla force into a regular army.\n\n        代表们还讨论了把他们从游击队武装改造为正规军的问题。\n\n    transformation\n\n        Norah made plans for the transformation of an attic room into a study...\n\n        诺拉计划把一个阁楼间改建成书房。\n\n        Chemical transformations occur.\n\n        发生了化学转换。\n    2.VERB改善；使改观；使改头换面To transform something or someone means to change them completely and suddenly so that they are much better or more attractive. \n\n        The Minister said the Urban Development Corporation was now transforming the area...\n\n        部长声称城市开发公司如今正使该地区改头换面。\n\n        A cheap table can be transformed by an interesting cover…\n\n        一块趣味盎然的桌布就能使一张廉价桌子面目一新。\n\n        He said she had transformed him from a hard-drinking womaniser into a devoted husband and father.\n\n        他说她已经把他由一个酗酒玩女人的浪荡子彻底改造成了一位忠诚的丈夫、一位慈爱的父亲。\n\n    transformation\n\n        In the last five years he's undergone a personal transformation.\n\n        过去 5 年里他整个人发生了全新的转变。\n\n        …one of the most astonishing economic transformations seen since the second world war.\n\n        二战以来最惊人的经济改革之一
angel@    1.N-COUNT天使Angels are spiritual beings that some people believe are God's servants in heaven.\n    2.N-COUNT（尤用于得到友好对待或帮助时）大好人，大善人You can call someone you like very much an angel in order to show affection, especially when they have been kind to you or done you a favour. \n\n        Thank you a thousand times, you're an angel.\n\n        万分感谢，你真是个大好人。\n    3.N-COUNT安琪儿；天使；善人If you describe someone as an angel, you mean that they seem to be very kind and good. \n\n        Poppa thought her an angel...\n\n        爸爸视她为小天使。\n\n        He was such an angel to put up with it.\n\n        他这都能忍，真是个大好人。\n    4.PHRASE行善；在道义一方If you say that someone is on the side of the angels, you believe very strongly that what they are doing is right. \n\n        Billy is on the side of the angels when it comes to racial tolerance.\n\n        说起种族间的包容，比利可真是宅心仁厚。\n    5.PHRASE愚蠢地冒险；鲁莽行事；暴虎冯河If you say that someone rushes in where angels fear to tread, you are criticizing them gently because they get themselves into dangerous or difficult situations without thinking carefully enough about what they are doing. \n\n        Martin is inclined to rush in where angels fear to tread.\n\n        马丁总是喜欢贸然行事。
harness@    1.VERB控制（情感）；利用（自然力）If you harness something such as an emotion or natural source of energy, you bring it under your control and use it. \n\n        ...the movement's ability to harness the anger of all Ukrainians...\n\n        该运动之疏解所有乌克兰人怒气的能力\n\n        Turkey plans to harness the waters of the Tigris and Euphrates rivers for big hydro-electric power projects.\n\n        土耳其计划利用底格里斯河和幼发拉底河的河水开发大型水电项目。\n    2.N-COUNT（系在身上用以携带装备或限制其移动的）系带，背带A harness is a set of straps which fit under a person's arms and fasten round their body in order to keep a piece of equipment in place or to prevent the person moving from a place.\n    3.N-COUNT马具；挽具A harness is a set of leather straps and metal links fastened round a horse's head or body so that the horse can have a carriage, cart, or plough fastened to it.\n    4.VERB给（马等）套上挽具If a horse or other animal is harnessed, a harness is put on it, especially so that it can pull a carriage, cart, or plough. \n\n        On Sunday the horses were harnessed to a heavy wagon for a daylong ride over the Border.\n\n        星期天，马匹被套在一辆沉重的马车上，准备踏上长达一天的穿越边境之旅。\n    5.PHRASE互相配合；通力合作People or things who are working in harness are working together in order to achieve a particular aim. \n\n        At Opera North he will be in harness with Paul Daniel, the conductor appointed music director last year.\n\n        在北方歌剧公司，他将和去年指挥指定的音乐总监保罗·丹尼尔通力合作。\n    6.PHRASE（常指停止工作一段时间后）正常工作的If you say that someone is in harness, you mean that they are working, often after a period of not working. \n\n        You can rest for three or four months and then the longing for work will return and you will be right back in harness.\n\n        你可以休息三四个月，然后又会开始渴望工作，并能很快回到正常的工作状态。
strategic@    1.ADJ战略（性）的；策略（上）的Strategic means relating to the most important, general aspects of something such as a military operation or political policy, especially when these are decided in advance. \n\n        ...the new strategic thinking which NATO leaders produced at the recent London summit...\n\n        北约领导人在最近召开的伦敦首脑会议上提出的新的战略思想\n\n        ...a strategic plan for reducing the rate of infant mortality...\n\n        降低婴儿死亡率的战略计划\n\n        The island is of strategic importance to France.\n\n        该岛对法国来说具有重要的战略意义。\n\n    strategically\n\n        ...strategically important roads, bridges and buildings.\n\n        具有重要战略意义的道路、桥梁和建筑物\n\n        ...integrating politics, economics and military affairs, thinking strategically, setting priorities and making choices.\n\n        将政治学、经济学和军事结合在一起，从战略的角度思考问题，确定主次关系，并作出选择\n    2.ADJ（武器）战略性的Strategic weapons are very powerful missiles that can be fired only after a decision to use them has been made by a political leader. \n\n        ...strategic nuclear weapons.\n\n        战略性核武器\n    3.ADJ（位置）具有战略意义的，重要的，合适的If you put something in a strategic position, you place it cleverly in a position where it will be most useful or have the most effect. \n\n        ...the marble benches Eve had placed at strategic points throughout the gardens, where the views were spectacular.\n\n        伊芙在各花园景色迷人的地方巧妙安置的大理石长凳\n\n    strategically\n\n        We had kept its presence hidden with a strategically placed chair.\n\n        我们用一张摆放得很巧妙的椅子将它隐藏了起来。
tactical@    1.ADJ（行动、计划）战术上的，策略性的You use tactical to describe an action or plan which is intended to help someone achieve what they want in a particular situation. \n\n        It's not yet clear whether the Prime Minister's resignation offer is a serious one, or whether it's simply a tactical move...\n\n        现在还不清楚首相提出辞职是认真的，还是仅仅作为一种策略。\n\n        The security forces had made a tactical withdrawal from the area.\n\n        安全部队已从该地区战术性撤军。\n\n    tactically\n\n        The electorate is astute enough to vote tactically against the Government...\n\n        选民们很精明，很有策略地投了政府的反对票。\n\n        They were tactically superior too.\n\n        他们在战术上也占据优势。\n    2.ADJ（武器、军队）战术的，作战的Tactical weapons or forces are those which a military leader can decide for themselves to use in a battle, rather than waiting for a decision by a political leader. \n\n        They have removed all tactical nuclear missiles that could strike Europe.\n\n        他们已经拆除所有能够袭击欧洲的战术核导弹。\n\n        ...U.S. tactical air fighter squadrons.\n\n        美国战术空中战斗机中队
face-off@ n. (冰球赛等的)开球，对峙
overwhelming@    1.ADJ-GRADED极强烈的；势不可挡的；令人不知所措的If something is overwhelming, it affects you very strongly, and you do not know how to deal with it.\n\n        The task won't feel so overwhelming if you break it down into small, easy-to-accomplish steps...\n\n        如果将这个任务细分为简单易行的若干步骤来做，便不会感到如此无所适从。\n\n        She felt an overwhelming desire to have another child.\n\n        她一心想再要一个孩子。\n\n    overwhelmingly\n\n        Women of his own middle class found him overwhelmingly attractive.\n\n        同属中产阶级的女性觉得他的魅力令人难以抗拒。\n\n        ...the overwhelmingly strange medieval city of Fès.\n\n        极为奇特的中世纪城市非斯\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（数量）巨大的，压倒性的You can use overwhelming to emphasize that an amount or quantity is much greater than other amounts or quantities. \n\n        The overwhelming majority of small businesses go broke within the first twenty-four months...\n\n        绝大多数小企业在头两年内就破产了。\n\n        The party won an overwhelming victory in Burma's general elections last May...\n\n        去年5月，该党在缅甸大选中获得了压倒性的胜利。\n\n        The vote was overwhelming — 283 in favour, and only twenty-nine against.\n\n        投票的结果是压倒性的——283票支持，只有29票反对。\n\n    overwhelmingly\n\n        The House of Commons has overwhelmingly rejected calls to bring back the death penalty for murder...\n\n        下议院以压倒性的多数驳回了对谋杀罪恢复死刑判决的呼吁。\n\n        Although things are changing the medical establishment is still overwhelmingly male.\n\n        虽然世易时移，但医学界依然是男性的天下。
possess@v. 持有,克制,为...着迷    1.VERB占有；拥有If you possess something, you have it or own it. \n\n        He was then arrested and charged with possessing an offensive weapon...\n\n        他随后被逮捕，并被控拥有攻击性武器。\n\n        He is said to possess a fortune of more than two-and-a-half-thousand million dollars.\n\n        据说他拥有超出25亿美元的财富。\n    2.VERB具备，具有（特定品质、才能等）If someone or something possesses a particular quality, ability, or feature, they have it. \n\n        ...individuals who are deemed to possess the qualities of sense, loyalty and discretion...\n\n        被认为具备了理性、忠诚和判断力的人\n\n        This figure has long been held to possess miraculous power.\n\n        这个数字长时间以来都被认为拥有神奇的力量。\n    3.VERB（情感或信仰）影响，控制If a feeling or belief possesses you, it strongly influences your thinking or behaviour. \n\n        Absolute terror possessed her...\n\n        她恐惧到了极点。\n\n        Tsvetayeva was possessed by a frenzied urge to get out of Moscow.\n\n        茨维塔耶娃内心有一种想要离开莫斯科的狂热冲动。\n    4.See also: possessed；\n    5.PHRASE（表示惊讶）是什么驱使…（干…），是什么促使…（做…）If you ask what possessed someone to do something, you are emphasizing your great surprise that they have done something which you consider foolish or dangerous. \n\n        What on earth had possessed her to agree to marry him?\n\n        究竟是什么让她同意嫁给他的？
psychic@adj. 灵魂的, 精神的, 心灵的, 通灵的\nn.通灵的人    1.ADJ-GRADED通灵的；有特异功能的If you believe that someone is psychic or has psychic powers, you believe that they have strange mental powers, such as being able to read the minds of other people or to see into the future.\n\n        Trevor helped police by using his psychic powers.\n\n        特雷弗用他的通灵能力帮助了警方。\n    2.ADJ鬼魂的；灵魂的Psychic means relating to ghosts and the spirits of the dead.\n\n        He declared his total disbelief in psychic phenomena.\n\n        他宣称自己完全不相信鬼魂现象。\n    3.ADJ心灵的；精神的Psychic means relating to the mind rather than the body. \n\n        These truths cause individuals much psychic pain.\n\n        这些真相给个体带来巨大的精神痛苦。
awaken@    1.VERB唤起，激起（情感）To awaken a feeling in a person means to cause them to start having this feeling. \n\n        The aim of the cruise was to awaken an interest in and an understanding of foreign cultures.\n\n        此次巡游旨在唤起我们对外国文化的兴趣和理解。\n    2.V-ERG（使）意识到；（使）认识到When you awaken to a fact or when someone awakens you to it, you become aware of it. \n\n        The British never awaken to peril until it is almost too late.\n\n        英国人从来不懂得防患于未然。\n\n        ...the picture of the Earth, so blue and fragile, that awakened a generation to the Earth's mortality.\n\n        照片上的地球，如此的忧郁而脆弱，唤起了一代人对地球生命的意识\n    3.V-ERG醒来；唤醒；叫醒When you awaken, or when something or someone awakens you, you wake up. \n\n        Unfortunately, Grandma always seems to awaken at awkward moments...\n\n        不幸的是，奶奶好像总是醒来的不是时候。\n\n        He was snoring when Desmond awakened him.\n\n        德斯蒙德叫醒他的时候他还在打呼噜呢。
fracture@n. 破碎,骨折\nvt. 破碎,破裂\nvi. 断裂    1.N-COUNT破裂；（尤指）骨折A fracture is a slight crack or break in something, especially a bone.\n\n        At least one-third of all women over ninety have sustained a hip fracture.\n\n        超过90岁的所有女性中至少有1/3已经出现髋骨骨折。\n    2.V-ERG（使）（轻微）骨折；（使）断裂If something such as a bone is fractured or fractures, it gets a slight crack or break in it. \n\n        You've fractured a rib, maybe more than one...\n\n        你的一根肋骨断了，可能不止一根。\n\n        One strut had fractured and been crudely repaired in several places...\n\n        一根撑木出现了裂痕，有几处已进行了粗略的修补。\n\n        He suffered a fractured skull.\n\n        他的头骨开裂了。\n    3.V-ERG（使）分裂；（使）解散If something such as an organization or society is fractured or fractures, it splits into several parts or stops existing. \n\n        His policy risks fracturing the coalition...\n\n        他的政策有分裂联盟的风险。\n\n        It might be a society that could fracture along class lines.\n\n        它可能成为一个阶级分化的社会。\n\n    fractured\n\n        ...in a world of fractured cultures and global interdependence.\n\n        在一个文化多元、全球互相依赖的世界里
expense@1.N-VAR花费；费用；开支Expense is the money that something costs you or that you need to spend in order to do something.\n\n    He's bought a specially big TV at vast expense so that everyone can see properly...\n\n    他花大价钱买了一台特别大的电视机，这样每个人都能看清楚。\n\n    To avoid extra expense and mess later on, try to decide on fittings before the plastering's finished...\n\n    为避免将来出现额外的开支和不必要的麻烦，尽量在抹灰完工之前把固定设施确定下来。\n\n    It was not a fortune but would help to cover household expenses.\n\n    这笔钱不算多，但是能帮助支付家庭开支。\n\n2.N-PLURAL（由雇主报销的）开支，费用，业务费用Expenses are amounts of money that you spend while doing something in the course of your work, which will be paid back to you afterwards. \n\n    As a member of the International Olympic Committee her fares and hotel expenses were paid by the IOC...\n\n    作为国际奥林匹克委员会的成员，她的交通费用和酒店住宿费用都由国际奥委会支付。\n\n    Can you claim this back on expenses?\n\n    这个你能报销吗？\n\n3.PHRASE由…付费If you do something at someone's expense, they provide the money for it. \n\n    Should architects continue to be trained for five years at public expense?...\n\n    建筑师是否应该继续接受5年的公费培训呢？\n\n    Teachers who signed up did so out of personal choice and at their own expense.\n\n    报名的教师完全出于自愿而且费用自理。\n\n4.PHRASE拿…开玩笑；以…为嘲弄的对象If someone laughs or makes a joke at your expense, they do it to make you seem foolish. \n\n    I think he's having fun at our expense.\n\n    我想他在拿我们寻开心。\n\n5.PHRASE以牺牲…的利益为代价If you achieve something at the expense of someone, you do it in a way which might cause them some harm or disadvantage. \n\n    But skeptics worry that costs may be trimmed at the expense of the patient...\n\n    但是持怀疑态度的人担心费用的削减会以牺牲病人的利益为代价。\n\n    According to this study, women have made notable gains at the expense of men.\n\n    根据这项研究，女性以牺牲男性的利益为代价而获得了显著的收益。\n\n6.PHRASE以…为代价If you say that someone does something at the expense of another thing, you are expressing concern at the fact that they are not doing the second thing, because the first thing uses all their resources. \n\n    They are worth having but not at the expense of better services...\n\n    它们值得拥有，但是不能因此放弃更好的服务。\n\n    The orchestra has more discipline now, but at the expense of spirit.\n\n    那个管弦乐团现在更有纪律性了，却丧失了灵魂。\n\n7.PHRASE花（大笔）钱做If you go to the expense of doing something, you do something which costs a lot of money. If you go to great expense to do something, you spend a lot of money in order to achieve it. \n\n    Why go to the expense of buying an electric saw when you can hire one?...\n\n    既然可以租电锯，为什么要花大价钱买一个呢？\n\n    It was said that he went to great expense to install a lift in the building.\n\n    据说他花费巨资在大楼里安装了一台电梯。
definitive@adj. 决定性的，权威性的，确定的，限定的\nn. 限定词    1.ADJ-GRADED明确的；最终的；不可更改的；决定性的Something that is definitive provides a firm conclusion that cannot be questioned. \n\n        No one has come up with a definitive answer as to why this should be so...\n\n        对于为什么应该是这样，还没有人想出最终确定的答案。\n\n        There is no definitive test as yet for the condition.\n\n        对这种病目前还没有决定性的检测手段。\n\n    definitively\n\n        The Constitution did not definitively rule out divorce.\n\n        宪法没有明确排除离婚。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（书籍或表演）最佳的，最具权威的A definitive book or performance is thought to be the best of its kind that has ever been done or that will ever be done. \n\n        His 'An Orkney Tapestry' is still the definitive book on the islands.\n\n        他的《奥克尼挂毯》一书仍是关于这些岛屿的最权威著作。
colony@n. 侨民,侨居地,殖民地,聚居(地)    1.N-COUNT殖民地A colony is a country which is controlled by a more powerful country. \n\n        In France's former North African colonies, anti-French feeling is growing...\n\n        在北非的一些前法属殖民地国家，反法情绪日益增长。\n\n        Puerto Rico, though it calls itself a Commonwealth, is really a self-governing American colony.\n\n        波多黎各尽管自称共和国，但实际上是有自治权的美国殖民地。\n    2.N-COUNT（某一类人的）聚居地，聚居区You can refer to a place where a particular group of people lives as a particular kind of colony . \n\n        In 1932, he established a school and artists' colony in Stone City, Iowa.\n\n        1932年，他在艾奥瓦州的石头城创建了一所学校，那儿成了艺术家的聚居地。\n\n        ...a penal colony.\n\n        罪犯流放地\n\n        ...industrial colonies.\n\n        工业聚集区\n    3.N-PLURAL（统称）英属殖民地The colonies means all the countries that used to be British colonies. \n\n        Many of our troops and officers were scattered around the world in the service of His Majesty in the colonies.\n\n        我们的很多部队和军官分驻世界各地的英属殖民地，为英王效力。\n    4.N-PLURAL（美国独立前的）北美十三州The colonies means the 13 British colonies in North America which formed the original United States. \n\n        On the eve of the Revolution, the colonies produced thirty thousand tons of crude iron a year.\n\n        独立战争前夕，北美十三州每年生产3万吨生铁。\n    5.N-COUNT（鸟、昆虫或动物的）群体，集群，群落A colony of birds, insects, or animals is a group of them that live together. \n\n        The Shetlands are famed for their colonies of sea birds...\n\n        设得兰群岛以其众多的海鸟而闻名。\n\n        The caterpillars feed in large colonies.\n\n        毛毛虫总是成群进食。
dwell@1.VERB沉湎于，唠叨，赘述（尤指令人不快的事）If you dwell on something, especially something unpleasant, you think, speak, or write about it a lot or for quite a long time. \n\n    I'd rather not dwell on the past.\n\n    我不想再沉湎于过去了。\n\n2.VERB居住；栖身If you dwell somewhere, you live there. \n\n    They are concerned for the fate of the forest and the Indians who dwell in it...\n\n    他们为这片森林及居住于其中的印第安人的命运而担心。\n\n    Shiva is a dark god; he dwells in the mountains and deserts.\n\n    湿婆神匿影藏形于深山和沙漠之中。
instinct@n. 本能, 天性, 直觉    1.N-VAR本能；天性Instinct is the natural tendency that a person or animal has to behave or react in a particular way.\n\n        I didn't have as strong a maternal instinct as some other mothers...\n\n        我不像别的母亲那样有那么强烈的母性本能。\n\n        The basis for training relies on the dog's natural instinct to hunt and retrieve...\n\n        训练是基于狗搜寻和衔回的天生本能。\n\n        He always knew what time it was, as if by instinct.\n\n        他总能知道几点了，仿佛是出于本能。\n    2.N-COUNT天分；天资；天赋的才能If you have an instinct for something, you are naturally good at it or able to do it. \n\n        Farmers are increasingly losing touch with their instinct for managing the land...\n\n        农民正在逐渐丢失经营土地的本领。\n\n        Irene is so incredibly musical and has a natural instinct to perform.\n\n        艾琳有着极高的音乐天分和天生的表演才能。\n    3.N-VAR本能反应；心里的话If it is your instinct to do something, you feel that it is right to do it. \n\n        I should've gone with my first instinct, which was not to do the interview...\n\n        我本该听从自己的第一反应，不接受这次采访的。\n\n        She hadn't followed her instinct and because of this Frank was dead.\n\n        她没有听从自己心里的话，弗兰克因此死了。\n    4.N-VAR直觉Instinct is a feeling that you have that something is the case, rather than an opinion or idea based on facts. \n\n        There is scientific evidence to support our instinct that being surrounded by plants is good for health...\n\n        我们觉得周围植物环绕会有益健康，这种直觉有科学证据支持。\n\n        He seems so honest and genuine and my every instinct says he's not.\n\n        他看起来这么老实诚恳，但我的全部直觉告诉我他一点都不。
nurture@n. 养育, 照顾, 教育, 滋养, 营养品\nvt. 养育, 给与营养物, 教养, 扶持    1.VERB养育；培育If you nurture something such as a young child or a young plant, you care for it while it is growing and developing. \n\n        Parents want to know the best way to nurture and raise their child to adulthood...\n\n        父母希望知道养育孩子长大成人的最佳方法。\n\n        The modern conservatory is not an environment for nurturing plants.\n\n        这个现代化温室的环境不适合培育植物。\n\n    nurturing\n\n        She was not receiving warm nurturing care.\n\n        她没有得到温暖的抚育。\n\n    nurturing\n\n        Which adult in these children's lives will provide the nurturing they need?\n\n        这些孩子生活中的哪个成人会为他们提供所需的养育呢？\n    2.VERB发展，孕育（计划、想法等）；培养（人等）If you nurture plans, ideas, or people, you encourage them or help them to develop. \n\n        She had always nurtured great ambitions for her son.\n\n        她总是鼓励儿子要树立远大抱负。\n\n        ...parents whose political views were nurtured in the sixties...\n\n        政治观点形成于60年代的父母一辈\n\n        Charlie Nelson has nurtured fine sprinters.\n\n        查理·纳尔逊已经培养出了相当优秀的短跑选手。\n\n    nurturing\n\n        The decision to cut back on film-making had a catastrophic effect on the nurturing of new talent.\n\n        削减电影制作经费的决定在扶植新人方面有灾难性的影响。\n    3.N-UNCOUNT教育；教养；培养Nurture is care that is given to someone while they are growing and developing.\n\n        The human organism learns partly by nature, partly by nurture.\n\n        人的学习能力部分是天生的，部分是后天培养的。
bizarre@adj. 奇异的,怪诞的,古怪的\nn. 奇异花
twinkle@n. 闪烁,闪耀,眨眼,瞬息\nv. 闪烁,使...闪耀,眨眼，迅速移动    1.VERB闪烁；闪耀If a star or a light twinkles, it shines with an unsteady light which rapidly and constantly changes from bright to faint. \n\n        At night, lights twinkle in distant villages across the valleys.\n\n        夜间，山谷那头的遥远村落里灯光闪闪。\n\n        ...a band of twinkling diamonds.\n\n        一串闪闪发光的钻石\n\n    twinkly\n\n        We always decorated a grand 6m pine tree on our front lawn with soft, twinkly blue lights.\n\n        我们总是给屋前草坪上一棵 6 米高的大松树挂上柔和闪烁的蓝灯。\n    2.VERB（因感到有趣或高兴而眼睛）闪亮，发光If you say that someone's eyes twinkle, you mean that their face expresses good humour or amusement. \n\n        She saw her mother's eyes twinkle with amusement.\n\n        她看到母亲眼中闪烁着喜悦的光芒。\n\n        Twinkle is also a noun.\n\n            A kindly twinkle came into her eyes.\n\n            她的目光变得友善起来。\n\n    twinkly\n\n        She describes him as kind, warm, compassionate, with the most naughty twinkly blue eyes.\n\n        她形容他善良、热情、富有同情心，还有一双最为顽皮的闪闪发亮的蓝眼睛。
circulatory@adj. 循环的，循环系统的    1.ADJ血液循环的Circulatory means relating to the circulation of blood in the body. \n\n        ...the human circulatory system.\n\n        人体血液循环系统
keep at bay@vi. 牵制9.PHRASE使…不能靠近；防止…侵袭If you keep something or someone at bay, or hold them at bay, you prevent them from reaching, attacking, or affecting you. \n\n    Eating oranges keeps colds at bay...\n\n    吃橘子可以预防感冒。\n\n    Prisoners armed with baseball bats used the hostages to hold police at bay.\n\n    手持棒球棒的囚犯们挟持了人质，使警察无法靠近。
nutrient@adj. 营养的,滋养的\nn. 营养物,营养品    1.N-COUNT营养物质；养分；滋养物Nutrients are substances that help plants and animals to grow. \n\n        ...the role of vegetable fibres, vitamins, minerals and other essential nutrients.\n\n        植物纤维、维生素、矿物质和其他必不可少的营养物质的作用
fraction@n. 分数, 小部分, 破片    1.N-COUNT少量；小份；一点儿A fraction of something is a tiny amount or proportion of it. \n\n        She hesitated for a fraction of a second before responding...\n\n        她在回答之前犹豫了一下。\n\n        Here's how to eat like the stars, at a fraction of the cost...\n\n        这就是如何花少量钱却能像明星一样吃喝的方法。\n\n        I opened my eyes just a fraction.\n\n        我微微睁开了眼睛。\n    2.N-COUNT分数A fraction is a number that can be expressed as a proportion of two whole numbers. For example, ½ and ⅓ are both fractions.\n\n        The students had a grasp of decimals, percentages and fractions.\n\n        学生们掌握了小数、百分数和分数。
