fragment@n. 碎片\nvt.vi. 变成碎片\n[计算机] 碎片    The noun is pronounced /'frægmənt/. The verb is pronounced /fræg'ment/. 名词读作/'frægmənt/。动词读作/fræg'ment/。\n    1.N-COUNT碎片；片断；小部分A fragment of something is a small piece or part of it. \n\n        ...fragments of metal in my shoulder...\n\n        我肩膀里的几块金属碎片\n\n        She read everything, digesting every fragment of news.\n\n        她什么都看，对新闻的每个片段都细细品味。\n\n        ...glass fragments.\n\n        玻璃碎片\n    2.V-ERG（使）成碎片；（使）分裂；（使）分化If something fragments or is fragmented, it breaks or separates into small pieces or parts. \n\n        The clouds fragmented and out came the sun...\n\n        乌云散开，太阳出来了。\n\n        Fierce rivalries have traditionally fragmented the region...\n\n        激烈的竞争已经如从前一样使得该地区四分五裂。\n\n        By the first century BC, Buddhism was in danger of fragmenting into small sects.\n\n        到公元前1世纪时，佛教面临着被分化成一些小派别的危险。\n\n    fragmentation\n\n        ...the extraordinary fragmentation of styles on the music scene.\n\n        音乐界极其多元化的风格\n\n    fragmented\n\n        Europe had become infinitely more unstable and fragmented.\n\n        欧洲已经变得相当不稳定，也越来越分化。
node@n. 节, 结节, 瘤, (戏剧情节的)曲折或纠纷\n[计算机] 节点    1.N-COUNT节；结；瘤A node is a point, especially in the form of lump or swelling, where one thing joins another.\n\n        Cut them off cleanly through the stem just below the node.\n\n        就从茎节下面，沿茎干把它们全砍掉。\n\n        ...nerve nodes.\n\n        神经结
respiration@n. 呼吸；呼吸作用    1.N-UNCOUNTSee also:artificial respiration；呼吸Your respiration is your breathing. \n\n        His respiration grew fainter throughout the day.\n\n        一天当中，他的呼吸越来越微弱。
downfall@    1.N-COUNT衰落；衰败；垮台The downfall of a successful or powerful person or institution is their loss of success or power. \n\n        His lack of experience had led to his downfall.\n\n        经验不足导致了他的下台。\n\n        ...people wishing to see the downfall of the government.\n\n        希望看到政府倒台的人们\n    2.N-COUNT失败（或垮台）的原因The thing that was a person's downfall caused them to fail or lose power. \n\n        His honesty had been his downfall...\n\n        他败在诚实。\n\n        Alan's downfall was women.\n\n        艾伦栽在了“女人”这两个字上。
spitter@ n. 吐唾沫的人，以肉叉烤肉的人
exterior@n. 外部, 表面, 外型\nadj. 外部的, 外在的, 表面的\n[计算机] 外部的    1.N-COUNT外观；外部The exterior of something is its outside surface. \n\n        In one ad the viewer scarcely sees the car's exterior...\n\n        在一则广告中，观众几乎看不到汽车的外观。\n\n        The exterior of the building was elegant and graceful.\n\n        这座大厦外观雅致而优美。\n    2.N-COUNT（尤指与实际性格相差甚远的）外表，外貌，外在You can refer to someone's usual appearance or behaviour as their exterior, especially when it is very different from their real character. \n\n        According to Mandy, Pat's tough exterior hides a shy and sensitive soul.\n\n        据曼迪说，帕特彪悍的外表下隐藏着一颗害羞且敏感的心。\n    3.ADJ外面的；外部的You use exterior to refer to the outside parts of something or things that are outside something. \n\n        The exterior walls were made of pre-formed concrete.\n\n        外墙用的是预制混凝土。\n\n        ...the oven's exterior surfaces.\n\n        烤箱的外表面
defensive@    1.ADJ防御（性）的；防卫（用）的；保护的You use defensive to describe things that are intended to protect someone or something. \n\n        The Government hastily organized defensive measures against the raids...\n\n        政府急忙布置了防卫措施抵御空袭。\n\n        The union leaders were pushed into a more defensive position by the return of a Republican Congress in November.\n\n        由于 11 月份共和党重新控制了国会，工会领导人被推到更加被动防守的位置。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（表现在行为上）防御的，戒备的，卫护的Someone who is defensive is behaving in a way that shows they feel unsure or threatened.\n\n        Like their children, parents are often defensive about their private lives.\n\n        就像子女一样，父母也常常很注重保护他们的私生活。\n\n        She heard the blustering, defensive note in his voice and knew that he was ashamed.\n\n        她听出他话音里的气势汹汹和自我卫护，知道他感到了羞愧。\n\n    defensively\n\n        'Oh, I know, I know,' said Kate, defensively.\n\n        “哦，我知道，我知道，”凯特以一种防卫的语气说道。\n\n    defensiveness\n\n        He felt a certain defensiveness about his position.\n\n        他对自己的位置心存戒备。\n    3.PHRASE处于防御姿态；处于守势If someone is on the defensive, they are trying to protect themselves or their interests because they feel unsure or threatened. \n\n        Accusations are likely to put the other person on the defensive...\n\n        谴责很可能会引发对方自我防卫的反应。\n\n        He smiled, not wanting to put the man on the defensive.\n\n        他笑了笑，不想让那个人产生抵触情绪。\n    4.ADJ-GRADED（体育运动中的打法）防守（型）的In sports, defensive play is play that is intended to prevent your opponent from scoring goals or points against you. \n\n        I'd always played a defensive game, waiting for my opponent to make a mistake.\n\n        我总是采取防守型的打法，等待对手出错。\n\n    defensively\n\n        Mexico did not play defensively.\n\n        墨西哥队没有采取防守型打法。
organism@n. 生物体, 有机体    1.N-COUNT生物；有机体；（尤指）微生物An organism is an animal or plant, especially one that is so small that you cannot see it without using a microscope.\n\n        Not all chemicals normally present in living organisms are harmless.\n\n        并不是所有常见于生物体中的化学物质都无害。\n\n        ...the insect-borne organisms that cause sleeping sickness.\n\n        通过昆虫传播、导致昏睡病的微生物
inorganic@adj. 无机的, 无生物的，非自然生长的    1.ADJ无机的Inorganic substances are substances such as stone and metal that do not come from living things. \n\n        ...roofing made from organic and inorganic fibres.\n\n        有机和无机纤维的屋面材料
sphere@adj. 球体的\nn. 范围, 领域, 球, 球体    1.N-COUNT球（体）；球形A sphere is an object that is completely round in shape like a ball.\n    2.N-COUNT（活动、兴趣等的）范围，领域A sphere of activity or interest is a particular area of activity or interest. \n\n        ...the sphere of international politics.\n\n        国际政治领域\n\n        ...nurses, working in all spheres of the health service.\n\n        在公共医疗保健服务业的各领域工作的护士们\n    3.N-COUNT（社会地位或兴趣等相同的）人群，阶层，圈子A sphere of people is a group of them who are similar in social status or who have the same interests. \n\n        ...the realities of life outside the government and academic spheres of society.\n\n        政府和学术界以外社会阶层的生活现状\n    4.PHRASE（国家的）势力范围，影响所及的范围A country's sphere of influence is an area of the world where it has a lot of influence. \n\n        They see the region as their natural sphere of influence due to their historical links and a shared language.\n\n        基于历史上的联系和共同的语言，他们把该地区看成是自己天然的势力范围。\n\n        ...countries traditionally within the British or American spheres of influence.\n\n        传统上处于英国或美国势力范围内的国家
claim@1.VERB声称；断言If you say that someone claims that something is true, you mean they say that it is true but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth. \n\n    He claimed that it was all a conspiracy against him... \n\n    他声称这一切都是一场针对他的阴谋。\n\n    A man claiming to be a journalist threatened to reveal details about her private life...\n\n    一个自称是记者的人威胁要公开有关她的私生活的细节。\n\n    'I had never received one single complaint against me,' claimed the humiliated doctor...\n\n    “从来没有人投诉过我，”感到受辱的那名医生宣称。\n\n2.N-COUNT声称；断言A claim is something which someone says which they cannot prove and which may be false. \n\n    He repeated his claim that the people of Trinidad and Tobago backed his action...\n\n    他再次声称，特立尼达和多巴哥的人民支持他的行动。\n\n    He rejected claims that he had affairs with six women.\n\n    他拒不承认他和6个女人有染的说法。\n\n3.VERB声称（负有责任或享有功劳）If you say that someone claims responsibility or credit for something, you mean they say that they are responsible for it, but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth. \n\n    An underground organisation has claimed responsibility for the bomb explosion...\n\n    一个地下组织已经声称对这起炸弹爆炸事件负责。\n\n    He was too modest to claim the credit.\n\n    他太谦逊，不愿意邀功。\n\n4.VERB索取，索要（有权拥有的东西）If you claim something, you try to get it because you think you have a right to it. \n\n    Now they are returning to claim what was theirs.\n\n    如今他们回来索取本属于他们的东西。\n\n5.N-COUNT主张；要求A claim is a demand for something that you think you have a right to. \n\n    Rival claims to Macedonian territory caused conflict in the Balkans.\n\n    多方主张拥有对马其顿的领土主权，结果在巴尔干地区引发了冲突。\n\n6.VERB取得，获得，赢得（纪录、冠军或奖励）If someone claims a record, title, or prize, they gain or win it. \n\n    Zhuang claimed the record in 54.64 seconds...\n\n    庄创下了54。64秒的纪录。\n\n    Steffi Graf claimed a fourth Wimbledon title in 1992.\n\n    施特菲·格拉芙于1992年第4次赢得温布尔登桂冠。\n\n7.N-COUNT权利；要求权If you have a claim on someone or their attention, you have the right to demand things from them or to demand their attention. \n\n    She'd no claims on him now...\n\n    现在他不欠她什么了。\n\n    He was surrounded by people, all with claims on his attention.\n\n    他被人们团团围住，个个都要他把注意力放在自己身上。\n\n8.VERB需要，要求（花时间或精力）If something or someone claims your attention, they need you to spend your time and effort on them. \n\n    There is already a long list of people claiming her attention.\n\n    需要她关注的人已经很多了。\n\n9.VERB索要，索取，申领（钱）If you claim money from the government, an insurance company, or another organization, you officially apply to them for it, because you think you are entitled to it according to their rules. \n\n    Some 25 per cent of the people who are entitled to claim State benefits do not do so...\n\n    有权申领政府补贴的人当中，约有25%没有提出申请。\n\n    John had taken out redundancy insurance but when he tried to claim, he was refused payment...\n\n    约翰办理过失业保险，可是当他去索赔时却遭拒付。\n\n    They intend to claim for damages against the three doctors.\n\n    他们打算向那3位医生索要损害赔偿。\n\n    Claim is also a noun.\n\n        ...the office which has been dealing with their claim for benefit...\n\n        受理他们申领补助的办事处\n\n        Last time we made a claim on our insurance they paid up really quickly.\n\n        上次我们申领保险赔付的时候，他们给付得非常爽快。\n\n10.VERB（向雇主）索要，索取，讨要（钱、福利）If you claim money or other benefits from your employers, you demand them because you think you deserve or need them. \n\n    The union claimed a pay rise worth four times the rate of inflation.\n\n    工会要求按照通货膨胀率的4倍提高工资。\n\n    Claim is also a noun.\n\n        They are making substantial claims for improved working conditions...\n\n        他们强烈要求改善工作环境。\n\n        Electricity workers have voted for industrial action in pursuit of a pay claim.\n\n        电工们已经投票决定采取劳工行动以增加工资。\n\n11.VERB（战争、疾病、事故）夺去（生命），导致（死亡）If you say that a war, disease, or accident claims someone's life, you mean that they are killed in it or by it. \n\n    The civil war claimed the life of a U.N. interpreter yesterday...\n\n    昨天，内战夺去了一位联合国译员的生命。\n\n    Heart disease is the biggest killer, claiming 180,000 lives a year.\n\n    心脏病是头号杀手，每年夺去18万条生命。\n\n12.See also: no claims；\n13.PHRASE成名之举；成名之作Someone's claim to fame is something quite important or interesting that they have done or that is connected with them. \n\n    Barbara Follett's greatest claim to fame is that she taught Labour MPs how to look good on television.\n\n    芭芭拉·福利特最出名的事就是她教工党议员如何在电视上拥有良好形象。\n\n14.PHRASE声称拥有If you lay claim to something you do not have, you say that it belongs to you. \n\n    Five Asian countries lay claim to the islands.\n\n    5个亚洲国家声称对那些岛屿拥有主权。
substance@    1.N-COUNT物质；物品；东西A substance is a solid, powder, liquid, or gas with particular properties. \n\n        There's absolutely no regulation of cigarettes to make sure that they don't include poisonous substances...\n\n        根本没有法规来确保香烟不含有毒物质。\n\n        The substance that's causing the problem comes from the barley.\n\n        引起该问题的物质来自大麦。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT重要性；重大意义Substance is the quality of being important or significant. \n\n        It's questionable whether anything of substance has been achieved...\n\n        是否已经取得了任何实质性进展还是个问题。\n\n        Syria will attend only if the negotiations deal with issues of substance.\n\n        只有在谈判涉及重大问题时叙利亚才会参加。\n    3.N-SING主旨；要点；实质；基本内容The substance of what someone says or writes is the main thing that they are trying to say. \n\n        The substance of his discussions doesn't really matter.\n\n        他讨论的要点实际上根本不重要。\n    4.N-UNCOUNT事实基础；根据If you say that something has no substance, you mean that it is not true. \n\n        There is no substance in any of these allegations.\n\n        这些指控都毫无根据。\n    5.PHRASE财力雄厚的；有权有势的；有影响力的A person of substance has a lot of money, power, or influence. \n\n        ...mature men of substance.\n\n        有钱有势的成熟男人
specifically@adv. 特定的,明确的    1.ADV特别地；特意地；专门地You use specifically to emphasize that something is given special attention and considered separately from other things of the same kind. \n\n        ...the first nursing home designed specifically for people with AIDS...\n\n        首家专为艾滋病人设计的疗养院\n\n        We haven't specifically targeted school children.\n\n        我们尚未特意把学生定为我们的目标。\n\n        ...the only book specifically about that event.\n\n        唯一一本专门讲述那一事件的书\n    2.ADV确切地说You use specifically to add something more precise or exact to what you have already said. \n\n        Death frightens me, specifically my own death.\n\n        死亡让我感到恐惧，确切地说，是我自己的死亡。\n\n        ...the Christian, and specifically Protestant, religion.\n\n        基督教，确切地说，新教\n\n        ...brain cells, or more specifically, neurons.\n\n        脑细胞，或者更确切地说，神经细胞\n    3.ADV局限性地You use specifically to indicate that something has a restricted nature, as opposed to being more general in nature. \n\n        ...a specifically female audience...\n\n        只由女性组成的听众\n\n        This is a European, and not a specifically British, problem.\n\n        这是全欧洲面临的问题，而不是英国独有的问题。\n    4.ADV准确地；确切地If you state or describe something specifically, you state or describe it precisely and clearly. \n\n        I asked her to repeat specifically the words that Patti had used...\n\n        我让她原原本本地重复一下帕蒂的措辞。\n\n        I specifically asked for this steak rare.\n\n        我明确要求把这份牛排煎得偏生一些。
clone@n. 克隆，无性繁殖，复制品\nv. 克隆，复制    1.N-COUNT极为相似的人（或事物）If someone or something is a clone of another person or thing, they are so similar to this person or thing that they seem to be exactly the same as them. \n\n        Tom was in some ways a younger clone of his handsome father...\n\n        汤姆某些地方长得和他那帅气的父亲一模一样，只是年轻一些。\n\n        Designers are mistaken if they believe we all want to be supermodel clones.\n\n        要是设计师认为所有人都想和超模一样，那他们就错了。\n    2.N-COUNT克隆动物（或植物）；无性繁殖动物（或植物）A clone is an animal or plant that has been produced artificially, for example in a laboratory, from the cells of another animal or plant. A clone is exactly the same as the original animal or plant.\n    3.VERB克隆；以无性繁殖技术复制To clone an animal or plant means to produce it as a clone. \n\n        The idea of cloning extinct life forms still belongs to science fiction.\n\n        克隆已经灭绝的生物的想法仍旧只限于科幻小说中。
enroll@in AM, use 美国英语用 enroll\n1.V-ERG招收（成员）；招（生）登记入学；注册（课程）If you enrol or are enrolled at an institution or on a course, you officially join it and pay a fee for it. \n\n    Cherny was enrolled at the University in 1945... \n\n    彻尼1945年在该大学登记入学。\n\n    She enrolled on a local Women Into Management course...\n\n    她注册学习当地的“女性参与管理”课程。\n\n    At 33 he enrolled in a glass-making degree course at London's Royal College of Art...\n\n    33岁时，他在伦敦皇家艺术学院注册学习玻璃制作学位课程。
database@    1.N-COUNT（计算机）数据库，资料库A database is a collection of data that is stored in a computer and that can easily be used and added to.\n\n        They maintain a database of hotels that cater for businesswomen.\n\n        他们维护着一个服务于商界女性的酒店资料库。
objective@adj. 客观的, 目标的\nn. 目标, 目的; 物镜\nn. =objective case 宾语    1.N-COUNT目的；目标；宗旨Your objective is what you are trying to achieve. \n\n        Our main objective was the recovery of the child safe and well...\n\n        我们的主要目标是将孩子安然无恙地找回来。\n\n        His objective was to play golf and win.\n\n        他的目标是参加高尔夫球比赛并赢得胜利。\n    2.ADJ（信息）客观的，基于事实的Objective information is based on facts. \n\n        He had no objective evidence that anything extraordinary was happening.\n\n        他没有客观证据表明正在发生什么不同寻常之事。\n\n    objectively\n\n        We simply want to inform people objectively about events.\n\n        我们只是想如实地向人们通报事件情况。\n\n    objectivity\n\n        The poll, whose objectivity is open to question, gave the party a 39% share of the vote.\n\n        在这次投票中该党获得了39％的选票，但其客观性值得怀疑。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED（观点）客观的，不带个人感情的，没有个人偏见的If someone is objective, they base their opinions on facts rather than on their personal feelings.\n\n        I believe that a journalist should be completely objective...\n\n        我认为新闻记者不应当有丝毫偏见。\n\n        I would really like to have your objective opinion on this.\n\n        我很想听听你对此事的客观见解。\n\n    objectively\n\n        Try to view situations more objectively, especially with regard to work.\n\n        要尽量客观地分析情况，尤其是在工作上。\n\n    objectivity\n\n        The psychiatrist must learn to maintain an unusual degree of objectivity.\n\n        精神科医生务必要学会保持超乎寻常的客观态度。
investigate@    1.VERB调查；审查If someone, especially an official, investigates an event, situation, or claim, they try to find out what happened or what is the truth. \n\n        Gas officials are investigating the cause of an explosion which badly damaged a house in Hampshire...\n\n        煤气系统的官员正在调查一起瓦斯爆炸的起因，这起事故严重毁坏了汉普郡的一所房屋。\n\n        The two officers were being investigated by the director of public prosecutions...\n\n        两名警官正在接受检察官的审查。\n\n        Police are still investigating how the accident happened.\n\n        警方仍然在调查事故的起因。\n\n    investigation\n\n        He ordered an investigation into the affair...\n\n        他命令对此事件展开调查。\n\n        He has been notified by magistrates that he is under investigation for corruption.\n\n        地方法官告知他因为贪污腐败问题正在对他进行审查。
engaged@    1.ADJ从事…的；忙于…的Someone who is engaged in or engaged on a particular activity is doing that thing. \n\n        They found the three engaged in target practice.\n\n        他们发现那3个人在练习打靶。\n\n        ...the various projects he was engaged on.\n\n        他参与的各种项目\n    2.ADJ订婚的When two people are engaged, they have agreed to marry each other. \n\n        We got engaged on my eighteenth birthday...\n\n        在我18岁生日那天我们订婚了。\n\n        He was engaged to Miss Julia Maria Boardman.\n\n        他和朱莉娅·玛丽亚·博德曼小姐订婚了。\n\n        ...the engaged couple.\n\n        那对订婚的情侣\n    3.ADJ（电话）占线的If a telephone or a telephone line is engaged, it is already being used by someone else so that you are unable to speak to the person you are phoning. \n\n        The line is engaged...\n\n        电话占线。\n\n        We tried to call you back but you were engaged.\n\n        我们试着给你回电，但是你正在通话中。\n\n    in AM, use 美国英语用 busy\n    4.ADJ（公共厕所）被占用的，使用中的If a public toilet is engaged, it is already being used by someone else. \n\n    in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用 occupied
come to one's senses@v.苏醒过来,醒悟14.PHRASE恢复理性；清醒过来；醒悟过来If you say that someone has come to their senses or has been brought to their senses, you mean that they have stopped being foolish and are being sensible again. \n\n    Eventually the world will come to its senses and get rid of them...\n\n    最终这世界会清醒过来，将它们全部丢弃。\n\n    May her death bring these people to their senses.\n\n    但愿她的死能让这些人醒悟。
vicious@adj. 恶毒的, 恶意的, 凶残的, 剧烈的, 严重的    1.ADJ-GRADED残暴的；凶残的；凶恶的A vicious person or a vicious blow is violent and cruel.\n\n        He was a cruel and vicious man...\n\n        他是一个残忍凶狠的男人。\n\n        He suffered a vicious attack by a gang of white youths...\n\n        他遭到一帮白人青年的残暴袭击。\n\n        The blow was so sudden and vicious that he dropped to his knees.\n\n        突如其来的猛然一击使他跪倒在地。\n\n    viciously\n\n        She had been viciously attacked with a hammer.\n\n        有人用锤子凶狠地攻击过她。\n\n    viciousness\n\n        ...the intensity and viciousness of these attacks.\n\n        这些袭击的猛烈和凶残程度\n    2.ADJ-GRADED恶毒的；恶意的；不怀好意的A vicious remark is cruel and intended to upset someone.\n\n        It is a deliberate, nasty and vicious attack on a young man's character.\n\n        这是对一个年轻人品格蓄意的、卑鄙的、恶毒的攻击。\n\n        ...her shrewish temperament and vicious tongue.\n\n        她暴躁的性格和恶毒的言语\n\n    viciously\n\n        'He deserved to die,' said Penelope viciously.\n\n        “他该去死，”佩内洛普恶毒地说道。
placement@    1.N-UNCOUNT放置；布置；部署The placement of something or someone is the act of putting them in a particular place or position. \n\n        The treatment involves the placement of twenty-two electrodes in the inner ear.\n\n        这一治疗需要在内耳放置22个电极。\n    2.N-COUNT（培训中的）实习安排If someone who is training gets a placement, they get a job for a period of time which is intended to give them experience in the work they are training for. \n\n        He had a six-month work placement with the Japanese government.\n\n        他被安排在日本政府部门实习了6个月。\n    3.N-UNCOUNT（人员的）安插，安置The placement of someone in a job, home, or school is the act or process of finding them a job, home, or school. \n\n        The children were waiting for placement in a foster care home...\n\n        这些孩子在抚育院等待安置。\n\n        A job placement program exists to help those who are unemployed.\n\n        就业安置计划是为了帮助那些失业者。\n    4.N-COUNT收容所；安置所You can refer to a home that is found for someone who is unable to look after themselves, for example a child, as a placement .\n\n        This home seemed like a good placement for Sarah.\n\n        这家养育院对萨拉来说似乎是一个合适的收容之所。
intellect@n. 智力，思维逻辑领悟力，理解力/nn. 知识份子，智力高的人，才智超群的人    1.N-VAR智力；理解力；领悟力；思维能力Intellect is the ability to understand or deal with ideas and information.\n\n        Do the emotions develop in parallel with the intellect?...\n\n        情感与智力是并行发展的吗？\n\n        The intellect is not the most important thing in life.\n\n        才智不是生活中最重要的东西。\n    2.N-VAR非凡的才智；出众的才华Intellect is the quality of being very intelligent or clever. \n\n        Her intellect is famed far and wide...\n\n        她的非凡才智闻名遐迩。\n\n        The members of the committee described Gates as a man of keen intellect.\n\n        委员会委员把盖茨描述为才智过人。\n    3.N-COUNT英才；才智非凡的人If you describe someone as an intellect, you mean that they are very intelligent.\n\n        My boss isn't a great intellect.\n\n        我的老板才智并不出众。
readily@    1.ADV-GRADED乐意地；欣然地If you do something readily, you do it in a way which shows that you are very willing to do it. \n\n        I asked her if she would allow me to interview her, and she readily agreed...\n\n        我问她是否允许我采访她，她欣然同意了。\n\n        When I was invited to the party, I readily accepted.\n\n        当被邀请参加聚会的时候，我一口答应了。\n    2.ADV-GRADED迅速地；容易地；轻松地You also use readily to say that something can be done or obtained quickly and easily. For example, if you say that something can be readily understood, you mean that people can understand it quickly and easily. \n\n        The components are readily available in hardware shops...\n\n        这些零件很容易在五金商店买到。\n\n        I don't readily make friends.\n\n        我不轻易交友。
odd@adj. 奇数的,古怪的,剩余的\n. 奇数1.ADJ-GRADEDSee also:odd-looking；奇怪的；古怪的；奇特的；异常的If you describe someone or something as odd, you think that they are strange or unusual.\n\n    He'd always been odd, but not to this extent...\n\n    他一直比较怪异，不过并没有到这种程度。\n\n    What an odd coincidence that he should have known your family...\n\n    他居然认识你的家人，真是太巧了。\n\n    Something odd began to happen.\n\n    怪事开始出现。\n\noddly\n\n    ...an oddly shaped hill...\n\n    形状怪异的小山\n\n    His own boss was behaving rather oddly.\n\n    他自己的老板举动相当反常。\n\noddness\n\n    Perhaps it was that very oddness that attracted me to Glen's music.\n\n    也许正是格伦音乐的怪异之处吸引了我。\n\n2.ADJ（用于名词前）少量的，微小的，不重要的You use odd before a noun to indicate that you are not mentioning the type, size, or quality of something because it is not important. \n\n    ...moving from place to place where she could find the odd bit of work...\n\n    她为了找到点儿零散活计不断地搬来搬去\n\n    He had various odd cleaning jobs around the place...\n\n    他在这附近干过各种零碎的保洁工作。\n\n    I knew that Alan liked the odd drink.\n\n    我知道艾伦喜欢偶尔喝点酒。\n\n3.ADV（用于数字后）大约，左右，略多You use odd after a number to indicate that it is only approximate. \n\n    How many pages was it, 500 odd?...\n\n    这有多少页，500来页？\n\n    He has now appeared in sixty odd films...\n\n    他迄今演过60多部影片。\n\n    'How long have you lived here?' — 'Twenty odd years.'\n\n    “你在这里住多久了？”——“20多年了。”\n\n4.ADJ奇数的；单数的Odd numbers, such as 3 and 17, are those which cannot be divided exactly by the number two. \n\n    The odd numbers are on the left as you walk up the street...\n\n    沿这条街走，在左边的是单号。\n\n    There's an odd number of candidates.\n\n    候选人总数为单数。\n\n5.ADJ不同类的；不成对的；单只的You say that two things are odd when they do not belong to the same set or pair.\n\n    I'm wearing odd socks today by the way.\n\n    顺便提一下，我今天穿的袜子不成对。\n\n6.PHRASE与集体不合的人；剩下孤零零的一人；异类The odd man out ,the odd woman out, or the odd one out in a particular situation is a person who is different from the other people in it. \n\n    Azerbaijan has been the odd man out, the one republic not to hold democratic elections...\n\n    阿塞拜疆没有举行民主选举，是这些共和国中的异类。\n\n    Mark and Rick were the odd ones out in claiming to like this cherry beer.\n\n    只剩下马克和里克声称喜欢喝这种樱桃啤酒。
scar@    1.N-COUNT疤；伤疤；伤痕A scar is a mark on the skin which is left after a wound has healed.\n\n        He had a scar on his forehead.\n\n        他的前额有一道疤。\n\n        ...facial injuries which have left permanent scars.\n\n        留下了永久性疤痕的面部创伤\n    2.VERB使结疤；使留下疤痕If your skin is scarred, it is badly marked as a result of a wound. \n\n        He was scarred for life during a pub fight...\n\n        在一次酒吧斗殴中，他留下了永久性的伤疤。\n\n        His scarred face crumpled with pleasure.\n\n        他那张疤脸高兴得皱了起来。\n    3.VERB使（表面）破损；使带脏痕If a surface is scarred, it is damaged and there are ugly marks on it. \n\n        The arena was scarred by deep muddy ruts.\n\n        赛场上留下了深深的车辙泥痕。\n\n        ...scarred wooden table tops.\n\n        有划痕的木桌面\n    4.N-COUNT（精神上的）创伤，伤痕If an unpleasant physical or emotional experience leaves a scar on someone, it has a permanent effect on their mind.\n\n        The early years of fear and the hostility left a deep scar on the young boy.\n\n        早年的恐惧不安和别人的敌意给这个小男孩留下了深深的创伤。\n\n        ...emotional scars that come from having been abused.\n\n        因受虐待而造成的精神创伤\n    5.VERB给…留下精神创伤If an unpleasant physical or emotional experience scars you, it has a permanent effect on your mind. \n\n        This is something that's going to scar him forever.\n\n        这将成为他一生的创伤。
isolation@    1.N-UNCOUNTSee also:isolate；孤独；孤寂；孤立无援Isolation is the state of feeling alone and without friends or help.\n\n        Many deaf people have feelings of isolation and loneliness...\n\n        很多失聪者都有孤独无助的感觉。\n\n        He also talked briefly about the isolation he endured while in captivity.\n\n        他还简单谈及了他被俘期间忍受的孤独。\n    2.PHRASE孤立地；脱离…地If something is considered in isolation from other things that it is connected with, it is considered separately, and those other things are not considered. \n\n        Punishment cannot be discussed in isolation from social theory.\n\n        不能脱离社会理论孤立地讨论惩罚。\n    3.PHRASE单独地；独自地If someone does something in isolation, they do it without other people being present or without their help. \n\n        Malcolm works in isolation but I have no doubts about his abilities.\n\n        马尔科姆单打独干，但我对他的能力丝毫不怀疑。
ginger@n. 姜, 姜根, 精力, 深棕色\nvt. 用姜调味, 使...活泼, 使...有生气    1.N-UNCOUNT姜Ginger is the root of a plant that is used to flavour food. It has a sweet spicy flavour and is often sold in powdered form.\n    2.COLOUR姜黄色Ginger is used to describe things that are orangey-brown in colour.\n\n        She was a mature lady with dyed ginger hair.\n\n        她是一位头发染成姜黄色的成熟女性。
rib@1.N-COUNT肋骨Your ribs are the 12 pairs of curved bones that surround your chest.\n\n    Her heart was thumping against her ribs...\n\n    她的心脏紧抵着肋骨砰砰跳动。\n\n    My face was covered with bruises and I had a broken rib.\n\n    我的脸上全是瘀伤，肋骨还断了一根。\n\n2.N-COUNT排骨；肋条（肉）A rib of meat such as beef or pork is a piece that has been cut to include one of the animal's ribs. \n\n    ...a rib of beef.\n\n    牛排\n\n    ...pork ribs in sweet sauce.\n\n    带甜酱的猪排\n\n3.N-UNCOUNT罗纹针织法Rib is a method of knitting that makes a raised pattern of parallel lines. You use rib, for example, round the edge of sweaters so that the material can stretch without losing its shape.\n\n4.VERB（友善地）开…的玩笑，逗弄，取笑If you rib someone about something, you tease them about it in a friendly way. \n\n    The guys in my local pub used to rib me about drinking 'girly' drinks.\n\n    我家当地酒馆里的人以前总是取笑我喝“女人”饮料。
Adam@ n.亚当(<<圣经>>故事人物,所谓人类始祖)
contend@vi. 奋斗,斗争,辩论\nvt. 坚持认为,竞争    1.VERB处理；对付；解决If you have to contend with a problem or difficulty, you have to deal with it or overcome it. \n\n        It is time, once again, to contend with racism...\n\n        又一次到了与种族主义战斗的时刻了。\n\n        American businesses could soon have a new kind of lawsuit to contend with.\n\n        美国公司可能很快就要有一种新型的官司去应付了。\n    2.VERB声称；争辩；主张If you contend that something is true, you state or argue that it is true. \n\n        The government contends that he is fundamentalist...\n\n        政府认定他是原教旨主义者。\n\n        'You were just looking,' contends Samantha. 'I was the one doing all the work.'\n\n        “你不过是看看而已。”萨曼莎争辩道，“什么活儿都是我来干。”\n    3.V-RECIP竞争；争夺If you contend with someone for something such as power, you compete with them to try to get it. \n\n        ...the two main groups contending for power.\n\n        两大集团争权夺利\n\n        ...with 10 UK construction yards contending with rivals from Norway, Holland, Italy and Spain.\n\n        10家英国建造厂与来自挪威、荷兰、意大利和西班牙的对手展开竞争\n\n        ...a binding political settlement between the contending parties.\n\n        角力各派间一项具有约束力的政治协议
destiny@    1.N-COUNT命运A person's destiny is everything that happens to them during their life, including what will happen in the future, especially when it is considered to be controlled by someone or something else. \n\n        We are masters of our own destiny...\n\n        我们是自己命运的主宰者。\n\n        It is my destiny one day to be king.\n\n        我命中注定有一天要成为国王。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT天命；神意；命运之神Destiny is the force which some people believe controls the things that happen to you in your life.\n\n        Is it destiny that brings people together, or is it accident?\n\n        人们的相遇是天意还是偶然？
Munich@ n. 慕尼黑[德国城市]
rebel@n. 叛徒,起义者\nvi. 造反,反抗,反感\nadj. 造反的,反抗的,反叛者的    The noun is pronounced /'rebəl/. The verb is pronounced /rɪ'bel/. 名词读作/'rebəl/。动词读作/rɪ'bel/。\n    1.N-COUNT叛军；反叛者；叛乱者Rebels are people who are fighting against their own country's army in order to change the political system there. \n\n        ...fighting between rebels and government forces.\n\n        叛军和政府军之间的战争\n\n        ...rebel forces in Liberia.\n\n        利比里亚的叛军\n    2.N-COUNT（政党内部的）持不同政见者，反对派Politicians who oppose some of their own party's policies can be referred to as rebels.\n\n        The rebels want another 1% cut in interest rates.\n\n        反对派希望利率再降一个百分点。\n\n        ...rebel MPs.\n\n        持不同政见的国会议员\n    3.VERB（政见不同者）反抗，反对If politicians rebel against one of their own party's policies, they show that they oppose it. \n\n        More than forty Conservative MPs rebelled against the government and voted against the bill.\n\n        40多个保守党议员反对政府的主张，对法案投了反对票。\n\n        ...MPs planning to rebel over the proposed welfare cuts...\n\n        打算反对削减社会福利提议的国会议员\n    4.N-COUNT叛逆者；不循规蹈矩的人You can say that someone is a rebel if you think that they behave differently from other people and have rejected the values of society or of their parents.\n\n        She had been a rebel at school.\n\n        她在学校时就是个叛逆者。\n    5.VERB表现叛逆；不守规矩When someone rebels, they start to behave differently from other people and reject the values of society or of their parents. \n\n        The child who rebels is unlikely to be overlooked...\n\n        叛逆的孩子不太容易被忽视。\n\n        I was very young and rebelling against everything.\n\n        我当时非常年轻，对一切都表现出叛逆。
label@    in AM, use 美国英语用 labeling, labeled\n    1.N-COUNT标签；签条；标贴A label is a piece of paper or plastic that is attached to an object in order to give information about it.\n\n        He peered at the label on the bottle.\n\n        他仔细地看着瓶上的标签。\n    2.VERB贴标签于；用标签标明If something is labelled, a label is attached to it giving information about it. \n\n        The stuff has never been properly logged and labelled...\n\n        这些东西从未进行过妥善登记，也没有贴标签标注。\n\n        Meat labelled 'Scotch Beef' sells for a premium in supermarkets...\n\n        带有“Scotch Beef（苏格兰牛肉）”标志的牛肉在超市里售价不菲。\n\n        All the products are labelled with comprehensive instructions.\n\n        所有产品均标有详尽的使用说明。\n    3.VERB（不公平地）把…称为，把…列为If you say that someone or something is labelled as a particular thing, you mean that people generally describe them that way and you think that this is unfair. \n\n        Too often the press are labelled as bad boys... \n\n        记者们往往被视为捣蛋分子。\n\n        Certain estates are labelled as undesirable...\n\n        某些物业被归入不受欢迎之列。\n\n        They are afraid to contact the social services in case they are labelled a problem family...\n\n        由于害怕被贴上“问题家庭”的标签，他们不敢联系社会福利机构。\n    4.N-COUNT（批评性的）标签，称号If you say that someone gets a particular label, you mean that people show disapproval of them by describing them with a critical word or phrase. \n\n        Her treatment of her husband earned her the label of the most hated woman in America.\n\n        她对待丈夫的行径使她赢得了“全美最可恶的女人”的称号。\n    5.N-COUNT唱片公司You can refer to a company that produces and sells CDs as a particular label . \n\n        She landed a contract with record label EMI...\n\n        她获得了一份与百代唱片公司的合约。\n\n        It was on the Virgin label.\n\n        它由维京唱片公司发行。
album@n. 集邮本,照相簿,唱片簿    1.N-COUNT唱片；唱片集；专辑An album is a record with about 25 minutes of music on each side. You can also refer to a collection of songs that is available on a record, cassette, or CD as an album .\n\n        Chris likes music and has a large collection of albums and cassettes.\n\n        克里斯喜欢音乐，收集了大量的唱片和磁带。\n    2.N-COUNT（用于保存照片、邮票等的）专册，专辑簿An album is a book in which you keep things such as photographs or stamps that you have collected. \n\n        Theresa showed me her photo album.\n\n        特雷莎给我看她的相册。
sacrifice@    1.VERBSee also:self-sacrifice；牺牲；舍弃；献出If you sacrifice something that is valuable or important, you give it up, usually to obtain something else for yourself or for other people. \n\n        She sacrificed family life to her career... \n\n        她为事业舍弃了家庭。\n\n        Her husband's pride was a small thing to sacrifice for their children's security...\n\n        为了孩子们的安全，舍弃她丈夫的尊严不算什么。\n\n        Kitty Aldridge has sacrificed all for her first film...\n\n        姬蒂·奥尔德里奇为自己的首部影片牺牲了一切。\n\n        Sacrifice is also a noun.\n\n            She made many sacrifices to get Anita a good education...\n\n            为了让安妮塔接受良好的教育，她作出了很多牺牲。\n\n            He was willing to make any sacrifice for peace.\n\n            他愿意为和平作出任何牺牲。\n    2.VERB献祭；以…为祭品To sacrifice an animal or person means to kill them in a special religious ceremony as an offering to a god. \n\n        The priest sacrificed a chicken...\n\n        祭司用一只鸡作祭品。\n\n        Two white bulls were sacrificed and a feast was held.\n\n        献祭了两头白牛，并举行了盛宴。\n\n        Sacrifice is also a noun.\n\n            ...animal sacrifices to the gods.\n\n            祭神的牺牲
asset@n. 资产,有用的东西,优点,长处    1.N-COUNT有用的物（或人）；财富Something or someone that is an asset is considered useful or helps a person or organization to be successful.\n\n        Her leadership qualities were the greatest asset of the Conservative Party...\n\n        她的领导才能是保守党最宝贵的财富。\n\n        His Republican credentials made him an asset.\n\n        他作为共和党人的资历成了他的一笔财富。\n    2.N-PLURAL资产；财产The assets of a company or a person are all the things that they own. \n\n        By the end of 1989 the group had assets of 3.5 billion francs.\n\n        到1989年底该集团拥有的资产达35亿法郎。
disadvantaged@adj.贫穷的,处于不利地位的    1.ADJ-GRADED社会地位低下的；生活条件差的；贫困的People who are disadvantaged or live in disadvantaged areas live in bad conditions and tend not to get a good education or have a reasonable standard of living. \n\n        ...the educational problems of disadvantaged children...\n\n        贫困儿童的教育问题\n\n        The centre aims to help disadvantaged areas of Europe, mainly by fostering new businesses.\n\n        该中心旨在帮助欧洲的贫困地区，方法主要是通过扶持新型商业。\n\n        The disadvantaged are people who are disadvantaged.\n\n            ...people who claim to be champions of the poor, the disadvantaged, and the helpless.\n\n            声称替穷人、弱势阶层和无依无靠的人说话的人士
stab@n. 刺,戳,刺伤的伤口,剧痛,尝试\nvt. 刺伤,中伤\nvi. 刺,扎1.VERB（用刀等锋利物）刺，戳，捅If someone stabs you, they push a knife or sharp object into your body. \n\n    Somebody stabbed him in the stomach...\n\n    有人朝他肚子上捅了一刀。\n\n    Dean tried to stab him with a screwdriver...\n\n    迪安试图用一把改锥捅他。\n\n    Stephen was stabbed to death in an unprovoked attack nearly five months ago.\n\n    斯蒂芬在近 5 个月前无故遭到袭击，被捅死了。\n\n2.VERB（用手指或手中的尖物）戳，捅If you stab something or stab at it, you push at it with your finger or with something pointed that you are holding. \n\n    Bess stabbed a slice of cucumber...\n\n    贝丝叉起一片黄瓜。\n\n    Goldstone flipped through the pages and stabbed his thumb at the paragraph he was looking for...\n\n    戈德斯通翻动书页，大拇指按到他正在寻找的那个段落上。\n\n    He stabbed at the omelette with his fork.\n\n    他用叉子戳着煎蛋。\n\n3.N-SING尝试；试图If you have a stab at something, you try to do it. \n\n    Several tennis stars have had a stab at acting.\n\n    好几位网球明星都尝试过从事演艺。\n\n4.N-SING（通常指令人不快的感觉的）突发的一阵You can refer to a sudden, usually unpleasant feeling as a stab of that feeling. \n\n    ...a stab of pain just above his eye...\n\n    他眼睛上方突然的一阵疼痛\n\n    She felt a stab of pity for him.\n\n    她突然对他心生同情。\n\n5.PHRASE背后捅刀子；暗地中伤If you say that someone has stabbed you in the back, you mean that they have done something very harmful to you when you thought that you could trust them. You can refer to an action of this kind as a stab in the back . \n\n    She felt betrayed, as though her daughter had stabbed her in the back...\n\n    她感到被出卖了，就像女儿在自己背后捅了一刀似的。\n\n    He denounced the defection as a stab in the back.\n\n    他谴责这次背叛是背后捅刀子。
crazed@adj. 疯狂的, 癫狂的    1.ADJ疯狂的；发狂的Crazed people are wild and uncontrolled, and perhaps insane. \n\n        A crazed gunman slaughtered five people last night.\n\n        昨晚一名疯狂的持枪歹徒连杀5人。\n\n        ...a crazed act of revenge.\n\n        疯狂的复仇计划
gracious@adj. 亲切的, 高尚的    1.ADJ-GRADED（尤指自己的上级或长者）和蔼的，慈祥的，有礼貌的If you describe someone, especially someone you think is superior to you, as gracious, you mean that they are very well-mannered and pleasant. \n\n        She is a lovely and gracious woman.\n\n        她是位可爱又亲切的女人。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（当权者）彬彬有礼的，宽厚的If you describe the behaviour of someone in a position of authority as gracious, you mean that they behave in a polite and considerate way. \n\n        She closed with a gracious speech of thanks.\n\n        她最后彬彬有礼地致谢，结束了讲话。\n\n    graciously\n\n        Hospitality at the Presidential guest house was graciously declined.\n\n        安排下榻总统宾馆的接待被婉拒了。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED富贵安逸的；舒适的You use gracious to describe the comfortable way of life of wealthy people. \n\n        He drove through the gracious suburbs with the swimming pools and tennis courts.\n\n        他驾车穿过设有游泳池和网球场的舒适城郊住宅区。\n    4.EXCLAM（表示惊讶、不满）天哪，哎呀Some people say good gracious or goodness gracious in order to express surprise or annoyance. \n\n        Good gracious, look at that specimen will you?\n\n        哎呀，你快来瞧瞧那个标本！
fatal@    1.ADJ-GRADED（行为）致命的，后果极严重的，毁灭性的A fatal action has very undesirable effects.\n\n        It would clearly be fatal for Europe to quarrel seriously with America...\n\n        欧洲若与美国反目显然会有致命的后果。\n\n        He made the fatal mistake of compromising early...\n\n        他犯了过早妥协的致命错误。\n\n        It would deal a fatal blow to his fading chances of success.\n\n        这将给他日渐渺茫的成功机会带来致命的一击。\n\n    fatally\n\n        Failure now could fatally damage his chances in the future.\n\n        现在失败会彻底毁掉他未来的机会。\n    2.ADJ（事故或疾病）致命的，致死的A fatal accident or illness causes someone's death.\n\n        ...the fatal stabbing of a police sergeant...\n\n        对警官致命的一刺\n\n        A hospital spokesman said she had suffered a fatal heart attack.\n\n        医院发言人说她死于心脏病发作。\n\n    fatally\n\n        The dead soldier is reported to have been fatally wounded in the chest.\n\n        据报道，死去的那位士兵是胸部受了致命伤。
flashy@    1.ADJ-GRADED俗艳的；浮华的；招摇的If you describe a person or thing as flashy, you mean they are smart and noticeable, but in a rather vulgar way. \n\n        He was much less flashy than his brother.\n\n        他远没有他的兄弟那么招摇。\n\n        ...a flashy sports car.\n\n        扎眼的跑车
punk rock@朋客摇滚乐（新潮摇滚乐，特点是嘈吵、粗哑和疯狂的音响）
inspirational@adj. 带有灵感的, 给予灵感的, 灵感的    1.ADJ-GRADED有启发性的；有启示作用的；有鼓舞力量的Something that is inspirational provides you with inspiration. \n\n        Gandhi was an inspirational figure...\n\n        甘地是富有感召力的人物。\n\n        Cumbria was inspirational for Wordsworth.\n\n        坎布里亚郡为华兹华斯提供了灵感。
establish@v. 建立, 确立, 创办    1.VERB建立；创立；设立；制定If someone establishes something such as an organization, a type of activity, or a set of rules, they create it or introduce it in such a way that it is likely to last for a long time. \n\n        The UN has established detailed criteria for who should be allowed to vote...\n\n        联合国已经制定了有关投票资格的标准细则。\n\n        The School was established in 1989 by an Italian professor.\n\n        这所学院由一名意大利教授于1989年创建。\n    2.V-RECIP建立，开始（联系）If you establish contact with someone, you start to have contact with them. You can also say that two people, groups, or countries establish contact. \n\n        We had already established contact with the museum...\n\n        我们已经和那家博物馆建立了联系。\n\n        Singapore and South Africa have established diplomatic relations.\n\n        新加坡和南非已经建立了外交关系。\n    3.VERB确定；查实；证实If you establish that something is true, you discover facts that show that it is definitely true. \n\n        Medical tests established that she was not their own child... \n\n        医学化验证实她不是他们的亲骨肉。\n\n        It will be essential to establish how the money is being spent...\n\n        查清楚这笔钱将作何用途至关重要。\n\n        An autopsy was being done to establish the cause of death...\n\n        正在进行尸检以确定死亡原因。\n\n    established\n\n        That link is an established medical fact.\n\n        那一关联是已经证实的医学事实。\n    4.VERB使立足；使被认可；确立（地位）If you establish yourself, your reputation, or a good quality that you have, you succeed in doing something, and achieve respect or a secure position as a result of this. \n\n        This is going to be the show where up-and-coming comedians will establish themselves...\n\n        这将是大有前途的喜剧演员们让自己获得认可的节目。\n\n        He has established himself as a pivotal figure in US politics...\n\n        他已经确立了自己在美国政界的核心地位。\n\n        We shall fight to establish our innocence.\n\n        我们应该努力证明自己的清白。
stall@n. 货摊, 托辞, (教堂内）唱诗班和牧师的座位, 熄火\nvt. 使...陷于泥中, 使停止\nvi. 陷入泥中, 发生障碍    1.V-ERG（使）（进程）暂停；（使）推后If a process stalls, or if someone or something stalls it, the process stops but may continue at a later time. \n\n        The Social Democratic Party has vowed to try to stall the bill until the current session ends.\n\n        社会民主党誓言要将该议案拖到本次议会会议结束之后。\n\n        ...but the peace process stalled...\n\n        但和平进程暂停了。\n\n        Negotiations remained stalled yesterday in New York.\n\n        昨天在纽约进行的谈判依然陷于停滞状态。\n    2.VERB拖延If you stall, you try to avoid doing something until later. \n\n        Some parties have accused the governor of stalling...\n\n        有些党派指责州长在拖延时间。\n\n        Thomas had spent all week stalling over his decision.\n\n        托马斯磨了整个星期，迟迟不想作出决定。\n    3.VERB暂时阻止；把…拖住If you stall someone, you prevent them from doing something until a later time. \n\n        Shop manager Brian Steel stalled the man until the police arrived.\n\n        商店经理布赖恩·斯蒂尔将那名男子拖住，直到警方赶到。\n    4.V-ERG（使）突然熄火If a vehicle stalls or if you accidentally stall it, the engine stops suddenly. \n\n        The engine stalled...\n\n        发动机突然熄火了。\n\n        Your foot falls off the pedal and you stall the car.\n\n        你的脚离开踏板，汽车便会熄火。\n    5.N-COUNT货摊；摊位；咨询台A stall is a large table on which you put goods that you want to sell, or information that you want to give people.\n\n        ...market stalls selling local fruits.\n\n        出售当地水果的市场摊位\n    6.N-PLURAL（戏院、音乐厅的）正厅前排座位The stalls in a theatre or concert hall are the seats on the ground floor directly in front of the stage. \n\n    in AM, use 美国英语用 orchestra\n    7.N-COUNT（淋浴间等房间里的）小分隔间A stall is a small enclosed area in a room which is used for a particular purpose, for example a shower. \n\n    in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 cubicle
stuff@n. 材料, 原料, 东西\nn. 素质, 本质; 废物\nvt. 填满, 塞满1.N-UNCOUNT（泛指的）东西，物品，玩意儿You can use stuff to refer to things such as a substance, a collection of things, events, or ideas, or the contents of something in a general way without mentioning the thing itself by name. \n\n    I'd like some coffee, and I don't object to the powdered stuff if it's all you've got... \n\n    我想来点咖啡，如果你只有速溶的那种也可以。\n\n    I don't know anything about this antique stuff...\n\n    我对于这种古玩物件一无所知。\n\n    'What do you want to know?'—'About life and stuff.'...\n\n    “你想知道些什么？”——“关于生命之类的东西。”\n\n2.VERB把…塞进（或填进）If you stuff something somewhere, you push it there quickly and roughly. \n\n    I stuffed my hands in my pockets...\n\n    我把手插进口袋里。\n\n    He stuffed the newspapers into a litter bin and headed down the street...\n\n    他把报纸塞进了垃圾箱，然后沿街往前走了。\n\n    His pants were stuffed inside the tops of his boots.\n\n    他的裤腿儿塞在靴子里。\n\n3.VERB填满；装满；塞满If you stuff a container or space with something, you fill it with something or with a quantity of things until it is full. \n\n    He grabbed my purse, opened it and stuffed it full, then gave it back to me...\n\n    他抢过我的钱包，打开并塞满钱，然后还给了我。\n\n    He still stood behind his cash register stuffing his mouth with popcorn.\n\n    他仍站在收银机后，嘴里塞满了爆米花。\n\n    ...wallets stuffed with dollars.\n\n    装满美元的钱包\n\n4.VERB（使）吃撑；（使）吃足；（使）吃得过饱If you stuff yourself, you eat a lot of food. \n\n    I could stuff myself with ten chocolate bars and half an hour later eat a big meal.\n\n    我可以一口气吃10块巧克力，半小时后再吃一顿大餐。\n\nstuffed\n\n    But you're just so stuffed you won't be able to drink anything.\n\n    但你已经撑得什么也喝不下了。\n\n5.VERB给…装馅儿；给（鸡、辣椒等食物里）加填料If you stuff a bird such as a chicken or a vegetable such as a pepper, you put a mixture of food inside it before cooking it. \n\n    Will you stuff the turkey and shove it in the oven for me?\n\n    你能帮我给火鸡填上料然后放进烤箱里吗？\n\n    ...stuffed tomatoes.\n\n    酿西红柿\n\n6.VERB将（动物）制作成标本If a dead animal is stuffed, it is filled with a substance so that it can be preserved and displayed. \n\n    A pike weighing 29 lb 8 oz taken in 1878 was stuffed and is on display at the estate office...\n\n    一条 1878 年捕获的重 29 磅 8 盎司的梭子鱼被制成标本陈列在庄园管理处。\n\n    He didn't much care for the stuffed animal heads that hung on the walls.\n\n    他不是很喜欢墙上挂的那些动物头颅标本。\n\n7.N-SING基本特征；特质；根本；基础If you say that one thing is the stuff of another, you mean that the first thing is a very important feature or characteristic of the second thing, or that the second thing can be based or built on the first thing. \n\n    The idea that we can be whatever we want has become the stuff of television commercials.\n\n    每个人皆无所不能，这一理念已经成为电视广告的精髓。\n\n8.EXCLAM滚开；去你的；别烦我If you are angry with someone for something that they have said or done, you might say 'Get stuffed!' to them. \n\n9.VERB（用在名词前表示强调）不稀罕，不在乎Stuff is used in front of nouns to emphasize that you do not care about something, or do not want it. \n\n    Ultimately my attitude was: stuff them...\n\n    我最终的态度是：去他们的。\n\n    Stuff your money. We don't want a handout.\n\n    收起你的钱，我们不需要施舍。\n\n10.PHRASE露一手；施展自己的本事If you do your stuff, you perform an activity in the way that people expect. \n\n    Once I get on the pitch I know I can do my stuff...\n\n    我一上场就知道是我大显身手的时候了。\n\n    All that was left was to plant the roses and wait for nature to do her stuff.\n\n    剩下的就只是栽上玫瑰，然后等大自然施展她的神奇魔力。\n\n11.PHRASE很内行；精通；懂行If you say that someone knows their stuff, you mean that they are good at doing something because they know a lot about it. \n\n    These chaps know their stuff after seven years of war.\n\n    7年的战争过后，这些家伙都成了作战行家。
chef@n. 厨师,主厨1.N-COUNT（饭店、宾馆的）厨师A chef is a cook in a restaurant or hotel.
uneasy@adj. 不自在的, 心神不安的, 不稳定的, 不舒服的    1.ADJ-GRADED焦虑的；不安的；心神不定的；不自在的If you are uneasy, you feel anxious, afraid, or embarrassed, because you think that something is wrong or that there is danger.\n\n        He said nothing but gave me a sly grin that made me feel terribly uneasy...\n\n        他什么也没说，只是朝我狡黠地笑了笑，这让我感到极其不安。\n\n        He looked uneasy and refused to answer questions...\n\n        他看上去焦虑不安，拒绝回答问题。\n\n        I had an uneasy feeling that he was going to spoil it.\n\n        我有种不安的感觉，觉得他会把事情搞糟。\n\n    uneasily\n\n        Meg shifted uneasily on her chair... \n\n        梅格坐在椅子上焦躁不安地动来动去。\n\n        He laughed uneasily...\n\n        他局促不安地笑了。\n\n        'Well,' she said a little uneasily, 'what is it?'...\n\n        “噢，”她有些不自在地说道，“是什么？”\n\n    uneasiness\n\n        With a small degree of uneasiness, he pushed it open and stuck his head inside.\n\n        他略带不安地将它推开，把头探了进去。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED不确定的；无把握的If you are uneasy about doing something, you are not sure that it is correct or wise. \n\n        Richard was uneasy about how best to approach his elderly mother...\n\n        最好如何去跟年迈的母亲谈，理查德心里没有数。\n\n        Scientists feel uneasy about giving a positive answer.\n\n        科学家们觉得很难给出一个明确的答案。\n\n    uneasiness\n\n        I felt a great uneasiness about meeting her again.\n\n        想到要再次见到她，我感到极不自在。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED（局势或关系）不稳定的，动荡的If you describe a situation or relationship as uneasy, you mean that the situation is not settled and may not last. \n\n        An uneasy calm has settled over Los Angeles...\n\n        洛杉矶归于一种不稳定的平静之中。\n\n        The uneasy alliance between these two men offered a glimmer of hope...\n\n        两人之间不够稳固的联合给了人们一线希望。\n\n        There is an uneasy relationship between us and the politicians.\n\n        我们和那些政治家之间的关系很不稳固。\n\n    uneasily\n\n        Democracy and entrepreneurial flair often sit uneasily together...\n\n        民主与创业才干常常不能融洽地并存。\n\n        The people have always coexisted uneasily since their country came into being.\n\n        自从建国以来，人们一直都相处得不很融洽。\n\n        ...a country whose component parts fit uneasily together.\n\n        由各组成部分勉强拼凑在一起的国家\n    4.ADJ（书或音乐）难懂的，晦涩的If you describe a book or music as uneasy, you are critical of it because it is difficult to read or listen to. \n\n        'Rid Of Me' is harrowing, uneasy listening...\n\n        《弃我而去》这首歌非常伤感，听起来很晦涩。\n\n        This is an uneasy travel book.\n\n        这本旅游手册不是很好懂。\n\n        ...an uneasy mix of thudding bass, drums and screaming guitar.\n\n        沉闷的贝司声、鼓声和尖利的吉他声胡乱混杂在一起
preschool@adj. 未满学龄的, 就学前的\nn. 育幼院, 幼稚园    Pronounced /ˌpriː 'skuːl/ for meaning 1, and /'priː skuːl/ for meaning 2. 义项1读作 /ˌpriː 'skuːl/，义项2读作 /'priː skuːl/。\n    1.ADJ入学前的；学龄前的Pre-school is used to describe things relating to the care and education of children before they reach the age when they have to go to school. \n\n        Looking after pre-school children is very tiring...\n\n        照顾学龄前的孩子非常辛苦。\n\n        The Halsey Report emphasized the value of a pre-school education.\n\n        《哈尔西报告》强调了学前教育的重要性。\n    2.N-VAR（美国二至五六岁孩子的）学前班In the United States, a pre-school is a school for children between the ages of 2 and 5 or 6.\n\n        Children graduate to the kindergarten, then pre-school, and then school.\n\n        孩子们先上幼儿园，然后上学前班，再接着上小学。
acquisition@    1.N-VAR（对公司的）收购，并购If a company or business person makes an acquisition, they buy another company or part of a company. \n\n        ...the acquisition of a profitable paper recycling company.\n\n        对一家效益好的纸张回收公司的收购\n\n        ...the number of mergers and acquisitions made by Europe's 1,000 leading firms.\n\n        欧洲1，000家龙头企业的合并和收购案例的数目\n    2.N-COUNT购买；添置If you make an acquisition, you buy or obtain something, often to add to things that you already have. \n\n        How did you go about making this marvellous acquisition then?\n\n        那么你是怎么买到这一绝品的？\n\n        ...the President's recent acquisition of a helicopter.\n\n        总统最近添置的直升机\n    3.N-COUNT购得物；获得物；增添物You can use acquisition to refer to an object that you buy or obtain, often to add to things that you already have.\n\n        From her wardrobe Laura took her latest acquisition, a bright red dress.\n\n        劳拉从衣柜里拿出了她最近的购物战果，一件鲜红色连衣裙。\n    4.N-UNCOUNT（知识、技能等的）获得，习得The acquisition of a skill or a particular type of knowledge is the process of learning it or developing it. \n\n        ...language acquisition.\n\n        语言习得
ensure@    1.VERB保证；确保；担保To ensure something, or to ensure that something happens, means to make certain that it happens. \n\n        Britain's negotiators had ensured that the treaty which resulted was a significant change in direction...\n\n        英国谈判代表已经担保由此而签订的条约将是方向上的重大改变。\n\n        Ensure that it is written into your contract.\n\n        确保把这一点写入合同中。\n\n        ...the President's Council, which ensures the supremacy of the National Party.\n\n        保证国民党最高地位的总统咨询委员会
unveil@1.VERB为…揭幕If someone formally unveils something such as a new statue or painting, they draw back the curtain which is covering it. \n\n        ...a ceremony to unveil a monument to the victims.\n\n        死难者纪念碑揭幕仪式\n\n    unveiling\n\n        ...the unveiling of a monument to one of the Croatian heroes of the past.\n\n        为一座纪念碑举行的揭幕仪式，它的建成是为了纪念克罗地亚一位昔日的英雄\n    2.VERB公布；推出；出台If you unveil a plan, new product, or some other thing that has been kept secret, you introduce it to the public. \n\n        Mr Werner unveiled his new strategy this week...\n\n        沃纳先生本周公布了其新策略。\n\n        Companies from across Europe are here to unveil their latest models.\n\n        全欧洲的公司都来到这里展示其最新款产品。\n\n    unveiling\n\n        ...the unveiling of a detailed peace plan.\n\n        详细的和平计划的披露
whereby@    1.PRON-REL凭此；借以A system or action whereby something happens is one that makes that thing happen. \n\n        ...the system whereby Britons choose their family doctors and the government pays those doctors...\n\n        通过这个系统，英国人选择自己的家庭医生，而由政府给那些医生支付薪水\n\n        They voted to accept a deal whereby the union will receive nearly three-quarters of a million pounds from the International Miners Organisation.\n\n        他们表决同意了一项协议，根据这一协议工会将从国际矿工组织得到近75万英镑。
no holds barred@ 没有限制的
constraint@1.N-COUNT限制；束缚；约束A constraint is something that limits or controls what you can do. \n\n    Their decision to abandon the trip was made because of financial constraints...\n\n    他们决定放弃这次出游是因为财力有限。\n\n    Water shortages in the area will be the main constraint on development.\n\n    水资源匮乏将是制约该地区发展的一个主要因素。\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT克制Constraint is control over the way you behave which prevents you from doing what you want to do.
liberation@n. 解放，解放运动（为获得平等权利和地位的行为）    1.VERB解放To liberate a place or the people in it means to free them from the political or military control of another country, area, or group of people. \n\n        They planned to march on and liberate the city...\n\n        他们计划继续挺进，解放该城市。\n\n        They made a triumphal march into their liberated city.\n\n        他们胜利地开进了被他们解放的城市。\n\n    liberation\n\n        ...a mass liberation movement.\n\n        群众解放运动\n    2.VERB使解脱；使脱离；解救To liberate someone from something means to help them escape from it or overcome it, and lead a better way of life. \n\n        He asked how committed the leadership was to liberating its people from poverty.\n\n        他问领导层有多大决心要让人民脱贫。\n\n    liberating\n\n        If you have the chance to spill your problems out to a therapist it can be a very liberating experience.\n\n        如果能有机会向治疗师倾诉自己的烦恼，你将会体验到一种如释重负的解脱感。\n\n    liberation\n\n        ...the women's liberation movement.\n\n        妇女解放运动\n    3.VERB释放（囚犯）To liberate a prisoner means to set them free. \n\n        The government is devising a plan to liberate prisoners held in detention camps.\n\n        政府计划释放关押在拘留营内的囚犯。
ally@The noun is pronounced /'ælaɪ/. The verb is pronounced /ə'laɪ/. 名词读作/'ælaɪ/，动词读作/ə'laɪ/。\n1.N-COUNT（尤指战时的）同盟国A country's ally is another country that has an agreement to support it, especially in war. \n\n    Washington would not take such a step without its allies' approval...\n\n    没有盟国的同意，华盛顿将不会采取这样一种行动。\n\n    The United States is a close ally of South Korea.\n\n    美国是韩国的亲密盟友。\n\n2.N-PLURAL（第二次世界大战时的）同盟国The Allies were the armed forces that fought against Germany and Japan in the Second World War. \n\n3.N-COUNT盟友；支持者If you describe someone as your ally, you mean that they help and support you, especially when other people are opposing you. \n\n    He is a close ally of the Prime Minister...\n\n    他是首相的亲密支持者。\n\n    She will regret losing a close political ally.\n\n    她将为失去一个亲密的政治盟友而懊悔。\n\n4.VERB与…结盟；支持If you ally yourself with someone or something, you give your support to them. \n\n    He will have no choice but to ally himself with the new movement.\n\n    他除了与新运动结盟别无选择。
reenact@vt. 重新制定(再次扮演)    1.VERB再次展现；再现；重现If you re-enact a scene or incident, you repeat the actions that occurred in the scene or incident. \n\n        He re-enacted scenes from his TV series.\n\n        他再次表演了他在连续剧中的情节。
militarist@n. 军国主义者，军事家    1.N-COUNT军国主义者；穷兵黩武者If you describe someone as a militarist, you mean that they want their country's armed forces to be strengthened in order to make it more powerful. \n\n        They became overheated nationalists, militarists, and they were out to conquer.\n\n        他们变成了过分狂热的民族主义分子和军国主义分子，并想要征服别国。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED同 militaristicMilitarist means the same as militaristic . \n\n        ...militarist policies.\n\n        军国主义政策
fend@1.VERB照料，照顾（自己）If you have to fend for yourself, you have to look after yourself without relying on help from anyone else. \n\n    The woman and her young baby had been thrown out and left to fend for themselves.\n\n    这个女人和她年幼的婴儿被赶了出来，无人照管。\n\n2.PHRASAL VERB挡开，避开（问题或人）If you fend off unwanted questions, problems, or people, you stop them from affecting you or defend yourself from them, but often only for a short time and without dealing with them completely. \n\n    He looked relaxed and determined as he fended off questions from the world's Press...\n\n    他回避各国媒体的提问时显得轻松而果决。\n\n    He had struggled to pay off creditors but couldn't fend them off any longer.\n\n    他曾想方设法还债主的钱，但却再也躲不过他们了。\n\n3.PHRASAL VERB挡住，抵挡（攻击）If you fend off someone who is attacking you, you use your arms or something such as a stick to defend yourself from their blows. \n\n    He raised his hand to fend off the blow.\n\n    他抬起手来抵挡那一拳。
deploy@vt. &amp;vi. 展开,配置,部署    1.VERB部署，调集（部队或军事力量）To deploy troops or military resources means to organize or position them so that they are ready to be used. \n\n        The president said he had no intention of deploying ground troops.\n\n        总统称并不打算部署地面部队。\n\n        ...the US-made Patriot anti-missile system which was deployed in the Gulf war.\n\n        在海湾战争中部署的美国制造的“爱国者”反导弹系统
wage@n. 薪水,报偿,代价\nvt. &amp;vi. 开始,进行（战争、运动）    1.N-COUNT工资；工钱Someone's wages are the amount of money that is regularly paid to them for the work that they do.\n\n        His wages have gone up...\n\n        他涨工资了。\n\n        This may end efforts to set a minimum wage well above the poverty line.\n\n        这可能会使将最低工资定得远高于贫困线的努力告吹。\n    2.VERB开展，发动（运动或战争）If a person, group, or country wages a campaign or a war, they start it and continue it over a period of time. \n\n        ...the three factions that had been waging a civil war...\n\n        发动内战的三个派别\n\n        They waged a price war.\n\n        他们打起了价格战。\n    Usage Note:\n\n    When used as a noun, pay is a general word which you can use to refer to the money you get from your employer for doing your job. Manual workers are paid wages, or a wage. The plural is more common than the singular, especially when you are talking about the actual cash that someone receives. Every week he handed all his wages in cash to his wife. Wages are usually paid, and quoted, as an hourly or a weekly sum. ...a starting wage of five dollars an hour. Professional people and office workers receive a salary, which is paid monthly. However, when talking about someone's salary, you usually give the annual figure. I'm paid a salary of £15,000 a year. Your income consists of all the money you receive from all sources, including your pay.\n\n    pay 用作名词时，泛指从雇主处得到的工资或薪水。体力劳动者的工资通常用 wages 或 a wage表示，其中复数形式更为常见，尤其是表示实际拿到的现金时。例如，Every week he handed all his wages in cash to his wife （每周他都将自己领到的工资全部交给妻子）。wages 通常按小时或按周支付或计算：a starting wage of five dollars an hour （每小时5美元的起薪）。专业人士以及办公室职员的工资用 salary 表示，通常按月支付。但是在谈论某人的薪水时，通常用年薪来表示：I'm paid a salary of £； 15， 000 a year （我年薪为15， 000英镑）。 income 表示从各个来源获得的总收入，包括工资。
instantaneous@adj. 瞬间的, 即刻的\nadv. 瞬间, 霎时    1.ADJ-GRADED瞬间的；即刻的Something that is instantaneous happens immediately and very quickly.\n\n        Death was instantaneous because both bullets hit the heart.\n\n        因为两颗子弹都击中了心脏，所以死亡是瞬间发生的。\n\n    instantaneously\n\n        Airbags inflate instantaneously on impact.\n\n        安全气囊遇到撞击立即膨胀。
lob@    1.VERB（向高空）投，掷，扔If you lob something, you throw it so that it goes quite high in the air. \n\n        Enemy forces lobbed a series of artillery shells onto the city...\n\n        敌军对该城发起连串炮轰。\n\n        A group of protesters gathered outside, chanting and lobbing firebombs.\n\n        一群抗议人士聚集在外面，边喊口号边扔燃烧弹。\n    2.VERB把（球）挑（或吊）高In sport, if you lob the ball, you hit or kick it high into the air so that it lands behind your opponent. \n\n        Brown lobbed the ball over the Australian goalkeeper.\n\n        布朗把球挑过澳大利亚门将的头顶。\n\n        Lob is also a noun.\n\n            ...long, high lobs that fell precisely on the baseline.\n\n            刚好压在底线上的长距离挑高球
ideally@adv. 理想地, 完美地，观念上地    1.ADV作为理想的做法；合乎理想地If you say that ideally a particular thing should happen or be done, you mean that this is what you would like to happen or be done, but you know that this is may not be possible or practical. \n\n        People should, ideally, eat much less fat.\n\n        理想情况下，人们应食用比现在少得多的脂肪。\n    2.ADV最适合地；绝好地；完美地If you say that someone or something is ideally suited, ideally located, or ideally qualified, you mean that they are as well suited, located, or qualified as they could possibly be. \n\n        They were an extremely happy couple, ideally suited...\n\n        他们是极其幸福、无比般配的一对。\n\n        The hotel is ideally situated for country walks...\n\n        宾馆坐落的位置非常适合乡间散步。\n\n        The General is ideally qualified for the job.\n\n        这位将军最适合做这项工作。
obstacle@n. 障碍,绊脚石    1.N-COUNT障碍物An obstacle is an object that makes it difficult for you to go where you want to go, because it is in your way.\n\n        Most competition cars will only roll over if they hit an obstacle...\n\n        大多数赛车只有在撞上障碍物时才会翻车。\n\n        He left her to navigate her own way round the trolleys and other obstacles.\n\n        他扔下她一个人在一堆手推车和其他障碍物之间绕来绕去。\n    2.N-COUNT障碍；困难；阻碍You can refer to anything that makes it difficult for you to do something as an obstacle . \n\n        Overcrowding remains a large obstacle to improving conditions...\n\n        过分拥挤仍然是改善环境的一大障碍。\n\n        To succeed, you must learn to overcome obstacles.\n\n        必须学会克服困难才能成功。
reckless@   1.ADJ-GRADED轻率的；不计后果的；鲁莽的；无所顾忌的If you say that someone is reckless, you mean that they act in a way which shows that they do not care about danger or the effect their behaviour will have on other people.\n\n        She loved to ride; on horseback, she was reckless and utterly without fear...\n\n        她喜欢骑马；在马背上，她纵横驰骋，毫无畏惧。\n\n        He is charged with causing death by reckless driving.\n\n        他被控危险驾驶致人死亡。\n\n    recklessly\n\n        He was leaning recklessly out of the unshuttered window...\n\n        他冒冒失失地从没有遮拦的窗户探出身去。\n\n        A congressional report charges that federal safety laws were recklessly violated.\n\n        一份国会报告指责联邦安全法被公然违反。\n\n    recklessness\n\n        He felt a surge of recklessness...\n\n        他感觉到一阵不顾一切的冲动。\n\n        The headstrong recklessness of youth may be fine in some areas, but not behind the wheel of a car.\n\n        年轻人在一些方面任性鲁莽一点也许没什么大不了，但是在驾车时可不行。
offense@    The spelling offense is used in American English. The pronunciation /'ɒfens/ is used for meaning 3. 拼写offense用于美国英语中。义项3读作/'ɒfens/。\n    1.N-COUNT违法行为；罪行An offence is a crime that breaks a particular law and requires a particular punishment.\n\n        Thirteen people have been charged with treason — an offence which can carry the death penalty...\n\n        13人被控犯有叛国罪——一种可处死刑的罪行。\n\n        In Britain the Consumer Protection Act makes it a criminal offence to sell goods that are unsafe.\n\n        英国的《消费者保护法》规定销售不安全物品属刑事犯罪行为。\n    2.N-VAR冒犯；得罪Offence or an offence is behaviour which causes people to be upset or embarrassed.\n\n        The book might be published without creating offense...\n\n        出版这本书可能不会引起人们的反感。\n\n        Privilege determined by birth is an offence to any modern sense of justice.\n\n        与生俱来的特权是对现代公正意识的亵渎。\n    3.N-SING（体育运动中的）进攻队，进攻方In sports such as American football or basketball, the offense is the team which has possession of the ball and is trying to score. \n\n        Between plays the coach was talking to the offense in the huddle.\n\n        中场时，这位教练对围拢一圈的进攻队员进行战术指导。\n    4.PHRASE冒犯；得罪；惹恼If you cause offence or give offence to someone, you say or do something rude which upsets or embarrasses them. \n\n        It says the photograph is likely cause distress and offence to the public...\n\n        上面说这张照片可能引起公众的忧虑和反感。\n\n        We have had our differences and I'm sorry if it has caused offence.\n\n        我们有过一些分歧，如有得罪我很抱歉。\n    5.CONVENTION别见怪；无冒犯之意Some people say 'no offence' to make it clear that they do not want to upset you, although what they are saying may seem rather rude. \n\n        Dad, you need a bath. No offence.\n\n        爸爸，别见怪，不过你该洗澡了。\n    6.PHRASE（常指不必要地）（对…）生气，（因…）见怪If someone takes offence at something you say or do, they feel upset, often unnecessarily, because they think you are being rude to them. \n\n        She never takes offence at anything...\n\n        什么事都不会让她生气。\n\n        Never had she seen him so tense, so quick to take offence as he had been in recent weeks.\n\n        她从未见过他像最近几周这样高度紧张，动不动就生气。
boil down to@    1.PHRASAL VERB-ERG重点是；将…归结为If you say that a situation or problem boils down to a particular thing or can be boiled down to a particular thing, you mean that this is the most important or the most basic aspect of it. \n\n        What they want boils down to just one thing. It is land...\n\n        他们说穿了就是想要一样东西，那就是土地。\n\n        For Malcolm work could always be boiled down to one idea: being good in business.\n\n        对于马尔科姆来说，工作归根结底就是要取得好的业绩。
dab@1.VERB轻拍；轻触；轻拭；轻敷；轻涂If you dab something, you touch it several times using quick, light movements. If you dab a substance onto a surface, you put it there using quick, light movements. \n\n    She arrived weeping, dabbing her eyes with a tissue... \n\n    她来的时候一边哭着，一边用纸巾抹着眼泪。\n\n    She spread the icing over the cake, dabbing it with a knife...\n\n    她把糖霜浇在蛋糕上面，并用刀子轻轻涂抹开。\n\n    She dabbed iodine on the cuts on her forehead...\n\n    她把碘酒轻搽在前额的伤口上。\n\n2.N-COUNT（表面的）少量，少许，一点儿A dab of something is a small amount of it that is put onto a surface. \n\n    She wore no make-up, not even a dab of lipstick.\n\n    她没有化妆，甚至连一点儿口红都没涂。\n\n    ...a dab of glue.\n\n    点滴胶水\n\n3.N-VAR孙鲽；黄盖鲽A dab is a small flat fish with rough scales.
civilian@    1.N-COUNT平民；老百姓In a military situation, a civilian is anyone who is not a member of the armed forces.\n\n        The safety of civilians caught up in the fighting must be guaranteed.\n\n        必须保证陷入战斗中的平民的人身安全。\n    2.ADJ民用的；平民的；非军用的In a military situation, civilian is used to describe people or things that are not military. \n\n        ...the country's civilian population.\n\n        该国的平民人口\n\n        ...civilian casualties.\n\n        平民伤亡\n\n        ...a soldier in civilian clothes.\n\n        穿便装的士兵
recruit@1.VERB招收；招募；征召If you recruit people for an organization, you select them and persuade them to join it or work for it. \n\n    The police are trying to recruit more black and Asian officers...\n\n    警方正在试图招募更多黑人和亚裔警官。\n\n    In recruiting students to Computer Systems Engineering, the University looks for evidence of all-round ability...\n\n    在招收计算机系统工程专业的学生时，这个大学看重的是学生的综合能力。\n\n    He helped to recruit volunteers to go to Pakistan to fight.\n\n    他协助招募志愿者到巴基斯坦打仗。\n\nrecruiter\n\n    ...a Marine recruiter.\n\n    海军陆战队征兵人员\n\nrecruiting\n\n    A bomb exploded at an army recruiting office.\n\n    一颗炸弹在一个军队征兵办公室爆炸了。\n\n2.N-COUNT新手；新兵；新成员A recruit is a person who has recently joined an organization or an army.
elite@n. 精华, 精锐, 中坚份子    1.N-COUNT精英；杰出人物You can refer to the most powerful, rich, or talented people within a particular group, place, or society as the elite .\n\n        ...a government comprised mainly of the elite...\n\n        主要由精英组成的政府\n\n        We have a political elite in this country.\n\n        我们国家有一群政治精英。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED精英的；精锐的；最优秀的Elite people or organizations are considered to be the best of their kind. \n\n        ...the elite troops of the President's bodyguard.\n\n        精锐的总统卫队
handy@    1.ADJ-GRADED有用的；方便的Something that is handy is useful.\n\n        The book gives handy hints on looking after indoor plants...\n\n        这本书提供了一些关于如何照料室内花草的有用信息。\n\n        Credit cards can be handy — they mean you do not have to carry large sums of cash.\n\n        信用卡很方便，有了它你就不用携带大量现金了。\n    2.PHRASE派上用场If something comes in handy, it is useful in a particular situation. \n\n        That key will come in handy if you lock yourself out...\n\n        要是你把自己锁在了屋外，那把钥匙就派上用场了。\n\n        The $20 check came in very handy.\n\n        那张20美元的支票正好派上了用场。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED手边的；附近的A thing or place that is handy is nearby and therefore easy to get or reach. \n\n        It would be good to have a pencil and paper handy...\n\n        最好在手边准备好纸和笔。\n\n        Keep handy a lightweight sweater or cardigan...\n\n        手边备一件薄的套头毛衣或开襟毛衫。\n\n        This lively town is handy for Londoners.\n\n        这个热闹的小城离伦敦很近。\n    4.ADJ-GRADED手巧的；有手艺的Someone who is handy with a particular tool is skilful at using it. \n\n        If you're handy with a needle you could brighten up your sweater with daisies.\n\n        如果你针线活做得好，可以在自己的毛衣上绣几朵雏菊做点缀。
registration@n. 登记,注册,挂号    1.N-UNCOUNT注册；登记The registration of something such as a person's name or the details of an event is the recording of it in an official list. \n\n        They have campaigned strongly for compulsory registration of dogs...\n\n        他们强烈呼吁实行犬类强制登记。\n\n        With the high voter registration, many will be voting for the first time.\n\n        登记选民数量的上升意味着许多人将第一次参加投票。
experimental@    1.ADJ-GRADED试验性的Something that is experimental is new or uses new ideas or methods, and might be modified later if it is unsuccessful.\n\n        ...an experimental air conditioning system...\n\n        试验性的空调系统\n\n        He tends to write bizarre and highly experimental pieces of music...\n\n        他倾向于创作高度试验性而且风格奇异的音乐作品。\n\n        The technique is experimental, but the list of its practitioners is growing.\n\n        这种技术是试验性的，但是采用它的人正在增加。\n    2.ADJ实验的；用于实验的；根据实验的Experimental means using, used in, or resulting from scientific experiments. \n\n        ...the main techniques of experimental science.\n\n        实验科学的主要技术\n\n        ...the use of experimental animals...\n\n        实验动物的使用\n\n        We have experimental and observational evidence concerning things which happened before and after the origin of life.\n\n        有关生命起源前后发生了什么，我们通过实验和观察得出了一些证据。\n\n    experimentally\n\n        ...an ecology laboratory, where communities of species can be studied experimentally under controlled conditions.\n\n        能够在受控环境中对物种群落进行实验研究的生态实验室\n    3.ADJ（行动）试验性的，试探性的An experimental action is done in order to see what it is like, or what effects it has. \n\n        The British Sports Minister is reported to be ready to argue for an experimental lifting of the ban.\n\n        据报道，英国体育大臣准备争取试行取消那条禁令。\n\n    experimentally\n\n        This system is being tried out experimentally at many universities...\n\n        该系统正在很多大学试用。\n\n        Before opening the front door he lifted the cases experimentally.\n\n        在打开前门之前，他试探性地提起了那些箱子。
setup@    1.N-COUNT体制；组织方式；建制A particular set-up is a particular system or way of organizing something. \n\n        It appears to be an idyllic domestic set-up...\n\n        这似乎是一种田园诗般的家庭组成格局。\n\n        I gradually got rather disillusioned with the whole setup of the university.\n\n        渐渐地，我对大学的整个体制感到相当失望。\n    2.N-COUNT陷害；栽赃If you describe a situation as a set-up, you mean that people have planned it in order to deceive you or to make it look as if you have done something wrong. \n\n        He was asked to pick somebody up and bring them to a party, not realizing it was a setup.\n\n        有人让他开车去接几个人来参加聚会，他并没有意识到这是个陷阱。\n    3.N-SING（软件或硬件的）安装，设置The set-up of computer hardware or software is the process of installing it and making it ready to use. \n\n        The worst part of the set-up is the poor instruction manual...\n\n        安装时最糟糕就是操作指南讲述不够清楚。\n\n        ... the setup program.\n\n        安装程序
initiate@    The verb is pronounced /ɪ'nɪʃieɪt/. The noun is pronounced /ɪ'nɪʃiət/. 动词读作 /ɪ'nɪʃieɪt/。名词读作 /ɪ'nɪʃiət/。\n    1.VERB开始；创始；发起If you initiate something, you start it or cause it to happen. \n\n        They wanted to initiate a discussion on economics...\n\n        他们想启动一次经济学讨论。\n\n        The trip was initiated by the manager of the community centre.\n\n        这次旅行由社区活动中心的经理发起。\n    2.VERB使初步了解；向…传授基本技巧（或基础知识）If you initiate someone into something, you introduce them to a particular skill or type of knowledge and teach them about it. \n\n        He initiated her into the study of other cultures.\n\n        他将她领进了研究其他文化的大门。\n    3.VERB（通过仪式）接纳，使加入If someone is initiated into something such as a religion, secret society, or social group, they become a member of it by taking part in ceremonies at which they learn its special knowledge or customs. \n\n        In many societies, young people are formally initiated into their adult roles.\n\n        在很多社会里，年轻人经过正式仪式才算成年。\n\n        ...the ceremony that initiated members into the Order.\n\n        吸收成员加入会社的仪式\n    4.N-COUNT有初步知识的成员；新入会的人An initiate is a person who has been accepted as a member by a particular group or club and been taught its secrets and skills. \n\n        Chen was an initiate of a Chinese spiritual discipline.\n\n        陈是某个中国神学领域的新入门者。
formulate@vt. 规划；用公式表示；明确地表达    1.VERB规划；策划；构想If you formulate something such as a plan or proposal, you invent it, thinking about the details carefully. \n\n        Little by little, he formulated his plan for escape.\n\n        他一点一点地设计构思出了逃跑的方案。\n    2.VERB明确表达；系统阐述If you formulate a thought, opinion, or idea, you express it or describe it using particular words. \n\n        I was impressed by the way he could formulate his ideas.\n\n        他陈述观点的方式让我印象深刻。
upgrade@    The verb is pronounced /ʌp'greɪd/. The noun is pronounced /'ʌpgreɪd/. 动词读作/ʌp'greɪd/，名词读作/'ʌpgreɪd/。\n    1.VERB改良；更新；升级If equipment or services are upgraded, they are improved or made more efficient. \n\n        Helicopters have been upgraded and modernized...\n\n        直升机已经更新换代，装配了现代化设备。\n\n        Medical facilities are being reorganized and upgraded.\n\n        正在对医疗设施进行重组和升级。\n\n        ...upgraded catering facilities.\n\n        更新换代的餐饮设施\n\n        Upgrade is also a noun.\n\n            ...equipment which needs expensive upgrades.\n\n            更新费用高昂的设备\n\n            ...upgrades in the level of security.\n\n            安全级别的升级\n    2.VERB擢升；晋升；提升；提拔If someone is upgraded, their job or status is changed so that they become more important or receive more money. \n\n        He was upgraded to security guard.\n\n        他被擢升为保安。\n    3.VERB（使）升级到更高待遇；（使）升舱If you upgrade or are upgraded, you change something such as your air ticket or your hotel room to one that is more expensive. \n\n        You can upgrade from self-catering accommodation to a hotel.\n\n        您可以将自理膳食旅店升级为酒店。
synthesize@    in BRIT, also use 英国英语亦用 synthesise\n    1.VERB（通过化学或生物反应）合成To synthesize a substance means to produce it by means of chemical or biological reactions. \n\n        After extensive research, Albert Hoffman first succeeded in synthesizing the acid in 1938...\n\n        经过大量研究，艾伯特·霍夫曼于 1938 年首次成功合成了该酸性物质。\n\n        A vitamin is a chemical compound that cannot be synthesized by the human body.\n\n        维生素是一种人体无法合成的化合物。\n    2.VERB综合；把…合为一体If you synthesize different ideas, facts, or experiences, you combine them to form a single idea or impression. \n\n        The movement synthesised elements of modern art that hadn't been brought together before, such as Cubism and Surrealism.\n\n        该运动综合了立体派和超现实主义等以前从未同时出现过的现代艺术元素。
duration@    1.N-UNCOUNT（某事件或状态的）持续时间，期间The duration of an event or state is the time during which it happens or exists. \n\n        He was given the task of protecting her for the duration of the trial...\n\n        他的任务是在审讯期间保护她。\n\n        Courses are of two years' duration.\n\n        课程为期两年。\n    2.PHRASE直到…结束；在整个…期间If you say that something will happen for the duration, you mean that it will happen for as long as a particular situation continues. \n\n        His wounds knocked him out of combat for the duration.\n\n        他的伤病使他在整个期间都无法参赛。
icon@1.N-COUNT偶像；代表人物If you describe something or someone as an icon, you mean that they are important as a symbol of a particular thing. \n\n    Only Marilyn has proved as enduring a fashion icon.\n\n    只有玛丽莲是常青的时尚偶像。\n\n    ...Picasso and the other icons of modernism.\n\n    毕加索和现代主义的其他代表人物\n\n    ...the greatest icon of this century.\n\n    本世纪最伟大的偶像人物\n\n2.N-COUNT圣像（如基督、圣母马利亚等）An icon is a picture of Christ, his mother, or a saint painted on a wooden panel.\n\n3.N-COUNT图标An icon is a picture on a computer screen representing a particular computer function. If you want to use it, you move the cursor onto the icon using a mouse. 
regeneration@    1.VERB革新；使复兴；重建To regenerate something means to develop and improve it to make it more active, successful, or important, especially after a period when it has been getting worse. \n\n        The government will continue to try to regenerate inner city areas.\n\n        政府将继续努力重建内城地区。\n\n    regeneration\n\n        ...the physical and economic regeneration of the area.\n\n        这个地区面貌的改善和经济的复苏\n    2.V-ERG（使）（器官或肌体组织）再生；（使）再造If organs or tissues regenerate or if something regenerates them, they heal and grow again after they have been damaged. \n\n        Nerve cells have limited ability to regenerate if destroyed...\n\n        如果受到损伤，神经细胞再造的能力有限。\n\n        Newts can regenerate their limbs.\n\n        蝾螈的肢体可以再生。\n\n    regeneration\n\n        Vitamin B assists in red-blood-cell regeneration.\n\n        维生素B可以促进红细胞再生。
devastating@    1.ADJ-GRADED毁灭性的；极具破坏力的If you describe something as devastating, you are emphasizing that it is very harmful or damaging. \n\n        The city of Ormac took the full force of the winds and devastating floods...\n\n        奥马克城受到了狂风和灾难性洪水的猛烈袭击。\n\n        Affairs do have a devastating effect on marriages.\n\n        婚外情确实会对婚姻造成毁灭性的影响。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED令人极为震惊的；使人极度不安的；可怕的You can use devastating to emphasize that something is very shocking, upsetting, or terrible. \n\n        The diagnosis was devastating. She had cancer.\n\n        诊断结果令人震惊：她得了癌症。\n    3.ADJ极其引人注目的；令人印象深刻的You can use devastating to emphasize that something or someone is very impressive. \n\n        ...a devastating display of galloping and jumping...\n\n        令人难忘的骑马飞奔和跳跃表演\n\n        I was devastating, if I do say so myself.\n\n        如果让我来说的话，我真是棒极了。\n\n    devastatingly\n\n        Its advertising is devastatingly successful...\n\n        其广告大获成功。\n\n        She was charming and devastatingly beautiful too.\n\n        她魅力四射，美貌绝伦。
