destructive@    1.ADJ-GRADED破坏（性）的；毁灭（性）的Something that is destructive causes or is capable of causing great damage, harm, or injury.\n\n        ...the awesome destructive power of nuclear weapons...\n\n        核武器可怕的毁灭性力量\n\n        Guilt can be very destructive.\n\n        负疚感会具有很强的杀伤力。\n\n    destructiveness\n\n        ...the size of armies and the destructiveness of their weapons.\n\n        军队规模及其武器的杀伤力\n\n    destructively\n\n        Power can be used creatively or destructively.\n\n        权力可以得到创造性的运用，也可以带来毁灭性的结果。
diminish@    1.V-ERG（使）减小；（使）减弱；（使）降低When something diminishes, or when something diminishes it, it becomes reduced in size, importance, or intensity. \n\n        The threat of nuclear war has diminished... \n\n        核战争的威胁已经减小了。\n\n        Federalism is intended to diminish the power of the central state...\n\n        联邦制旨在削弱中央政府的权力。\n\n        Universities are facing grave problems because of diminishing resources...\n\n        由于资源的减少，大学正面临严峻的问题。\n    2.VERB贬低；轻视If you diminish someone or something, you talk about them or treat them in a way that makes them appear less important than they really are. \n\n        He never put her down or diminished her...\n\n        他从未奚落或贬低过她。\n\n        He could no longer cope; he relied on me, and felt diminished by it.\n\n        他再也无法承受，他依赖我，却因此觉得是受了轻贱。
capability@n. 能力,才能,性能,容量    1.N-VAR能力；素质If you have the capability or the capabilities to do something, you have the ability or the qualities that are necessary to do it. \n\n        People experience differences in physical and mental capability depending on the time of day...\n\n        在一天当中的不同时间，人的体力和脑力也会有所差异。\n\n        The standards set four years ago in Seoul will be far below the athletes' capabilities now.\n\n        4年前在首尔制定的标准将远远低于目前运动员的水平。\n    2.N-VAR（国家的）军事力量A country's military capability is its ability to fight in a war.→see usage note at:capacity \n\n        Their military capability has been reduced because their air force has proved not to be effective...\n\n        由于空军战斗力不够强大，他们的军事实力有所下降。\n\n        They have the capability to destroy the enemy in days rather than weeks.\n\n        他们有能力在几天内，而不是几个星期内消灭敌人。
activate@    1.VERB使运作；使起作用；激活If a device or process is activated, something causes it to start working. \n\n        Video cameras with night vision can be activated by movement.\n\n        带夜视镜的摄像机一有动静就会启动。\n\n        ...a voice-activated computer.\n\n        声控电脑\n\n    activation\n\n        A computer controls the activation of an air bag.\n\n        电脑控制着气囊的启动。
reload@    1.VERB再次给（枪）上膛；再装填If someone reloads a gun, they load it again by putting in more bullets or explosive. If you reload a container, you fill it again. \n\n        She reloaded the gun as quickly as she could...\n\n        她以最快的速度再次给枪装上子弹。\n\n        He reloaded and nodded to the gamekeeper.\n\n        他给枪重新装上子弹，然后朝猎场看守人点了点头。
line up@1.PHRASAL VERB-ERG（使）（某一批人）排成行；（使）列队If people line up or if you line them up, they move so that they are standing in a line. \n\n    The senior leaders lined up behind him in orderly rows... \n\n    高级将领整齐有序地在他身后站成几排。\n\n    The gym teachers lined us up against the cement walls...\n\n    体育老师让我们靠着水泥墙排好。\n\n    Four members of a family were lined up and shot...\n\n    一家的四名成员被排成一排枪杀了。\n\n2.PHRASAL VERB使（某一批物）排列成行If you line things up, you move them into a straight row. \n\n    I would line up my toys on this windowsill and play...\n\n    我会把玩具排在这个窗台上来玩。\n\n    He finished polishing the cocktail glasses and lined them up behind the bar.\n\n    他擦完了鸡尾酒杯，把它们成排摆放在吧台后面。\n\n3.PHRASAL VERB-RECIP-ERG（使）对齐If you line one thing up with another, or one thing lines up with another, the first thing is moved into its correct position in relation to the second. You can also say that two things line up, or are lined up. \n\n    You have to line the car up with the ones beside you... \n\n    你得把车子和旁边的车停齐。\n\n    Gas cookers are adjustable in height to line up with your kitchen work top...\n\n    燃气灶的高度可调整，使之与厨房操作台齐平。\n\n    Mahoney had lined up two of the crates...\n\n    马奥尼已经摆好了其中两个板条箱。\n\n4.PHRASAL VERB组织；邀集If you line up an event or activity, you arrange for it to happen. If you line someone up for an event or activity, you arrange for them to be available for that event or activity. \n\n    She lined up executives, politicians and educators to serve on the board of directors...\n\n    她邀请了高管、政坛人物和教育家加入董事会。\n\n    Bob Dylan is lining up a two-week UK tour for the New Year.\n\n    鲍勃·迪伦正在组织一个为期两周的英国新年巡回演唱会。\n\n5.PHRASAL VERB支持/反对If you line up with, behind, or alongside a person or group, you support them. If you line up against a person or group, you oppose them. \n\n    Some surprising names have lined up behind the idea...\n\n    有些出人意料的名人也在支持这个想法。\n\n    We Spaniards have lined up against each other all too often.\n\n    我们西班牙人太爱窝里斗了。
wind up@1.PHRASAL VERB完成；停止When you wind up an activity, you finish it or stop doing it. \n\n    The President is about to wind up his visit to Somalia...\n\n    总统即将结束对索马里的访问。\n\n    Winding up the debate, she said: 'It would immediately put up interest rates.'\n\n    她在结束辩论时说道：“这会立即抬高利率。”\n\n2.PHRASAL VERB关停，关闭（企业或其他组织）When someone winds up a business or other organization, they stop running it and close it down completely. \n\n    The Bank of England seems determined to wind up the company.\n\n    英格兰银行似乎决心要关闭这家公司。\n\n3.PHRASAL VERB最终沦落到；最终落得；（以…）告终If you wind up in a particular place, situation, or state, you are in it at the end of a series of actions, events, or experiences, even though you did not originally intend to be. \n\n    He could wind up in gaol...\n\n    他可能最后会进监狱。\n\n    Little did I know that I would actually wind up being on the staff...\n\n    我完全没有想到自己最后竟会在这里供职。\n\n    Both partners of the marriage wound up unhappy.\n\n    最后婚姻双方都不幸福。\n\n4.PHRASAL VERB摇上（车窗等）When you wind up something such as the window of a car, you make it move upwards by turning a handle. \n\n    He started winding the window up but I grabbed the door and opened it.\n\n    他开始摇上车窗，但我一把抓住并拉开了车门。\n\n5.PHRASAL VERB故意惹恼；挑衅If you wind someone up, you deliberately say things which annoy them. \n\n    This woman really wound me up. She kept talking over me.\n\n    这个女人真气死我了。她一直想要说服我。\n\n6.PHRASAL VERB骗；哄骗If you wind someone up, you say untrue things in order to trick them. \n\n    You're joking. Come on, you're winding me up.\n\n    你是开玩笑的。得了吧，你在骗我。
brand-new@    1.ADJ崭新的；簇新的A brand-new object is completely new.\n\n        Yesterday he went off to buy himself a brand-new car.\n\n        昨天他去给自己买了一辆崭新的小汽车。
await@    1.VERB等候；等待If you await someone or something, you wait for them. \n\n        Very little was said as we awaited the arrival of the chairman...\n\n        我们等候主席到来的时候都没怎么说话。\n\n        He's awaiting trial, which is expected to begin early next year.\n\n        他在等候审判，预计明年初开始。\n    2.VERB即将发生于；将降临到…身上Something that awaits you is going to happen or come to you in the future. \n\n        A nasty surprise awaited them in Rosemary Lane.\n\n        在罗斯玛丽巷，一起严重的意外事件正等待着他们。
bachelor@n. 单身汉, 学士1.N-COUNT未婚男子；单身汉A bachelor is a man who has never married.
sin@\n\n    1.N-VAR罪；罪过；罪孽Sin or a sin is an action or type of behaviour which is believed to break the laws of God.\n\n        The Vatican's teaching on abortion is clear: it is a sin...\n\n        罗马教廷对堕胎的教义非常清楚：这是罪过。\n\n        Was it the sin of pride to have believed too much in themselves?\n\n        他们过分自信，这是否犯了骄纵之罪？\n    2.See also: cardinal sin；mortal sin；\n    3.VERB犯戒律；犯过失If you sin, you do something that is believed to break the laws of God. \n\n        The Spanish Inquisition charged him with sinning against God and man...\n\n        西班牙宗教法庭指控他亵渎上帝和人类。\n\n        You have sinned and must repent your ways.\n\n        你犯了罪，必须为你的所作所为作出忏悔。\n\n    sinner\n\n        I am a sinner and I need to repent of my sins.\n\n        我是个罪人，必须忏悔我的罪过。\n    4.N-COUNT罪恶；恶行；不道德的行为A sin is any action or behaviour that people disapprove of or consider morally wrong.\n\n        ...the sin of arrogant hard-heartedness...\n\n        傲慢无情的恶行\n\n        The ultimate sin was not infidelity, but public mention which led to scandal.\n\n        最大的罪过不是通奸而是公众议论，是它导致了丑闻的发生。\n    5.PHRASE同居If you say that a man and a woman are living in sin, you mean that they are living together as a couple although they are not married. \n\n        She was living in sin with her boyfriend.\n\n        她和男友同居。
intention@    1.N-VAR意图；目的；打算An intention is an idea or plan of what you are going to do. \n\n        Beveridge announced his intention of standing for parliament...\n\n        贝弗里奇宣布他打算竞选议员。\n\n        It is my intention to remain in my position until a successor is elected...\n\n        我的打算是继续呆在岗位上，直到选出继任者。\n\n        Unfortunately, his good intentions never seemed to last long.\n\n        不幸的是，他的善意似乎从来就没有持久过。\n    2.PHRASE不想/很想；不打算/一心打算If you say that you have no intention of doing something, you are emphasizing that you are not going to do it. If you say that you have every intention of doing something, you are emphasizing that you intend to do it. \n\n        We have no intention of buying American jets...\n\n        我们无意购买美国喷气式飞机。\n\n        Those close to him are convinced that he has every intention of staying on until the end of his seven-year term.\n\n        他身边的人都确信他打算继续留任，直到 7 年任期期满。
collide@    1.V-RECIP碰撞；相撞；撞上If two or more moving people or objects collide, they crash into one another. If a moving person or object collides with a person or object that is not moving, they crash into them. \n\n        Two trains collided head-on in north-eastern Germany early this morning...\n\n        今天早上德国东北部两列火车迎面相撞。\n\n        Racing up the stairs, he almost collided with Daisy...\n\n        他飞奔上楼，差点撞到黛西。\n\n        He collided with a pine tree near the North Gate.\n\n        他撞到了北门旁边的一棵松树上。\n    2.V-RECIP（目标、意见等）冲突，抵触If the aims, opinions, or interests of one person or group collide with those of another person or group, they are very different from each other and are therefore opposed. \n\n        The aims of the negotiators in New York again seem likely to collide with the aims of the warriors in the field...\n\n        看来，纽约谈判人员的目标可能会再次与战场上勇士们的目标发生冲突。\n\n        In the next two years, Nasser regularly collided with the different Western powers, who refused to arm him...\n\n        随后的两年里，纳赛尔不断与拒绝为他提供武器装备的几个西方大国发生冲突。\n\n        What happens when the two interests collide will make a fascinating spectacle.\n\n        两种利益发生冲突时将会上演一场好戏。
deterioration@n. 恶化,降低,退化    1.VERB恶化；变坏；衰退If something deteriorates, it becomes worse in some way. \n\n        There are fears that the situation might deteriorate into full-scale war...\n\n        人们担心形势可能恶化而演变成一场全面战争。\n\n        The weather conditions are deteriorating...\n\n        天气变得越来越糟。\n\n        Grant's health steadily deteriorated.\n\n        格兰特的健康状况持续恶化。\n\n    deterioration\n\n        ...concern about the rapid deterioration in relations between the two countries.\n\n        对两国关系迅速恶化的担忧\n\n        ...the slow steady deterioration of a patient with Alzheimer's disease.\n\n        一名阿尔茨海默病患者病情的持续缓慢恶化
sole@1.ADJ唯一的；仅有的The sole thing or person of a particular type is the only one of that type. \n\n    Their sole aim is to destabilize the Indian government.\n\n    他们唯一的目的就是要动摇印度政府的统治。\n\n2.ADJ（控制权或所有权）唯一的，独占的If you have sole charge or ownership of something, you are the only person in charge of it or who owns it. \n\n    Many women are left as the sole providers in families after their husband has died...\n\n    许多女人在丈夫去世之后只好独自供养一家人。\n\n    Chief Hart had sole control over that fund.\n\n    哈特主任独自掌控那笔资金。\n\n3.N-COUNT脚掌；鞋底；袜底The sole of your foot or of a shoe or sock is the underneath surface of it. \n\n    ...shoes with rubber soles...\n\n    橡胶底的鞋子\n\n    He had burned the sole of his foot.\n\n    他的一只脚脚底被灼伤了。\n\n4.N-COUNT鲽鱼；板鱼A sole is a kind of flat fish that you can eat.
descendant@ 1.N-COUNT后代；后裔；子孙Someone's descendants are the people in later generations who are related to them. \n\n        They are descendants of the original English and Scottish settlers.\n\n        他们是最初的英格兰和苏格兰定居者的后代。\n\n        ...Lord Cochrane and his descendants.\n\n        科克伦勋爵及其后裔\n    2.N-COUNT派生物；衍生物；后代产物Something modern which developed from an older thing can be called a descendant of it. \n\n        His design was a descendant of a 1956 device...\n\n        他的设计是从一个 1956 年的装置衍生而来的。\n\n        They are the descendants of plants imported by the early settlers.\n\n        它们是早期移民带来的一些植物的后代。
ultimately@    1.ADV最终；最后；终于Ultimately means finally, after a long and often complicated series of events. \n\n        Whatever the scientists ultimately conclude, all of their data will immediately be disputed.\n\n        不管科学家们最后得出什么样的结论，他们的全部数据将会立即引起争议。\n\n        ...a tough but ultimately worthwhile struggle.\n\n        艰苦卓绝但最终还是值得的一次抗争\n    2.ADV根本上；归根结底You use ultimately to indicate that what you are saying is the most important point in a discussion. \n\n        Ultimately, Bismarck's revisionism scarcely affected or damaged British interests at all.\n\n        从根本上说，俾斯麦的修正主义几乎未对英国的利益造成一丝一毫的影响或损害。
unfold@    1.VERB展现；呈现；逐渐明朗If a situation unfolds, it develops and becomes known or understood. \n\n        The outcome depends on conditions as well as how events unfold...\n\n        结果取决于条件，还取决于事件的进展。\n\n        The facts started to unfold before them.\n\n        真相开始在他们面前显露出来。\n    2.V-ERG（故事）展开；讲述If a story unfolds or if someone unfolds it, it is told to someone else. \n\n        Don's story unfolded as the cruise got under way...\n\n        随着航行的开始，唐的故事也随之展开。\n\n        Mr Wills unfolds his story with evident enjoyment.\n\n        威尔斯先生喜形于色地讲述自己的经历。\n    3.V-ERG展开；打开；伸展If someone unfolds something which has been folded or if it unfolds, it is opened out and becomes flat. \n\n        He quickly unfolded the blankets and spread them on the mattress...\n\n        他迅速展开毯子，铺在床垫上。\n\n        When the bird lifts off into flight, its wings unfold to an impressive six-foot span.\n\n        这种鸟起飞时，翼展可达6英尺，很惊人。
vow@    1.VERB发誓；起誓；立誓If you vow to do something, you make a serious promise or decision that you will do it. \n\n        While many models vow to go back to college, few do... \n\n        很多模特发誓要重回大学校园，但很少有人做到。\n\n        I solemnly vowed that someday I would return to live in Europe...\n\n        我郑重发誓，总有一天我将回到欧洲生活。\n\n        'I'll kill him,' she vowed...\n\n        “我要宰了他，”她发誓说。\n    2.N-COUNT誓言；诺言A vow is a serious promise or decision to do a particular thing. \n\n        I made a silent vow to be more careful in the future...\n\n        我暗暗发誓，日后要倍加小心。\n\n        I had to admire David's vow that he would leave the programme.\n\n        戴维发誓要离开这个项目，我不得不对他表示钦佩。\n    3.N-COUNT誓词；誓约；宣言Vows are a particular set of serious promises, such as the promises two people make when they are getting married. \n\n        I took my marriage vows and kept them.\n\n        我结婚时许下誓言，并一直信守。\n\n        ...a nun who had taken final vows...\n\n        已立誓出家的尼姑\n\n        He had broken his vow of poverty.\n\n        他违背了他安贫乐道的誓言。
pertain@    1.VERB与…相关；属于；适用（于）If one thing pertains to another, it relates, belongs, or applies to it. \n\n        The restrictions he imposed pertained to the type and height of buildings and the activities for which they could be used...\n\n        他限制的是建筑物的种类和高度以及它们的用途。\n\n        I would much rather that you asked Mrs Zuckerman any questions pertaining to herself.\n\n        我宁愿你问楚克尔曼夫人的是与她本人相关的问题。\n\n        ...matters pertaining to naval district defense.\n\n        有关海防区防御的问题
immense@adj. 巨大的,广大的,非常好的    1.ADJ-GRADED广大的；巨大的If you describe something as immense, you mean that it is extremely large or great. \n\n        ...an immense cloud of smoke...\n\n        大片的烟云\n\n        With immense relief I stopped running.\n\n        我长长地松了一口气，停止了奔跑。\n\n    immensity\n\n        The immensity of the universe is difficult to grasp.\n\n        宇宙的浩瀚难以捉摸。
discredit@    1.VERB败坏…的名声；使丧失信誉；使丢脸To discredit someone or something means to cause them to lose people's respect or trust. \n\n        ...a secret unit within the company that had been set up to discredit its major rival...\n\n        公司里设立的败坏其主要竞争对手名声的秘密部门\n\n        He says his accusers are trying to discredit government foreign-aid policies...\n\n        他说他的责难者试图使政府的对外援助政策名声扫地。\n\n        He said such methods would discredit the party worldwide.\n\n        他说这一举措会让该政党在全世界名誉扫地。\n\n    discredited\n\n        The previous government is, by now, thoroughly discredited.\n\n        现在前任政府已经名声扫地。\n\n        ...the old, discredited regimes.\n\n        过时的、名声不好的政治制度\n    2.VERB使不可信；证实…是假的To discredit an idea or evidence means to make it appear false or not certain. \n\n        They realized there would be difficulties in discrediting the evidence.\n\n        他们意识到要揭穿这个证据困难重重。
feasibility@n.可行性；可能性；现实性1.ADJ-GRADED可行的；行得通的；做得到的If something is feasible, it can be done, made, or achieved. \n\n        She questioned whether it was feasible to stimulate investment in these regions...\n\n        她对在这些地区刺激投资是否可行表示怀疑。\n\n        That may be fine for the US, but it's not feasible for a mass European market.\n\n        那也许适合美国，但对于庞大的欧洲市场却并不可行。\n\n    feasibility\n\n        The committee will study the feasibility of setting up a national computer network.\n\n        委员会将研究建立国家计算机网络的可行性。
preoccupy@vt. 先占, 使专注于, 迷住    1.VERB使全神贯注；使入神；占据…的思想If something is preoccupying you, you are thinking about it a lot. \n\n        Crime and the fear of crime preoccupy the community.\n\n        犯罪和对犯罪的恐惧一直困扰着这个社区。\n\n        ...the particular issues, problems and theories that preoccupied him.\n\n        萦绕在他心头的那些议题、问题和理论
funeral@    1.N-COUNT葬礼；丧礼A funeral is the ceremony that is held when the body of someone who has died is buried or cremated.\n\n        His funeral will be on Thursday at Blackburn Cathedral...\n\n        他的葬礼将于星期四在布莱克本大教堂举行。\n\n        He was given a state funeral.\n\n        为他举行了国葬。\n    2.PHRASE这是你自作自受；那你可要倒霉了If someone says to you 'It's your funeral', they think your decision or your actions will have bad consequences for you, but they are unwilling to interfere. \n\n        None of my business, I guess. It's your funeral.\n\n        我想是不关我什么事儿，你就自寻死路吧。
sneak@vt. 偷偷摸摸做\nvi. 偷偷地走,偷偷地做\nn. 鬼鬼祟祟的人,潜行,溜\nadj.暗中进行的,出其不意的The form snuck is also used in American English for the past tense and past participle. 在美国英语里 snuck 也用作过去式和过去分词。\n1.VERB潜行；偷偷地走If you sneak somewhere, you go there very quietly on foot, trying to avoid being seen or heard. \n\n    Sometimes he would sneak out of his house late at night to be with me...\n\n    有时候，他会在深夜里偷偷溜出家与我相会。\n\n    Don't sneak away and hide.\n\n    别溜走藏起来。\n\n2.VERB偷带；私运If you sneak something somewhere, you take it there secretly. \n\n    He smuggled papers out each day, photocopied them, and snuck them back...\n\n    他每天都把文件偷偷地带出去复印，然后再偷偷地拿回来。\n\n    You even snuck me a cigarette.\n\n    你居然偷偷塞给我一支烟。\n\n3.VERB偷（看）If you sneak a look at someone or something, you secretly have a quick look at them. \n\n    You sneak a look at your watch to see how long you've got to wait.\n\n    你偷偷地望一眼手表，看看要等多长时间。
symptom@    1.N-COUNT症状A symptom of an illness is something wrong with your body or mind that is a sign of the illness.\n\n        One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.\n\n        精神分裂症的最常见的一个症状就是幻听。\n\n        ...patients with flu symptoms...\n\n        有流感症状的病人\n\n        If the symptoms persist, it is important to go to your doctor.\n\n        如果这些症状持续存在，一定要去看医生。\n    2.N-COUNT征候；征兆A symptom of a bad situation is something that happens which is considered to be a sign of this situation. \n\n        Your problem with keeping boyfriends is just a symptom of a larger problem: making and keeping friends...\n\n        你在维系同男友的关系时遭遇的困难暴露了一个更大的问题：如何结交朋友和维持友谊。\n\n        The contradictory statements are symptoms of disarray in the administration.\n\n        这些互相矛盾的说法反映了管理的混乱。
outline@    1.VERB概述；概括If you outline an idea or a plan, you explain it in a general way. \n\n        The mayor outlined his plan to clean up the town's image...\n\n        市长概述了他整顿市容的计划。\n\n        The methods outlined in this book are only suggestions.\n\n        本书概括的一些方法仅供参考。\n    2.N-COUNT概要；梗概An outline is a general explanation or description of something. \n\n        Following is an outline of the survey findings...\n\n        以下是调查结果概要。\n\n        The proposals were given in outline by the Secretary of State.\n\n        国务卿对提议进行了简要的概述。\n    3.V-PASSIVE（因背后的光线）显示…的轮廓（或外形）You say that an object is outlined when you can see its general shape because there is light behind it. \n\n        The Ritz was outlined against the lights up there...\n\n        高悬的灯光映照出里兹饭店的轮廓。\n\n        It was a beautiful sight outlined above the starry sky.\n\n        星空之上映衬出美景。\n    4.N-COUNT（尤指模糊的）轮廓，外形The outline of something is its general shape, especially when it cannot be clearly seen. \n\n        He could see only the hazy outline of the goalposts.\n\n        他只能看见球门柱模糊的轮廓。
fatality@    1.N-COUNT（事故或暴力导致的）死亡A fatality is a death caused by an accident or by violence. \n\n        Drunk driving fatalities have declined more than 10 percent over the past 10 years.\n\n        酒后驾车死亡人数在过去 10 年中下降了 10%以上。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT宿命感；宿命论Fatality is the feeling or belief that human beings cannot influence or control events.\n\n        ...with a feeling of fatality.\n\n        怀着宿命感
postscript@    1.N-COUNT（信末署名后的）附笔，附言，又及A postscript is something written at the end of a letter after you have signed your name. You usually write 'PS' in front of it.\n\n        A brief, handwritten postscript lay beneath his signature.\n\n        在他的签名下，有一句简短的手写附言。\n    2.N-COUNT（加在故事、记述、声明末尾的）附言，补充说明；补编；跋A postscript is an addition to a finished story, account, or statement, which gives further information. \n\n        As the editor's postscript reminds the reader, she was to endure two more spells of mental illness before the book was published...\n\n        正如编辑在附言中提醒读者的那样，她在本书出版前还要再经历两次精神疾病发作的折磨。\n\n        I should like to add a postscript to your obituary for John Cage.\n\n        我想在你为约翰·凯奇写的讣告后补充一点内容。
decline@    1.VERB下降；减少；衰退；衰落If something declines, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or strength. \n\n        The number of staff has declined from 217,000 to 114,000... \n\n        员工人数从 21。7万减少到了11。4万。\n\n        Hourly output by workers declined 1.3% in the first quarter...\n\n        第一季度工人每小时的产量下降了 1。3%。\n\n        Union membership and union power are declining fast.\n\n        工会的人数和力量都在迅速萎缩。\n    2.VERB婉拒；谢绝If you decline something or decline to do something, you politely refuse to accept it or do it. \n\n        He declined their invitation...\n\n        他谢绝了他们的邀请。\n\n        The band declined to comment on the story...\n\n        乐队拒绝对这一报道作任何评论。\n\n        He offered the boys some coffee. They declined politely.\n\n        他问那些小伙子要不要来点咖啡，他们婉辞了。\n    3.N-VAR下降；减少；衰退；衰落If there is a decline in something, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or quality. \n\n        There wasn't such a big decline in enrollments after all...\n\n        注册人数终究还是没有出现如此大幅度的下降。\n\n        ...Rome's decline in the fifth century...\n\n        公元5世纪时罗马的衰落\n\n        The first signs of economic decline became visible.\n\n        经济衰退的最初迹象开始显现出来。\n    4.PHRASE逐渐势微；正在衰退If something is in decline or on the decline, it is gradually decreasing in importance, quality, or power. \n\n        Thankfully the smoking of cigarettes is on the decline...\n\n        令人欣慰的是，吸烟量在逐渐下降。\n\n        He is still one of the world's most popular golfers, but his game is in decline.\n\n        他仍是世界上最受欢迎的高尔夫球选手之一，但他的球技日不如前。\n    5.PHRASE走下坡路；开始衰退If something goes or falls into decline, it begins to gradually decrease in importance, quality, or power.\n\n        Libraries are an investment for the future and they should not be allowed to fall into decline.\n\n        图书馆是对未来的一项投资，不应任其日趋萎缩。
sprout@    1.VERB（植物、蔬菜、种子）发芽，抽芽，长芽When plants, vegetables, or seeds sprout, they produce new shoots or leaves. \n\n        It only takes a few days for beans to sprout.\n\n        豆子只要几天就能发芽。\n    2.VERB（叶子、芽或植株）生长When leaves, shoots, or plants sprout somewhere, they grow there. \n\n        Leaf-shoots were beginning to sprout on the hawthorn...\n\n        山楂树上开始长出叶芽。\n\n        Birch trees sprouted from the rubble and grew into a dense young wood.\n\n        桦树从瓦砾中长出来，形成了一片茂密的新林。\n    3.VERB使生长If a garden or other area of land sprouts plants, they start to grow there. \n\n        ...the garden, which had had time to sprout a shocking collection of weeds.\n\n        久而久之便野草丛生的花园\n    4.VERB（出于食用目的）使（豆子、种子等）发芽If you sprout beans or seeds, you make them grow small shoots before eating them. You usually do this by soaking them in water. \n\n        When you sprout seeds their nutritional content increases...\n\n        让种子发芽后，其营养含量会提高。\n\n        Sprouted beans only need to be cooked for 1-2 minutes.\n\n        豆芽只需烹炒一到两分钟。\n    5.V-ERG（毛发等）生长，长出If something such as hair sprouts from a person or animal, or if they sprout it, it grows on them. \n\n        She is very old now, with little, round, wire-rimmed glasses and whiskers sprouting from her chin...\n\n        她现在很老了，戴着圆圆的金属架小眼镜，下巴上还长出了胡须。\n\n        As well as sprouting a few grey hairs, Kevin seems to be suffering the occasional memory loss.\n\n        除长出了些许白发外，凯文似乎还患上了间歇性失忆。\n    6.V-ERG大量涌现；迅猛发展If a large number of things have appeared or developed somewhere, you can say that they have sprouted there or that the place has sprouted them. \n\n        More than a million satellite dishes have sprouted on homes across the country...\n\n        100 多万个卫星接收器迅速出现在了全国各地的家庭用户中。\n\n        Since its first shop was opened in 1976, it has sprouted outlets in 39 countries.\n\n        自从 1976 年开设第一家店以来，它已经在 39 个国家里开设了大量分店。\n    7.N-COUNT抱子甘蓝；球芽甘蓝Sprouts are vegetables that look like tiny cabbages. They are also called brussels sprouts . \n    8.N-COUNT新芽；子苗；嫩枝Sprouts are new shoots on plants. \n\n        After eleven days of growth the number of sprouts was counted.\n\n        经过11天的生长后，对新芽的数量进行了计数。
optimistic@    1.ADJ-GRADED乐观的Someone who is optimistic is hopeful about the future or the success of something in particular. \n\n        The President says she is optimistic that an agreement can be worked out soon...\n\n        总统说她对很快达成协议持乐观态度。\n\n        Michael was in a jovial and optimistic mood.\n\n        迈克尔情绪愉快乐观。\n\n    optimistically\n\n        Both sides have spoken optimistically about the talks.\n\n        双方都对会谈表示乐观。
deplete@    1.VERB（大量）减少，消耗To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it. \n\n        ...substances that deplete the ozone layer...\n\n        大量消耗臭氧层的物质\n\n        They fired in long bursts, which depleted their ammunition...\n\n        他们长时间开火，耗尽了弹药。\n\n        Most native mammal species have been severely depleted.\n\n        大多数本地哺乳动物的数量都已经大大减少了。\n\n    depleted\n\n        ...Robert E. Lee's worn and depleted army.\n\n        罗伯特·E。 李率领的疲惫不堪、所剩无几的部队\n\n    depletion\n\n        ...the problem of ozone depletion.\n\n        臭氧损耗问题\n\n        ...the depletion of underground water supplies.\n\n        地下水源的枯竭
scrape@1.VERB（尤指用锋利物）刮落，削掉，擦掉If you scrape something from a surface, you remove it, especially by pulling a sharp object over the surface. \n\n    She went round the car scraping the frost off the windows...\n\n    她把结霜的车窗挨个儿擦干净。\n\n    Young children were trying to scrape up some of the rice that spilled from the sacks.\n\n    小孩子们正试图铲起从麻袋中散落的米粒儿。\n\n2.V-ERG摩擦使发出刺耳声；擦伤；蹭破If something scrapes against something else or if someone or something scrapes something else, it rubs against it, making a noise or causing slight damage. \n\n    The only sound is that of knives and forks scraping against china... \n\n    只听见刀叉摩擦瓷器的刺耳声。\n\n    The cab driver struggled with her luggage, scraping a bag against the door as they came in...\n\n    出租车司机费力地拿着她的行李，进门时把一个包剐破了。\n\n    The car hurtled past us, scraping the wall and screeching to a halt...\n\n    汽车从我们身边疾驰而过，蹭到墙壁上然后戛然刹住。\n\n    Scrape is also a noun.\n\n        From the other side of the door came the scrape of a guard's boot.\n\n        从门的另一侧传来了保安嚓嚓的马靴声。\n\nscraping\n\n    The house was silent but for the scraping of a branch on the slates.\n\n    这所房子寂静无声，只听见树枝刮擦着石板瓦吱吱作响。\n\n3.VERB擦伤，刮破（身体部位）If you scrape a part of your body, you accidentally rub it against something hard and rough, and damage it slightly. \n\n    She stumbled and fell, scraping her palms and knees.\n\n    她绊了一下摔倒了，手掌和膝盖都蹭破了。\n\n4.N-COUNT（自己导致的）窘境，困境If you are in a scrape, you are in a difficult situation which you have caused yourself. \n\n    We got into terrible scrapes.\n\n    我们走投无路。
scrape together@费力地获得    1.PHRASAL VERB（艰难地）凑齐，筹集If you scrape together an amount of money or a number of things, you succeed in obtaining it with difficulty. \n\n        They only just managed to scrape the money together...\n\n        他们只是勉强凑够了钱。\n\n        It's possible the Congress Party will scrape together a majority.\n\n        国大党可能会勉强获得多数票。
infer@    1.VERB推断；推定If you infer that something is the case, you decide that it is true on the basis of information that you already have. \n\n        I inferred from what she said that you have not been well...\n\n        我从她的话语里推断你身体一直不太好。\n\n        By measuring the motion of the galaxies in a cluster, astronomers can infer the cluster's mass.\n\n        通过测量星系在一个星系团内的运动，天文学家们可以推定这个星系团的质量。\n    2.VERB暗示，暗指，意味着（许多人认为此用法不正确）Some people use infer to mean 'imply', but many people consider this use to be incorrect. \n\n        The police inferred that they found her behaviour rather suspicious.\n\n        警方暗示他们发现她行为非常可疑。\n    Usage Note:\n\n    Do not confuse infer and imply. If you infer that something is the case, you decide that it must be the case because of what you know, but without actually being told. From this simple statement I could infer a lot about his wife. If you imply that something is the case, you suggest that it is the case without actually saying so. Rose's barrister implied that he had married her for her money.\n\n    不要混淆 infer 与 imply。infer 表示在没有被明确告知的情况下，根据已知信息推断某事是事实。例如，From this simple statement I could infer a lot about his wife （从这句简单的话我能够推断出关于他妻子的很多情况）。imply 指不加以明说，但通过暗示表明某事的事实。例如，Rose's barrister implied that he had married her for her money （罗斯的律师暗示他是为了她的钱才娶了她）。
circulate@    1.V-ERG（文章等）传递，传阅，散发If a piece of writing circulates or is circulated, copies of it are passed round among a group of people. \n\n        The document was previously circulated in New York at the United Nations...\n\n        这份文件先前在纽约的联合国总部传阅过。\n\n        Public employees, teachers and liberals are circulating a petition for his recall...\n\n        公务员、教师和自由派人士正在散发请愿书，要求将他召回。\n\n        An e-mail is already circulating amongst news staff calling for voluntary redundancies.\n\n        在新闻部员工中已经在转发一封电子邮件，呼吁大家自愿裁汰。\n\n    circulation\n\n        ...an inquiry into the circulation of 'unacceptable literature'.\n\n        对“不良文学作品”的流传进行的调查\n    2.V-ERG（谣言等）流传；散布If something such as a rumour circulates or is circulated, the people in a place tell it to each other. \n\n        Rumours were already beginning to circulate that the project might have to be abandoned...\n\n        已传出谣言说，该项目可能会被迫取消。\n\n        I deeply resented those sort of rumours being circulated at a time of deeply personal grief.\n\n        我特别憎恨那种在人家伤心透顶的时候还在传播的谣言。\n    3.VERB（在密闭场所或系统内）循环，流转，传播When something circulates, it moves easily and freely within a closed place or system. \n\n        ...a virus which circulates via the bloodstream and causes ill health in a variety of organs...\n\n        通过血液循环传播、造成多种器官病变的病毒\n\n        Cooking odors can circulate throughout the entire house.\n\n        做饭的香味可以传到家里的各个角落。\n\n    circulation\n\n        The north pole is warmer than the south and the circulation of air around it is less well contained.\n\n        北极比南极温度高，周围的空气流动也更为顺畅。\n\n        ...the principle of free circulation of goods.\n\n        商品自由流通的原则\n    4.VERB（在聚会上）周旋，往来应酬If you circulate at a party, you move among the guests and talk to different people. \n\n        Let me get you something to drink, then I must circulate.\n\n        我给你找点喝的，然后我得去应酬一下。
liar@    1.N-COUNT说谎者；骗子If you say that someone is a liar, you mean that they tell lies.\n\n        He was a liar and a cheat...\n\n        他曾坑蒙拐骗。\n\n        'She seems at times an accomplished liar,' he said.\n\n        “她有时像个撒谎高手，”他说。
infinite@    1.ADJ极多的；极度的If you describe something as infinite, you are emphasizing that it is extremely great in amount or degree. \n\n        ...an infinite variety of landscapes...\n\n        变化万千的风景\n\n        With infinite care, John shifted position...\n\n        约翰小心翼翼地挪动了位置。\n\n        The choice is infinite.\n\n        选择是极其多的。\n\n    infinitely\n\n        His design was infinitely better than anything I could have done.\n\n        他的设计比我所能设计出的不知要好上多少倍。\n    2.ADJ无限的；无穷的；无边的Something that is infinite has no limit, end, or edge. \n\n        ...an infinite number of atoms...\n\n        无穷多的原子\n\n        Obviously, no company has infinite resources.\n\n        显然，没有哪个公司的资源是无限的。\n\n        ...God's infinite mercy.\n\n        上帝无限的仁慈\n\n        The infinite is something which is infinite.无限（或无穷）的事物\n\n            ...pondering on the infinite.\n\n            对无极的思考\n\n    infinitely\n\n        A centimeter can be infinitely divided into smaller units.\n\n        一厘米可以无穷尽地分成更小的单位。
branch out@横生枝节，扩大范围    1.PHRASAL VERB扩大范围；拓展领域If a person or an organization branches out, they do something that is different from their normal activities or work. \n\n        I continued studying moths, and branched out to other insects...\n\n        我继续研究飞蛾，并将研究范围扩展到其他昆虫。\n\n        ASEAN has branched out tentatively into the security business.\n\n        东盟已经尝试将合作范围拓展到安全领域。
theoretical@    1.ADJ（研究、解释）理论的，理论性的A theoretical study or explanation is based on or uses the ideas and abstract principles that relate to a particular subject, rather than the practical aspects or uses of it. \n\n        ...theoretical physics.\n\n        理论物理学\n    2.ADJ理论上的；推想的If you describe a situation as a theoretical one, you mean that although it is supposed to be true or to exist in the way stated, it may not in fact be true or exist in that way. \n\n        This is certainly a theoretical risk but in practice there is seldom a problem...\n\n        从理论上讲，这肯定是有风险的，可是实际上很少出问题。\n\n        These fears are purely theoretical.\n\n        这些担忧纯粹是臆测出来的。
hole up@冬眠，躲藏    1.PHRASAL VERB（为免受打扰等而）躲藏，隔绝If you hole up somewhere, you hide or shut yourself there, usually so that people cannot find you or disturb you. \n\n        His creative process involves holing up in his Paris flat with the phone off the hook.\n\n        他在创作的过程中躲在自己巴黎的公寓里，连电话都挂起。
pop up@    1.See also:pop-up；突然出现；不意冒出If someone or something pops up, they appear in a place or situation unexpectedly. \n\n        She was startled when Lisa popped up at the door all smiles...\n\n        莉萨突然笑容满面地出现在门口时，她吓了一跳。\n\n        You solved one problem and another would immediately pop up.\n\n        你解决完一个问题，另一个问题又会马上冒出来。
creep@vi. 爬, 蔓延\nn. 爬, 徐行, 蠕动1.VERB（人或动物）悄悄地缓慢行进，蹑手蹑脚地移动When people or animals creep somewhere, they move quietly and slowly. \n\n    Back I go to the hotel and creep up to my room...\n\n    我回到旅馆，蹑手蹑脚地上楼回到房间。\n\n    The rabbit creeps away and hides in a hole.\n\n    兔子悄悄溜走，藏进洞里。\n\n2.VERB缓慢移动If something creeps somewhere, it moves very slowly. \n\n    Mist had crept in again from the sea.\n\n    薄雾又从海面上弥漫过来了。\n\n3.VERB不知不觉地发生If something creeps in or creeps back, it begins to occur or becomes part of something without people realizing or without them wanting it. \n\n    Insecurity might creep in... \n\n    可能会不知不觉地产生不安全感。\n\n    An increasing ratio of mistakes, perhaps induced by tiredness, crept into her game.\n\n    可能是由于体力不支，她在比赛中的失误越来越多。\n\n    ...a proposal that crept through unnoticed at the National Council in December...\n\n    一项于12月份在全国委员会不声不响获得通过的提议\n\n4.VERB（比率或数值）逐渐增长If a rate or number creeps up to a higher level, it gradually reaches that level. \n\n    The inflation rate has been creeping up to 9.5 per cent...\n\n    通货膨胀率已攀升至9。5%。\n\n    The average number of students in each class is creeping up from three to four.\n\n    每个班的平均学生人数已经从3人增长到了4人。\n\n5.N-COUNT讨厌鬼； （尤指）讨好卖乖的人，马屁精If you describe someone as a creep, you mean that you dislike them a great deal, especially because they are insincere and flatter people. \n\n6.PHRASE吓人；使惊慌；使心里发毛If someone or something gives you the creeps, they make you feel very nervous or frightened. \n\n    I always hated that statue. It gave me the creeps.\n\n    我一直都很讨厌那座雕像。它让我心里发毛。
unfettered@adj. 被除去脚镣的, 无拘无束的\n动词unfetter的过去式和过去分词    1.ADJ自由的；不受拘束的If you describe something as unfettered, you mean that it is not controlled or limited by anyone or anything. \n\n        ...unfettered free trade...\n\n        不受限制的自由贸易\n\n        Unfettered by the bounds of reality, my imagination flourished.\n\n        跳出现实的束缚，我的想象力天马行空。\n\n        ...city slums, where drug traffickers reign virtually unfettered.\n\n        毒贩横行无忌的城市贫民窟
peek@v. 偷看, 窥视\nn. 偷看, 窥见    1.VERB瞥；偷看；窥视If you peek at something or someone, you have a quick look at them, often secretly. \n\n        On two occasions she had peeked at him through a crack in the wall.\n\n        她曾两次透过墙缝窥视他。\n\n        Peek is also a noun.\n\n            American firms have been paying outrageous fees for a peek at the technical data.\n\n            美国公司为了一窥这些技术数据一直在支付巨额费用。
obtain@vt. 获得, 得到\nvi. 通用, 流行, 存在    1.VERB得到；获得；实现To obtain something means to get it or achieve it. \n\n        Evans was trying to obtain a false passport and other documents...\n\n        埃文斯正试图取得一本假护照和其他证件。\n\n        The perfect body has always been difficult to obtain.\n\n        完美的身材总是很难拥有。\n    2.VERB存在；流行；通行If a situation obtains, it exists. \n\n        The longer this situation obtains, the more extensive the problems become.\n\n        这种局面持续的时间越长，问题波及的范围就越广。
crack@    1.V-ERG（使）破裂；（使）裂开；（使）断裂If something hard cracks, or if you crack it, it becomes slightly damaged, with lines appearing on its surface. \n\n        A gas main had cracked under my neighbour's garage and gas had seeped into our homes...\n\n        邻居车库下面的煤气总管裂开了，煤气渗入了我们家。\n\n        Remove the dish from the oven, crack the salt crust and you will find the skin just peels off the fish.\n\n        把盘子从烤箱里拿出来，弄碎鱼表面的那层盐，鱼皮就会从鱼身上剥落下来了。\n    2.V-ERG（使）发出爆裂声；（使）噼啪作响If something cracks, or if you crack it, it makes a sharp sound like the sound of a piece of wood breaking. \n\n        Thunder cracked in the sky...\n\n        空中雷声咔嚓作响。\n\n        He cracked his fingers nervously.\n\n        他紧张不安地把手指按得咔吧作响。\n    3.VERB重击；猛击If you crack a hard part of your body, such as your knee or your head, you hurt it by accidentally hitting it hard against something. \n\n        He cracked his head on the pavement and was knocked cold.\n\n        他一头撞到人行道上，不省人事了。\n    4.VERB打破；砸开；砸碎When you crack something that has a shell, such as an egg or a nut, you break the shell in order to reach the inside part. \n\n        Crack the eggs into a bowl.\n\n        把鸡蛋打在一个碗中。\n    5.VERB（尤指经过反复思考）找到…的解决办法，破译（密码）If you crack a problem or a code, you solve it, especially after a lot of thought. \n\n        He has finally cracked the system after years of painstaking research.\n\n        经过多年的努力研究，他终于找到了破解这个系统的办法。\n    6.VERB（因压力大而）失控，崩溃，瓦解If someone cracks, they lose control of their emotions or actions because they are under a lot of pressure. \n\n        She's calm and strong, and she is just not going to crack...\n\n        她镇定而且坚强，绝不会垮掉。\n\n        I had the conviction Larkin's nerve would crack and he'd squeeze the trigger in a reflex action...\n\n        我确信拉金会神经崩溃，他会反射性地扣动扳机。\n\n        Some countries are showing signs of cracking under intense pressure from the United States.\n\n        有些国家在美国的强大压力下有崩盘的迹象。\n    7.VERB（因感情强烈而嗓音）变嘶哑，变沙哑If your voice cracks when you are speaking or singing, it changes in pitch because you are feeling a strong emotion. \n\n        Her voice cracked and she began to cry.\n\n        她的声音变得沙哑，继而哭了起来。\n    8.VERB说（笑话）；开（玩笑）If you crack a joke, you tell it. \n\n        He cracked jokes and talked about beer and girls.\n\n        他爱说笑话，喜欢谈论啤酒和姑娘。\n    9.See also: cracked；cracking；\n    10.PHRASE不如别人说的那么好If you say that something is not all it's cracked up to be, you mean that it is not as good as other people have said it is. \n\n        Package holidays are not always all they're cracked up to be.\n\n        全包旅游并不总像人们说的那么好。\n\n    crack on\n\n        You've just got to crack on, whatever the problems are.\n\n        不管有什么问题，你都得抓紧时间努力干。\n\n        Just tell him what to do and he'll crack on with the work.\n\n        告诉他该干什么就行了，他会抓紧时间尽快干完的。\n    相关词组：crack downcrack up\n\n收起更多\n\nNOUN AND ADJECTIVE USES名词和形容词用法\n\n    1.N-COUNT缝隙；狭缝；窄缝A crack is a very narrow gap between two things, or between two parts of a thing.\n\n        Kathryn had seen him through a crack in the curtains.\n\n        凯瑟琳透过窗帘缝看见了他。\n    2.N-SING（门或窗户打开的）缝隙，窄缝If you open something such as a door, window, or curtain a crack, you open it only a small amount.\n\n        He went to the door, opened it a crack, and listened.\n\n        他朝门走去，打开一条门缝听着。\n    3.N-COUNT裂纹；裂缝A crack is a line that appears on the surface of something when it is slightly damaged.\n\n        The plate had a crack in it...\n\n        盘子上有一道裂纹。\n\n        Hundreds of office buildings and homes developed large cracks in walls and ceilings.\n\n        数百栋写字楼和住宅楼的墙壁和天花板上都出现了裂缝。\n    4.N-COUNT; SOUND爆裂声；噼啪声A crack is a sharp sound, like the sound of a piece of wood breaking.\n\n        Suddenly there was a loud crack and glass flew into the car...\n\n        突然发出一声巨大的爆裂声，玻璃碎片飞进了车里。\n\n        'Crack!' — The first shot rang out, hitting Paolo.\n\n        “砰！”第一声枪响了，打中了保罗。\n    5.N-SING尝试；试图If you have or take a crack at something, you make an attempt to do or achieve something. \n\n        I should love to have a crack at the Olympia title in my last year...\n\n        我非常愿意在我职业生涯的最后一年向奥林匹亚大赛冠军头衔发起冲击。\n\n        She decided to head for the dormitory to take another crack at locating Blanche.\n\n        她决定回宿舍再找找布兰奇。\n    6.N-COUNT（略显粗鲁或刻薄的）笑话，俏皮话A crack is a slightly rude or cruel joke.\n\n        When Paul made the crack about the 'famous girl detective', I began to suspect that he had it in for you.\n\n        当保罗挖苦你是“著名的女侦探”时，我开始怀疑他是不是故意刁难你。\n    7.N-UNCOUNTSee also:crack cocaine；强效可卡因；强力古柯碱Crack is a very pure form of the drug cocaine.\n    8.ADJ-GRADED（士兵或运动员）训练有素的，一流的A crack soldier or sportsman is highly trained and very skilful. \n\n        ...a crack undercover police officer...\n\n        训练有素的便衣警察\n\n        He is said to be a crack shot, despite weak vision in one eye.\n\n        尽管一只眼视力较弱，他仍被称为神枪手。\n    9.See also: craic；\n    10.PHRASE黎明；破晓；清晨If you say that someone does something at the crack of dawn, you are emphasizing that they do it very early in the morning. \n\n        I often start work at the crack of dawn when there is a big order to get out.\n\n        有大笔订单要处理时，我经常会清晨便开始工作。\n    11.PHRASE掩盖错误If you paper over the cracks, you try to hide all the things that are wrong with something. \n\n        The meeting was stormy, and the two sides managed only to paper over the cracks on some issues.\n\n        会议很激烈，但双方只是在试图掩盖某些问题上的错误。\n    12.PHRASE合理的机会；均等的机会If you get a fair crack of the whip, you are allowed a reasonable opportunity to succeed at something. \n\n        None of them is expecting any favours, just a fair crack of the whip.\n\n        他们谁也不期望受到任何特殊照顾，只希望机会均等。
component@n. 元件, 组件, 成份\nadj. 组成的, 构成的    1.N-COUNT组成部分；成分The components of something are the parts that it is made of.\n\n        Enriched uranium is a key component of a nuclear weapon...\n\n        浓缩铀是核武器的关键组成部分。\n\n        The management plan has four main components...\n\n        管理计划有4个主要部分。\n\n        They were automotive component suppliers to motor manufacturers.\n\n        他们为汽车制造商供应汽车零件。\n    2.ADJ组成的；构成的The component parts of something are the parts that make it up. \n\n        Gorbachev failed to keep the component parts of the Soviet Union together...\n\n        戈尔巴乔夫没能把苏联各成员国团结在一起。\n\n        Polish workers will now be making component parts for Boeing 757s.\n\n        现在波音757飞机的组成部件将由波兰工人制造。
virtually@adv. 几乎,实际上    1.ADV几乎；实际上；事实上；差不多You can use virtually to indicate that something is so nearly true that for most purposes it can be regarded as true. \n\n        Virtually all cooking was done over coal-fired ranges...\n\n        差不多所有的烹饪都是在燃煤灶上进行的。\n\n        It would have been virtually impossible to research all the information.\n\n        要对所有的信息进行分析研究几乎是不可能的。
barrier@1.N-COUNT障碍；壁垒；阻碍A barrier is something such as a rule, law, or policy that makes it difficult or impossible for something to happen or be achieved. \n\n    Duties and taxes are the most obvious barrier to free trade.\n\n    关税和税收是自由贸易的最大壁垒。\n\n2.N-COUNT隔阂；阻碍A barrier is a problem that prevents two people or groups from agreeing, communicating, or working with each other. \n\n    There is no reason why love shouldn't cross the age barrier...\n\n    爱没有理由不能跨越年龄的阻碍。\n\n    She had been waiting for Simon to break down the barrier between them...\n\n    她一直在等待西蒙打破他们之间的隔阂。\n\n    When you get involved in sports and athletes, a lot of the racial barriers are broken down.\n\n    当你参与到体育运动中的时候，很多种族隔阂就消失了。\n\n3.N-COUNT关卡；栅栏A barrier is something such as a fence or wall that is put in place to prevent people from moving easily from one area to another.\n\n    The demonstrators broke through heavy police barriers...\n\n    示威者们冲破了警察的重重设防。\n\n    As each woman reached the barrier one of the men glanced at her papers.\n\n    每一位女士来到关卡前，其中一个男士便会扫一眼她的证件。\n\n4.N-COUNT障碍物；挡板；屏障A barrier is an object or layer that physically prevents something from moving from one place to another. \n\n    ...a severe storm, which destroyed a natural barrier between the house and the lake...\n\n    猛烈的暴风雨摧毁了房子和湖之间的一道天然屏障\n\n    The packaging must provide an effective barrier to prevent contamination of the product.\n\n    包装必须提供有效的保护，以免产品受污染。\n\n5.N-SING大关；界限You can refer to a particular number or amount as a barrier when you think it is significant, because it is difficult or unusual to go above it. \n\n    They are fearful that unemployment will soon break the barrier of three million...\n\n    他们担心失业人数很快将突破300万大关。\n\n    The Popular Front failed, as expected, to pass the 5 per cent barrier.\n\n    不出所料，人民阵线没能突破5%大关。
missile@    1.N-COUNT导弹；飞弹A missile is a tube-shaped weapon that travels long distances through the air and explodes when it reaches its target.\n\n        The authorities offered to stop firing missiles if the rebels agreed to stop attacking civilian targets.\n\n        当局表示，如果叛乱分子答应停止攻击平民目标，就不再发射导弹。\n\n        ...nuclear missiles.\n\n        核弹\n    2.N-COUNT（作为武器的）投掷物，抛掷物，发射物Anything that is thrown as a weapon can be called a missile.\n\n        The football supporters began throwing missiles, one of which hit the referee.\n\n        足球迷们开始扔东西，其中还砸到了裁判一次。\n    3.See also: cruise missile；guided missile；
facility@    1.N-COUNT设备；设施Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose. \n\n        What recreational facilities are now available?...\n\n        现在有些什么娱乐设施？\n\n        The problem lies in getting patients to a medical facility as soon as possible.\n\n        问题在于要把病人尽快送至医院。\n    2.N-COUNT（组织提供的）附加服务，特色服务；（机器的）功能A facility is something such as an additional service provided by an organization or an extra feature on a machine which is useful but not essential. \n\n        It is very useful to have an overdraft facility...\n\n        有透支功能用处很大。\n\n        One of the new models has the facility to reproduce speech as well as text.\n\n        新型号中有一款具备复读和文本复制的功能。\n    3.N-COUNT天资；才能；天赋If you have a facility for something, for example learning a language, you find it easy to do. \n\n        He and Marcia shared a facility for languages...\n\n        他和马西娅都有语言天赋。\n\n        Smell is a very basic sense but humans have lost much of the facility to use it properly.\n\n        嗅觉是一种非常基本的官能，但人类已经丧失了恰当使用这种官能的大部分能力。
sufficient@    1.ADJ足够的；充足的If something is sufficient for a particular purpose, there is enough of it for the purpose. \n\n        One metre of fabric is sufficient to cover the exterior of an 18-in-diameter hatbox...\n\n        一米布足以包裹住直径为 18 英寸的帽盒。\n\n        Lighting levels should be sufficient for photography without flash...\n\n        光照亮度应达到不开闪光灯便可以清楚拍照的程度。\n\n        There was not sufficient evidence to secure a conviction.\n\n        没有足够的证据来定罪。\n\n    sufficiently\n\n        She recovered sufficiently to accompany Chou on his tour of Africa in 1964...\n\n        她恢复得不错，并得以在 1964 年陪同周访问非洲。\n\n        The holes were sufficiently large to serve as nests.\n\n        这些洞作鸟巢足够大。\n    2.ADJ（理由、条件）充足的，充分的If something is a sufficient cause or condition for something to happen, it can happen. \n\n        Discipline is a necessary, but certainly not a sufficient condition for learning to take place.\n\n        纪律是有必要的，但绝对不是保证学习成效的充分条件。
dispense with@摒弃,省掉,没有...也行    1.PHRASAL VERB摒弃；省却；不用If you dispense with something, you stop using it or get rid of it completely, especially because you no longer need it. \n\n        Many households have dispensed with their old-fashioned vinyl turntable.\n\n        很多家庭都将老式的黑胶唱机束之高阁了。
seize@1.VERB（迅速有力地）抓住，捉住If you seize something, you take hold of it quickly, firmly, and forcefully. \n\n    'Leigh,' he said seizing my arm to hold me back.\n\n    “莉，”他说着一把抓住我的胳膊把我拉了回来。\n\n    ...an otter seizing a fish.\n\n    捉到了一条鱼的水獭\n\n2.VERB（通过暴力突然迅速地）夺取，攻占，控制When a group of people seize a place or seize control of it, they take control of it quickly and suddenly, using force. \n\n    Troops have seized the airport and railroad terminals...\n\n    军队已控制了机场和火车站。\n\n    Army officers plotted a failed attempt yesterday to seize power.\n\n    军官们昨天夺权未遂。\n\n3.VERB（通常指通过武力）起获，没收，扣押If a government or other authority seize someone's property, they take it from them, often by force. \n\n    Police were reported to have seized all copies of this morning's edition of the newspaper...\n\n    据说警方已经将该报纸今天的早间版全部没收。\n\n    Bailiffs need a certificate from the county court to seize goods for rent arrears.\n\n    查封官需要有郡法院的证明才能没收货物以抵欠租。\n\n4.VERB逮捕；捉拿；俘获When someone is seized, they are arrested or captured. \n\n    UN officials say two military observers were seized by the Khmer Rouge yesterday...\n\n    联合国官员称昨天有两名军事观察员被红色高棉逮捕。\n\n    Men carrying sub-machine guns seized the five soldiers and drove them away.\n\n    持冲锋枪的几名男子俘虏了 5 名士兵并开车将他们带走。\n\n5.VERB抓住，把握（机会）When you seize an opportunity, you take advantage of it and do something that you want to do. \n\n    During the riots hundreds of people seized the opportunity to steal property...\n\n    在暴乱中成百上千的人纷纷趁机偷窃财物。\n\n    The government now hopes to seize the initiative on education.\n\n    如今政府希望抓住教育上的主动权。
vague@    1.ADJ-GRADED（文字或言语）含糊的，不明确的，不清楚的If something written or spoken is vague, it does not explain or express things clearly.\n\n        A lot of the talk was apparently vague and general...\n\n        很多话明显是些含糊的泛泛之论。\n\n        The description was pretty vague.\n\n        描述相当模糊。\n\n        ...vague information.\n\n        不明确的信息\n\n    vaguely\n\n        'I'm not sure,' Liz said vaguely...\n\n        “我不确定，”利兹含糊其词地说。\n\n        They issued a vaguely worded statement.\n\n        他们发表了一份措辞含混不清的声明。\n\n    vagueness\n\n        ...the vagueness of the language in the text.\n\n        文章语言隐晦\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（记忆或想法）模糊的，不清晰的If you have a vague memory or idea of something, the memory or idea is not clear.\n\n        They have only a vague idea of the amount of water available...\n\n        他们只是大概知道可用水的总量。\n\n        Waite's memory of that first meeting was vague.\n\n        韦特对第一次见面的记忆很模糊。\n\n    vaguely\n\n        Judith could vaguely remember her mother lying on the sofa.\n\n        朱迪丝隐约记得她母亲躺在沙发上的情景。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED含糊其词的；闪烁其词的If you are vague about something, you deliberately do not tell people much about it.\n\n        He was vague, however, about just what U.S. forces might actually do...\n\n        然而，他对美军实际可能采取的行动却闪烁其词。\n\n        Democratic leaders under election pressure tend to respond with vague promises of action...\n\n        民主党领导人在选举压力下往往用一些含糊其词的行动承诺来予以回应。\n\n        Christopher's answer was deliberately vague.\n\n        克里斯托弗的回答故意模棱两可。\n    4.ADJ-GRADED思维不清的If you describe someone as vague, you mean that they do not seem to be thinking clearly.\n\n        She had married a charming but rather vague Englishman...\n\n        她嫁给了一个外表迷人实际却很迷糊的英国人。\n\n        His eyes were always so vague when he looked at her.\n\n        他看她的眼神总是那么暧昧。\n\n    vaguely\n\n        He looked vaguely around the room as he spoke, his mind elsewhere.\n\n        他边说话边茫然地打量着房间，心不在焉的样子。\n\n    vagueness\n\n        ...a girl wandering in the blissful vagueness of someone in love.\n\n        被幸福冲昏了头脑的热恋中的女孩\n    5.ADJ-GRADED（感觉等）轻微的，隐约的If something such as a feeling is vague, you experience it only slightly. \n\n        He was conscious of that vague feeling of irritation again...\n\n        他再次感到有点儿恼火。\n\n        He had a vague impression of rain pounding on the packed earth.\n\n        他隐约记得雨点打在坚实地面上的情景。\n    6.ADJ-GRADED（外形或轮廓）模糊的，蒙眬的A vague shape or outline is not clear and is therefore not easy to see. \n\n        He looked at her vague shape through the frosted glass...\n\n        他透过雾蒙蒙的眼镜注视着她模糊的身形。\n\n        The bus was a vague shape in the distance.\n\n        远处的公交车只是一个模糊的轮廓。
veil@n. 面纱,掩饰物,修女\nvt. 给...戴面纱或面罩\nvi. 带面纱或面罩    1.N-COUNT面纱；面罩A veil is a piece of thin soft cloth that women sometimes wear over their heads and which can also cover their face.\n\n        She's got long fair hair but she's got a veil over it...\n\n        她有一头金色的长发，但她用头巾包住了。\n\n        She swathes her face in a veil of decorative muslin.\n\n        她用装饰性的薄纱遮住了脸。\n    2.N-COUNT掩盖物；遮蔽物You can refer to something that hides or partly hides a situation or activity as a veil . \n\n        The country is ridding itself of its disgraced prime minister in a veil of secrecy...\n\n        这个国家暗地里正试图把失势的首相赶下台。\n\n        The chilling facts behind this veil of silence were slow to emerge.\n\n        沉默背后的骇人真相慢慢显露出来。\n    3.N-COUNT（薄雾等）幕障You can refer to something that you can partly see through, for example a mist, as a veil. \n\n        The eruption has left a thin veil of dust in the upper atmosphere...\n\n        火山爆发在高层大气中留下了一层薄薄的尘土。\n\n        He recognized the coast of England through a veil of mist...\n\n        透过薄雾他认出了那是英格兰的海岸线。\n\n        He retreated behind a veil of cigarette smoke.\n\n        他隐藏在一层香烟烟雾之后。\n    4.PHRASE隐瞒；避而不谈If you draw a veil over something, you stop talking about it because it is too unpleasant to talk about. \n\n        The clamour to draw a veil over the minister's extra-marital activities reeks of hypocrisy.\n\n        想要掩饰部长婚外情的喧嚣叫嚷之声让人倍感虚伪。
secrecy@n. 秘密，保密, 隐蔽    1.N-UNCOUNT保密；秘密状态Secrecy is the act of keeping something secret, or the state of being kept secret. \n\n        The British government has thrown a blanket of secrecy over the details...\n\n        英国政府对细节讳莫如深。\n\n        He shrouds his business dealings in secrecy.\n\n        他秘密进行交易。
flaw@1.N-COUNT错误；谬误A flaw in something such as a theory or argument is a mistake in it, which causes it to be less effective or valid. \n\n    There were, however, a number of crucial flaws in his monetary theory...\n\n    但是，他的货币理论中存在若干关键性错误。\n\n    Almost all of these studies have serious flaws.\n\n    几乎所有这些研究中都存在严重谬误。\n\n2.N-COUNT（性格中的）缺点，弱点A flaw in someone's character is an undesirable quality that they have. \n\n    The only flaw in his character seems to be a short temper.\n\n    他性格中的唯一缺点好像就是脾气急。\n\n3.N-COUNT瑕疵；缺陷A flaw in something such as a pattern or material is a fault in it that should not be there.
bring forth@ vt. 产生(发表,宣布)
may well@ 很可能；充分理由；有充分理由可以…
may as well@ conj. 最好...(还是...的好)
miracle@    1.N-COUNT奇迹；出人意料的事If you say that a good event is a miracle, you mean that it is very surprising and unexpected.\n\n        It is a miracle no one was killed...\n\n        出人意料的是，没有人死亡。\n\n        The Italian economic miracle has always been a mystery...\n\n        意大利的经济奇迹一直是个谜。\n    2.ADJ（药物或产品）神奇的，不可思议的A miracle drug or product does something that was thought almost impossible. \n\n        ...a miracle drug that is said to be a cure for Aids and cancer.\n\n        据说可以治愈艾滋病和癌症的神药\n    3.N-COUNT（上帝创造的）神迹，圣迹A miracle is a wonderful and surprising event that is believed to be caused by God.\n\n        ...the miracle of the Virgin Birth.\n\n        童贞女生子的神迹\n\n        ...Jesus's ability to perform miracles.\n\n        耶稣创造奇迹的能力
fulfill@  1.VERB履行；实现；使应验If you fulfil something such as a promise, dream, or hope, you do what you said or hoped you would do. \n\n        President Kaunda fulfilled his promise of announcing a date for the referendum.\n\n        卡翁达总统兑现了他的承诺，宣布了全民公决的日期。\n    2.VERB实行；执行；完成To fulfil a task, role, or requirement means to do or be what is required, necessary, or expected. \n\n        Without them you will not be able to fulfil the tasks you have before you...\n\n        没有他们你将无法完成面临的任务。\n\n        All the necessary conditions were fulfilled.\n\n        所有必要的条件都满足了。\n    3.VERB满足；使满意；使有成就感If something fulfils you, or if you fulfil yourself, you feel happy and satisfied with what you are doing or with what you have achieved. \n\n        The war was the biggest thing in her life and nothing after that quite fulfilled her...\n\n        这场战争是她生命中最重大的事件，从那以后再没有什么让她特别有成就感的了。\n\n        They don't like the idea that women can fulfil themselves without the assistance of a man.\n\n        他们不喜欢那种女人没有男人的帮助仍会有所成就的想法。\n\n    fulfilled\n\n        She has courageously continued to lead a fulfilled life...\n\n        她一直勇敢地坚持着充实满足的生活。\n\n        I feel more fulfilled doing this than I've ever done.\n\n        做这件事让我比以往任何时候都感到满足。\n\n    fulfilling\n\n        ...a fulfilling career...\n\n        让人有成就感的职业\n\n        I found it all very fulfilling.\n\n        我发觉一切都令人感到非常满足。
wizard@n. 男巫, 术士, 鬼才\nadj. 男巫的, 巫术的    1.N-COUNT（传说或童话故事中的）魔法师In legends and fairy stories, a wizard is a man who has magic powers.\n    2.N-COUNT奇才；能手；行家If you admire someone because they are very good at doing a particular thing, you can say that they are a wizard . \n\n        ...a financial wizard...\n\n        金融奇才\n\n        Accountant John Talbot is a wizard with numbers.\n\n        会计师约翰·塔尔博特精通数字。\n    3.N-COUNT向导程序A wizard is a computer program that guides you through the stages of a particular task. \n\n        Wizards and templates can help you create brochures, calendars, and Web pages.\n\n        向导程序和模板可以帮助你创建手册、日历和网页。
reproduce@v. 再生, 复制, 生殖    1.VERB复制；模拟；再现If you try to reproduce something, you try to copy it. \n\n        I shall not try to reproduce the policemen's English...\n\n        我不会试图去模仿那个警察讲的英语。\n\n        The effect has proved hard to reproduce.\n\n        事实证明，这种效果很难再现。\n    2.VERB复制；临摹；翻印If you reproduce a picture, speech, or a piece of writing, you make a photograph or printed copy of it. \n\n        We are grateful to you for permission to reproduce this article.\n\n        非常感谢您允许我们复印这篇文章。\n    3.VERB重复If you reproduce an action or an achievement, you repeat it. \n\n        If we can reproduce the form we have shown in the last couple of months we will be successful.\n\n        如果我们能再采用前两个月的形式，我们就会成功。\n    4.VERB繁殖；生殖When people, animals, or plants reproduce, they produce young. \n\n        ...a society where women are defined by their ability to reproduce...\n\n        用生育能力衡量女性价值的社会\n\n        We are reproducing ourselves at such a rate that our numbers threaten the ecology of the planet.\n\n        我们的繁衍速度太快，以至于人口数量对地球的生态系统造成了威胁。\n\n    reproduction\n\n        Genes are those tiny bits of biological information swapped in sexual reproduction.\n\n        基因是在有性繁殖中交换的微小生物信息。\n\n        ...the acids which are vital for normal cell reproduction.\n\n        对正常细胞繁殖至关重要的酸性物质
defect@    The noun is pronounced /'diːfekt/. The verb is pronounced /dɪ'fekt/. 名词读作 /'diːfekt/。动词读作 /dɪ'fekt/。\n    1.N-COUNT缺点；缺陷；毛病；瑕疵A defect is a fault or imperfection in a person or thing. \n\n        He was born with a hearing defect.\n\n        他患有先天性听力缺损。\n\n        ...a defect in the aircraft caused the crash...\n\n        飞机的一个缺陷导致了这起坠毁事故。\n\n        A report has pointed out the defects of the present system.\n\n        一份报告指出了当前体制存在的毛病。\n    2.VERB叛逃；背叛；变节；倒戈If you defect, you leave your country, political party, or other group, and join an opposing country, party, or group. \n\n        He tried to defect to the West last year...\n\n        去年他试图叛逃到西方。\n\n        He defected from the party in the late 1970s.\n\n        他在20世纪70年代后期叛出了该党。\n\n        ...a KGB officer who defected in 1963.\n\n        1963年叛变的一名克格勃官员\n\n    defection\n\n        ...the defection of at least sixteen Parliamentary deputies.\n\n        至少 16 名议会代表的倒戈
grab@    1.VERB抓住；攫取If you grab something, you take it or pick it up suddenly and roughly. \n\n        I managed to grab her hand...\n\n        我抓到了她的手。\n\n        I grabbed him by the neck.\n\n        我掐住他的脖子。\n    2.VERB（试图）抓住，夺取If you grab at something, you try to grab it. \n\n        He was clumsily trying to grab at Alfred's arms.\n\n        他笨手笨脚地想抓住艾尔弗雷德的手臂。\n\n        Grab is also a noun.\n\n            I made a grab for the knife...\n\n            我试图抓住那把刀。\n\n            Mr Penrose made a grab at his collar.\n\n            彭罗斯先生试图揪住他的衣领。\n    3.VERB引起…的注意；吸引If you grab someone who is walking past, you succeed in getting their attention. \n\n        Grab that waiter, Mary Ann.\n\n        玛丽·安，叫那位侍者过来。\n    4.VERB吸引（某人的注意）If you grab someone's attention, you do something in order to make them notice you. \n\n        I jumped on the wall to grab the attention of the crowd.\n\n        为了吸引那群人的注意，我纵身跃上墙头。\n    5.VERB（匆忙地）拿，取；抓紧（吃、睡等）If you grab something such as food, drink, or sleep, you manage to get some quickly. \n\n        Grab a beer.\n\n        拿瓶啤酒来。\n    6.VERB抓住（机会等）If you grab something such as a chance or opportunity, or grab at it, you take advantage of it eagerly. \n\n        She grabbed the chance of a job interview...\n\n        她抓住了一次求职面试的机会。\n\n        He grabbed at the opportunity to buy his castle.\n\n        他抓住机会买下了他的城堡。\n    7.N-COUNT攫取；争取；赚取A grab for something such as power or fame is an attempt to gain it. \n\n        ...a grab for personal power.\n\n        对个人权力的巧取豪夺\n    8.See also: smash-and-grab；\n    9.PHRASE供人竞购的；供争夺的If something is up for grabs, it is available to anyone who is interested. \n\n        The famous Ritz hotel is up for grabs for £100m.\n\n        著名的里兹饭店开价1亿英镑供各方竞购。
nourish@1.VERB给…提供营养；滋养To nourish a person, animal, or plant means to provide them with the food that is necessary for life, growth, and good health. \n\n    The food she eats nourishes both her and the baby.\n\n    她吃的食物给她和婴儿提供了营养。\n\n    ...microbes in the soil which nourish the plant.\n\n    土壤中为植物提供营养的微生物\n\nnourishing\n\n    Most of these nourishing substances are in the yolk of the egg.\n\n    这些营养物质中的大部分在蛋黄里。\n\n    ...sensible, nourishing food.\n\n    合理的、有营养的食物\n\n2.VERB滋长，怀有（感情、信念等）To nourish something such as a feeling or belief means to allow or encourage it to grow. \n\n    Journalists on the whole don't create public opinion. They can help to nourish it.\n\n    大体说来记者不制造舆论。他们会助长舆论。\n\n    ...a current of thought which has been nourished by historical tradition.\n\n    在历史传统中汲取养分的思潮
classified@adj. 分类的, 类别的, 被指定为机密的\nv. 分类, 分等级\nvbl. 分类, 分等级    1.ADJ（信息或文件）机密的，保密的Classified information or documents are officially secret.\n\n        He has a security clearance that allows him access to classified information...\n\n        他获得了安全许可，可以接触机密信息。\n\n        The document was highly classified and circulated to a very limited group of people.\n\n        这份文件高度机密，只在很小范围内传阅。
divert@vt. 转移,使欢娱\nvi. 转移    1.V-ERG（使）转向；（使）绕道To divert vehicles or travellers means to make them follow a different route or go to a different destination than they originally intended. You can also say that someone or something diverts from a particular route or to a particular place. \n\n        ...Rainham Marshes, east London, where a new bypass will divert traffic from the A13... \n\n        伦敦东部的雷纳姆泽，那儿有一条新的旁道将会分流 A13 公路的交通\n\n        During the strike, ambulances will be diverted to private hospitals...\n\n        在罢工期间，救护车将被转到私人医院去。\n\n        We diverted a plane to rescue 100 passengers...\n\n        我们让一架飞机改变航线去营救 100 名乘客。\n\n    in AM, use 美国英语用 detour\n    2.VERB改变（资金、资源）的用途；转移To divert money or resources means to cause them to be used for a different purpose. \n\n        The government is trying to divert more public funds from west to east.\n\n        政府正试图将更多的公共基金从西部转到东部。\n\n        ...government departments involved in diverting resources into community care.\n\n        负责将资源用于社区保健的政府部门\n    3.VERB转接（电话）To divert a phone call means to send it to a different number or place from the one that was dialled by the person making the call. \n\n        He instructed switchboard staff to divert all Laura's calls to him.\n\n        他让总机接线员将劳拉所有的电话都转给他。\n\n        Customers will only incur additional call charges if the call is diverted outside the UK.\n\n        只有当电话被转接到英国之外，客户才会被加收额外的电话费。\n    4.VERB转移，分散（注意力）If you say that someone diverts your attention from something important or serious, you disapprove of them behaving or talking in a way that stops you thinking about it. \n\n        They want to divert the attention of the people from the real issues.\n\n        他们想要把人们的注意力从真正的问题上转移开。\n\n        The President needed to divert attention away from his own economic record.\n\n        总统需要将人们的视线从他以往在经济上的表现上转移开。
revenge@    1.N-UNCOUNT报仇；报复Revenge involves hurting or punishing someone who has hurt or harmed you. \n\n        The attackers were said to be taking revenge on the 14-year-old, claiming he was a school bully...\n\n        据说，这些攻击者是在报复这个14岁的孩子，说他是学校的小霸王。\n\n        The killings were said to have been in revenge for the murder of her lover.\n\n        据说，她杀人是为了替她被害的情人报仇。\n    2.VERB向…报仇；报复If you revenge yourself on someone who has hurt you, you hurt them in return. \n\n        The Sunday Mercury accused her of trying to revenge herself on her former lover...\n\n        《星期日信使报》指责她企图报复她以前的情人。\n\n        ...the relatives of murdered villagers wanting to revenge the dead.\n\n        想要为死者报仇的被害村民的亲属
grip@    1.VERB紧握；抓牢If you grip something, you take hold of it with your hand and continue to hold it firmly. \n\n        She gripped the rope.\n\n        她紧紧抓住绳索。\n    2.N-COUNT紧握；抓牢A grip is a firm, strong hold on something. \n\n        His strong hand eased the bag from her grip.\n\n        他强有力的手迫使她松开了握紧袋子的双手。\n    3.N-SING掌握；支配；控制Someone's grip on something is the power and control they have over it. \n\n        The president maintains an iron grip on his country...\n\n        总统牢牢地控制着他的国家。\n\n        Tony Blair last night tightened his grip on Labour mps with new powers to root out troublemakers.\n\n        昨晚，托尼·布莱尔利用新赋予的权力铲除了制造事端者，加强了对工党议员的控制。\n    4.VERB强烈地影响If something grips you, it affects you very strongly. \n\n        Pain gripped him...\n\n        他感到一阵剧痛。\n\n        The entire community has been gripped by fear.\n\n        恐惧笼罩着整个社区。\n    5.VERB吸引；迷住If you are gripped by something such as a story or a series of events, your attention is concentrated on it and held by it. \n\n        The nation is gripped by the dramatic story.\n\n        举国上下都为那个戏剧性的故事牵动着。\n\n    gripping\n\n        The film turned out to be a gripping thriller.\n\n        那部电影原来是部扣人心弦的惊悚片。\n    6.N-UNCOUNT防滑；抓地力If things such as shoes or car tyres have grip, they do not slip.\n\n        ...a new way of reinforcing rubber which gives car tyres better grip.\n\n        加固橡胶以增强车胎抓地力的新方法\n    7.N-COUNT手提包；旅行袋A grip is a bag that is smaller than a suitcase, and that you use when you are travelling.\n    8.PHRASE认真考虑并着手处理If you get to grips with a problem or if you come to grips with it, you consider it seriously, and start taking action to deal with it. \n\n        The government's first task is to get to grips with the economy.\n\n        政府的首要任务是处理好经济问题。\n    9.PHRASE（使自己）镇定下来；控制住（自己）If you get a grip on yourself, you make an effort to control or improve your behaviour or work. \n    10.PHRASE受制于；受…的深刻影响If a person, group, or place is in the grip of something, they are being severely affected by it. \n\n        Britain is still in the grip of recession.\n\n        英国依然没有摆脱经济衰退。\n\n        ...a region in the grip of severe drought.\n\n        受大旱严重影响的地区\n    11.PHRASE效率降低；失去信心；驾驭不住If you lose your grip, you become less efficient and less confident, and less able to deal with things. \n    12.PHRASE了解形势；理解现状If you say that someone has a grip on reality, you mean they recognize the true situation and do not have mistaken ideas about it. \n\n        Shakur loses his fragile grip on reality and starts blasting away at friends and foe alike.\n\n        沙库尔丧失了对形势仅存的一点判断，无论对敌对友都开始大加挞伐。
prestigious@    1.ADJ-GRADED有威望的；有声望的；有威信的；受尊敬的A prestigious institution, job, or activity is respected and admired by people. \n\n        It's one of the best equipped and most prestigious schools in the country.\n\n        这是国内设备最先进、最有威望的学校之一。
raging@1.ADJ（水流）汹涌的，湍急的Raging water moves very forcefully and violently. \n\n    The field trip involved crossing a raging torrent.\n\n    实地考察时要穿过一条水流湍急的河。\n\n2.ADJ（火势）猛烈的，凶猛的Raging fire is very hot and fierce. \n\n    As he came closer he saw a gigantic wall of raging flame before him.\n\n    他走近时发现前面是一道烈火熊熊的巨大火墙。\n\n3.ADJ（尤指坏事）严重的Raging is used to describe things, especially bad things, that are very intense. \n\n    If raging inflation returns, then interest rates will shoot up...\n\n    如果再发生严重的通货膨胀，那么利率就会迅速上调。\n\n    There may be the occasional criticism but it's clear there is no raging debate right now...\n\n    可能偶尔会有批评，但现在显然没有出现激烈的辩论。\n\n    He felt a raging thirst.\n\n    他感到口渴难忍。
rage@1.N-VAR狂怒；盛怒Rage is strong anger that is difficult to control.\n\n    He was red-cheeked with rage...\n\n    他气得满脸通红。\n\n    I flew into a rage...\n\n    我勃然大怒。\n\n    He admitted shooting the man in a fit of rage.\n\n    他承认自己一怒之下朝那人开了枪。\n\n2.VERB肆虐；猖獗You say that something powerful or unpleasant rages when it continues with great force or violence. \n\n    Train services were halted as the fire raged for more than four hours...\n\n    火灾肆虐超过4个小时，期间列车停止了运行。\n\n    ...the fierce arguments raging over the future of the Holy City...\n\n    关于圣城未来的激烈争论\n\n    The war rages on and the time has come to take sides.\n\n    战乱肆虐，是时候表明立场了。\n\n3.VERB发脾气；大怒If you rage about something, you speak or think very angrily about it. \n\n    Monroe was on the phone, raging about her mistreatment by the brothers...\n\n    门罗正在打电话，怒不可遏地说着她被这几个兄弟虐待的事。\n\n    Inside, Frannie was raging...\n\n    弗兰妮正在屋里大发脾气。\n\n    'I can't see it's any of your business,' he raged.\n\n    “这根本不关你的事，”他生气地说。\n\n4.N-UNCOUNTSee also:road rage；（尤指引发暴力或攻击行为的）暴怒，盛怒You can refer to the strong anger that someone feels in a particular situation as a particular rage, especially when this results in violent or aggressive behaviour. \n\n    Cabin crews are reporting up to nine cases of air rage a week.\n\n    乘务人员一周内报告的飞机上闹事行为多达9起。\n\n5.N-SING风靡一时；非常流行When something is popular and fashionable, you can say that it is the rage or all the rage . \n\n    The 1950s look is all the rage at the moment.\n\n    目前，20世纪50年代的装扮正流行。
cruelty@n. 残酷,残忍, 残酷的行为，虐待    1.N-VAR残暴；残忍；残酷Cruelty is behaviour that deliberately causes pain or distress to people or animals. \n\n        Britain had laws against cruelty to animals but none to protect children...\n\n        英国有禁止虐待动物的法律，但却没有保护儿童的法律。\n\n        He had been unable to escape the cruelties of war.\n\n        他没能逃脱战争的残酷。
pound@n.英镑； 磅； 兽栏； 重击声\nvt.&amp; vi.连续重击； 咚咚地走\nvi.（持续地）苦干； （驾舟时）拍打（水面）； （心脏）狂跳； 脚步沉重地走（或跑）\nvt.连续重击； 捣碎，碾碎； 强迫吸收； 猛烈袭击    1.N-COUNT英镑（英国货币单位，等于100便士）；镑（埃及等国的货币单位）The pound is the unit of money which is used in Britain. It is represented by the symbol £. One British pound is divided into a hundred pence. Some other countries, for example Egypt, also have a unit of money called a pound . \n\n        Beer cost three pounds a bottle... \n\n        啤酒每瓶3英镑。\n\n        A thousand pounds worth of jewellery and silver has been stolen.\n\n        价值1，000英镑的珠宝和银饰被盗。\n\n        ...multi-million pound profits.\n\n        数百万英镑的利润\n    2.N-SING英镑币制；镑币制The pound is used to refer to the British currency system, and sometimes to the currency systems of other countries which use pounds. \n\n        The pound is expected to continue to increase against most other currencies.\n\n        英镑对大多数其他货币的汇率有望继续升高。\n    3.N-COUNT磅（英美等一些讲英语的国家的重量单位，合0。454千克）A pound is a unit of weight used mainly in Britain, America, and other countries where English is spoken. One pound is equal to 0.454 kilograms. A pound of something is a quantity of it that weighs one pound.→see usage note at:weight \n\n        Her weight was under ninety pounds.\n\n        她的体重不足90磅。\n\n        ...a pound of cheese.\n\n        一磅奶酪\n    4.N-COUNT（流浪猫狗的）收留所，待领场A pound is a place where dogs and cats found wandering in the street are taken and kept until they are claimed by their owners.\n    5.N-COUNT（违章停放车辆的）扣留场A pound is a place where cars that have been parked illegally are taken by the police and kept until they have been claimed by their owners.\n    6.VERB用力击打；连续砰砰地猛击If you pound something or pound on it, you hit it with great force, usually loudly and repeatedly. \n\n        He pounded the table with his fist... \n\n        他用拳头猛击桌子。\n\n        Somebody began pounding on the front door...\n\n        有人开始不停地猛敲前门。\n\n        She came at him, pounding her fists against his chest.\n\n        她冲向他，用拳头使劲打他的胸膛。\n    7.VERB把…捣成粉状；捣碎；舂烂If you pound something, you crush it into a paste or a powder or into very small pieces. \n\n        She paused as she pounded the maize grains.\n\n        她捣玉米粒时停了一下。\n    8.VERB（常因恐惧而心脏）剧烈跳动，怦怦地跳If your heart is pounding, it is beating with an unusually strong and fast rhythm, usually because you are afraid. \n\n        I'm sweating, my heart is pounding. I can't breathe.\n\n        我浑身冒汗，心脏狂跳，呼吸困难。\n\n    pounding\n\n        ...the fast pounding of her heart.\n\n        她快速的心跳\n    9.See also: pounding；\n    10.PHRASE（不顾别人痛苦而坚决要求的）应得的东西If you say that someone demands their pound of flesh, you mean that they insist on getting something they are entitled to, even though it may cause distress to the person it is demanded from. \n\n        Banks are quick to demand their pound of flesh when overdrafts run a little over the limit.\n\n        透支稍微超出限额时，银行便会很快要求归还欠款。
be hard on@ 对 ... 苛刻, 使 ... 极为难堪
caution@1.N-UNCOUNT谨慎；慎重Caution is great care which you take in order to avoid possible danger.\n\n    Extreme caution should be exercised when buying part-worn tyres...\n\n    购买部分磨损轮胎时要格外当心。\n\n    The Chancellor is a man of caution.\n\n    财政大臣为人处世谨慎。\n\n2.VERB提醒；告诫；警告If someone cautions you, they warn you about problems or danger. \n\n    Tony cautioned against misrepresenting the situation...\n\n    托尼告诫说不要歪曲形势。\n\n    The statement clearly was intended to caution Seoul against attempting to block the council's action again...\n\n    显然，这个声明的目的是要警告首尔不要尝试再次阻拦委员会的行动。\n\n    He cautioned that opposition attacks on the ruling party would not further political co-operation.\n\n    他告诫说，反对派对执政党的攻击并不能增进政治合作。\n\n    Caution is also a noun.\n\n        There was a note of caution for the Treasury in the figures.\n\n        统计数字向财政部亮出了警告。\n\n3.VERB受到（警方）正式警告If someone who has broken the law is cautioned by the police, they are warned that if they break the law again official action will be taken against them. \n\n    The two men were cautioned but police say they will not be charged...\n\n    那两个人受到了警告，不过警方说不会对他们提出指控。\n\n    Tapp was eventually cautioned for wasting police time.\n\n    最后，塔普因浪费警方时间而受到警告。\n\n    Caution is also a noun.\n\n        In November 1987 Paula escaped with a caution. In October 1988 she was fined.\n\n        1987年11月，葆拉运气好只是受到了口头警告；1988年10月，她被处以罚款。\n\n4.VERB向…告知其法律权利（即嫌疑人所说的任何话都可能成为呈堂证据）If someone who has been arrested is cautioned, the police warn them that anything they say may be used as evidence in a trial. \n\n    Nobody was cautioned after arrest.\n\n    被捕后，没有人被告知其法律权利。\n\n5.PHRASE把理智抛至脑后；鲁莽行事；恣意妄为If you throw caution to the wind, you behave in a way that is not considered sensible or careful. \n\n    I threw caution to the wind and rode as fast as I could.\n\n    我不顾一切，骑得飞快。
scared@    1.ADJ-GRADED惊恐的；恐惧的；害怕的If you are scared of someone or something, you are frightened of them. \n\n        I'm certainly not scared of him...\n\n        我当然不怕他。\n\n        I was too scared to move...\n\n        我吓得动弹不得。\n\n        Why are you so scared?\n\n        你为什么如此害怕？\n    2.ADJ-GRADED担心的；害怕的；焦虑的If you are scared that something unpleasant might happen, you are nervous and worried because you think that it might happen. \n\n        I was scared that I might be sick...\n\n        我担心自己可能病了。\n\n        He was scared of letting us down.\n\n        他怕让我们失望。\n    3.PHRASE非常恐惧的；极度害怕的；吓得要死的；吓傻的If you are scared to death or scared stiff, you are extremely scared. \n\n        In high school I was scared to death of you...\n\n        高中时我怕你怕得要命。\n\n        He's scared stiff of the relationship breaking down.\n\n        他非常害怕关系破裂。
gap@    1.N-COUNT缝隙；缺口；豁口；裂口A gap is a space between two things or a hole in the middle of something solid.\n\n        He pulled the thick curtains together, leaving just a narrow gap.\n\n        他拉上厚厚的窗帘，仅留下一条狭窄的缝隙。\n\n        ...the wind tearing through gaps in the window frames.\n\n        从窗框缝隙中呼啸而入的风\n    2.N-COUNT（时间上的）间断，间隔，间隙A gap is a period of time when you are not busy or when you stop doing something that you normally do. \n\n        There followed a gap of four years, during which William joined the Army.\n\n        随后的4年时间，威廉在陆军服役。\n    3.N-COUNT漏洞；空白；缺口If there is something missing from a situation that prevents it being complete or satisfactory, you can say that there is a gap . \n\n        We need more young scientists to fill the gap left by a wave of retirements expected over the next decade...\n\n        我们需要更多年轻的科学家来填补预计未来10年退休高峰带来的人才缺口。\n\n        Like a good businessman, Stewart identified a gap in the market.\n\n        像精明的商人一样，斯图尔特发现了市场上的一个空白。\n    4.N-COUNT分歧；差距；隔阂A gap between two groups of people, things, or sets of ideas is a big difference between them. \n\n        ...the gap between rich and poor...\n\n        贫富差距\n\n        America's trade gap widened...\n\n        美国的贸易逆差加大了。\n\n        Britain needs to bridge the technology gap between academia and industry.\n\n        英国需要弥合学术界和企业界之间的技术差距。
