monstrous@    1.ADJ-GRADED骇人听闻的；极不公正的If you describe a situation or event as monstrous, you mean that it is extremely shocking or unfair. \n\n        She endured the monstrous behaviour for years...\n\n        多年来，她一直忍受着这种骇人听闻的暴行。\n\n        I just hope the people who committed this monstrous evil will be able to live with themselves.\n\n        我只是希望犯下这种骇人罪行的人能承受良心的谴责。\n\n    monstrously\n\n        Your husband's family has behaved monstrously.\n\n        你婆家人的行为实在可恶。\n    2.ADJ-GRADED（令人不悦之物）巨大的；特大规模的If you describe an unpleasant thing as monstrous, you mean that it is extremely large in size or extent. \n\n        ...a monstrous copper edifice...\n\n        又大又难看的铜制建筑物\n\n        It was blowing a monstrous gale.\n\n        狂风肆虐。\n\n    monstrously\n\n        It would be monstrously unfair...\n\n        这样会极不公正。\n\n        Monstrously inflated prices are designed to keep people like us at bay.\n\n        疯狂飞涨的价格会使像我们这样的人走投无路。\n    3.ADJ-GRADED可怕的；丑陋怪异的If you describe something as monstrous, you mean that it is extremely frightening because it appears unnatural or ugly. \n\n        ...the film's monstrous fantasy figure.\n\n        电影里虚构出来的恐怖形象
huh@int. 哼! 哈! (表示轻蔑、吃惊或疑问)1.（表示征求对方认同）啊，是吧；（表示希望他人重复所说的话）什么；（表示惊讶或不以为然）嘿，哼Huh is used in writing to represent a noise that people make at the end of a question if they want someone to agree with them or if they want someone to repeat what they have just said. Huh is also used to show that someone is surprised or not impressed.\n\n    Can we just get on with it, huh?... \n\n    我们能继续干下去吗，啊？\n\n    Clever, huh?...\n\n    挺聪明的，是吧？\n\n    Huh? What's going on? You want to tell me what I did?...\n\n    啊？怎么了？你要告诉我我刚才做了什么吗？
presence@    1.N-SING出席；到场Someone's presence in a place is the fact that they are there. \n\n        They argued that his presence in the village could only stir up trouble...\n\n        他们认为他在村里出现只会招惹麻烦。\n\n        Her Majesty later honoured the Headmaster with her presence at lunch.\n\n        随后女王陛下出席了午餐，令校长感到荣幸。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT风度；风采；仪态If you say that someone has presence, you mean that they impress people by their appearance and manner. \n\n        They do not seem to have the vast, authoritative presence of those great men...\n\n        他们看起来并没有那些伟人的翩翩风度和威严。\n\n        Hendrix's stage presence appealed to thousands of teenage rebels.\n\n        亨德里克斯在台上的风采吸引了成千上万的叛逆少年。\n    3.N-COUNT鬼怪；幽灵A presence is a person or creature that you cannot see, but that you are aware of. \n\n        The forest was dark and silent, haunted by shadows and unseen presences...\n\n        这个森林黑暗寂静，经常有幽灵和看不见的鬼怪出没。\n\n        She started to be affected by the ghostly presence she could feel in the house.\n\n        她觉得这座房子里有可怕的鬼怪，开始变得神经紧张。\n    4.N-SING（军队的）驻扎，进驻，存在If a country has a military presence in another country, it has some of its armed forces there. \n\n        The Philippine government wants the US to maintain a military presence in Southeast Asia.\n\n        菲律宾政府希望美国继续在东南亚驻军。\n    5.N-UNCOUNT存在；被包含If you refer to the presence of a substance in another thing, you mean that it is in that thing. \n\n        The somewhat acid flavour is caused by the presence of lactic acid.\n\n        这种微酸的味道是因为含有乳酸造成的。\n\n        ...the presence of a carcinogen in the water...\n\n        水中含有的一种致癌物质\n\n        Although the fluid presents no symptoms to the patient, its presence can be detected by a test.\n\n        虽然这种液体不会使患者出现任何症状，但是它可以通过测试检测出来。\n    6.PHRASE引起注意；使得到关注If you make your presence felt, you do something which makes people notice you or pay attention to you. \n\n        Rather than politely lobbying politicians, Gay Dignity will be making its presence felt through demonstrations.\n\n        “同性恋尊严”游行活动不会彬彬有礼地向政客们游说，而会通过示威引起关注。\n    7.PHRASE当着…的面；在…面前If you are in someone's presence, you are in the same place as that person, and are close enough to them to be seen or heard. \n\n        The talks took place in the presence of a diplomatic observer.\n\n        会谈是在一位外交观察员在场的情况下进行的。\n    8.PHRASE镇定自若；沉着冷静If you say that someone had the presence of mind to do something, you approve of them because they were able to think and act calmly in a difficult situation. \n\n        He had the presence of mind to put his emergency oxygen tube in his mouth.\n\n        他镇定自若地把应急输氧管放进了自己的嘴里。
breed@1.N-COUNT（宠物或牲畜的）种，品种A breed of a pet animal or farm animal is a particular type of it. For example, terriers are a breed of dog.\n\n    ...rare breeds of cattle...\n\n    稀有品种的牛\n\n    Certain breeds are more dangerous than others.\n\n    某些品种比其他品种更危险。\n\n2.VERBSee also:cross-breed；饲养；培育If you breed animals or plants, you keep them for the purpose of producing more animals or plants with particular qualities, in a controlled way. \n\n    He lived alone, breeding horses and dogs...\n\n    他独自一人生活，饲养马匹和狗。\n\n    He used to breed dogs for the police...\n\n    他曾经为警方培育警犬。\n\n    These dogs are bred to fight.\n\n    这些狗被培育作斗犬。\n\nbreeding\n\n    There is potential for selective breeding for better yields.\n\n    选种培育以提高产量会大有可为。\n\n3.VERB（动物）繁殖，繁育When animals breed, they have babies. \n\n    Frogs will usually breed in any convenient pond...\n\n    通常青蛙会在任何条件适宜的池塘中繁殖。\n\n    The area now attracts over 60 species of breeding birds.\n\n    这一地区现在吸引了60多种鸟类到此繁育后代。\n\nbreeding\n\n    During the breeding season the birds come ashore.\n\n    在繁殖季节各种鸟都飞到岸边。\n\n4.VERB产生；引起；酿成If you say that something breeds bad feeling or bad behaviour, you mean that it causes bad feeling or bad behaviour to develop. \n\n    If they are unemployed it's bound to breed resentment...\n\n    如果他们失去工作，一定会产生怨恨。\n\n    Violence breeds violence.\n\n    暴力会催生更多暴力。\n\n5.N-COUNT类型；种类You can refer to someone or something as one of a particular breed of person or thing when you want to talk about what they are like. \n\n    Sue is one of the new breed of British women squash players who are making a real impact...\n\n    休是英国新一代的女子壁球运动员，她们的影响正在显现出来。\n\n    The new breed of walking holidays puts the emphasis on enjoyment, not endurance...\n\n    这种新型的徒步旅行假日重在愉悦身心，而不是为了锻炼耐力。\n\n    I had found that rare breed of man who was not afraid of committing himself.\n\n    我找到了那种勇于承担责任的男人，这样的男人很少有。\n\n6.See also: breeding；ill-bred；pure-bred；well-bred；\n7.PHRASE（在某地）出生并长大Someone who was born and bred in a place was born there and grew up there.\n\n    I was born and bred in the highlands...\n\n    我在高地地区出生和长大。\n\n    Born and bred in this country, he and his wife emigrated to Los Angeles after the war...\n\n    尽管生于斯长于斯，他和妻子在战后还是移民去了洛杉矶。\n\n    A Londoner born and bred, she suspected that a month in the country would bore her to distraction.\n\n    作为一个土生土长的伦敦人，她不相信在乡下呆一个月就会令她心烦意乱。
triumph@    1.N-VAR非凡的成功；杰出的成就A triumph is a great success or achievement, often one that has been gained with a lot of skill or effort.\n\n        The championships proved to be a personal triumph for the coach, Dave Donovan...\n\n        事实证明，在这次锦标赛中教练戴夫·多诺万取得了非凡的个人成就。\n\n        Cataract operations are a triumph of modern surgery, with a success rate of more than 90 percent...\n\n        成功率达到 90% 以上的白内障手术是现代外科学的杰出成果。\n\n        In the moment of triumph I felt uneasy.\n\n        在成功的那一刻我反而感到了不安。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT（成功或获胜时的）极大的满足，狂喜，骄傲Triumph is a feeling of great satisfaction and pride resulting from a success or victory.\n\n        Her sense of triumph was short-lived...\n\n        她只感受了片刻成功的喜悦。\n\n        He was laughing with triumph.\n\n        他发出胜利的大笑。\n    3.VERB成功；获胜；得胜If someone or something triumphs, they gain complete success, control, or victory, often after a long or difficult struggle. \n\n        All her life, Kelly had stuck with difficult tasks and challenges, and triumphed...\n\n        凯莉一生经历了各种艰巨的任务与挑战，她都一一成功应对了。\n\n        The whole world looked to her as a symbol of good triumphing over evil.\n\n        全世界都把她视为正义战胜邪恶的象征。
insanity@    1.N-UNCOUNT精神错乱；精神失常；疯狂Insanity is the state of being insane.\n\n        The film is a powerful study of a woman's descent into insanity...\n\n        那部电影深入剖析了一个女人堕入疯狂的过程。\n\n        The defence pleaded insanity, but the defendant was found guilty and sentenced.\n\n        辩方以精神错乱为由进行申辩，但被告被判有罪并获刑。\n    2.N-UNCOUNT极端的愚蠢（行为）；荒唐（事）If you describe a decision or an action as insanity, you think it is very foolish. \n\n        It was a period of collective insanity, of legalized murder and mayhem.\n\n        那是个集体丧失理智、谋杀与暴力合法化的时期。\n\n        ...the final financial insanity of the 1980s.\n\n        20 世纪 80 年代最后的财政疯狂
format@n. 设计,版式\nn.[计算机]格式,DOS命令 : 格式化(磁盘),用于空盘或使用过的磁盘建立新空盘来存储数据\nv. vt.使格式化,设计,安排    1.N-COUNT版式；格式；形式The format of something is the way or order in which it is arranged and presented.\n\n        I had met with him to explain the format of the programme and what we had in mind.\n\n        我已经和他当面解释了我们节目的形式以及我们的想法。\n\n        ...a large-format book.\n\n        大开本的书\n    2.N-COUNT（电脑软件或音乐的）载体形式The format of a piece of computer software or a musical recording is the type of equipment on which it is designed to be used or played. For example, possible formats for a musical recording are CD and cassette.\n\n        His latest album is available on all formats.\n\n        他的最新专辑有各种载体形式。\n    3.VERB格式化（磁盘）To format a computer disk means to run a program so that the disk can be written on. \n    4.VERB编排（计算机文本或图表）的格式To format a piece of computer text or graphics means to arrange the way in which it appears when it is printed or is displayed on a screen. \n\n        When text is saved from a Web page, it is often very badly formatted with many short lines.\n\n        从网页上转存文本时，往往会出现许多短行，格式也乱了。
capacity@    1.N-VAR能力；才能Your capacity for something is your ability to do it, or the amount of it that you are able to do. \n\n        Our capacity for giving care, love and attention is limited...\n\n        我们能够给予的关怀、关爱和关注是有限的。\n\n        Her mental capacity and temperament are as remarkable as his.\n\n        她的才智和气质和他一样出众。\n\n        ...people's creative capacities.\n\n        人们的创造才能\n    2.N-UNCOUNT（工厂、企业、地区的）生产量，生产（或运输）能力The capacity of something such as a factory, industry, or region is the quantity of things that it can produce or deliver with the equipment or resources that are available.\n\n        ...the amount of spare capacity in the economy... \n\n        经济中的剩余生产能力\n\n        Bread factories are working at full capacity...\n\n        面包厂正在全力生产。\n\n        The region is valued for its coal and vast electricity-generating capacity...\n\n        这个地区因其煤炭资源丰富和发电能力巨大而备受重视。\n    3.N-COUNT（设备的）容量，功率，马力The capacity of a piece of equipment is its size or power, often measured in particular units.\n\n        ...an aircraft with a bomb-carrying capacity of 454 kg.\n\n        载弹量为454千克的飞机\n\n        ...a feature which gave the vehicles a much greater fuel capacity than other trucks.\n\n        使这些车辆的储油量远远超过其他卡车的一个特点\n    4.N-VAR（容器的）容积，容量The capacity of a container is its volume, or the amount of liquid it can hold, measured in units such as litres or gallons.\n\n        ...the fuel tanks, which had a capacity of 140 litres...\n\n        容量为140升的油箱\n\n        Grease 6 ramekin dishes of 150 ml (5-6 fl oz) capacity.\n\n        将6个容量为150毫升（5至6液盎司）的烤盘涂上油。\n    5.N-SING（建筑、地方、车辆的）可容纳人数，载客量The capacity of a building, place, or vehicle is the number of people or things that it can hold. If a place is filled to capacity, it is as full as it can possibly be. \n\n        Each stadium had a seating capacity of about 50,000...\n\n        每个体育场均可容纳5万人左右。\n\n        Toronto hospital maternity wards were filled to capacity.\n\n        多伦多医院的产房都已住满了。\n    6.ADJ座无虚席的；满场的；挤满的A capacity crowd or audience completely fills a theatre, sports stadium, or other place. \n\n        A capacity crowd of 76,000 people was at Wembley football stadium for the event.\n\n        温布利球场座无虚席，76，000人前来观看这场比赛。\n    7.N-COUNT身份；职责；职位If you do something in a particular capacity, you do it as part of a particular job or duty, or because you are representing a particular organization or person. \n\n        Ms Halliwell visited the Philippines in her capacity as a Special Representative of Unicef...\n\n        哈利韦尔女士以联合国儿童基金会特别代表的身份访问了菲律宾。\n\n        This article is written in a personal capacity...\n\n        本文是以个人名义所写。\n\n        Since 1928, Major Thomas has served the club in many capacities.\n\n        自1928年以来，托马斯少校担任过该俱乐部的多个职位。\n    Usage Note:\n\n    Do not confuse capacity with ability and capability. If someone has a particular capacity, a capacity for something, or a capacity to do something, they have the qualities required to do it. Capacity is a more formal word than ability. ...their capacity for hard work. ...his capacity to see the other person's point of view. You often use ability to say that someone can do something well. He had remarkable ability as a musician. ...the ability to bear hardship. A person's capability is the amount of work they can do and how well they can do it. ...a job that was beyond the capability of one man. ...the director's ideas of the capability of the actor.\n\n    不要混淆 capacity，ability 和 capability。capacity 比 ability 更加正式， 表示具有做某事所必需的特质： their capacity for hard work （他们能吃苦耐劳）， his capacity to see the other person's point of view （他理解他人观点的能力）。ability 常用来表示能够做好某事： He had remarkable ability as a musician （他拥有杰出的音乐才华）， the ability to bear hardship （承受苦难的能力）。capability 表示能完成的工作量及工作质量： a job that was beyond the capability of one man （个人力所不及的工作）， the director's ideas of the capability of the actor （导演对那个演员演技的评价）。
stock@1.N-COUNT股票；证券Stocks are shares in the ownership of a company, or investments on which a fixed amount of interest will be paid. \n\n    ...the buying and selling of stocks and shares...\n\n    证券和股票买卖\n\n    As stock prices have dropped, so too has bank capital.\n\n    随着股价下跌，银行资本也减少了。\n\n2.N-UNCOUNT（公司的）股本，股份A company's stock is the amount of money which the company has through selling shares. \n\n    Two years later, when Compaq went public, their stock was valued at $38 million...\n\n    康柏公司两年后上市时，他们的股本为 3，800 万美元。\n\n    The Fisher family holds 40% of the stock.\n\n    费希尔家族持有 40%的股份。\n\n3.VERB（商店）存（货），储备If a shop stocks particular goods, it keeps a supply of them to sell. \n\n    The shop stocks everything from cigarettes to recycled loo paper.\n\n    商店货品齐全，从香烟到再生厕纸应有尽有。\n\n4.N-UNCOUNT（商店的）全部存货，库存A shop's stock is the total amount of goods which it has available to sell.\n\n    We took the decision to withdraw a quantity of stock from sale.\n\n    我们决定将一批存货下架。\n\n5.VERB在…中储备（或贮存）If you stock something such as a cupboard, shelf, or room, you fill it with food or other things. \n\n    I worked stocking shelves in a grocery store...\n\n    我在一家杂货店工作，负责为货架上货。\n\n    Some families stocked their cellars with food and water...\n\n    有些家庭在地窖里储备了食品和水。\n\n    The kitchen cupboard was stocked with tins of soup.\n\n    厨房的橱柜里堆满了罐装汤。\n\n    Stock up means the same as stock .stock up 同 stock\n\n        I had to stock the boat up with food...\n\n        我得在船上备足干粮。\n\n        Customers travel from hundreds of miles away to stock up their deep freezes...\n\n        为了在冷冻箱中储备食品，顾客们从几百英里以外的地方赶来购物。\n\n        Start planning for Christmas now by stocking up the freezer with some festive dishes.\n\n        现在就开始为圣诞节做准备吧，首先在冰箱里备足过节的菜肴。\n\n6.N-COUNT贮存；储备If you have a stock of things, you have a supply of them stored in a place ready to be used. \n\n    I keep a stock of cassette tapes describing various relaxation techniques...\n\n    我收集了一些介绍各种放松技巧的卡带。\n\n    Stocks of ammunition were running low.\n\n    弹药的库存正在减少。\n\n7.N-SING供应量；储备量；现有量The stock of something is the total amount of it that is available in a particular area. \n\n    ...the stock of accommodation available to be rented.\n\n    可供租赁的住房储备量\n\n8.N-UNCOUNT出身；种族；家系If you are from a particular stock, you are descended from a particular group of people. \n\n    We are both from working class stock.\n\n    我们俩都出身于工人家庭。\n\n    ...blacks, Asians and people of Mediterranean stock.\n\n    黑人、亚洲人和地中海沿岸高加索人的后裔\n\n9.N-PLURAL（尤指经过特殊饲养的）家畜，牲畜Stock are cattle, sheep, pigs, or other animals which are kept by a farmer, usually ones which have been specially bred.\n\n    I am carefully selecting the breeding stock...\n\n    我正在精心挑选种畜。\n\n    His herd of 170 dairy cattle and 200 young stock are kept on the land.\n\n    他那170头奶牛和200头乳牛都在那块地上圈养。\n\n10.ADJ（回答、说法或做事方式）老一套的，陈腐的A stock answer, expression, or way of doing something is one that is very commonly used, especially because people cannot be bothered to think of something new. \n\n    My boss had a stock response — 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it!'...\n\n    我上司总是这一句——“别没事找事！”\n\n    National security is the stock excuse for keeping things confidential.\n\n    国家安全常被用作对一些事情保密的挡箭牌。\n\n11.N-MASS高汤；原汤Stock is a liquid, usually made by boiling meat, bones, or vegetables in water, that is used to give flavour to soups and sauces.\n\n12.N-PLURAL（旧时惩罚犯人用的）手足枷In former times, the stocks were an instrument of punishment. A criminal's hands and legs were locked into holes in a wooden frame while people threw things at them.\n\n13.See also: stocking；laughing stock；rolling stock；\n14.PHRASE有货/缺货If goods are in stock, a shop has them available to sell. If they are out of stock, it does not. \n\n    Check that your size is in stock...\n\n    查查你的尺码是否有货。\n\n    Lemon and lime juice were both temporarily out of stock.\n\n    柠檬汁和酸橙汁暂时都缺货。\n\n15.PHRASE作出整体估量；全面分析If you take stock, you pause to think about all the aspects of a situation or event before deciding what to do next. \n\n    It was time to take stock of the situation...\n\n    是时候统观一下形势了。\n\n    I was forty, the age when people take stock and change their lives.\n\n    我已年届不惑，到了该全面审视自己并改变生活的年龄了。
scope@n. 能力，范围，眼界，机会，余地\nvt. 仔细研究    1.N-UNCOUNT机会；施展余地If there is scope for a particular kind of behaviour or activity, people have the opportunity to behave in this way or do that activity. \n\n        He believed in giving his staff scope for initiative...\n\n        他认为应给员工提供发挥主动性的机会。\n\n        Banks had increased scope to develop new financial products.\n\n        银行已为开发新的金融产品留出了更大余地。\n    2.N-SING（活动、话题或作品的）范围The scope of an activity, topic, or piece of work is the whole area which it deals with or includes. \n\n        Mr Dobson promised to widen the organisation's scope of activity.\n\n        多布森先生许诺拓宽该组织的活动范围。\n\n        ...the scope of a novel.\n\n        小说所涉及的范围
invincible@    1.ADJ-GRADED不可战胜的；所向披靡的If you describe an army or sports team as invincible, you believe that they cannot be defeated.\n\n        When Sotomayor is on form he is virtually invincible.\n\n        索托马约尔状态好时几乎无人可敌。\n\n    invincibility\n\n        ...symbols of the invincibility of the Roman army.\n\n        罗马军队不可战胜的象征\n    2.ADJ（信念、态度）不可动摇的，不可改变的If someone has an invincible belief or attitude, it cannot be changed. \n\n        He also had an invincible faith in the medicinal virtues of garlic.\n\n        他同时也对大蒜的医学功效深信不疑。
blast@1.N-COUNT爆炸A blast is a big explosion, especially one caused by a bomb.\n\n    250 people were killed in the blast.\n\n    250人在这次爆炸中丧生。\n\n2.VERB爆炸；炸毁；炸出；炸开If something is blasted into a particular place or state, an explosion causes it to be in that place or state. If a hole is blasted in something, it is created by an explosion. \n\n    There is a risk that toxic chemicals might be blasted into the atmosphere. \n\n    爆炸后有毒化学物质可能会进入大气层。\n\n    ...a terrible accident in which his left arm was blasted off by some kind of a bomb...\n\n    他的左臂被某种炸弹炸飞的可怕事故\n\n    Earlier two holes were blasted into the ship's hull to let water out and stabilise the ferry...\n\n    之前在船体上炸出了两个洞，以便把水排出，使船平稳下来。\n\n3.VERB炸（石）；爆破If workers are blasting rock, they are using explosives to make holes in it or destroy it, for example so that a road or tunnel can be built. \n\n    Their work was taken up with boring and blasting rock with gelignite...\n\n    他们的工作是用葛里炸药炸石头，非常枯燥。\n\n    They're using dynamite to blast away rocks to put a road in.\n\n    他们用炸药炸石筑路。\n\nblasting\n\n    Three miles away there was a salvo of blasting in the quarry.\n\n    三英里之外的采石场进行了爆破作业。\n\n4.VERB枪击；开枪射击To blast someone means to shoot them with a gun. \n\n    ...a son who blasted his father to death after a lifetime of bullying...\n\n    因从小到大一直被父亲虐待而开枪弑父的男子\n\n    Alan Barnett, 28, was blasted with a sawn-off shotgun in Oldham on Thursday.\n\n    28岁的艾伦·巴尼特于星期四在奥德姆被人用短管猎枪射杀。\n\n    Blast is also a noun.\n\n        ...the man who killed Nigel Davies with a shotgun blast.\n\n        用猎枪打死奈杰尔·戴维斯的男子\n\n5.VERB（通过枪击） 冲出（道路）；轰开，炸开（通路）If someone blasts their way somewhere, they get there by shooting at people or causing an explosion. \n\n    The police were reported to have blasted their way into the house using explosives...\n\n    据报道，警方借助爆破冲进了房子。\n\n    One armoured column attempted to blast a path through a barricade of buses and trucks.\n\n    一个武装纵队试图从公交车和卡车组成的路障中间炸出一条通道来。\n\n6.VERB喷射（水流、气流等）Ifsomething blasts water or air somewhere, it sends out a sudden, powerful stream of it. \n\n    Blasting cold air over it makes the water evaporate...\n\n    向它喷射冷空气可以使水蒸发。\n\n    A blizzard was blasting great drifts of snow across the lake.\n\n    暴风雪夹着大团的积雪吹过湖面。\n\n    Blast is also a noun.\n\n        Blasts of cold air swept down from the mountains.\n\n        强冷气流从山上疾掠而下。\n\n7.V-ERG（使）（汽车喇叭等）突然发出响亮的声音；（使）（音乐）轰响If you blast something such as a car horn, or if it blasts, it makes a sudden, loud sound. If something blasts music, or music blasts, the music is very loud. \n\n    ...drivers who do not blast their horns...\n\n    不按喇叭的司机\n\n    The sound of western music blasted as she entered.\n\n    她一进门便听到西部音乐震天的响声。\n\n    Blast is also a noun.\n\n        The buzzer suddenly responded in a long blast of sound.\n\n        蜂鸣器突然相应地发出了一声响亮的长鸣。\n\n8.VERB（体育运动中）用力踢，猛击You can say that a sports player blasts the ball somewhere if he or she gives it a powerful kick or hit. \n\n    Ramsay blasted the ball into the back of the net...\n\n    拉姆齐劲射入网。\n\n    He may try to blast his way out of trouble, playing attacking shots to balls he would not normally contemplate hitting.\n\n    他可能是想努力摆脱困境，平时不会考虑击打的球也打起了进攻。\n\n9.VERB炮轰；抨击To blast someone or something means to criticize them strongly. \n\n    Football: Taylor blasts Beck...\n\n    足球：泰勒炮轰贝克。\n\n    The Department of Health and a top immunologist have blasted a report in last week's Sunday Times.\n\n    卫生部和一位知名免疫学家严词抨击了上周《星期日泰晤士报》的一篇报道。\n\n    Blast is also a noun.\n\n        Cricket: Blast for Ormrod.\n\n        板球：炮轰奥姆罗德。\n\n10.EXCLAM（表示厌恶）真讨厌，真该死Some people say 'blast' to show that they are annoyed at something or someone. \n\n    Blast! I can't do anything with this.\n\n    真该死！我拿这个一点办法也没有。\n\n11.N-SING有趣的事；开心的事；乐趣If you say that something was a blast, you mean that you enjoyed it very much. \n\n    Making the album was a real blast.\n\n    做这个专辑真是一种乐趣。\n\n12.PHRASE以最大音量；以最大功率If something such as a radio or a heater is on full blast, or at full blast, it is producing as much sound or power as it is able to. \n\n    In many of those homes the television is on full blast 24 hours a day...\n\n    那些家庭有很多一天24小时把电视开到最大音量。\n\n    You are unlikely to run the heater at full blast for long periods.\n\n    你不太可能长时间把加热器开到最大挡位。\n\n13.PHRASE岁月回响（勾起回忆的老歌、旧时尚等）You can use a blast from the past as a light-hearted way of referring to something such as an old song or fashion that you hear or notice again, and which reminds you of an earlier time. 
cling@    1.VERB紧紧抓住；抱紧If you cling to someone or something, you hold onto them tightly. \n\n        Another man was rescued as he clung to the riverbank...\n\n        另外一个人因为紧紧攀住河堤而获救。\n\n        She had to cling onto the door handle until the pain passed...\n\n        她只好紧紧握住门把手，直到不疼了才松开。\n\n        They hugged each other, clinging together under the lights.\n\n        他们彼此拥抱，在灯光下紧紧相依。\n    2.VERB抓住（职位或财产）不放If someone clings to a position or a possession they have, they do everything they can to keep it even though this may be very difficult. \n\n        He appears determined to cling to power...\n\n        看来他决心要抓住权力不放。\n\n        Another minister clung on with a majority of only 18...\n\n        另一位部长仅以18票的微弱优势保住了职位。\n\n        Japan's productivity has overtaken America in some industries, but elsewhere the United States has clung on to its lead.\n\n        在有些行业，日本的生产效率超过了美国，但在其他行业美国仍然保持着领先的地位。\n    3.VERB（衣服）紧附，黏着Clothes that cling to you stay pressed against your body when you move. \n\n        His sodden trousers were clinging to his shins.\n\n        湿淋淋的裤子紧紧粘在他小腿上。\n\n    clinging\n\n        ...clinging black garments.\n\n        黑色紧身衣\n    4.VERB黏附；粘住Something that is clinging to something else is stuck on it or just attached to it. \n\n        Her glass had bits of orange clinging to the rim.\n\n        她的杯口上粘有些许橙汁。\n    5.VERB缠住；依附If someone clings to a person they are fond of, they do not allow that person to be free or independent. \n\n        I was terrified he would leave me, so I was clinging to him.\n\n        我害怕他会离开我，所以缠着他不放。\n\n    clinging\n\n        She was anxious not to appear clinging.\n\n        她竭力不让自己看上去显得过分依恋别人。\n    6.VERB墨守，坚持（观念或行为方式）If you cling to an idea or way of behaving, you continue to believe in its value or importance, even though it may no longer be valid or useful. \n\n        They know scholars reject their legend, but they still cling to their belief...\n\n        尽管知道学者们不相信他们的传说，他们还是坚持自己的信仰。\n\n        They're clinging to the past.\n\n        他们对过去念念不忘。
computation@n. 计算，计算机的使用，计算方法，计算结果    1.N-VAR计算Computation is mathematical calculation.\n\n        The discrepancies resulted from different methods of computation...\n\n        这些差异是由不同的计算方法造成的。\n\n        He took a few notes and made computations.\n\n        他记了一点笔记，然后做了运算。
destruction@    1.N-UNCOUNT破坏；毁灭；消灭Destruction is the act of destroying something, or the state of being destroyed.\n\n        ...an international agreement aimed at halting the destruction of the ozone layer.\n\n        一项旨在阻止臭氧层破坏的国际协议\n\n        ...weapons of mass destruction.\n\n        大规模杀伤性武器
caption@1.N-COUNT（图片、漫画的）说明文字A caption is the words printed underneath a picture or cartoon which explain what it is about.\n\n        On the back of the photo is written the simple caption, 'Mrs. Monroe'.\n\n        照片背面只有简单的几个字——“梦露女士”。\n    2.VERB为（照片或漫画）添加说明文字When someone captions a picture or cartoon, they put a caption under it. \n\n        The Sun had captioned a picture of Princess Diana 'Princess of Veils'...\n\n        《太阳报》在黛安娜王妃的一张照片下写了一段说明文字——“披着面纱的王妃”。\n\n        The photograph is captioned 'People Power'...\n\n        配图文字为“人民的力量”。\n\n        The book is well written, properly illustrated and excellently captioned.\n\n        这本书写得很好，插图生动形象，说明文字简练精辟。
toggle@n. 乒乓开关，触发器，套索钉，棒形纽扣\nvt. 系纽扣，提供索钉\nvi. 开开关1.N-COUNT（木质或塑料的）棒形纽扣A toggle is a small piece of wood or plastic which is sewn to something such as a coat or bag, and which is pushed through a loop or hole to fasten it.
reverse@    1.VERB逆转，彻底改变（决定、政策、趋势等）When someone or something reverses a decision, policy, or trend, they change it to the opposite decision, policy, or trend. \n\n        They have made it clear they will not reverse the decision to increase prices...\n\n        他们已经明确表示不会更改提价的决定。\n\n        The rise, the first in 10 months, reversed the downward trend in Belgium's jobless rate.\n\n        10个月来失业率的首次上升逆转了比利时失业率持续下降的趋势。\n    2.VERB颠倒，反转（事物的顺序）If you reverse the order of a set of things, you arrange them in the opposite order, so that the first thing comes last. \n\n        In the squares place a penny, nickel, dime and quarter in that order. The object is to reverse the order of these coins...\n\n        在这些方块中按顺序放置1分、5分、10分和25分的硬币各一枚。目标是颠倒这些硬币的顺序。\n\n        The normal word order is reversed in passive sentences.\n\n        正常词序在被动句中是颠倒的。\n    3.VERB交换，互换（位置、功能）If you reverse the positions or functions of two things, you change them so that each thing has the position or function that the other one had. \n\n        He reversed the position of the two stamps.\n\n        他将两枚邮票的位置调换了一下。\n    4.V-ERG倒（车）When a car reverses or when you reverse it, the car is driven backwards. \n\n        Another car reversed out of the drive...\n\n        另一辆车倒出了车道。\n\n        He reversed and drove away...\n\n        他把车倒出来，开走了。\n\n        He reversed his car straight at the policeman.\n\n        他径直把车倒向警察。\n\n    in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用back up\n    5.N-UNCOUNT倒挡；倒车If your car is in reverse, you have changed gear so that you can drive it backwards. \n\n        He lurched the car in reverse along the ruts to the access road.\n\n        他顺着车辙摇摇晃晃地将车倒到了支路上。\n    6.ADJ相反的Reverse means opposite to what you expect or to what has just been described. \n\n        The wrong attitude will have exactly the reverse effect.\n\n        错误的态度会产生完全相反的效果。\n    7.N-SING完全相反；正相反If you say that one thing is the reverse of another, you are emphasizing that the first thing is the complete opposite of the second thing. \n\n        There is absolutely no evidence at all that spectators want longer cricket matches. Quite the reverse...\n\n        完全没有证据表明观众想看时间更长的板球比赛。情况恰恰相反。\n\n        This would lead one to expect a fat, dense and detailed autobiography. The reverse is true. The book is short and spare.\n\n        这会让人以为是一本内容晦涩而详尽的大部头自传。但正好相反，这本书简短明了。\n    8.N-COUNT严重的失败；挫折A reverse is a serious failure or defeat. \n\n        It's clear that the party of the former Prime Minister has suffered a major reverse.\n\n        显然，前首相所在党派遭受了重大的挫折。\n    9.N-SING反面；背面The reverse or the reverse side of a flat object which has two sides is the less important or the other side. \n\n        Cheques should be made payable to Country Living and your address written on the reverse.\n\n        支票抬头必须写“《乡村生活》杂志”，你的地址应写在背面。\n    10.PHRASE相反地；逆向地；颠倒地If something happens in reverse or goes into reverse, things happen in the opposite way to what usually happens or to what has been happening. \n\n        Amis tells the story in reverse, from the moment the man dies...\n\n        埃米斯以倒叙的方式讲述了这个故事，从这个男人死去的时候开始讲起。\n\n        The downward trend went into reverse and the scores started to creep up again.\n\n        比分下降的趋势发生逆转，分数又开始逐渐上升了。\n    11.PHRASE打对方付费的电话If you reverse the charges when you make a telephone call, the person who you are phoning pays the cost of the call and not you. \n\n    in AM, use 美国英语用 call collect
